Job Description:
Position Title:Pricing Analyst
Position Type: Temporary - Part-Time
Requisition ID: 7304
Company: Day & Ross Inc.
At Day & Ross, you’ll go far.
Day & Ross is one of Canada’s largest transportation companies, serving top brands across North America. We got our start hauling potatoes in 1950, and now we have a team of more than 8,000 employees, drivers and owner operators.
We believe our people are our greatest strength – and we treat them like family. For over a decade, we’ve been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, and we were named a Top Company for Women to Work for in Transportation in 2018 and 2019. Our industry recognition is a testament to the family values we share with our parent company, McCain Foods Limited.
About the Role
Pricing Analyst
Fixed-Term
Mississauga, ON
The Pricing Analyst will ensure that all rate requests are processed in a timely fashion and that all pricing components are considered and recommendations are made accordingly, and within pricing policy.
How You’ll Help
Receives and reviews rate requests from Account Executives.
Performs cost analysis of rates requested to determine profitability.
Applying cost factors for dock charges, pickup charges, delivery charges, etc.
Entering data into spreadsheet for calculation of total cost
Applying profit margin
Comparing results to requested rates
Advise Sales Reps that requested rates are approved, or what increase is necessary to maintain profit margin. Assist in negotiations with customers by the provision of information.
Creates tariff with finalized rates in place.
Maintains log of activity on rate requests.
Prepares cost analysis for tender submissions.
Reviews unrated bills from night rating activity. Determine what rate was quoted, or assign one where previously undetermined.
Assists in annual tariff reviews as required.
Your Skills & Experience:
Bachelor's degree from a university or college program related to business or mathematics would be an asset.
Minimum 3 years of related experience.
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, and governmental regulations.
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, or the general public.
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference.
Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
Ability to apply these skills in Microsoft Excel and Access.
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Bilingual in English and French
Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.

We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross Transportation Group fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.
Function: Transportation

Location(s): CA - Canada : Ontario : Mississauga

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Telephony Manager
Reporting Manager: VP of Technology

Location: Mississauga
Job Type: Full time, Permanent

 Job Summary


The primary responsibility of the Telephony Manager (Senior Data Analyst) is to maintain and operate and to operate a high-volume dialer system and its subsystems in a contact center environment effectively and efficiently. Experience in managing Telephony Applications (IVR, Quality Management, Workforce Management, Reporting). You will also collaborate with business management to determine overall strategy.

 Responsibilities:

Research, plan, install, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade telephony systems.
Analyze and evaluate present or proposed telephony procedures to drive contact center best practices and continually improve performance of the systems and dialer strategies.
Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity problems, including user access and component configuration
Record and maintain hardware and software inventories, site and/or server licensing, and user access and security.
Work with vendors to resolve complex Telephony problems.
Produce and maintain system documentation
Conduct technical research on system upgrades to determine feasibility, cost, time required, and compatibility with current system.
To document system problems and resolutions logs for future reference.
Works closely with management to prioritize business goals and information needs.
Perform daily uploads, downloads and importing Analysis of dialer-output data to identify potential problems/issues.
Create and update dialing campaigns, filter, list strategies and reports.
You must be able to take ownership of your client base and complete daily tasks accurately and efficiently.
General requirements:

Ability to make quick decisions, establish priorities and concentrate on detailed information sometimes under stressful conditions.
Proficient understanding of Telephony Technology.
Detailed oriented; ability to manage multiple projects at the same time.
Excellent verbal and written communication abilities are essential.
Firm understanding of business practices in a Collection Agency and Sales/Customer service contact center environment.
Advanced proficiency level with Microsoft Excel
Experience working with AVAYA IP Office and other alternative and multiple hosted platforms
Experience working with other communication channels used in call centerish. Chat, SMS, Email.

We are looking for a talented Fuel Cell Data Engineer/ Analyst to join our team specializing in hydrogen fuel cell power systems technology for our # NewPower Business Unit in Mississauga, Ontario.
In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:
Analyze field data to evaluate key performance indicators (KPI) for deployed fuel cell engines.
Collaborate with the engineering team to utilize analyzed data as part of design feedback process.
Development and deployment of novel data acquisition systems and protocols.
Analyze data and generate reports to demonstrate system performance.
Support field service technicians.
Qualifications
To be successful in this role you will need the following:
Bachelor’s in Engineering or Computer Science, Master’s degree preferred.
Minimum three years of experience in a similar role.
Strong experience building and analyzing databases and evaluating field data for key performance indicators (KPI’s) (e.g., MySQL database).
Experience with Python and MATLAB highly preferred.
Experience working with field datalogging telemetry solutions an asset.
Strong Excel skills (macros, pivot tables, etc.).
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.

CAREER OPPORTUNITY
SENIOR METER DATA ANALYST
Location: Mississauga, ON
If you are an ambitious, curious, hard-working, and seasoned energy professional, this is an exciting new opportunity for you to join the Rodan Energy team – an organization that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for three years in a row.
Rodan Energy is a top North American energy services company, quickly growing to serve our clients across North America. We are a leader in distributed energy resource asset optimization, demand response, energy management and intelligence systems, and power systems engineering and metering services. Our innovative solutions are designed for large commercial and industrial energy users as well as power distribution and generation companies. We focus on minimizing energy costs while maximizing efficiencies and corporate sustainability for our clients. Our goal is a sustainable energy future.
We have an opportunity for a Senior Meter Data Analyst based out of our head office in Mississauga. As an integral member of the Information Services team, the Senior Meter Data Analyst will be responsible for Meter data management services for retail, wholesale, and Meter Service Provider (MSP) clients including remote meter interrogation, data collection, verification and posting using meter interrogation software.
Your responsibilities include:
Administration of the Meter Trouble Report (MTR) process; communicating, coordinating, and assisting, customers and the Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)
Schedule MV-90-meter interrogation cycles to ensure availability of metered data and to avoid conflict with IESO reading cycles.
Program meters and configure telemetry and communication devices.
Configuration of equipment for real-time and near real-time telemetry using sources such as Modbus, DNP 3.0, and KYZ pulses.
Interface with other metering service providers, meter data management agencies and clients regarding the provision of metering services, metering installations and metering data.
Interface with the IESO for new meter installations, meter upgrades, meter deregistration, and other issues.
Interface with field staff, prior to and during commissioning of meter installations and commencement of meter data collection.
Maintain the metering database and ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of the data contained therein.
Support Rodan staff with audit and technical proposals, engineering drawings and design, order processing, project management, MSP site registration, installation and commissioning, meter trouble reports and maintenance.
Key qualifications:
Post-secondary education from an accredited college or university and/or prior related work experience ideally in utility metering or billing.
Experience working with data collection and/or settlement systems particularly Itron MV-90 software.
Strong proficiency with MS Office, specifically MS Excel.
Macro and VB scripting skills is considered an asset.
Comprehensive knowledge of electrical principals, terminology, function, SLDs, and interpretation
of electrical measuring instruments.
Experience in networking and telecommunications.
Knowledge of communications protocols, firewalls, TCP/IP.
Strong customer service orientation and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
To apply for this opportunity, please visit us at http://rodanenergy.com/careers/jobs/
Rodan Energy is strongly committed to diversity and equality of opportunity. We strive to create an environment that is welcoming and inclusive for everyone.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

The Data Engineer reports directly to the Director, Business Intelligence & Analytics, and is responsible for the creation and implementation of business intelligence solutions. They will act as a subject matter expert (SME) for the design, development and maintenance of the data pipeline and storage requirements as they relate to the needs of the organization. This person works across functional areas to ensure quality and consistency in services.


The role also involves a consultative aspect by acting as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for internal business units and customers.
Key Responsibilities
Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for data storage requirements as they relate to the needs of the organization.
Design and Develop ETL Pipeline to ingest data.
Perform the GAP analysis between applications to migrate them to newer solutions.
Designs, develops, implements, and installs defined SQL Server database systems and maintains enterprise level database systems.
Testing, fixing, improving, and deploying software and solutions.
Must be able to troubleshoot and correct database problems and to proactively maintain the health of database systems.
Provide guidance on the structure of data sources, drafting of queries, compiling of operational type business intelligence data to various departments.
Write complex scripts to preprocess files and schedule ETL jobs.
Meeting project milestones and delivering working solutions.
Handle all requests with a high standard of quality and professionalism; determine the best course of action to ensure resolution meets established standards.
Coordinate activities with business units. Provide analysis and interpretation in clear user language.
Document activities as required in compliance with established controls, delivery schedule, process documents.
Maintain knowledge of business unit policies and procedures, systems, and requirements.
Identify opportunities for process improvements, document them and collaborate with the team to move them forward.
Participate in department objectives; including quality and productivity standards and other duties as assigned within the department.
Assisting customers (internal and external) through each phase of the software lifecycle, including requirements, delivery, and support.
Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.
In this role, incumbent will gain experience and knowledge to evolve from focusing on single/defined database systems to multiple database systems with broader interdependencies.
Have an interest in coaching and mentorship for other members of the BI&A team.
Qualifications
5+ years of experience designing and developing ETL jobs.
5+ years of experience working on relational databases and writing SQL queries.
5+ years of experience using Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, SSRS, Power Pivot, Power View, Power BI)
5+ years of experience with related scripting languages and techniques (Python, PowerShell, Rest API etc.)
5+ years of experience with working on cloud technologies for data pipelines, data warehouses.
Post-secondary diploma or degree in a computer science-related course.
Knowledge in reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (Power BI preferred).
Experience with ServiceNow considered an asset.
Experience with unstructured data (JSON) considered an asset.
Be self-motivated, organized, and detailed oriented.
Strong leadership and motivational skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong problem solving and diagnostic skills.
Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.
An interest in, and comfort with, technical concepts related to network and information security.

Join our Team
We are seeking a highly motivated self-starter to join our fast-paced high-performing B2B Systems Capabilities team!

Reporting to the Manager, B2B Systems Capabilities, Strategy & Roadmap you will support the ideation, evaluation, and prioritization of the system capabilities backlog for our Salesforce and ServiceNow platforms. Our key mandate is to represent the Business stakeholders as trusted unbiased shepherds of our B2B Systems strategy.
As the successful candidate, you are an individual with:
experience working with highly urgent and highly visible content
efficient organization and ability to manage multiple timelines and requirements
excellent collaborative skills, with a proven track record of working with cross-function teams such as Finance, Marketing, Product, and Operations, and are comfortable working with all levels of the organization – from managers to senior executives
ongoing desire to be part of a high paced and exciting team focused on long term planning and business governance
a natural ability to form strong working relationships and transform the complicated into the simple

Qualifications

Your ideal profile includes
Problem Solving & Analytics
analytical, problem identification and problem solving skills; advanced ability to perform an appropriate level of assessment to recommend solutions; make good decisions based on analysis, experience and judgment
utilize advanced conceptual and critical thinking skills for business planning and/or problem analysis and resolution
Product & Customer Marketing and Operations
familiarity with Customer Marketing, Product Marketing, call center operations, field operations, customer service delivery & digital transformation; broad telecommunications industry knowledge and experience
Business Case Development
enable a consistent approach to the development of authentic business cases through proper assumptions, use of data, and research
support ad hoc requests and business case development from leadership team and key stakeholders
Systems knowledge
familiarity with Salesforce – asset
familiarity with ServiceNow – asset
familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - asset
Professional Designation/Certification
University degree in computer science and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
5+ years of experience in an analytical role
Who is TELUS?
We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.
Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.
Do you share our passion?
At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.

The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.
Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers.
The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.
Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters.
Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area.
Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.

Job Title: Data Analyst, Finance and Enterprise Risk
Job Description:
Adresse :
234 Simcoe Street
Groupe de famille d'emploi :
Analyses données et rapports
Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy.
Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies.
Performs data profiling and data analyses.
Documents and maintains data flow specifications.
Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights.
Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes.
Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation.
Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain.
Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements.
Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making.
Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model.
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions.
Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security.
Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups.
Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes.
Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 1 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle).
Skilled in working with BI tools such as PowerBI, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks.
Proficient in working with SQL
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
Ici, pour vous.
À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde.
En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences.
Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr .
BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Des mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour demander des mesures d’adaptation, veuillez communiquer avec votre recruteur.

Job Title: Sales Strategy and Operations Analyst, Google Cloud
Job Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in sales operations, FP&A, consulting, sales strategy or similar analytical role.
Experience with SQL.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience extracting and manipulating large, complex datasets with SQL.
Ability to create and foster cross-functional networks.
Ability to be proactive and flexible, and work in a fast-paced or unstructured environment. Ability to navigate ambiguity and bring clarity and structure with limited direction while balancing competing priorities and deliverables.
Excellent leadership and influencing skills, including the ability to work with senior-level stakeholders or clients.
Excellent analytical and communication skills, with the ability to construct and articulate simple and impactful messages/insights from complex analysis.
About the job
The Google Cloud Sales Strategy and Operations team plays an important role in Google Cloud, acting as trusted advisors to the Sales Organization, partnering with Sales, Customer Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Partners and the Professional Sales Organization to together plan, strategize and run the business in a transformational way. As a Sales Strategy and Operations Analyst, you will support the Regional Sales Strategy and Operations Managers by leveraging your data extraction skills to generate reports and analysis, providing insights that support decision making and help define, land and execute on our key strategic priorities for the region.
You will work on increasing efficiency by creating and simplifying processes and supporting training, communications and enablement to sales. You will be responsible for running the business cadence, helping the organization navigate the complexities of systems and tools, as well as collaborating with cross-functional Google Cloud teams to solve problems, design, manage and successfully deliver projects against high operational standards.
Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Be the subject matter expert from data to process to our internal customers, structure and communicate complex, ambiguous, and challenging business issues to advise the Google Cloud Sales leadership team.
Provide strategic, analytical and day to day operational activities support for the Regional Sales Strategy and Operations Team.
Perform large-scale data analysis and modeling to identify trends and efficiency opportunities. Build and maintain tools and dashboards to help with reporting and analytical needs of the team and key stakeholders.
Engage in ad-hoc analyses to understand business performance/user metrics, Key Performance Indicators and provide concise summaries and recommendations to management.
Identify process gaps and opportunities for process improvement. Partner with Google Cloud business teams to define and solve problems/opportunities that impact the sales organization.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

About SuMO:
Enterprise Service & Operations Management is what we do. All day. Every Day. As the First Canadian-owned ServiceNow ELITE Services & Sales partner, we've been steadily growing for years and aren't slowing down yet! With ServiceNow having 2 major releases a year & 9 solution areas, we have multiple projects going all the time and you can be assured that your skills will be tested and honed.
Role Overview:
As the Business Analyst you will serve as the ultimate facilitator between the client and SuMO in truly understanding the client’s needs and playing a key role in the overall management and success of a project through the entire project lifecycle.
Using proven methods and tools, you will lead the planning, eliciting, analyzing, validating and managing of requirements, business processes, high-level solution design, test case design, and implementation planning & support - in partnership with Engagement Managers, client Stakeholders, and technical consultants. You will work on projects that use Waterfall, Agile Scrum and hybrid delivery methods.
Responsibilities:
Collect, review, analyze, manage, system and user requirements from business users
Form a partnership with the client business teams to deeply understand their business in order to enable the capture of clear, concise, and correct user stories
Bridge the gap between business and technology, ensuring common understanding and technology/Business alignment of both functional (for business needs) and non-functional requirements (quality attributes, scalability, interfaces, constraints, etc.)
Convey business requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, use cases, prototypes, etc. as appropriate
Responsible for creating, refining, and maintaining functional requirements/user stories/use cases and associated deliverables – process flows, test cases, etc. – to meet development and stakeholder needs
Provide project management support using approved project management processes, tools, and techniques
Manage the UAT process by performing smoke testing, test case validation, and obtaining business approvals on UAT for scheduled deployments.
Contribute to a collaborative team environment by information sharing and team cooperation
Required Skills:
We are looking for high performing individuals who are:
Agile and innovative individuals, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment
Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers
Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet the client’s business objectives
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
What You’ve Done:
University degree in Commerce/Business Administration, Applied/Computer Science, or equivalent
Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Business Analyst role in a Waterfall, Agile or hybrid project-based environment
Nice To Have - Fluent in ServiceNow or Service Management technology
Strong knowledge of project and software development methodologies/techniques
Solid presentation, facilitation, interview, and workshop skills
Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict-management skills
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and under tight deadlines
Ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion, and simplify complex situations
Proficient in developing requirements definition, functional specifications, test scenarios/scripts, data models and business procedures.
Strong process flow and diagramming skills (Visio application)
Creation and delivery of training materials
Exposure to managing the testing disciplines (use of Quality Center tool)
Strong interpersonal skills; strong relationship management and negotiation skills.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills - verbal, written, listening and presentation.
Business Analyst certification, IIBA, PMI – (PBA), or equivalent – Nice to Have
What’s in it for you?
We’re different. We recognize that you have opportunities in front of you but here’s what makes SuMO different and a great place to work:
ELITE Partner status- What does this mean for you? It means that you get to work with large global customers on cutting-edge projects. It also means that you get to be on the cutting edge of technology and solutions – not just doing the same thing every day.
A collaborative team – With experts across the country providing support for you so you know that we will have your back.
Investment In YOU- We will ensure that you are equipped with everything you need in terms of Training, Certifications, and Accreditations so that you positioned for success at SuMO and for your career ahead.
 Benefits & Culture– Competitive compensation including Profit Sharing. Work-life balance is also important to us as is hanging out with your colleagues at company events.
If this sounds like it could be a home for you, send us your resume. We’d love to talk.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. You must be legally entitled to work for any employer in Canada.

If you are an ambitious, curious, hard-working, and seasoned energy professional, this is an exciting new opportunity for you to join the Rodan Energy team – an organization that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for three years in a row.

Rodan Energy is a top North American energy services company, quickly growing to serve our clients across North America. We are a leader in distributed energy resource asset optimization, demand response, energy management and intelligence systems, and power systems engineering and metering services. Our innovative solutions are designed for large commercial and industrial energy users as well as power distribution and generation companies. We focus on minimizing energy costs while maximizing efficiencies and corporate sustainability for our clients. Our goal is a sustainable energy future.

We have an opportunity for a Senior Meter Data Analyst based out of our head office in Mississauga. As an integral member of the Information Services team, the Senior Meter Data Analyst will be responsible for Meter data management services for retail, wholesale, and Meter Service Provider (MSP) clients including remote meter interrogation, data collection, verification and posting using meter interrogation software.

Your responsibilities include:

Administration of the Meter Trouble Report (MTR) process; communicating, coordinating, and assisting, customers and the Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)
Schedule MV-90-meter interrogation cycles to ensure availability of metered data and to avoid conflict with IESO reading cycles.
Program meters and configure telemetry and communication devices.
Configuration of equipment for real-time and near real-time telemetry using sources such as Modbus, DNP 3.0, and KYZ pulses.
Interface with other metering service providers, meter data management agencies and clients regarding the provision of metering services, metering installations and metering data.
Interface with the IESO for new meter installations, meter upgrades, meter deregistration, and other issues.
Interface with field staff, prior to and during commissioning of meter installations and commencement of meter data collection.
Maintain the metering database and ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of the data contained therein.
Support Rodan staff with audit and technical proposals, engineering drawings and design, order processing, project management, MSP site registration, installation and commissioning, meter trouble reports and maintenance.

Key qualifications:

Post-secondary education from an accredited college or university and/or prior related work experience ideally in utility metering or billing.
Experience working with data collection and/or settlement systems particularly Itron MV-90 software.
Strong proficiency with MS Office, specifically MS Excel.
Macro and VB scripting skills is considered an asset.
Comprehensive knowledge of electrical principals, terminology, function, SLDs, and interpretation
of electrical measuring instruments.
Experience in networking and telecommunications.
Knowledge of communications protocols, firewalls, TCP/IP.
Strong customer service orientation and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Rodan Energy is strongly committed to diversity and equality of opportunity. We strive to create an environment that is welcoming and inclusive for everyone.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

IO’s Finance, Technology, and Lending Enterprise Team ensures that IO is a financially efficient and effectively managed organization and that the agency’s finances are monitored, reported, and managed appropriately. The team also manages the infrastructure lending program, which has supported more than $18 billion in local infrastructure development, and IO’s Information Technology and Business Services, providing tools and systems to ensure secure, effective, and efficient operations.
Position Purpose:
In this role, the Senior Database Analyst will be in charge of developing, implementing and maintaining the organization’s data, reporting, and information strategy ensuring compatibility with the overall business strategy of the organization. The position is also expected to lead and provide mentorship to other members of the team on tasks associated to data warehousing, data integration processes and Report Tools.
What You Will Do:
Provide database architecture expertise and data related software solutions to IO business units.
Provide technical leadership across a broad range of data analysis functions including data modeling, structured query language (SQL), data quality, data profiling and other specialized data management functions.
Participate in developing specifications, products, services, applications, conversions, implementation plans, and other features associated with the implementation and deployment of the organizational data infrastructure.
Implement data ingestion and ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) processes for data integration with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and Azure Data Factory (ADF).
Make recommendations on how to optimize, rewrite, modify and redesign SQL and ETL based processes based on analysis.
Implement and deploy reporting solutions utilizing technologies sanctioned by IO IT such as SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Power BI.
Look into ways to revamp, optimize and upgrade the current data infrastructure by employing latest cloud technologies with Azure platform.
Work directly with IT Business Analysts, Developers, and external third party partners to build and support the integrations.
Work directly with Business Analysts, Software Developers, and business teams to document report requirements, develop reporting solutions, and support within the production environment.
Work closely with the Infrastructure team and any third party managed services providers to ensure standards are applied and regular database administration tasks are successfully performed.
Support integration points across different applications in organization with Microsoft BizTalk.
Who We’re Looking For:
A post-secondary degree in Information Systems combined with a minimum of 5 years of experience in information systems with a background in database development and business analysis.
Experience with technologies including SQL Server Enterprise Edition (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Visual Studio Data Tools, and Azure Dev Ops is required.
Knowledge of OLAP, Tabular Model, and data warehousing methodologies is required.
Experience in structured methodologies for the design, development, implementation and maintenance of software applications.
Experience in systems design and a solid understanding of development, testing, evaluation procedures, quality assurance, and integration methodologies.
Exposure to cloud-based data solution such as Azure data platform and Power BI is considered a critical asset.
Experience managing projects related to new systems development, the integration of legacy systems with new systems, data and information management and process re-engineering is considered an asset.
Strong oral and written communication skills in order to establish and maintain client relationships.
Infrastructure Ontario is an inclusive employer, we encourage applications from all qualified candidates. We will accommodate your needs under the Ontario Human Rights Code. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers.
The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.
Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters.
Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area.
Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.
Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment.
Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality).
A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience.
MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word).
Strong written, oral, and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes.
Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team.
Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist.
This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel.

Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
Developing data quality Dashboards and Scorecards within Tableau to monitor Risk Data Integrity and KPIs/KRIs for the Risk Data Management Office.
Partnering with Risk Management and Technology stakeholders to document, test and implement data quality fixes for Risk Data.
Assisting in the execution of controls related to the integrity of risk data. Conduct ongoing data quality reviews and ensure that new initiatives meet the standards required to support the business unit’s objectives and overall controls.
Managing the processes and procedures around overall Risk Data Management for the RDMO including the data controls, issue, intake and service management and overall governance documentation.
Oversee the monthly loading and reconciliation of Operational Losses for the Enterprise and ensuring the integrity of the data captured within the Operational Risk System.
How You’ll Succeed
Data driven - Give meaning to large sets of data and aggregate information from multiple sources to summarize it into a meaningful ensemble.
Continuous improvement mindset: Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
Communication and Relationship Management - You get things done, but it is always done in collaboration with your peers and stakeholders. You will be a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the organization by understanding their needs, and presenting a credible and compelling plan that meets those needs. You will leverage your ability to adapt your communications style to lead working level project discussions as well as preparing management level presentations and briefings.
Critical Thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities. You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions. You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in building scorecards and dashboards with tools like Tableau. You have good coding skills, and have used SQL to extract and transform data for the purpose of producing reports for internal and external use. It's an asset if you have experience with visualization tools like Tableau and Cognos. If you have a STEM undergraduate degree, then it will be considered an asset as well.
You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

Position Purpose:

The Alectra Green Energy & Technology Centre (GRE&T Centre) makes energy innovations come to life by identifying, evaluating, developing and accelerating the commercialization of emerging, clean, and customer-friendly energy solutions, creating sustainable values for customers, shareholders and communities it serves. The Grid Innovation team at the GRE&T Centre is focused on enabling a more sustainable electricity grid, by unleashing the potential of grid modernization technologies and integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into local electricity grid. The Business Analyst will provide support to the project initiatives undertaken by Grid Innovation team. The incumbent will work closely with the Grid Innovation team and provide technical support in delivering pilot projects such as Non-Wires alternative (“NWA”) project aimed at designing and operating local distribution energy market that enables distributed energy resources (DER) to participate in grid services; defer or reduce the need for wires investment on distribution grid.

Responsibilities:

Participate in daily project development meeting with the software system vendor; document, update and maintain issues tracking system, capturing live issues and progress on software development.
Analyze business functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and business rules; review and update functional specification documents as necessary to ensure it is up-to-date and address business requirement changes.
Assist with the solution design discussion including database structure, user interface, customer experience etc.
Ensure that changes and features to the system development are properly submitted, updated, assigned, escalated in the current development ticketing system.
Create, deliver, and maintain user stories, process workflows, mockups and system test cases.
Conduct user acceptance testing, system integration testing, regression testing and all other Q&A testing, ensuring system is functioning as designed.
Discover, record and log system issues, defects and resolutions; participate in debug solutioning, fix and QA testing.
Identify areas for improvement and make appropriate recommendations to the project team pertaining to best practices, processes, templates, workflows and methodologies.
Coordinate and support the project teammates and management to ensure alignment of projects and timelines.
Ensure deliverables and feedback needed by project team and vendor software development teams are provided in a timely manner to ensure overall delivery of projects on-time and within budget.
Collaborate and interact with a variety of team members and business units to coordinate project activities; perform demos and customers/users support to the system.
Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis of new and existing data sets and research reports, including advanced modelling and analysis through Excel or similar tools, and develop recommendations based on findings.
Develop written reports and presentations as required to communicate project updates, share research findings and provide topical backgrounders for internal and external stakeholders.
Maintain collaborative working relationships with vendor project team members and support collective efforts on projects delivery.
Provide project support as needed to support the achievement of departmental objectives and other initiatives being carried on within the GRE&T Centre
Other duties as assigned

Education & Specialized Knowledge:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited institution field
Direct experience with both classical waterfall software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies (i.e. scrum)
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications including MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.
General knowledge of the energy markets and utility industries

Experience:

Minimum of 3 years of business analyst or related work experience demonstrating the range of duties expected for this position
Experience in Azure DevOps system environment
Experience in project management on web-based software development project
Knowledge of energy policy and regulation, especially related to distributed energy resources is a strong asset
Experience working in Energy/Utility and/or Data Analytics sector is a strong asset

Skills/Abilities/Competencies:

Strong analytical, problem resolution, technical, application / system troubleshooting skills with the ability to think clearly and resolve issues efficiently under pressure.
Excellent organizational and time management skills with high attention to detail in a demanding, deadline-driven environment.
Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate effectively with other team members as needed.
Excellent data gathering techniques supported by strong interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to use creative and strategic thinking to identify and develop solutions for customers
Demonstrated skills in research and planning to support strategy development and commercialization planning
Ability to build and maintain strong collaborative and collegial working relationships with team members, and internal and external stakeholders
Strong oral, written and presentation skills, with the ability to learn, apply and explain information in an organized and concise way
Self-motivated; ability to work both independently and as a team player
Strong results orientation, with excellent attention to detail

About TROX:
For more than 70 years, we have partnered with Educators and IT Leaders to give them access to an unmatched selection of proven EdTech products and services for the classroom and campus, that enhance the learning experience. As a result, we have helped tens of millions of students in hundreds of thousands of K-12 classrooms and many higher education institutions throughout the US & Canada.
We’re a rapidly growing company focused on selling technology solutions to North American schools. We need help analyzing our product range, managing inventory decisions and setting prices.
A portion of our business comes from traditional distributors and is relatively straight forward to analyse for stock levels, order points, target pricing etc. Another portion comes from purchasing or removing large lots of computer equipment which we refurbish, warranty and resell to schools.
The challenge is in analyzing those large mixed lots to make data driven instead of anecdotal decisions. If you buy a container with 1000 different laptops for $100,000, how do you assign costs to maximize profits and sales? Add in the variable time required to test and refurbish various units, failure rates, shortages in the market and other variables that determine our real cost. Simply averaging will result in low end units that are too expensive and high end units that are too cheap; what should be a simple cost is not so simple.
Similarly, if every tiny variation in specs (i.e. slightly more RAM or a slightly larger hard drive) creates a new SKU, how do you derive meaningful analysis? Some variations are so slight that the SKUs should be considered the same for all analysis purposes.
The ideal candidate will have the skill, experience and desire to solve complex analysis puzzles and the confidence to suggest business practices based on their data despite what general market wisdom might be.
Given the complexity of the computer industry a strong general knowledge of computer hardware is essential.
You will be part of the Purchasing Department and report directly to the Chief Operating Officer while working closely with logistics and development teams to understand and analyse needs, create reports and software, then implement solutions with our warehouse team.
Responsibilities:
Analyze historical and market data to design and implement a cost model that accurately captures costs but does not unduly burden sales
Analyze sales to determine re-order points, minimum and maximum stock levels, lead times necessary to maintain stock, integrate JIT deliveries to maintain production while not crowding the warehouse
Analyze different suppliers and offers to calculate and negotiate the most cost-effective solutions.
Proposes strategies to reduce costs, increase efficiencies and improve procedures
Requirements:
A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
Strong knowledge of data analysis, inventory management software, and forecasting techniques.
Thorough understanding of computer hardware.
An analytical mind with strong attention to detail.
Creativity and problem solving skills.
Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
If you feel like this is a good fit for you and you can positively and significantly contribute to our team, apply today for immediate consideration. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

About Us

Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and their employees. Homebase currently serves more than 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses with everything they need to manage their hourly teams: employee scheduling, time clocks, team communication, hiring, onboarding, and compliance. We are not Human Capital Management. We are not HR Software. We're tools built for the busiest businesses, so owners and employees can spend less time on paperwork and more time on what matters. The Homebase team brings small business expertise from Intuit, Square, Yelp, Gusto, and First Data, and finance and strategy experience from Bain, Goldman Sachs, KKR, and McKinsey. Based in San Francisco and Houston, Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Bain Capital Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, and Khosla Ventures.

We are in the early stages of what we will achieve, and we're looking for a motivated self-starter in this key Business Operations role.

You

A successful Business Operations Analyst is a dynamic, strategic, and collaborative self-starter with an ability to digest and prioritize large amounts of data to craft a narrative. You most likely have a consulting or investment banking background, are eager to act fast, and want to start learning how to build and operate a business. You love working cross-functionally and enjoy tackling a wide range of challenges, from operations to strategy.

The Job

Data Analysis and Reporting: Support as the connective tissue to the business in answering complicated strategic questions with both quantitative and qualitative insights. Be a key voice and sounding board to key players and executives in reinforcing our data-driven culture and be seen as a go-to internal expert across a variety of functions.
Forecasting: Work with senior executives across functional groups to plan and measure how resources are deployed, both at the company and department level. Define and track KPIs to ensure resources are efficiently allocated and aligned in support of broader business objectives.
Market Development and Growth: Identify, quantify, and execute against high potential growth opportunities within both existing and new products. Conduct customer and market research to develop hypotheses and then work with engineering, product, and marketing to execute tests and to ensure learnings are implemented successfully.
Process Development: Scale existing systems and processes - or help build new ones from the ground up – to facilitate our customer growth and take our operations to the next level.
Corporate Strategy & Finance: Help guide Homebase's strategic direction with solid business modeling and decision analysis. Develop forecasts, monitor market conditions, and help execute fundraising as needed.

This role is a rare opportunity to have visibility across a rapidly growing startup and to play a key role in multiple projects critical to scaling the business. The size of our team and stage of our growth means you will get your hands in a variety of unique and challenging ways, and impact the lives of millions of hourly workers.

Must-Have

Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, or related field
2-3 years of analytical experience in management consulting, equity research, investment banking, private equity, and/or a corporate development, strategy, or planning & analysis role
Has experience with SQL, Looker, or other Data Viz tools; or a strong desire to learn
Gets a kick out of digging deep into data, structuring thoughts and process upfront to help deliver the best results and business outcomes
Ability to drive complex projects and processes with minimal guidance and oversight, with a bias towards action and constant prioritization
Loves finding the most customer-friendly solution to the problems, bringing in both qualitative and quantitative feedback before making decisions
Proven track record for working well across teams and with external partners
Keeps a process-oriented mindset with an ability to execute projects small and large
Possesses a strong sense of urgency in line with our value of "No Day Wasted"
Works well with and influences people with a vast array of working styles
Loves local business… supporting them and building great tools for them

What We Offer You

Supplemental Benefits
Stock Options - Everyone is an owner
Fun Team Activities
A dynamic, well-connected, productive team that is thriving while working from home and who have found new ways to connect and have fun despite social distancing

Job Title: Lead Data Quality Analyst - Opportunity for Working Remotely Toronto,
Job Description:
This role is fully remote, and can be done anywhere in the US or Canada.
The purpose of the role is to lead and support the enterprise data quality efforts for VMware Inc. This role is responsible for supporting the enterprise data quality monitoring and reporting program to ensure adherence to the organization’s data quality standards. This includes the development of standardized and executable business rules that are applied systemically across data sources, engagement and education with data consumers, owners & stewards to implement and enforce the adoption of enterprise quality standards, and the management of quality reporting through the process, technology, and communication. The incumbent will assist with the development and management of quality procedures and the promotion of data quality standards to ensure the quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels. The incumbent will also work with business partners, stakeholders, and the IT department to provide recommendations on the resolution of data integrity gaps while supporting the implementation of systematic and procedural controls for Critical Business Elements (CBEs) in the scope of Governance.
Responsibilities:
Demonstrate strong information management, data quality, data analytics including strong working knowledge of data infrastructure and various technology reporting platforms.
Provide leadership, motivation and establish a teamwork environment for the cross-functional data quality team and processes.
Independently manage and drive work deliverables and co-ordinate with the offshore team.
Play a key role in leading the development, documentation, and implementation of data quality procedures and standards to support enterprise goals.
Work with business partners, stakeholders, and the IT departments to define and document data quality rules, targets, and standards.
Establish change controls over quality standards and work with functional and IT partners to enforce them within the organization.
Partner with data stewards and owners to implement, enhance, and manage governance dashboarding capability on quality metrics.
Define user experience standards and exception reporting capability.
Partner with IT to implement data quality mart and data quality trend reporting. Implement and manage training and education in the data quality space with users to ensure the use and adoption of data quality tools and processes to improve the quality of data.
Facilitate and provide data quality subject matter expertise within data governance working groups focused on data quality improvement efforts.
Oversee the development and implementation of the detailed project and work plans for data quality monitoring and reporting efforts within the data governance organization.
Coordinate the planning, documenting, and execution activities for the projects; along with tasks, budgets, timelines, and project staffing to successfully complete projects on a timely basis and within budget.
Develop documentation to support the project planning and implementation process. Lead and provide support to project teams by facilitating/attending project meetings, documenting minutes and action items, responding to assigned tasks when due.
Provide recommendations for measuring and improving the effectiveness and efficiency of data governance, operational control processes, and compliance activities. Support proactive profiling, data lineage reviewing, performing root cause triage, and support identifying appropriate owners for fixing root causes of the issues.
Develop and refine high quality monthly and quarterly metrics reporting and -publishing capability demonstrating program activities and communication to stakeholders & senior leadership.
Technical Skills:
6+ years of experience in data quality/governance/ analysis related work or similar
Proficient in SQL with a minimum of 3-5 years of hands-on experience
Proficient in Informatica Data Quality with 2-3 years of hands-on experience
Strong conceptual understanding of data analysis, data quality ,etc.
Experience with reporting tools like Power BI, Tableau ,etc., data quality tools like Informatica IDQ, SAP Info Steward is desired
Experience of intent to learn software domain related to VMware products and the way virtualization software/hardware
Preferred Skills:
Business Acumen, ability to translate business needs into a set of workable, specific requirements
Ability to independently lead data quality efforts with minimal guidance
Ability to navigate across cross-functional groups in a global organization
Well versed with MS PowerPoint/Visio
Ability to understand business requirements, KPIs and convert into analytical hypothesis in a structured and logical manner along with solution identification
Ability to handle multiple projects at a time in terms of multitasking, prioritization, allocation, and team management
Ability to coordinate and work within multiple business units from a project management perspective
Ability to work across geographies and interact with global stakeholders
Ability and motivation to work efficiently and productively in a multi-task environment and with minimal direction
Ability to identify and analyze problems using sound judgment and determine solutions to effectively resolve issues
Strong task management and prioritization capabilities
Ability to initiate process improvement plans and work towards change
Flexible to changing priorities and to work outside of office hours as per business requirements.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills
Strong work ethic and sense of responsibility
What we are looking for:
A Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 6 years of experience in data quality/ governance/ analysis-related work or similar.
Strong SQL and relational database /data warehouse (Oracle, SQL Server, Postgress, Presto) skills, data analysis experience is needed to be successful in this role. A Techno-functional individual with strong business acumen is required. Experience with reporting tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc., data quality tools like Informatica IDQ, SAP Info Steward is desired.
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and a fast-changing environment. Ability to lead and drive efforts to completion.
Knowledge of industry-leading data quality and issue management tools and practices.
Strong knowledge and experience in data-related activities (data quality, data governance, metadata, data management, data standards, data structures, data aggregation, and business requirements).
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to speak to varying levels across the organization.
Development and championing of cross-functional engagement within data governance and to other business / IT groups.
Ability to get to the heart of the problem and make sound and timely decisions to resolve problems.

Employment Opportunity

Business Systems Analyst (1 Year Contract)

TO Live

Toronto, Canada

TO Live has an opportunity in the Information Technology Department for an enthusiastic, organized, and resourceful team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and studying new and existing technology systems and solutions. This position will also involve working with other departments to determine their future and current software, data, reporting and hardware requirements.

A key responsibility for this position will be to provide recommendations to management regarding technology systems as they are analyzed and implemented, and how they relate to overall Information Technology lifecycle expenditures. The Business Systems Analyst will also be required to create detailed documentation, workflows, and flowcharts for both new and existing technology systems.

ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze software solutions regarding current business requirements:
Foundation Customer Relationship Management
Foundation Financials
Financial Forecasting and Budgeting
Microsoft Office Azure and Intune
Microsoft SharePoint
Cloud Storage
Archives Digitization
Project coordination for implementing new systems, existing system changes and/or enhancements.
Analyze and evaluate current systems to identify and suggest solutions for process improvements.
Maintain existing applications and databases with appropriate patches and security updates.
Assist with implementation of the infrastructure lifecycle.
Conduct and implement training sessions related to application changes, new software implementations, and business requirements.
Proactively collect information that may turn into future projects.
Perform introduction and information sessions for users regarding software and equipment use, policies and procedures.
Research and address user needs by creating and/or enhancing processes and reports where required that improve user experiences and optimize expenses.
Attend educational events and stay up to date with the latest technology and best practices.
Backup support as required for days off and/or vacation coverage.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Director of Information Technology.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS

Experience working with analyzing and implementing complex and cross-department information technology initiatives.
Minimum 7 years of experience in a similar position within Information Technology.
Fluent understanding of Information Technology terminology.
Fluent understanding of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V and VMware.
Fluent understanding of Microsoft Office 365.
Strong understanding of ticketing, fundraising, event, CRM and accounting processes.
Diligent in training and development of training materials.
Solid analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work under strict deadlines.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Flexibility in hours and schedules and includes work on nights and weekends as required.
Lack of natural light in workplace.
Travel between all three TO Live venues as required.

THE ORGANIZATION:
TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall (formerly the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts), the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre (formerly the Toronto Centre for the Arts). In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity.
