Killi is currently seeking a Data & Research Analyst to join our Product team that stands apart from the rest of the market that is interested in joining a true startup culture and be part of building something special.
Killi is direct to consumer (D2C) platform that allows people to take back control of their personal data and get rewarded for sharing data with buyers. Killi directly tackles the issues of personal data breaches and massive corporations getting rich by selling their customers’ data in exchange for, well, nothing. Killi also provides a transparent market solution in the face of growing cries for government regulation around the collection and use of personal data.
We are a true start-up. It is hard, but you will learn a lot. We work fast, have big aspirations and have a lot of fun along the way.

What you are responsible for:

Being a customer advocate pulling together behavioral, data, and support analytics and others against the brand and product roadmap.
Platform by platform analytics. Behavioral analytics (Amplitude/Branch.io), User Analytics (Metabase), documentation in Confluence, and others to analyze consumer trends and gaps not only in reporting but with consumer engagement and to generate an actionable plan to improve customer experience.

Measuring and reporting on the impact of all new features in the product while establishing suggestions and gaps for revision of these features.

Assisting with designing and prioritizing the product roadmap.

Assist product and engineering team with grooming.
Supporting the product strategy by developing a deep understanding of market trends, the needs of prospective and current customers, as well as how customers use our products and our competitors’ products.

Experience working with consumer-facing (DTC or Fintech) products or emerging protocols such as blockchain essential

Experience with agile methodologies – scrum master a plus.

Strong business acumen with the ability to think strategically and tactically.

Job Title: Senior Data Insights Analyst, Customer Experience
Job Description:
We believe small businesses are at the heart of our communities, and championing them is worth fighting for. We empower small business owners to manage their finances fearlessly, enabling more of them to thrive by offering the simplest, all-in-one financial management solution small business owners can't live without.
As an award-winning company, and one of the fastest growing financial services software, we are unwavering in our commitment to grow and support both our customers and our people. We care deeply and we challenge directly. We re-image the possible, together, to achieve extraordinary results for the small business owners we support and believe in.
About Wave
Wave propels brave entrepreneurs who pursue their dreams and drive the world’s economy. As an award-winning product and company, and one of the fastest-growing financial services software we’re on a mission to change the lives of entrepreneurs across the globe, and are looking for only the best to join us.
About this Role
Reporting into the Data and Analytics Team, the Senior Data Insights Analyst, Customer Experience will be accountable for laying the foundation and advancing Wave’s customer experience analytics, intelligence, and strategy.
We are looking for a talented, analytically skilled and curious self-motivator who can help transform our customer experience (CX) into a strategic, growth accelerant. We need someone who can partner with CX leadership and horizontally across various business units to deeply understand the effects of our product offerings and how we service customers to surface critical insights where customer value and business value are tightly aligned. This will start with building a strong data foundation from a customer support and behaviour lens and then expand into developing new measurement frameworks and creating new analytical and descriptive models to drive testing and experimentation to transform customer experience into a key business growth driver.
This role is for someone who is naturally curious, has a strong desire to learn and can combine their strong business acumen with their expertise in the field of quantitative analytics to the context and challenge at hand. Influence and strong communication skills are a must as this role will engage with varying levels of the organization from senior leadership to front line managers to help drive business solutions through their articulation of actionable insights and highlighting opportunities.
To get better, we need to change and we need someone who is not afraid to challenge the status quo in their quest for driving business value through data accuracy and exceptional customer service.
Here’s how you’ll make a difference:
YOUR PLAYGROUND AND SANDBOX - Partner with the broader Customer Experience team to examine and analyze the service experience. Provide actionable insights and measure the direct and indirect impacts of customer support interactions and their positive (or negative) effects on key customer behaviours (retention, acquisition, adoption, Net Promoter Score, satisfaction) across the Wave ecosystem.
FOCUS ON LEARNING THROUGH EXPERIMENTATION - Using the scientific method, you’ll formulate specific hypotheses, design and evaluate various experiments to test and learn what support methods and models work in partnership with our customer operations teams (e.g., channel mix, response times, proactive versus reactive, self serve versus human).
BUILD AND GOVERN OUR DATA INFRASTRUCTURE - Collaborate with Data Engineers and Developers to ensure the right data elements and pipelines are captured, organized and stored in the right format from various product administration and servicing systems to enable a consistent, repeatable analytical environment for reporting and experimentation measure progress against departmental goals and help with strategic decision making.
DESIGN THE COCKPIT INSTRUMENTATION - Build and manage reporting dashboards (e.g., Looker, Zendesk Insights / Explorer) that highlight the health and performance of the different customer operations and experiments you are working on. You’re responsible for what should be included in these dashboards and how that data is presented working with the individual department managers and leads to drive consistency against targets.
LINK SERVICE EXPERIENCE TO VALUE CREATION - Create relational, statistical and descriptive analytical models to support strategic decision making. (e.g., resourcing/headcount investments, service experience contribution to business returns, Wave wide customer retention service model, servicing tiers and customer segmentation) Over time, this role will evolve to include predictive modelling and analytics building upon the solid analytical foundation established
These will help you succeed:
5+ years of hands-on experience in Data Analytics. This is important ‘cause this is what you’ll be doing all the time, and we need someone experienced to do it. It’s big stuff we’re working on.
Experience partnering with internal business to ideate and translate data and ideas into execution.
Advanced SQL & Python skills with experience querying large and very complex and varied data sources including Relational Databases, APIs, clickstream and log data. You should know what all of these words mean if you want to apply, and you’re excited about it, too.
Experience calculating, tracking and understanding business and operational KPIs (e.g. CSAT, customer retention, engagement, activation, contact rate, deflection, churn, and conversion).
You know the differences between Redshift, Amplitude, Looker and are super comfy with all of them.
Experience in Experimental design and statistical analysis (including multivariate regression, decision trees, correlation models, and analysis of variance). This is the type of analysis you’ll be expected to do.
Strong knowledge of customer support channels (phone, live chat, email) and hands-on experience linking customer experience data with business, marketing and product data.
Experience in customer support, marketing and/or operations is considered an asset
You’ll Thrive Here, If:
You have the ability to work autonomously. No one’s going to be peering over your shoulder here. We count on you to get your work done, in ambiguous conditions, with tight deadlines, while still producing high-quality work. It’s fun, promise!
You are all about collaboration. You’ll be working with Operations Managers, Product Managers, Engineering Managers, Marketing Managers, Business Unit Managers and tons of other folks as their go-to customer analytics person. It’s not going to work if you don’t see the value of different perspectives.
You are a stellar communicator. This means you know how to translate technical terms into non-technical language which your grandma could understand. This also means you have no problem presenting the insights you’ve gathered from your stellar analysis to Kirk (our CEO).
You’re good with other tech. Wave is a diverse place with lots of different tools, languages, frameworks, structures, and types of analysis. Knowing R, SAS, or Python would be helpful to help close the gap between your role and others
We hire world-class talent, but the learning doesn’t stop once you’re in the door. We believe in the balance of IQ with EQ. We support continuous professional and personal development with flexible mentorship programs, ongoing learning opportunities and a serious investment in each employee. We’re here to do excellent work, together, and achieve that by bringing on only the best.
We are a community of people with competitive hearts. Competitive in wanting to better the lives of our Brave Entrepreneurs. Competitive in never settling for less than extraordinary. Competitive in pushing each other and our ideas, by collaborating and communicating respectfully.
Monthly town hall meetings are where we regularly share business metrics and updates from the CEO. When you have the data you need, you are empowered to pivot your plans to solve problems, remove bottlenecks and find a way to win.
At Wave, we have an unwavering commitment to growing our people personally and professionally, and we make a serious investment in each employee’s health and wellness. Through skills training, mentorship, leadership programs, monthly mindshares, and education allowances, we foster continuous learning and development. Our extensive health benefits plan combined with flex health funds, employee assistance plan, wellness classes, and extensive time off allow our employees to stay healthy and care for themselves and their families while doing their best work - whether you choose to work from our beautiful office in Toronto or from home anywhere else in Canada.
We are different from other companies in many ways; first and foremost, by our culture. We are not perfect by any means. We can all do better, and as a company, we strive with uncompromising integrity to do better every day. We have an unwavering belief that a diverse and inclusive culture creates the best workplace experiences. We embrace our differences, value individuality, and respect the broad spectrum of every Waver's skills and abilities. We challenge each other from a place of respect and pursuit of continuous growth. We trust each other and encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work, everyday. At Wave, our voices matter, our opinions are met with an open mind, and contributing to an inclusive culture is a part of all of our roles.
Our culture is reflected in a stellar Glassdoor rating. We’ve been continuously recognized as one of Canada's Top Ten Most Admired Corporate Cultures and one of Canada’s Great Places to Work in various categories including Technology, Millennials, Mental Health, Inclusion and Women for years. Our people are incredibly talented and the key to our success, so we admire and respect each and every one greatly.

Are you ready to be a Waver? Join us!

The main purpose of this position is to Collaborate with the Bond Business Application and Project Stakeholders. The IT Business Analyst will reduce the rework on projects by effectively collaborating with the business stakeholders to understand their technical requirements. The IT Business Analyst will determine the complete and correct business requirements at the beginning of the project with the business stakeholders buy-in so that the steps can be implemented properly throughout the project.
The IT Business Analyst will act as the conduit between the Business stakeholders and the Technical resources for the initial implementation of new technologies as well as enhancements to existing technologies and the ongoing evolving business driven technology requirements.
This position reports to the Manager, Helpdesk.
As our IT Business Analyst, you will:
Be accountable for providing consulting services to internal Bond Corporate application users
Development of corporate technical solutions for business problems
Develop detailed functional and technical specifications
Develop technology systems according to specifications
Provide on-going support for implemented systems
Build and Maintain knowledge of corporate applications, methodologies and information technology trends through training, appropriate literature and other means
Review and approve test strategy, test plans and test cases, ensuring business requirements are met
Analysis Phase = provide consultative services to Business Units cross BOND, investigate and identify business problem, develop targeted solution, provide estimates of work effort and duration for moderate sized enhancement.
Planning Phase = prepare external design document and ensure it is comprehensive with respect to business requirement, functionality, performance and operating efficiency, participate in the design of screens, participate in walkthrough meetings with clients.
Build Phase = ensure application has been properly migrated into test environment, ensure walkthroughs are held to the test requirements and test cases.
Testing Phase = support testing and execution of test plan, ensure that testing team is provided with updated functional specifications
Implementation Phase = responsible for user verification activities in a production environment, participate in post implementation review.
As our Corporate Technical Business Analyst, you have:
Broad exposure/experience of analyzing corporate requirements and making recommendations of new and improved applications to meet those requirements along with becoming the conduit between the business and Technical Implementation and Support Team. In many cases manage the relationship with external vendors and providing them with the appropriate business requirements.
Excellent in-depth knowledge of various data structures and different operating system.
Excellent communication skills (oral, written and interpersonal)
Analytical, problem solving, decision making and negotiating skills
The ability to effectively manage multiple Projects and activities of varying complexity while under time constraints
Relevant client-facing experience
Must be a team player
Minimum 5 Years’ experience within the Business Analyst role.
Why Join Us?
Bond is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work and a Best Managed Company for the third year in a row.
We’re 400(ish) people working tirelessly together to make the world a more loyal place. You’ll be joining a hyper-talented team with a galaxy of skillsets ranging from research to creative to digital and beyond. You’ll have an excellent opportunity to grow, learn and make an impact as we tackle some of our client’s biggest business challenges.
If you’re looking to build your career, build your skills and build bonds apply today! We're growing and have multiple roles available.
At Bond, we are proud to be a diverse organization and we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly create equal opportunity and positive employment experiences for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

Builds and maintains the production execution of Data Science into enterprise systems and architecture

You will be accountable to:
Under limited guidance deploy within the production data science environment understanding pipeline controls, and documentation around intent and usage of model or algorithm.
Support the research, design, and construct predictive models to enhance understanding of Moneris core business and adjacent opportunities such as transaction monitoring and consumer behaviour
Partner with data engineering and data analytics teams to use and understand data pipelines for data science usage.
Use robust statistical techniques to increase accuracy for existing projects and create solutions for adoption in business context.

Retail Business Analyst
Overview
IQVIA™ (www.IQVIA™.com) is the world’s leading company providing information, technology, and services for virtually every type of stakeholder in healthcare. Every day, IQVIA™ innovates on a large scale. Since 1954 we’ve been helping healthcare organizations harness the power of commercial and scientific insights We develop and operate systems and applications using big data technologies on our private-public hybrid cloud. IQVIA™ stores and computes more than 20 petabytes of complex healthcare data on diseases, treatments, costs and outcomes, annually, helping our clients run their operations more efficiently. IQVIA processes over 50 billion healthcare transactions annually and employs over 50,000 professionals in more than 100 countries to drive results for over 5,000 healthcare clients globally. IQVIA™ is a publicly listed company (NYSE – Q) with estimated revenue exceeding $10B and a market cap of over $28B.
Individuals joining us should expect a rewarding and progressive career in life sciences consulting. You’ll have the opportunity to address challenging client issues, across multiple geographies with a hands-on influence in delivering solutions. We operate in a truly multi-cultural, collegial and collaborative work environment that is rich in development and growth.
Role & Responsibilities
As a Retail Pharmaceutical Analyst, you will be responsible for providing data analytics, supporting the maintenance and development of a suite of syndicated offerings for retail pharmacies. This includes leading investigations to address internal and external client queries, requiring research and coordination with the commercial team, formulating client responses.
Support in the investigating of both internal and external client queries. Requires research and respond and work with a commercial team to share knowledge and support workload across various offerings and databases.
Retail Analyst:
Provides analysis and project management support in the delivery of syndicated offerings & ad hoc studies.
Manages requirements gathering, providing recommendations to develop research plans, identifying appropriate data sources and delivery options to meet client needs.
Performs analysis in support of offerings production and delivery cycles.
Performs quantitative research, and provides summaries of study results to commercial and offerings lead.
Participates in selecting or developing methodology for use in new offerings and analytics.
May consult with clients in support of project delivery or requirements gathering.
Performs routine data analysis to develop customer specific insights and solutions to customer business challenges.
Validates / QA’s reporting methodologies supporting the business needs
Proactively develops knowledge of the pharmaceutical marketplace with emphasis on wholesale and retail pharmacy
About You
The skills and behaviors required for this position include: Experience within the healthcare industry. Strong understanding of business intelligence tools is preferred, with emphasis on utilization and application. Demonstrated problem solving, analytical and customer service skills.
Bachelor’s Degree
Four (4) years relevant analytics &/or pharmaceutical industry experience
Strong analytical skills
Strong communication skills
Experience analyzing large amounts of data.
Advantaged Knowledge of MS-Excel, MS-Access
Knowledge of IQVIA datasets/databases an asset
Knowledge SQL and relational database concepts
Knowledge of the Canadian Healthcare/Pharmaceutical industry
Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and multi-task
At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Ready to be the change at TD?
We're an innovator and leader in the change management space. When others look to change, they look to TD for inspiration and results. Across the bank, we're fast-tracking digital and agile culture transformation. Our legendary customer experience continues to guide us as we deliver groundbreaking projects and experiences. With an innovative mindset, we will achieve our critical Business Imperatives while instilling a culture that brings the TD Shared Commitments to life.

Want to be where the action is? Strategic change management is a valued and evolving discipline at TD, ready to take the organization and your career, to new heights.

Want to shape the future? This is a strong and connected enterprise-wide change management community where you'll feel connected and challenged. You'll be busy, but never bored and your real passion for change will reap lasting rewards.

See yourself shoulder to shoulder with enterprise leaders and industry influencers? We do too. This is a role where you're at the table, on industry panels and in your element. We support think time, planning and the value of connecting with peers, leaders and outside networks. There's a big appetite to raise the bar in this role. Change at TD is evolving and influencing at a rapid pace and we're looking for visionaries, just like you to be this change.

Who we are? Our Wealth Change Management team reports into the Wealth Shared Services Group of TD Wealth. Our team is focused to drive legendary client and colleague experience by taking a proactive and integrated approach to influence, lead and deliver solutions in partnership with our key stakeholders. We are the centre of excellence and lead the strategic change for our TD Wealth projects and to augment change management needs for wealth as it relates to Enterprise and Business Projects.


What we do? By leveraging our standard TD change methodology we;
Address the people side of change to support people, process and technology changes
Help the business with insights on how best to prepare, manage, and reinforce the change.
Drive increased probability of project success, by reducing resistance, increasing speed of adoption, and sustaining the change.
Job Description
As a Senior Change Management Analyst, you will:

Lead, plan and / or execute on the end-to-end delivery of change management activities throughout the lifecycle for assigned projects / initiatives. Adhering to change management standards to ensure all work is in alignment with the change management strategy, TD methodology, adheres to the project delivery governance, business and project objectives.
Lead a diverse range of multiple projects. Engage project partners, and subject matter experts effectively. Assess potential change processes and diverse audience issues.
Analyze change impacts / risks and provide recommendations to project managers, stakeholders, employees, process, technology solutions to achieve business results
Provide recommendations and direction based on the end-to-end client experience for Wealth
Lead and own the project deliverables related to change management to meet the needs of the clients, colleagues, and Wealth to drive successful adoption of change.
Engage appropriate stakeholders to identify and manage required outcomes of projects
Assess and ensure that client and colleague experience / stakeholder impacts are appropriately understood and managed.
Identify and engage appropriate stakeholders to identify and manage required change outcomes of the projects for the business.
Provide on-going communications and status updates on your change management deliverables and tactics using the Project Delivery governance structure
Provide critical insights to align communication and training plans to the change management strategy while ensuring the groups fully integrated and aligned for project delivery with the project manager.
Respond to inquiries and escalate change related concerns from stakeholders, project managers and partners at all level in the organization.
Collaborate with partners across TD and Wealth to drive successful adoption of change (e.g. communication, training, process, etc.)
Work with the Business Owner / Sponsor to identify change metrics and how they will be measured
Accountable for providing standard change deliverables based on scope of Wealth Change Management Service level and Enterprise methodology.
Support the development / delivery of presentations / communications
Exercise discretion and professionalism when providing and receiving coaching and feedback
Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communications of issues / points of interest
Provide thought leadership for change management area of expertise and participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units
Participate in personal performance management and development activities, including cross training within the change management community
Keep others informed and up to date about the status / progress of your projects and on all relevant or useful information relates to day-to-day activities.
Contribute to team development of skills and capabilities through mentoring of others, by sharing knowledge and experiences in leveraging best practices.
Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce.
Act as a brand champion and change ambassador for Wealth and TD, both internally and externally

Job Requirements
This is an expert level professional role requiring in-depth knowledge, expertise in change management and working knowledge of broader related areas including training, communications and technology. Must have the ability to lead end-to-end projects with major deliverables that are moderately complex in scope and scale. Accountable for own work and acts as a point of escalation related to change management methodology and tools for Wealth Change Management. Required to support multiple projects across multiple Wealth business areas. Ability to integrate the broader business context into change management deliverables, advice and solutions. Must have the ability to solve moderately complex problems by taking on new perspectives to drive realistic solutions. Leads the resolution to complex problems requiring analysis of multiple variables, including consultation with multiple stakeholders.
Undergraduate degree
Relevant Change Management accreditations are an asset
Five (5) or more years of related experience, working in a project environment
Proficient knowledge of change management principles, industry standards and methodologies, project management, organizational practices and business transformation
Knowledge of risk management environment, standards and regulations
Skill in using software tools, applications (MS Office), data analysis methods and reporting techniques
Ability to communicate clearly, confidently and effectively in both oral and written form
Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships, succeed in a team and work independently
Ability to exercise good judgement in making decisions and consistently exercise discretion in managing information
Ability to analyze, research, organize and prioritize work and meet multiple deadlines
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.
Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers.
The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.
Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters.
Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area.
Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.
Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment.
Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality).
A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience.
MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word).
Strong written, oral, and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes.
Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team.
Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist.
This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel.

About Earth Rangers:


Environmental education at a young age plays a critical role in influencing lifelong attitudes towards our
natural world. But we can’t just equip children with knowledge—to create long term behavioral change,
we must empower them with the ability to act on that knowledge. Preparing the next generation to be
conservationists is some of the most important work that any of us can do, and the time to do it is now.
Earth Rangers is the kids’ conservation organization, committed to instilling environmental knowledge,
positivity, and the confidence to take action in every child in Canada. We do this through a suite of
programming that children can participate in at school, at home, and in their communities. All of these
programs are educational and engaging—but more importantly, they show children that it’s not too late
to help the planet, and the things we do today will matter tomorrow.
Founded as a small community organization in 2004, Earth Rangers has grown to be the largest youth
environmental organization globally; a homegrown, Canadian success story with over 250,000 members
and alumni.
Job Summary:


The successful Data Analyst will assist Earth Rangers with the management of our data and will provide
evidence based insights to inform business decisions. Sources of data include our membership
activities, app usage, and web and social media analytics. The successful candidate will be curious and
constantly looking for ways to improve our programs based on insights gleaned from the data.

Responsibilities
* 
Maintain a complete understanding of Earth Rangers data structures and architecture
* Interpret Earth Rangers’ data sets and analyze results using statistical techniques
* Provide technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing
* Work closely with program managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytical
needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant
decision-makers
* Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated
curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating
areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
* Regularly pull reports for each department and work with managers to prioritize business and
information needs using relevant data
* Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data
analysis process
* Manage and improve existing reporting systems
Qualifications
* University degree in Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics/Information Management.
* Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
* Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL, etc),
programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
* Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel,
SPSS, SAS, etc)
* Experience representing data in understandable/consumable formats for stakeholders
* Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations
* Administrative knowledge of Salesforce an asset
* Knowledge of GIS systems an asset
* Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases, web analytics,
and social media insights
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant
amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Position:

Data Governance Analyst

Reports To:

Supervisor, Data Governance

Tier:

Staff

Department:

Data Governance

Company:

GS1 Canada

Location:
Toronto(Remote)

Status:

Full-Time Contract(12 months)


Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role

Our mission is to generate the greatest possible return on internal data assets by protecting the integrity of enterprise information through data management policies and guidelines. This requires a deep understanding of governance principles and a genuine desire to create, document and audit the conditions which will enforce its robustness.

The Data Governance Analyst will lead, or provide cross functional support, in these five primary areas: Process Mapping, Policy Creation, Data Definitions, Best Practices and Exception Reporting. The incumbent will be a champion in deploying best practices while maintaining standards and be a pillar of consistency which the business can rely on.

Duties and Responsibilities
Recognizes the data requirements for enterprise data throughout the entire lifecycle
Supports the implementation of strategies designed to enhance data reliability, quality and integrity
Work closely with senior business and technology leaders to create programs, disciplines and practices to significantly improve the ownership and quality of critical enterprise data assets
Assists with new initiatives and projects by understanding impacts on data constraints, data flow and business requirements
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Ensures that data governance guidelines are followed and that the needs of each business unit are met
Maintain common data dictionaries for key data sources, tools and methods that support data standards for the organization
Create process maps which clearly represents the flow of data and key decision-making steps
Monitors and tracks data quality issues or gaps in processes and develops plans for remediation
Works closely with local and global member office representatives to execute remediation plans
Conducts numerous data conversion activities and facilitate data cleansing, collection and processing for new initiatives
Collaborates with cross functional business units to determine data requirements and help meet needs while adhering to master data necessities
Develops and reports on the health of master data for stakeholders
Develops and maintains metrics to support enterprise and board level reports
Assists with documenting and mapping the Data Warehouse content lifecycle process
Develop standards, conventions and guidelines for the creation, deployment and maintenance of BI tools and reports
Assist with Data Analysis counterparts to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
Successful completion of a four-year undergraduate degree in an applicable field, preferably Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Statistics, or, equivalent experience in applicable fields
1 to 2 years work experience relative to analytics, managing data and working with large and sometimes ubiquitous data file
Process thinker with knowledge of data modelling is a benefit
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business requirements, technical design and operational implementation of systems and processes
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Understanding of governance principles and master data management required.
Proficiency with Excel and advanced capability with other MS Office applications highly desirable
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Knowledge of Data Warehouses, design and/or architecture highly desired
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM an asset
Ability to understand complex processes, work and data flows and leverages excellent technical writing experience to illustrate succinctly in standard operating procedures, functional document or diagrams.
Meticulous with high attention to detail particularly when reviewing work of others
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment Ability to work at a detailed level and quickly learn business application-specific details
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyse data for recommendations
Confident communicator capable of speaking and presenting to stakeholders at all levels
Proven high level of proficiency with MS Office suite (Word, Visio & PowerPoint, etc.)
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

Diversity, equity and inclusion are fundamental to our mission to educate students. We are committed to education that places strong emphasis on global citizenship, social justice and equity. We live this through the strength and richness that diversity brings to our workforce and welcome contributors from equity groups including: Visible Minorities, Persons with Disabilities, Lesbian Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer persons
We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississauaga of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations.
Position Summary
Centennial College is immediately hiring a Senior Analyst, Data Visualization & Analytics with a strong foundation in data visualization and predictive modelling. Reporting to the Manager, Institutional Research Office, the Analyst will work independently to build and implement machine learning-based solutions to drive measurable organizational outcomes. The incumbent will use a combination of techniques from statistics, machine learning, computer science and data visualization, to produce advanced predictive analytics and data visualization solutions that determine patterns and relationships of large volumes of data to predict future behaviours, events and outcomes. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with staff across departments to clearly communicate research findings through dashboards, data visualizations, interactive charts, graphs and other tools to diverse audiences. These solutions will support strategic enrolment management (SEM) initiatives and the full student life cycle carried out by academic units and student support services college-wide.
Responsibilities
Provide centralized support and action plans to various data visualization and predictive analytics initiatives through the development of standardized frameworks, processes, measures, templates, tools, and checklists
Build, develop and maintain inter-departmental data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support answers to complex business questions
Create and maintain interactive dashboards in Cognos Analytics / PowerBI / Tableau through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources
Translate user needs into compelling BI dashboard designs utilizing best practices in infographic design
Design, implement and deploy end-to-end machine learning / deep learning pipelines and models with cloud services (e.g., DataRobot, Dataiku, AWS Sagemaker, etc.)
Build relationships with internal (leaders, administrators, faculty and support staff) and external stakeholders (Ministry of Colleges and Universities, Colleges Ontario, colleges and municipal governments) to implement strategic and changing business initiatives
Identify business requirements and provide data consultation services to the college community
Identify emerging issues and trends within data science and predictive analytics, to inform decision-making up to the institutional level; educate and advance data literacy and methodologies
Structure/clarify unclear business problems and determine the appropriate statistical methodologies and techniques based to design solutions
Thoroughly document data workflows, system functionality, and processes related to the collection and clean-up of data to improve the efficiency
Diagnose and determine solutions for predictive and analytical model performance issues identified through system monitoring
Maintain and re-engineer KPIs and various reports, including any data cleansing and manipulation when working with multiple disparate data sources
Apply scripting and/or programming skills to varying types of source data (unstructured or structured) into datasets, to address tiers of granularities (i.e. demographics, transactions, etc.)
Summarize statistical findings to draw reliable and accurate conclusions; presents actionable institutional and business recommendations
Active involvement on multiple projects to ensure appropriate documentation and deliverables are met
Ensure team members remain up-to-date with relevant knowledge and skills, and offer training opportunities to aid in the process
Other duties as required
Qualifications/Experience
Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Business Administration; other quantitative disciplines and/or equivalent experience will be considered
Minimum five (5) years of corporate and/or academic research-driven work experience developing data visualization; statistical and machine learning models; simulation and visualization tools
Experience with R, Python, and SQL
Knowledge of SQL, entity relationship diagrams and dimensional data models.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Cognos Analytics, Tableau, or Power BI.
Proficient with word processing software, network computer systems (e.g., Banner / AIS, Windows, Microsoft Office, Crystal, Oracle, Cognos, Internet, College Websites, etc.)
Demonstrated project management experience including processes and methodology, programs, and portfolio management
Proven adaptability to manage multiple and changing priorities within a high volume and deadline-driven environment
A self-starter with the ability to engage others in a highly diverse work environment and deliver results with minimal supervision
Innovative thinking ability to identify opportunities or solutions to stay relevant and current with changing times
Proven problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated oral, written and presentation skills
High attention to detail and accuracy
Experience mentoring, training and leading others
Knowledge of CRM principles and lifecycle marketing strategies (e.g. customer journey, acquisition, conversion, loyalty, engagement, retention and attrition models) is an asset

At Mosaic, we are never satisfied with the status quo and are in constant search for new ideas and new ways to help our clients build their brands amidst the evolving dynamics of empowered consumers and leveraging new technologies.

The Client Business Analyst I position is responsible for the operational support of a client, including responsibility for reporting, data collection, survey setup, and other adhoc requests. The Analyst will lead standardized report design, automation and data administration. They will leverage business and market relevant information to make data-driven decisions that allow Mosaic to achieve its sales and marketing objectives and quickly adapt tactics. They will play a key role in evolving and growing the data-driven discipline within our team and contribute to our shared success.

The Incumbent(s) in this position should exhibit the following values:

Results Oriented – Must show passion, pride and commitment to succeed
Trust – Must be honest, sincere and confident
Teamwork – Must build trusting relationships
Innovation – Must progress through a combination of creativity, common sense and vision

Collect, inspect, cleanse, transform, model and diagram of complex data sets
Daily use of various business intelligence and analytical software tools
Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations to the team
Design and build specific research methods such as surveys and market testing
Remain fully informed on latest data trends, practice and process
Other duties as assigned, such as managing systems access and tracking assets

Qualifications

A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Computer Services, Geography or related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience
1-3 years of relevant professional experience
Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills including formulas, pivot tables and V-lookup
Intermediate knowledge of data cleansing and data visualization using systems such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL, and R/Python
Preferred Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact comfortably with peers and leadership both internally and externally
Ability to execute standard measurement strategies within a project
Strong analytical and critical thinking with the ability to disseminate insight from large datasets
Meet tight deadlines, prioritize workloads and achieve results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Develop understanding of all areas phases of Mosaic business to find new opportunities for measurement
Proven ability to timely complete projects and achieves results in ambiguous work environment

Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

Integrates in-depth data analysis knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices.
Demonstrates a Good understanding of how data analytics teams and area integrate with others in accomplishing objectives.
Applies project management skills.
Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies.
Analyzes factual information to make accurate judgments and recommendations focused on local operations and broader impacts.
Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results breaking down information in a systematic and communicable manner.
Employs developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information.
Demonstrates attention to quality and timeliness of service to ensure the effectiveness of the team and group.
Provides informal guidance or on-the-job-training to new team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
2-5 years relevant experience
Knowledge of tools for statistical modeling of large data sets
Ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem solving techniques
Demonstrated interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

Company Description
As one of the largest independent technology companies in Atlantic Canada, Mariner has a team of over 200 IT and software professionals working with clients both regionally and across the globe. With extensive capabilities in the areas of analytics, automation software, information security and IT consulting, Mariner has been delivering innovative solutions with a strong emphasis on productivity and customer experience since 2003.

Job Description
Mariner is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to support our Telecommunications clients based both within the Maritimes and also throughout Canada.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in business administration, information systems, or related field.
Experience with BCRIS is mandatory.
5+ years experience working in a Quality Assurance Analyst role.
Experience leading business analysis and testing activities on large, complex projects;
Experience preparing Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements
Demonstrated ability to create, plan, manage, and execute test strategies, plans, and cases to support business process and software development quality assurance;
Experience utilizing formal testing methodologies to verify that system and business applications meet specific requirements.
Experience using defect management and testing tools.
Demonstrated experience working well with an integrated team of both business and technical resources.
Experience working in client-based consulting role is highly desirable.
Additional Information
Why Mariner Partners?
We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work – our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development.
We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the world’s largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations.
We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers.
Join our growing team!

What is the opportunity?
The Senior Configuration Analyst will be a main player on the IT Service Management (ITSM) team with the key role of managing the day to day activities for the Enterprise Configuration Management process. Objectives include setting up the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), expanding use of the CMDB into other IT processes, aid in establishing a Configuration Management process, and establishing relationships with Configuration Item (CI) owners to enforce the process.
This role will focus on Configuration Management but will also be involved in other aspects of the ITSM processes such as Asset, Change, Incident, Problem, Availability and Service Level Management. The primary responsibility will be setting up and maintaining the CMDB.
What will you do?
Configuration Management process improvements/ITSM initiatives:
Support the Senior Manager, Enterprise Configuration Management in the implementation of the CMDB
Assist the Senior Manager, Enterprise Configuration Management with continual process improvement; lead and deliver key project-based initiatives
Collaborate with IT & Process Owners, and Process Stakeholders to gather and analyze needs, translating these needs into requirements; maintain up to date knowledge of industry best practice standard
Configuration Management Operational Tasks:
Ensure the Configuration Management process is understood and adhered to; assist in identifying and onboarding new CI Types; work with CI Owners to help maintain their data
Reconcile the CMDB data when exceptions are noted between CMDB, discovery information, and other authoritative production data repositories
Resolve CI duplicates within the CMDB; work with CI Owners to identify and understand CI relationships; build, maintain and validate CI relationships within the CMDB
Work with Discovery/CMDB administrator to enable Discovery services or implement scripts required to process data feeds to update the CMDB; establish and support controls and procedures to review, assess, prioritize, & track compliance to requirements incorporated into tool and process designs; maintain operational procedures and knowledge base; assist with process documentation and user guides
Metrics, Reporting and Governance
Develop reports for management on KPIs to improve the process effectiveness, efficiency, and data accuracy; perform CMDB audits to ensure data completeness and quality; enable process adherence through reporting and dashboards
What do you need to succeed?
Must Have:
Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field along with 5 to 7 years Configuration Management experience
Experience in data analysis and management utilizing advanced Excel techniques
Familiarity with Agile and SCRUM methodologies
Experience in a large IT shared services organization
Excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration and documentation skills
Ability to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams
Understanding of Service Management processes
Passion for learning and knowledge transferAbility to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams
Nice to have:
ITIL v3 Foundations Certified

Position Title: Supply Chain Analyst Intern (Temp)
Requisition ID: 13021
Career Group (ADSP): Distribution Center

Department: Logistics and Distribution
Work Location: METRO ON - 5559 DUNDAS STREET W (#A-DUND)

Summary

A Supply Chain Intern at Metro Ontario is responsible for supporting the Supply Chain Integrated Planning team in planning and optimizing functions in the supply chain, contributing with detailed definition of business requirements, design of distribution solutions, continuous improvement initiatives and analysis to support business strategies as well as supporting the stores and business services team. This is an exciting opportunity for an intern to support project management and execution of changes to supply chain to improve item availability, service levels, and reductions in total cost-to-serve. Projects can include distribution center capacity assessment, layout and design as well as network optimization and network strategic analysis. The industrial engineering intern is responsible for data analysis, time studies, process mapping and KPI reporting through to presentation of solutions, mapping new processes and simulation of results.
Responsibilities
Provide design and engineering support for new automation process, with focus on productivity improvement and maximizing return on capital investments
Perform detailed analysis and research to conduct feasibility studies in support of the development of project business case analysis
Build project requirements and manage the successful execution of a range of selected tactical projects in collaboration with stakeholders and cross functional teams
Support the development of short and long-term planning including automated network design and optimization.
Support the project and implementation team with analysis, KPI reporting performance improvement.

Qualifications
Industrial Engineering/Supply Chain Management/Business undergraduate student (or equivalent)
Ability to model operational problems
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Highly proficient PC skills including MS Excel, Access, Visio, and Project (an asset)
Self motivated, capable of managing multiple projects and strong data mining skills
Moderate travelling between Ontario’s Distribution Center’s is needed and travel between Ontario and Quebec may be required
Bilingual (French, an asset)

Job Title: Business Analyst Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade Support
Job Description:
HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada.
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking.
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.
About Global Banking & Markets, IT
Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides financial services and products to corporates, governments and institutions worldwide, building partnerships with them to help them achieve consistent, long-term performance. We use the strength of HSBC’s international network to connect emerging and mature markets, covering key growth areas. Our products and services include advisory, financing, prime services, research and analysis, securities services, trading and sales, and transaction banking.
The Global Banking and Markets Technology team is dedicated to supporting Global Banking and Markets by working in partnership with business leaders who rely on us for delivering innovative, robust, stable platforms to enable their investment and financial solutions for clients. Join Global Banking and Markets Technology and be part of the global connectivity, collaboration and team that spans across 20 countries. The total number of successful production releases surpass some of the biggest blue chip tech companies. Canada is a key location in Global Banking and Markets Technology’s global growth strategy and is receiving global attention for its deliveries.
Key Objectives for Business Analyst Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade Support:
Fixed Income normally refers to debt markets under Global Banking & Markets. This role is particularly for Fixed Income projects which facilitate market connectivity, pricing, Request for Quotes and negotiations, processing and persistence of trades electronically for fixed income Cash business covering bonds and derivative products.
Senior Business Analyst responsible for Fixed Income Cash Business use of Bloomberg and Operations use of Optitrade for the block and allocation flow. Analyst will be required to assist and investigate issues and questions raised by a variety of stakeholders. These queries will range from functional questions about the use of both systems, queries with system set up, processing issues and data issues. The expectation is the role will extend to assist the Global Team with testing, system changes and ad hoc Maintain the Bank items managed by the Team.
The candidate would be responsible to deliver multiple services for the project with quality and efficiency coordinating with global stakeholders. The candidate should be able to work in a techno-functional role as an individual contributor responsible for business communication, requirement analysis and implementing solutions as a hands on contributor. He/she would be required to coordinate with global business/technical team and Production Support teams. Proven track record of delivering high quality, excellent analysis and excellent communication and interpersonal skills are the essentials for the position.
Principle Accountabilities:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Analyst who will join our team supporting Business, development and maintenance of the Fixed Income applications (Trade Order Management Solutions & Optitrade)
A successful candidate must have deep knowledge and skills in investment banking with both front-end and back-end applications in order to support various requirements coming from our business partners
We expect this person will play one of the key roles in the delivery team - not only when it comes to analysis but self-driven in understanding functionalities across different flows/applications, trouble-shooting on production issues and guiding other members in team
Identifying potential issues, reviewing solutions and recommending strategies for solving problems. Provide support to Technical lead responsible for the project delivery
Conducting research – business process and strategy – to ensure knowledge of best practice needed to support delivery for business stakeholders
The Candidate must be reactive and responsive to queries raised by the Business. The Candidate Have an appreciation of the priority of the issue, who is asking and what the impact of the request is.
The Analyst must Always be professional and act with integrity. Seek guidance and support from the Team – always look to gain additional experience and knowledge to be able to better support stakeholders.
The Analyst must Develop relationships with Operational users of Optitrade & Always ensure that answers to any queries are concise, directive and correct. Should an answer not be immediately available ensure we communicate this and work with the wider Team to seek guidance.
Always ensure that an issue is fully resolved to the satisfaction of the requestor. Be willing and prepared to work limited shift patterns so that we have coverage amongst the Team from Hong Kong Mid-day until United States mid-day.
Ensure compliance with all relevant internal instructions (Functional Instruction Manual, Global Standards Manual, circulars), internal control standards and external regulatory requirements, including the management of operational risk and adherence to the Group’s standards of ethical behaviour. Ensure that confluence documentation is fully maintained as and when new solutions, resolution pages are created.
Major Challenges are to become system and process flow experts in both Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade. Functional usage in Bloomberg is a cross a varied set of users, so queries can range from Trader use, end to end straight through processing queries re trades, files queries around data attributes etc etc. Gaining an in-depth cross functional knowledge will be an ongoing, iterative process, which at times will have to be self-taught. Need to be multi-functional IA Financial provide support and also be able to do Business Analyst and testing to support the full stack pod in ad hoc Maintain the Bank projects.
The ultimate aim of this role is to become a fully productive and integral part of the full stack Team. Levels of knowledge across the Team can be at different levels however each resource must show an interest and also a desire to take on more responsibility be self-sufficient and look to increase knowledge of the product, the processes and the systems.
Qualifications
Knowledge & Experience / Qualifications:
Individual Contributor
8-12 years of experience as an individual contributor
Experience in Agile projects
Participate in production support of Fixed Income application & worked on improvement initiatives like improvement of performance, production stability
Self-motivated, enthusiastic and proven rapid learning capability
Experience working in fast-paced, collaborative environment Excellent Understanding of Block and allocation flow & Testing experience in FI Cash flow.
Evidence of working in a controlled environment.
Previous knowledge of Fixed Income products ( cash Trading )
Experience in the use of Bloomberg TOMs would be ideal however Knowledge of Cash Primary trading systems, inherent system functions and a basic understanding of additional PTS functions IE PnL pricing etc etc would be desirable
F2b knowledge of cash fixed income processing would be desirable
Experience in an automated Production support Team environment would be desirable, one which has used CHAT BOTs and has used Symphony extensively.
Experience in JIRA and RTC and some limited knowledge in task automation and Python/scripting language would be desirable.
Technical
Good To Have
Technical exposure to Java.
Exposure to industry standard financial production support standareds.
L2 production support of BBG-Toms and Optitrade applications
Exposure to Automation.
Domain
Must Have
Exposure to Fixed Income Cash and Derivartive products.
Understanding of electronic markets, trading terminologies, pricing models, reference data.
Knowledge of Block & Alocation flow in FI.
Able to go through logs and write basic queries in database
Technical exposure to Geneos Monitoring & Maintenance
Experience
8-12 Years
Qualifications
FI Production support experience with Equivalent Qualifications
HSBC Proud

This is why HSBC Canada is committed to being an inclusive employer and encourages applications from all suitably qualified applicants irrespective of background, circumstances, age, disability, gender identity, ethnicity, religion or belief and sexual orientation.

Anheuser-Busch InBev (‘AB InBev’) is looking for an ambitious and driven finance / consulting professional to join their North America (US & Canada) Global Risk Management team and assist in developing innovative ways of solving complex business problems through the use of data analytics and detailed root cause analysis.

You will work with a dynamic and high-performing Global team reviewing all functions of the organization to solve real business problems, understand underlying processes and make recommendations in order to add value to and improve controls of the business.

You will:
Develop new ways of solving complex business issues through the use of data, analytical tools, working with the business and understanding various processes. Depending on the review, you will work with a variety of people from different functions within ABInBev.

Act as an owner for your part of the reviews. You will conduct interviews with internal and external stakeholders, understand the key processes and controls, perform in-depth analysis and document your findings and recommendations for presentation to senior management.

Practically use and regularly improve your technical/functional knowledge as well as gain exposure to a variety of other functions within ABInBev.

Be required at times to step out of your comfort zone and develop your corporate contact network in a highly dynamic environment.

Take initiative to drive meaningful outcomes from reviews and adopt an Agile project management approach to continuously prioritize and align focus areas.

Primarily focus on reviews of ABInBev’s US & Canada business units but have periodic exposure to reviews in other ABInBev business units globally

By joining our department, you will have the opportunity to work in a small but truly Global team and perform quarterly reviews focused on key business processes (from Finance to Production including Support Functions, Sales, Procurement, etc.) and controls. You will use your knowledge to bring actionable and value-adding insights to stakeholders and will have the opportunity to develop further your analytical, soft and risk management skills.

Competencies

:

At AB InBev you truly own your (Global) career. We are looking for an ambitious person who is eager to grow, develop her/his technical and management skills and, in time, bring expertise to other functions within AB InBev.

You have a problem-solving mindset to help the team find the root cause of complex business problems in a sustainable way. You can quickly understand processes and highlight financial and operational risks.

You are a good communicator, capable of clearly describing complex problems and recommend solutions to senior management (both orally and in writing).

Experience with Microsoft suite (powerpoint, excel, word)

Experience with data analytics / visualization tools (PowerBi, Tableau etc.)

You are fluent (Oral and Written) in English

You are comfortable working with remote teams

You are willing to travel (up to around 30% of working time)

Job Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
University degree

At least 2 years of experience in position(s) where you developed your analytical skills (e.g. external audit, internal audit, due diligence, business analyst, management consultant, business controller, data analyst)

Good to have and/or willing to learn:
Knowledge of SAP that you can leverage to perform in-depth analysis during reviews

A good understanding of basic accounting and finance principles

Experience with internal control, external audit and/or internal audit frameworks and methodology

Experience with a programming language (R, Python, SQL) for developing data extraction queries and/or data analysis scripts

Experience with Agile methodology approach to project management

Overview:

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.
When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 200,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 154 countries.
With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.
Overview of the opportunity:
Our Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Group in Business Enablement Services is looking for a Risk Analyst, to join our team. The DLP Group helps ensure the firm and its personnel are in compliance with KPMG’s Global Acceptable Use and other information policies.
What you will do:
Monitor and assess potential DLP incidents as they arise
Advise relevant stakeholders of required actions as a result of DLP incidents
Organize and document incident management from initiation to completion
Assess, summarize, and escalate potential breaches to leadership
Manage group mailbox as well as internal database used for tracking
Assisting partners and staff with related queries
Provide support on ad-hoc project work
Assist with the development of other operational/project documentation
Provide support to other teams within the broader Risk Management Group, as needed
At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.
What you bring to this role:
Undergraduate degree
Self-motivated, intellectually curious, diligent, able to respond promptly and professionally to all requests and inquiries.
Strong verbal and written communication skills; comfort interacting with individuals in high-level roles within the firm.
Takes initiative and has strong organizational, research, and analytical skills
Must be able to work independently and flexibly
Ability to build and maintain professional relationships
Proficient with Excel, Research via the Internet and comfort with online tools
Must be able to manipulate spreadsheet and database information for analysis
Familiarity with various software packages and databases
Be aware of the sensitivity of information received and treat it appropriately
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
