Position Summary:
As one of Canada’s largest Restaurant Equipment Suppliers and fabricators, Trimen Food Service Equipment Ltd is looking for an ESTIMATOR to support our sales, project management and business development teams in our Bid & Tender segment, Multi Unit Chain Restaurant business, and our Independent Street Business initiatives. Based at our Head office at Trimen Toronto, this position will report into the Director of Purchasing and Supply Chain.
This role will require the successful candidate to take proactive action to estimate all projects from start to finish, including the creation of the initial quote, manage the addendum process up to and including bid submittals. We are looking for a creative individual who strives in a collaborative environment, but is also comfortable working with a degree of autonomy where/when required. We expect this individual to build a growth strategy from the ground up and successfully execute upon our ambitious goals.
Responsibilities & Qualifications:

Roles and Responsibilities:
Accountable for the entire estimating process - from RFP receipt and acknowledgement through to submission.
Ensure alignment with divisional goals and objectives as related to pricing and margin needs
Use industry costing tools to prepare estimates
Follow CCDC guidelines with 11-400 category focus for Bid & Tender
Maintain consistency for our chain business
Manage Project Cost Control and job overruns
Manage Customers Order process in conjunction with our Project Managers teams
Project forecasting and analysis as well as conduct job costing analysis from time to time
Conduct peer reviews with PM teams to ensure accurate and timely submittals
Building and maintenance of client and supplier relationships
Reviewal of all tender documents and ensuring accuracy and timelines of tender submissions
Coordination and ongoing support to our sales and business development team
Develop and utilize exception reporting to provide accurate and timely recommendations to leadership regarding pricing and margin issues.
Participates in the development of training activities around pricing
Participates with the category teams in the establishment of cost
Development of ‘best practices’ with regard to Trimen program pricing
The successful candidate should demonstrate:
Proficient communication skills - both written and verbal - to communicate effectively with a broad-based team including diverse internal stakeholders
Excellent internal customer service, interpersonal and communication skills.
Must be able to develop, refine, communicate, and implement plans and to set goals.
Industry, and segment knowledge preferred, and able to analyze and interpret data.
Must have excellent time management, administration, and organizational skills with attention to detail.
Must be able to build relationships, network, influence and link resources to plan and execute business practices.
Must have the ability to multi-task and take on new responsibilities with a strong desire to succeed.
Develops solutions to complex problems that require the regular use of ingenuity and innovation. Ensures solutions are consistent with organization objectives
Ability to inject creativity, fresh thinking, and new perspectives into business approaches.
Judgment and decision making - considers the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one
Experience and Qualifications:
Bachelor Degree/College Diploma in a related field.
3-5 years previous experience in analytics/coordinator or related field
Knowledge of AUTO-QUOTES will be an asset
Knowledge of SAGE 300 will be an asset
Excel Experience required
Experience on Google apps (gmail and SHEETS) will be an asset.
Our Commitment:

We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, continuous training, and opportunities for growth and career advancement.

Company Bio
IMAGINE a hospital where everyone is committed to excellence. We did. We are. From boardroom to bedside, we go above and beyond to offer the best and safest patient care. At North York General Hospital (NYGH), we put our patients first in everything we do. We are achieving a new standard of excellence in integrated patient-centered care and as one of Canada's leading community academic hospitals, we are building on our academic foundation through enhanced education, research and innovation. North York General Hospital is part of North York Toronto Health Partners, a collaborative partnership with patients, primary care, and community partners, a first- generation Ontario Health Team, driving the development of a locally integrated health system to serve the community. As part of our dynamic team, you too can stand out and be amazing! At North York General, our team is making a world of difference.
Position Summary
Research Data Analyst, Research and Innovation
Research & Innovation at North York General Hospital currently has an opening for a Temporary Full-Time Research Analyst. The contract is for one year with the possibility of renewal. Reporting to Dr. Katie Dainty and her team, this role will support a growing research portfolio of projects related to patient-centred outcomes, patient and family experiences of health and health care, and quality improvement in health care settings.
We are seeking a highly motivated individual with strengths in qualitative health research and familiarity with quantitative and literature review methods. The ideal candidate will have experience with qualitative interviewing, qualitative data analysis (including coding, writing memos and analytic notes), and use of NVivo or other data management programs. Additional experience with survey-based data collection and analysis are considered assets.
On a practical level, you will

Assisting with the day-to-day operations of ongoing qualitative and survey studies, including:

Liaising with patients, family members, and other stakeholder groups (e.g., clinical staff, decision-makers, etc.), to arrange research interviews.

Liaising with other investigators and research team members to facilitate recruitment and ensure the consistency and quality of all study procedures.

Conducting participant recruitment/enrollment and informed consent processes.

Monitoring project requirements to ensure that data and procedure flow in accordance with study protocols.

Maintaining ongoing records of participant recruitment, data collection, and analysis files in an organized manner that is easily accessible by other research team members.

Supporting interview and survey data collection, management, and analysis.

Contributing to the writing of final reports and manuscripts.

Supporting literature reviews (e.g. basic, scoping, systematic).

Scheduling and attending research meetings, including preparing agendas and meeting minutes.
Qualifications

At minimum, completion of a Bachelor’s degree in health sciences, social sciences, or related fields that include formal training in the qualitative methodologies. Master’s degree strongly preferred (complete or in progress). Formal training and/or education related to qualitative research methods is required.

A minimum of two (2) years of qualitative research experience in an academic/health care/scientific environment.

Experience conducting qualitative interviews, analyzing qualitative data, and writing research reports is required.

Advanced written and verbal communication, critical thinking, analytical abilities, and interpersonal skills.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a team member and set priorities for delegated tasks

Excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to detail.

Previous word-processing, database and qualitative data management experience in a Microsoft Office environment, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and NVivo. Experience working online with video conferencing technologies (e.g. Zoom, MS Teams) an asset.

Knowledge of ICH/GCP regulations and guidelines.

Ability to produce high quality work in accordance with Hospital standards.

Ability to maintain confidentiality and strong knowledge of clinical ethics regulations.

Must be flexible to work Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm with occasional evening/weekend hours required for data collection. This will be an off-site position pending pandemic conditions.

Bilingualism in French/English an asset
What We Offer
Working at NYGH means working with a dynamic team of fellow healthcare providers, staff, and volunteers in one of Canada’s leading hospitals. This is a Full-time Temporary Position (approx. 12 months), with 75 hours bi-weekly, 8 hour shifts, Days, in Research & Innovation. We offer a highly competitive total compensation package which may include benefits, pension, vacation pay, or pay in lieu of benefits, when applicable. If you were searching for more reasons to consider joining the wonderful team at NYGH, check out some features of our Total Rewards package by visiting nygh.on.ca

We will review all applications and will contact those selected for an interview.

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. North York General is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Position Purpose:
The Alectra Green Energy & Technology Centre (GRE&T Centre) makes energy innovations come to life by identifying, evaluating, developing and accelerating the commercialization of emerging, clean, and customer-friendly energy solutions, creating sustainable values for customers, shareholders and communities it serves. The Grid Innovation team at the GRE&T Centre is focused on enabling a more sustainable electricity grid, by unleashing the potential of grid modernization technologies and integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into local electricity grid. The Business Analyst will provide support to the project initiatives undertaken by Grid Innovation team. The incumbent will work closely with the Grid Innovation team and provide technical support in delivering pilot projects such as Non-Wires alternative (“NWA”) project aimed at designing and operating local distribution energy market that enables distributed energy resources (DER) to participate in grid services; defer or reduce the need for wires investment on distribution grid.
Responsibilities:
Participate in daily project development meeting with the software system vendor; document, update and maintain issues tracking system, capturing live issues and progress on software development.
Analyze business functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and business rules; review and update functional specification documents as necessary to ensure it is up-to-date and address business requirement changes.
Assist with the solution design discussion including database structure, user interface, customer experience etc.
Ensure that changes and features to the system development are properly submitted, updated, assigned, escalated in the current development ticketing system.
Create, deliver, and maintain user stories, process workflows, mockups and system test cases.
Conduct user acceptance testing, system integration testing, regression testing and all other Q&A testing, ensuring system is functioning as designed.
Discover, record and log system issues, defects and resolutions; participate in debug solutioning, fix and QA testing.
Identify areas for improvement and make appropriate recommendations to the project team pertaining to best practices, processes, templates, workflows and methodologies.
Coordinate and support the project teammates and management to ensure alignment of projects and timelines.
Ensure deliverables and feedback needed by project team and vendor software development teams are provided in a timely manner to ensure overall delivery of projects on-time and within budget.
Collaborate and interact with a variety of team members and business units to coordinate project activities; perform demos and customers/users support to the system.
Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis of new and existing data sets and research reports, including advanced modelling and analysis through Excel or similar tools, and develop recommendations based on findings.
Develop written reports and presentations as required to communicate project updates, share research findings and provide topical backgrounders for internal and external stakeholders.
Maintain collaborative working relationships with vendor project team members and support collective efforts on projects delivery.
Provide project support as needed to support the achievement of departmental objectives and other initiatives being carried on within the GRE&T Centre
Other duties as assigned

Education & Specialized Knowledge:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited institution field
Direct experience with both classical waterfall software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies (i.e. scrum)
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications including MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.
General knowledge of the energy markets and utility industries
Experience:
Minimum of 3 years of business analyst or related work experience demonstrating the range of duties expected for this position
Experience in Azure DevOps system environment
Experience in project management on web-based software development project
Knowledge of energy policy and regulation, especially related to distributed energy resources is a strong asset
Experience working in Energy/Utility and/or Data Analytics sector is a strong asset

Skills/Abilities/Competencies:
Strong analytical, problem resolution, technical, application/system troubleshooting skills with the ability to think clearly and resolve issues efficiently under pressure.
Excellent organizational and time management skills with high attention to detail in a demanding, deadline-driven environment.
Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate effectively with other team members as needed.
Excellent data gathering techniques supported by strong interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to use creative and strategic thinking to identify and develop solutions for customers
Demonstrated skills in research and planning to support strategy development and commercialization planning
Ability to build and maintain strong collaborative and collegial working relationships with team members, and internal and external stakeholders
Strong oral, written and presentation skills, with the ability to learn, apply and explain information in an organized and concise way
Self-motivated; ability to work both independently and as a team player
Strong results orientation, with excellent attention to detail
Must hold and maintain a valid class “G” driver’s license

Anheuser-Busch InBev (‘AB InBev’) is looking for an ambitious and driven finance / consulting professional to join their North America (US & Canada) Global Risk Management team and assist in developing innovative ways of solving complex business problems through the use of data analytics and detailed root cause analysis.

You will work with a dynamic and high-performing Global team reviewing all functions of the organization to solve real business problems, understand underlying processes and make recommendations in order to add value to and improve controls of the business.

You will:
Develop new ways of solving complex business issues through the use of data, analytical tools, working with the business and understanding various processes. Depending on the review, you will work with a variety of people from different functions within ABInBev.

Act as an owner for your part of the reviews. You will conduct interviews with internal and external stakeholders, understand the key processes and controls, perform in-depth analysis and document your findings and recommendations for presentation to senior management.

Practically use and regularly improve your technical/functional knowledge as well as gain exposure to a variety of other functions within ABInBev.

Be required at times to step out of your comfort zone and develop your corporate contact network in a highly dynamic environment.

Take initiative to drive meaningful outcomes from reviews and adopt an Agile project management approach to continuously prioritize and align focus areas.

Primarily focus on reviews of ABInBev’s US & Canada business units but have periodic exposure to reviews in other ABInBev business units globally

By joining our department, you will have the opportunity to work in a small but truly Global team and perform quarterly reviews focused on key business processes (from Finance to Production including Support Functions, Sales, Procurement, etc.) and controls. You will use your knowledge to bring actionable and value-adding insights to stakeholders and will have the opportunity to develop further your analytical, soft and risk management skills.

Competencies

:

At AB InBev you truly own your (Global) career. We are looking for an ambitious person who is eager to grow, develop her/his technical and management skills and, in time, bring expertise to other functions within AB InBev.

You have a problem-solving mindset to help the team find the root cause of complex business problems in a sustainable way. You can quickly understand processes and highlight financial and operational risks.

You are a good communicator, capable of clearly describing complex problems and recommend solutions to senior management (both orally and in writing).

Experience with Microsoft suite (powerpoint, excel, word)

Experience with data analytics / visualization tools (PowerBi, Tableau etc.)

You are fluent (Oral and Written) in English

You are comfortable working with remote teams

You are willing to travel (up to around 30% of working time)

Job Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
University degree

At least 2 years of experience in position(s) where you developed your analytical skills (e.g. external audit, internal audit, due diligence, business analyst, management consultant, business controller, data analyst)

Good to have and/or willing to learn:
Knowledge of SAP that you can leverage to perform in-depth analysis during reviews

A good understanding of basic accounting and finance principles

Experience with internal control, external audit and/or internal audit frameworks and methodology

Experience with a programming language (R, Python, SQL) for developing data extraction queries and/or data analysis scripts

Experience with Agile methodology approach to project management

Position Description:
CGI is a global business and technology service provider with $11.5B in revenues. CGI is on a mission to help financial services organizations focus on servicing their clients. CGI supports 15 of the top 20 banks worldwide and our top 10 banking clients have worked with us for 26 years on average. Our clients have seen the value and commitment we bring through our products. This is why nearly $1.6 trillion in assets managed through CGI’s portfolio management, investment fund and asset management solutions.
You will be joining our consulting organization at pivotal point. We have ambitious growth plans and are looking for motivated people to join us.

As a Business Analyst, you will be given the tools to solve business problems, but it’ll up to you to make it happen. As an experienced analyst, you will be expected to mentor our junior analysts.

Your future duties and responsibilities:
Diagnose. Be curious. Learn from others – peers, development team, and management. Read about new regulations, follow industry forums, think about how to build new solutions and improve what we have built. Identify what we do well and what we can do better.


Solution. Solve complex problems working with your team. Understand regulatory and business requirements and come up with scalable solutions. Ask questions and think about if solutions others have in mind really address the core problem. Cut out anything that is not needed. Work with developers to implement the solution and automate testing. Test it and make sure it works as we expect it to.


Mentor. Help your team get better. Work with junior analysts to improve their contribution to the team. Build a sense of community.


Who are you?

Quality first. You believe quality is into every step of the development cycle, not bolted on at the end. You believe in automating as much as possible. You believe we should be open-minded and logic should prevail where the best solution given constraints wins.


Team player. You believe a strong team will achieve more than a few heroes. You believe humility is strength and that no one, including yourself, is above any task to achieve a team goal. You try to foster an environment in which teammates can constructively challenge anyone for the betterment of the team.


Continuous learner. You are open-minded and are excited about being challenged and solving complex problems. You can empathize with and mentor junior analysts to solve business problems. You get excited at the opportunity to work on new and complex problems.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
You need to have:

experience as a Capital Markets business analyst for at least 5 yearsexperience working in an agile environmentknowledge of Client Onboarding, Account Management, KYC, Anti-Money Laundering initiatives or Capital Markets regulatory initiatives
strong analytical and communication skillsstrong technical skills including SQL, data analysis and systems analysisIt would be nice if you have experience with:
Fenergo product knowledge
- Experience with testing - Design test scenarios, test cases and test scripts, Test Execution, Defects Management

Experience working with FPML and FIX protocols
TDD/ATDD experience
Here's how we work:
-

We work very hard to meet tight timelines to keep our clients regulatory compliant.

We deliver in increments through bi-weekly sprints to continually address the top priorities of our clients. We foster an environment of entrepreneurship in which cross-functional teams are given autonomy to make decisions. We have multiple teams that work on the product and each team is given flexibility to find a way that best allows them to thrive. We try to keep the static teams to less than 10 to form a micro-team culture. We encourage team members “swarming” on a single issue instead working on issues in silo.

It will be hard. We have high expectations and our teams are filled with dedicated high calibre members. You’ll need to have persistence, passion and grit.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Cardinal Health Canada, with over 1300 employees nationwide, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.
We are looking for positive and team-oriented individual to join our dynamic Supply Chain team in Mississauga. The Demand Planning Analyst will be responsible of demand forecasts to identify sales’ trends across all business segments and to proactively represent any statistical forecasting exceptions. The Demand Planning Analyst will also create and maintain forecast models, assist in incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from sales, marketing, finance, and other sources into that demand plan utilizing their analytic and interpersonal skills.
For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings.
Your Contributions to the Organization will be:
Proactively develop, analyze, and recommend finished goods demand forecasts at multiple levels of aggregation
Identifying areas of forecast risk and improvement opportunities for their assigned demand planning categories
Owning a New Business Program Management, including workflow submissions, troubleshooting, daily uploading processes and measuring forecasting accuracy & bias (NB Materialization)
Playing a key role in the future ERP Implementation
Reviewing historical sale trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, evaluate forecast results
Developing an easy way to quickly compile and analyze month over month and year over year trends on product groups as required.
Creating reports and automated system alerts to proactively identify forecast exceptions
Assisting in the creation of best-in-class processes to improve forecast accuracy and bias
Engaging and collaborating with sales teams to ensure better inventory planning, demand Signal Exception Analysis, new business materialization and service level analysis
Drive analysis and provide insights related to overall network optimization, stocking analysis, core assortment framework and other related adhoc activities
This Job might be for you if:
Possess a strong understanding of logistics and distribution gained through 2-4 years of Supply Chain experience
College/University education in /Supply Chain Management, MBA is an asset
You have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence internal and external customers to drive value-added solutions
You possess strong analytical skills and proven ability to analyze data trends with the use of reporting tools (ex. Excel, Access) and initiate action from findings.
You have the ability to work successfully in a team environment as well as individually
Proven ability to handle multiple tasks at the same time and be able to prioritize effectively
You have strong facilitation, presentation, and effective communication skills
You have knowledge of category management is an asset

Music Data Analyst
Job Description:
We are Warner Music Group, home to a broad roster of new stars and legendary artists through a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, East West, Elektra, Erato, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Spinnin’, Warner Bros., Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville, as well as Warner/Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide.
We currently have a fantastic opportunity to join our innovative and highly sought-after Business Development team.
A little bit about our team:
Warner Music Canada is home to some of the most influential and innovative artists of our time. Our extraordinary roster of new and established recording artists is unparalleled, and our collective influence on music culture is without precedent. With a visionary approach toward discovering and nurturing musical talent, the Warner Music Canada family of labels is currently home to an impressive generation of major artists.
As the music industry continues to evolve, Warner Music Canada is always looking for innovative ways to help artists grow and reach their fans successfully. Using data to supplement strategic initiatives, the Music Data Analyst will use data to build models, test hypotheses, and interpret analyses to help key stakeholders achieve strategic goals.
If you are highly analytical, a great communicator, and love to solve problems using data in a fast-changing and exciting industry, this role is for you. We are looking for someone who is passionate about data, spreadsheets, and infographics – someone who’s a self-starter, a critical thinker, loves technology, socials, and of course – music!
Here you’ll be able to:
Serve as a part of a key business function that anchors all data-led analytics initiatives cross-functionally.
Leverage data insights by applying learnings and presenting them in a way that can be understood and applied to all levels of the organization.
Collect and translate data into actionable insights to help drive business strategy and decision-making process:
Dig through multiple data tools and data sets to draw conclusions based on marketing plans
Perform artist analyses on streaming, social, content and commerce properties
Determine cause and effect of marketing plans on streaming, sales and other channels
Analyze the impact of advertising, promotion, radio and other inputs on sales/streaming
Perform financial modelling to forecast quantitative impact of pilot and strategic projects.
Identify and fulfil ongoing and ad hoc reporting opportunities.
Be a storyteller: Liaise and communicate recommendations to solve specific strategic initiatives as requested from various departments.
Act as a resident expert on the latest tools and learnings within the music world of streaming, marketing, research & analysis, and CRM/Direct-to-Consumer.
Provide ad-hoc analytical support as directed and requested.
It would be music to our ears if you also had:
3+ years’ experience as a data analyst required.
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, computer science, management information systems, or related field. Master’s an asset.
Proven intermediate/advance level experience working with SQL and Excel, a must. Tableau/Python/R an asset.
Experience with database query and statistical analysis tools/systems.
Experience analysing music industry data (including streaming, and marketing data) an asset.
Experience with enterprise-level and start-up analytical tools, including data segmentation, visualization and dashboard tools. May include: Salesforce, Social listening tools and beyond.
Familiarity with Nielsen SoundScan/Connect and Mediabase/BDS an asset.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large data sets, while keeping the big picture in mind.
Strong interpersonal, visual skills, and creative writing skills.
Extremely organized and detail oriented.
Why join us?
Warner Music Group is all about our people. We are one global company made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business.
It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music, at every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart from the rest of the industry by embracing a philosophy of innovation that is part of our company's DNA.
Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the biggest forces in music today.
Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Please note that due to the volume of applicants we receive for a given position, you may not be contacted if you do not meet minimum eligibility requirements for this position.
Thanks for your interest in working for Warner Music Group. We love it here and think you will too.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Job Description
We are hiring a Business Analyst in our Mississauga, ON location!
The Business Analyst will be responsible for operational support, data mining, data analysis and small project work. You will work closely with domain experts, across a wide variety of functions (e.g. Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Sales, Operations) at various levels on a day to day basis. The Business Analyst will support the company’s business intelligence, data warehouse and reporting needs across all business system. You will also derive business, system, user and data requirements, and develop reports and Cognos workspaces to meet the business needs and ultimately achieve the company’s goals.
What’s In It for You?
Competitive salary
Employee benefits program, deferred profit-sharing plan and optional pension program
Employee Assistance Program
Employee Discount Program, Employee Store and Dell Discount Program
Opportunities for community contributions and volunteering
Fast paced work environment
Opportunity to work in a growing company and industry
What You Will Do:
Provide day to day operational support across the organization by working with all functions to deliver their data verification and reporting needs.
Support the company’s business intelligence, data mining and reporting needs by providing validated data.
Provide analytical and technical expertise, collecting requirements and delivering versatile data models and reporting solutions.
Understand data and data modelling to deliver experienced business analysis to all functions.
Partnering with technical team experts to determine and detail the efficient design (performance and recovery).
Apply validated analytical approaches to identify errors or limitations in data and recommend, implement processes to improve data validity.
Train and support users in the use of analytic dashboards and reports.
Collaborate with business users on the execution of small projects.
Assist in documentation of requirements and specifications.
Perform daily, month end and Ad Hoc reporting as requested or advised.
Who You Are:
Experience working with OLAP reporting tools such as Cognos, Microsoft Power BI, etc.
3 to 5 years’ experience crafting reports from centralized datasets that contribute to the company’s decision-making process.
Solid grasp of relational database structures and strong SQL query writing capabilities.
Ability to write in Visual Basic is an asset.
Excellent business analysis and technical capability skills
Detail-oriented, knowledge of accounting procedures and financial reporting practices, understanding of software and database systems and excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience crafting or working with automated ETL pipelines.
Experience with SSIS.
Experience building content and dashboards in business intelligence (Cognos BI or similar) and data visualization tools.
Detailed knowledge of finance with an eye for business.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Willingness to work a flexible schedule including potentially extended hours during month end reporting and other key times during the fiscal year.
Bachelor’s Degree (Business Admin, Computer Science, Science or Data Analytics) and/or an equivalent combination of experience and education is required.
At least 3 - 5 years hands on experience in a business analyst position in a mid-sized organization. (preferably a manufacturing environment)
Additional Skills Preferred:
Knowledge of various SDLC and process methodologies (e.g. Agile, Waterfall)
JD Edwards or similar ERP experience
Strong desire to innovate and advance internal technologies and processes
Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications
Continuous improvement approach following best practice analytic principles
Understanding of Project Management and Organisational Change principles and methodology
Access to a reliable vehicle and the ability to travel to our St. Thomas location (10%)

Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.
Job Description:
This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams.
What will you do?
Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect.
Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge.
Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures.
Contribute & maintain quality requirement artifacts. Use a variety of visual techniques such as process models, workflow diagrams, storyboards and use cases, with appropriate guidance.
Participate in requirement elicitation sessions contributing in discussions to identify the true business need and associated risks.
Identify project risks and issues and communicate to Project Manager.
What you need to succeed:
University Degree in Business, Technology, Computer Science and Management
Experience or Knowledge in Investments, Asset Management and/or Capital Markets
Exposure in data analytics and data extraction with reporting tools such as SQL or Tableau.
Consultation and facilitation skills application in a school or office setting
Preferred skills:
Effective and efficient communication in a virtual environment.
Customer service focus to achieve valued results with a sense of urgency
Organized and flexible individual, comfortable in an evolving environment.
Innovative team member with a passion for learning and improving the client experience
What’s in it for you?
SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. Our history of organic and strategic growth reflects this commitment with over CA$303 billion in assets under management / US$238 billion in assets under management.
SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. We are breaking ground with innovative solutions for a growing institutional client base of more than 1200 organizations across North America. As a subsidiary of Sun Life, we are aligned with one of the world’s leading financial services companies, and benefit from the stability and strength of that relationship.
Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead.
Visit us at https://www.slcmanagement.com/inv
For a journey this exciting and complex, we’re looking for someone who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change.

Job Description

The Analyst will help Fraud Risk Assessment (FRA) manager(s) in collecting data to help conduct the assessment and track the implementation of recommendations at the enterprise level. Successful candidate will create and utilize fraud data to help deliver fraud risk assessments reports to stakeholders. In addition, the analyst will gather data and conduct medium complexity level of analysis and review on assigned areas or topics. Output of analysis/review will be incorporated in the overall assessment of the business unit, product or services or threat vector.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Conduct fraud risk assessments with the FRA manager in conjunction with business line managers/staff
Responsible for collecting and analyzing necessary data provided by Businesses during assessment
Responsible for maintaining the Fraud Risk Assessment tool and adding new products/channels to the product list
Quarterly follow-up on the status of action plans from business units and report to management with the progress report.
Work with the businesses in closing the action plans on timely manner.
Develop/Create reports and metric dashboards on various risk management related topics for various audiences.
Must comply with all bank policies and procedures and all applicable laws and regulations.
Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite
Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork
Support data requests during active audit/regulator engagements, tracking requests and coordinating the collection of documents

Job Requirements
Job Requirements
Undergraduate degree/college diploma in quantitative field or 2+ years of relevant experience in risk related area
Prior Fraud operations or Operational Risk experience is an asset
Experience and understanding of second line of defense
Exhibit ability to solve complex problems with support from management
Manage stakeholder needs and expectations while providing consistent and regular communications with support from management
Effectively balance multiple tasks through careful prioritization
Work collaboratively with team and business partners to produce a quality work product
Proven ability to effectively work with others to deliver projects on-time
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Excellent communication skills and written skills. Must have the ability to comfortably interact & communicate with all levels of the organization
Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Comfortable using Data Analytics and visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Proactive approach to problem-solving and escalation to management
SharePoint and MS Visio experience considered an asset
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Self-motivated and goal-oriented
Digitally savvy, seek innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies by adapting to new tools and trends

POSITION DESCRIPTION

POSITION: Business Data Analyst

REPORTS TO: VP, Finance
Cority leverages its cutting-edge SaaS-based technology and broad EHS product suite to partner with organizations around the world to effect meaningful change in the way environmental, health, and safety is managed. Cority stands by its customers as they attain performance goals, reduce EHS risks, enhance corporate productivity, and create a healthier workforce. The company has received many accolades for its strong employee culture and outstanding growth rate including recognition as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies; being shortlisted for the Canadian Chamber of Commerce’s Private Business Growth Award; and being named by Aon Hewitt as one of the Best Employers in Canada.
POSITION SUMMARY:


We are seeking an experienced Business Data Analyst to analyze raw data to create insights, opportunities and make recommendations to improve the access and flow of information to measure performance. You bring your strong analytical and cross functional collaboration skills to engage and interface with business leaders from different business units. The Data Analyst will deliver a range of dashboards, metrics and insights to drive operational excellence.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Innovatively explore how data can add value to Cority’s finance team.
Develop and own reporting and metrics dashboards, culling data from different data sources
Work with stakeholders to provide insights, conclusions and action steps.
Translate data into insights to measure the company’s performance against key metrics to identify opportunities and/or inconsistencies
Apply creative problem solving skills to business questions
Generate reports in Qlik, for Executives on a variety of customer/business related data
Manage data and data mining as well as translating financial data
Support ad-hoc requests and inquiries in a timely manner


QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor`s Degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics or related field
3+ years with BI tools . Must have Qlik experience
Strong data and SQL skills
Attention to detail to pursue data quality, troubleshoot data validation, and see issues to completion.
Excellent interpersonal skills
Advanced computer skills: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, CRM, Teams, Qlik
Must have an ability to work independently as well as on a team in a collaborative environment
Possess excellent written, verbal communications and presentation skills with a polished presence.

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
Join our team!

Bringing innovation to our healthcare system is a team sport. With over 3000 dedicated team members and several key partners, we are joining forces to develop technology through everyday innovation.

Working in collaborative partnerships with business units across TELUS Health and our partners, you would be part of a dynamic team of highly skilled technical and business members. Our team is responsible for digitally connecting TELUS Health and the Healthcare industry across Canada by innovating, designing and executing on software solutions for complex health care applications.
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!

As a Business Analyst working on the Digital Health team, you will work in collaboration with the Product Manager and the Integrations team to support in moving our products and projects forward. We are a national team comprised of passionate, driven individuals with diverse and unique experiences and skill sets in clinical workflow, business analysis, project management and health information management. You will work with teams across TELUS Health to ensure operational readiness as Digital Health expands our product portfolio. The successful candidate must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, someone who is a natural collaborator and problem solver that can work with multiple stakeholders across the product development and business teams.

Here's how...
Contribute to the successful delivery of key Digital Health initiatives by leading a development team
Owning and creating the business / product requirements documentation
Engage internal teams and/or external parties to resolve issues
Demonstrated ability to adapt quickly to change
Actively participate in project team meetings and lead when necessary
Capable and willing learner who proactively researches solutions to business and technical challenges
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to communicate with all areas of the company

Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
3-5 years in comparable role
University Degree or related College Diploma in Health Science, Computer Science or Business/Commerce and/or CCBA or CBAP certification
API technology, i.e. SOAP, Rest, AJAX, security & scalability
Business analysis, requirement elicitation and documentation skills
Agile project management, creating user stories, knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Healthcare workflows, data flows, privacy and security concerns, data ownership and sovereignty, and the unique challenges of healthcare connectivity
Drive innovation and team collaboration to continuously improve upon best practices and standard processes
Nice to have…
Experience in digital health products and healthcare data
Strong understanding of APIs and their interactions
Working knowledge of electronic medical records (EMR) applications
Who is TELUS?

We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.

TELUS Health is an IT leader in Canada that focuses on the health sector. Our mission is to improve the way information is being used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in Canada and in selected countries.

Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.

Do you share our passion?
At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.

At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

In the 1830s, the May family began raising chickens on a farm outside what is now Brampton, Ontario. They became a pillar of the community, and their proud tradition of hard work, agricultural wisdom, and humble family values inspire and guide us to this day.
Role Purpose: The Logistics Analyst has primary responsibility for on-demand analytics (including data mining), providing business recommendations (and support), and leading cross-functional projects. They lead to scope problems/ opportunities, develop potential solutions and reach consensus on the path forward. Projects range from inventory optimization, to cost savings, to process improvement, to supplier management to field execution.
Note: This is an 8-month contract only.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES:
Budgeting: prepare, track and manage a budget for the logistics areas of responsibility by conducting analysis & preparing data to support requested budget; ensure compliance of budgeting for logistics teams by validating invoices relating to logistics, live haul and finished goods; monitor the financial performance of area of responsibility against approved budget so that areas of unsatisfactory performance are identified; and yearly freight tender responsibility.
Project Management: achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; Implementing productivity, customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change; with leadership team, set and monitor targets based on a developed, actionable plan; define action require when results are off target; and provide analysis, strategic planning processes to Leadership Team.
Technology Lead: evaluate future needs as it pertains to application, hardware, communication, professional services, and maintenance; develop a technology strategy based on the findings of future needs, best practices and available technology to modernize use of technology in order to improve service and work more efficiently; and provide professional expertise and advice as it pertains to technology.
Data Analytics: in collaboration with stakeholders, take lead role to implement data analytics supported by reports and dashboards are required; create processes and methods to gather logistics; run detailed spreadsheets in EXCEL; understand implications of network models; understand use of optimization tools; and score card management.
Logistics Optimization: evaluate vendor operations (e.g. freight forwarders) according to quality standards; track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance; define action require when results are off target; and collaborate with IT professionals to implement effective systems.
Policies, Processes & Procedures: adhere/comply with company policies and procedures.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
One to three years of working experience required;
Good understanding of supply chain fundamentals and the ability to embed best practices into the daily operations;
Experience with data mining and analysis techniques;
Experience in data mining, analysis and reporting;
Experience with supply chain processes (e.g., inventory planning, warehouse management);
Strong quantitative analytical skills, business acumen and insight; with the ability to understand and synthesize data from various sources, work around data limitations, and form impactful judgments and insights;
Desire to -roll up your sleeves - disaggregate complex problems and simplify into executable solutions;
Working knowledge of MS Office, relational databases and ERP systems (e.g. NAV).
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Undergraduate degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Analytics, Mathematics or related field required.
CLT (Canadian Livestock Transport) certification is an asset.
COMPETENCIES:
Building Trust - Builds strong relationships on a foundation of trust, loyalty and authenticity.
Driving for Results - Relentlessly pursues quantifiable and measurable results: identifies areas for improvement and executes changes as necessary.
Communication & Listening - Encourages open and honest communication with the team, communicates messages clearly and concisely and listens attentively to others.
Initiative - Proactively seeks new opportunities and challenges; takes ownership and accountability for enhancing results or minimizing problems.
Builds Networks - Builds strong relationships with peers, partners and key stakeholders, cultivating meaningful connections.
Awareness & Insight - Assesses one’s own abilities, understands how actions impact perceptions and thrives within our culture, climate and organization at all levels.
WORKING CONDITION: Office based
In accordance with Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.

Job Title: Analyst, Data Management and Analytics Enablement
Job Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
As an Analyst lead, you will be joining the Internal Audit Data Analytics team. You’ll be responsible for making complex data more accessible, understandable and usable to our users. You’ll also have the opportunity of incorporating design thinking, process design and user experience techniques to create intuitive dashboards for our users for insights and analytics.
How You’ll Succeed
Project Management and Process Design – Be able to look for ways to optimize and streamline processes to enhance efficiencies. A good understanding of User Interface and User Experience (UI/UX) design is preferred.
Be Curious and Creative – Demonstrate the ability to innovate and an aptitude to try new concepts, interpret themes and insights and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive for the users.
Technical and Data Modelling – Be able to find meaningful insights and design intuitive visualizations.
Data Management – Assist the director and the analytics team to source and manage new data sources for projects and ongoing audit engagements.
Stay Current with Best Practices in Internal Audit – Constantly look for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, stay up to date with industry best practices in storytelling/data visualization, user experience, machine learning and big data analytics. Actively identify current and emerging trends, themes and topics in Internal audit analytics to enable our auditors to be effective.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in areas including but not limited to data design and transformation, web development and UX & UI development. You must have 2 – 3 years of progressive python experience towards analyzing data and for web application design purposes. Experience in languages like PHP, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Alteryx will also help you to thrive in this role. It’s an asset if you have experience in frameworks within Python incl. IDJANGO and have background in graphical design.
You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results
You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive : Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop : Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper : Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

The Data Analyst will support the SAP Project team in preparing data for migration from legacy systems to SAP. Ensuring that we have accurate and complete data to support the business needs will be essential for a successful go live.

It’s a great opportunity to be involved in a large transformational project. The student will gain knowledge of SAP, which is used by ~ 24,000 companies worldwide currently, and ~700 companies in Canada. It’s also a great opportunity to learn about Weston Foods through an understanding of the data used to operate the business. The pace is fast and the deadlines are tight. Remaining focused will be key to success.

CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Working closely with a cross functional team of internal and external resources to profile, cleanse, collect and prepare data for migration.
Follow established data standards where they exist, but will also have the opportunity to contribute to the development of data standards, where absent, to meet the needs of SAP.
Responsible for tracking progress against project timelines ensuring complete and accurate data on time to meet business needs.

Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business administration, commerce, computer science or engineering

Self-starter with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a fast paced, team environment

Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.
Job Description:
This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams.
What will you do?
Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect.
Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge.
Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures.
Contribute & maintain quality requirement artifacts. Use a variety of visual techniques such as process models, workflow diagrams, storyboards and use cases, with appropriate guidance.
Participate in requirement elicitation sessions contributing in discussions to identify the true business need and associated risks.
Identify project risks and issues and communicate to Project Manager.
What you need to succeed:
University Degree in Business, Technology, Computer Science and Management
Experience or Knowledge in Investments, Asset Management and/or Capital Markets
Exposure in data analytics and data extraction with reporting tools such as SQL or Tableau.
Consultation and facilitation skills application in a school or office setting
Preferred skills:
Effective and efficient communication in a virtual environment.
Customer service focus to achieve valued results with a sense of urgency
Organized and flexible individual, comfortable in an evolving environment.
Innovative team member with a passion for learning and improving the client experience
What’s in it for you?
SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. Our history of organic and strategic growth reflects this commitment with over CA$303 billion in assets under management / US$238 billion in assets under management.
SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. We are breaking ground with innovative solutions for a growing institutional client base of more than 1200 organizations across North America. As a subsidiary of Sun Life, we are aligned with one of the world’s leading financial services companies, and benefit from the stability and strength of that relationship.
Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead.
Visit us at https://www.slcmanagement.com/inv
For a journey this exciting and complex, we’re looking for someone who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change.

Job Title: Data Analyst, Finance and Enterprise Risk
Job Description:
Address:
234 Simcoe Street

Data Analytics & Reporting
Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy.
Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies.
Performs data profiling and data analyses.
Documents and maintains data flow specifications.
Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights.
Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes.
Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation.
Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain.
Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements.
Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making.
Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model.
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions.
Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security.
Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups.
Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes.
Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 1 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle).
Skilled in working with BI tools such as PowerBI, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks.
Proficient in working with SQL
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose
Individual in this role are contributing to the overall success of the Global Brand & Customer Insights (GBCI) department globally. In this role, the Senior Market Research Analyst will conduct full lifecycle market research which includes understanding objectives and requirements, research design, fieldwork/execution, data analysis and reporting. The Senior Market Research Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities and will also monitor performance to identify improvements.
The Senior Market Research Analyst ensures all activities conducted comply with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
Accountabilities

Takes ownership of market research projects assigned for development, execution, fielding and/or reporting.Determines and applies appropriate market research principles and methodology to requests made to GBCI department. Sales strategy analyst


LOCATION:

Mississauga
Belvika Trade & Packaging Ltd. is a leading one-stop contract packaging company, specializing in precision packing of dry foods, chocolate and confectionary products from multiple facilities totaling more than 250,000 ft2. Belvika is a 28-year-old, 100% owned Canadian Company and has grown to be one of the largest co-packers of confectionary and snack products in Canada. Belvika uses its extensive experience in managing both manual processes and automated equipment to handle primary and secondary packaging of products for some of the world's best known confectionary brands.

Belvika is an equal opportunity employer; offering competitive wages, shared benefit plan, ongoing training and an interesting and challenging work environment. We will provide the tools and training that you require to excel at your role together with access to Senior Management to provide additional support and guidance. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Belvika is currently seeking a Sales Strategy Analyst to maintain the overall quality standards for all products packed and ensuring that the Company's & Client's quality specifications are complied with at all times. The Sales Strategy Analyst will be located in the Mississauga facility.

Position Summary:

The Sales Strategy Analyst will be responsible for compiling and analyzing sales and market data and providing valuable feedback and actionable insights to guide our promotional and sales activities.

Sales Strategy Analyst must be able to analyze large amounts of data, accurately project sales trends, identify sales opportunities, and provide practical guidance to optimize sales strategies and increase market share.

The successful candidate will:

Compiling, analyzing, and reporting sales, forecast and sales pipeline data.
Responsible for developing new and existing customer presentation decks;
Monitoring and analyzing competitive activity, customer, and market trends.
Providing actionable insights to guide the sales.
Contributing to the development of sales plans, objectives and strategy.
Monitoring and evaluating sales performance.
Forecasting demand, revenue, and expenses.
Determining sales potential and making recommendations.
Regularly prepare reports and presentations for executives. These reports can include data on market performance, competitor research, and general sales trends.
Provide advice on increasing revenue, eliminating weaknesses within the company's sales ecosystem, meeting sales goals, and improving marketing and promotional efforts in certain sectors
Using data and research, identify markets to target with advertising and promotional efforts or determine how to best set the company apart from its competitors.

Education/Work experience requirements:

Degree in business administration, finance, or marketing.
Experience in sales analysis, strategy or marketing.
Consumer products or food related background an asset

Key technical & behavioral competencies:

Strong research and data analysis skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM software.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Projection and forecasting skills.
Ability to work independently and with cross-functional teams.

Job Title: Manager, Business Intelligence & Performance Tracking - North Zone
Job Description:
Manager, Business Intelligence & Performance Tracking - North Zone
Position Overview
This role will lead the design & delivery of analytic solutions that support the long-term strategy and annual plan of The Coca-Cola Company and Coca-Cola Bottlers. All consumer-relevant routes to market are in-scope including, but not limited to, Direct Store Delivery (DSD) Retail, Food Service, and Warehouse.
The Business Intelligence (BI) Manager will identify key strategic growth risk & opportunities at the regional and local level that are aligned with the Cola-Cola North America Operating Unit (NAOU) strategy. In addition, the BI Manager will create performance management capability by leveraging a variety of consumer/shopper/guest, market, and company data sources including shopper panel (e.g. Numerator, Simmons, MEMRI), dining guest panel (e.g. NPD-CREST), syndicated scanner (e.g. Nielsen, IR), financial, and supply chain. The ideal candidate will have not only a strong foundation in analytic capability but also complementary influential communication skills. Prior experience successfully working in a networked organization is strongly preferred.
What You’ll Do for Us
Partner with scaled data services to design & delivery scorecards that manage & optimize strategic initiatives.
Identify insights from varied sources & analyses that enables strategy-to-execution across the entire value chain.
Perform ad hoc analysis that isolate root causes and provide recommended solutions.
Qualifications & Requirements
Bachelor’s degree; Master's degree, MBA, a plus
2-5 years’ experience in relevant industry (e.g. food, beverage, other CPG)
Demonstrated experience and skills in data analysis & problem solving
Business knowledge and experience relative to P&L impact beyond data collection and analysis
Proven ability to take initiative and be innovative.
Able to draw insights-to-action from data and translate to prioritized opportunities
Adaptable and willing to work flexible hours to meet deadlines
Ability to prioritize the workload and balance competing demands
Experience with collaborating and influencing cross-functional teams
Comfortable working with large data sets and able to create simple queries
Advanced Excel, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI skills are a plus.
Demonstrated experience and skills in synthesizing data and analyses across multiple sources to glean insights (e.g., Numerator, Simmons, MEMRI, NPD-CREST, CBL, Bev360, iDine, iShop, Nielsen, IRI, MATRIX).
Skills
Information-to-Insights: Manage & synthesize diverse internal and external data sources that identify key performance trends. Perform detailed data analysis (i.e. determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples).
Data Analysis & Interpretation: Leverage synthesized insights to define key takeaways and recommended action plans to drive profitable growth for The Coca-Cola Company, Coca-Cola Bottlers and Coca-Cola Customers within the NAOU.
Stewardship & Performance Tracking: Develop & implement reports, scorecards & communication routines against key categories, brands, customers, and bottler-specific initiatives. Assist with creation of effective Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and analytical dashboards / analytical tools for business users in Tableau/Microsoft BI/MicroStrategy.
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

Equitable Bank offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending, and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs.
At Equitable, we have no doubt that financial services are changing. Consumers increasingly prefer to interact remotely through digital channels and are less likely to visit brick and mortar locations. That’s why we launched EQ Bank in 2016. Its approach to simple and convenient banking makes it a strong contender in the industry. We believe there’s an opportunity for something different, to provide better service and a better deal for our customers through digital banking.
