Our Story:

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organisation. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people’s lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact.
Why Work for Us:
We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work – our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry.
LOCATION: Toronto Downtown Headquarters OR Chicago Downtown Office (candidates outside of the two areas will be considered but must be willing to move at own expense).
Overview:

We are seeking an HRIS Analyst to join our dynamic and energetic Human Resources team. At Avison Young, you will be the go-to person in assuring accurate data are reported on all our people – from titles, hire dates, pay rates, to benefits elections, attrition rates, and more. As a company committed to a culture where we’re “powered by people,” it takes a serious and dedicated person to ensure that our people’s data are “right”.
Responsibilities:

The main functions anticipated for this role include, but are not limited to, the following:
Analytical Skills: Sort through large amounts of data, analyze, summarize and present conclusions in an appealing and easy to understand format; Thorough knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint required
Monthly, quarterly and annual business metrics reporting to assist with business decisions
HRIS database and systems; Perform system maintenance and production support activities in both North American HRIS systems (Ultipro and ADP)
Serve as a key contact for the Learning Management System (LMS), 401(K) program, and the HRIS systems, among other programs
Standardized Operating Procedures: Documenting processes, identifying HR concerns, and compiling data analysis reports
HR Initiatives: Assist with various HR initiatives as assigned including data transfers to and from various vendors for systems upgrades, integrations and implementations
This is a high demand environment in terms of which requires keen attention to detail and focus on accuracy; and the successful candidate top performer will be one who keeps cool when the going gets tough.
Qualifications:

You will be:
Data driven and detail-oriented to ensure accuracy of data and reports
Highly pro-active and self-motivated
Collaborative team member with effective written and verbal communication skills
Analytical and have experience with people metrics to influence decision-making
Advanced in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite of products, with a specific focus on Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Clear, concise and experienced with providing relevant and accurate information in formats suitable for the audience receiving the information
Education/Certifications
Bachelor’s degree
Finance or Economics degree with an interest/specialization in HR or related work experience
3 years of work experience with exposure to working with at least one HRIS
System Implementation experience
HR certification in either Canada or United States is preferred

Company Description
Torstar Corporation is a progressive media organization with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar’s vision for success is driven by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. The successful candidate will be a champion of those priorities while keeping the customer at the heart of all of the creative work that s/he will be doing.

Job Description
The Geospatial Data Analyst will report to the Manager, Revenue Analytics and work on the data team and with our sales teams through the delivery of reports and analysis supporting advertising sales, both print and digital. You possess a combination of data analytic skills with geospatial skills and have an analytical mindset with a keen business acumen. You are passionate about delivering analysis with meaningful insights, and impactful business recommendations that enable our sales teams and directly contribute to revenue generation, helping to foster a data-first culture across the organization.
Responsibilities
Work closely with the Sales and Data teams to deliver geographic, demographic, and sales analysis
Conduct analysis using demographic, psychographic, and customer expenditure data and mapping software to determine distribution patterns
Work with the Sales and Data teams to ensure advertiser reporting and analysis needs are met
Ensure the reporting and analysis we provide is evolutionary, progressive, and easily understood, helping to drive successful business decisions
Ensure data presented is inclusive, ensuring consideration of the big picture
Audience segmentation
Have a high attention to detail, resulting in accuracy
Gain a deep understanding of KPIs

Qualifications
Geospatial
Master or Bachelor Degree in Spatial Analysis, Geography, Urban Planning or Data Analytics
Advanced experience using ArcGIS Pro and Online
Advanced experience using Environics Analytics’ geo/demo/psychographic data and Envision
Trained in programming and ability to create simple custom code/scripts in ArcGIS
Sales background is an asset
Databases
Experience using SQL
Experience in creating visualizations through tools such as Tableau
Experience with data-management systems, working with large data-sets and creating reporting surrounding the data
Knowledge of Google Analytics
Plus!
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Attention to detail
Ability to prioritize and organize
Highly motivated independent worker

Dans des marchés en rapide évolution, les clients à travers le monde font confiance à Thales. Thales est une entreprise où les personnes les plus brillantes du monde entier se regroupent pour mettre en commun leurs idées et ainsi s'inspirer mutuellement. Dans tous les secteurs où œuvre Thales, notamment l’aérospatiale, le transport, la défense, la sécurité et l'espace, nos équipes d’architectes conçoivent des solutions innovantes qui rendent demain possible dès aujourd’hui.
Thales fournit des systèmes de commande de trains par télécommunications (CBTC) et des systèmes d’enclenchement destinés au secteur des transports en commun sur voie ferrée à l'échelle mondiale. Le centre de compétences pour la signalisation ferroviaire urbaine est situé au centre-ville de Toronto. Nous sommes le plus grand bureau situé au Canada et nous disposons d’un service pour chaque étape du cycle de vie du développement logiciel (SDLC). Cela comprend le logiciel, le matériel, la conception des systèmes, la vérification et la validation, les opérations, etc. Les équipes de services partagés dans les domaines des finances, des ressources humaines et des technologies de l’information sont également situées sur ce site. Notre espace de bureau est conçu pour fournir un milieu de travail sûr et durable qui correspond à la marque TRSS et qui favorise la collaboration. Le mobilier répond aux normes Greenguard, les appareils ménagers sont certifiés EnergyStar et les adhésifs et produits d'étanchéité répondent aux critères de faible émission. De plus, les portes coulissantes en verre laissent entrer la lumière dans les bureaux intérieurs qui offrent ainsi une vue sur l'extérieur. Venez vous joindre à la grande famille du Transport, ici à Toronto !
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
Thales provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. The Centre of Competence for Urban Rail Signalling is located right before you at mid-town Toronto. As the largest office in Canada, we house a department for every step of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)! This includes Software, Hardware, Systems Design, Verification & Validation, Operations, etc. The supporting corporate shared services teams in Finance, Human Resources and IT is also located at the office. Our office space was designed to provide a sustainable, healthy workplace that expresses TRSS’s brand while increasing collaboration. Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances, low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big Transport family, here in Toronto!
Job Purpose:
Thales is looking to add a Business Intelligence Engineer to lead the Thales North America BI Centre of Excellence (CoE) to join their team in Toronto.
The Business Intelligence Engineer is responsible for the support and deployment of BI solutions, particularly using Datalake, datawarehouse, PowerBI technologies. The role will encompass planning, implementation, management and support of Business Intelligence solutions with the key purpose to implement strategic automated reports. While the primary tool is PowerBI, this responsibility would also extend to future applications implemented in support of the Thales business domains. This role, at times, may directly lead projects assigned to their domain. As a shared service organization, our customers are Thales units within the North American region; however, the engagement of business units outside of this region is possible.
Key Job Functions:
Lead the North American BI CoE (Centre of Excellence)
Work closely with the IT teams to design and deliver reporting and analytical solutions that satisfy business and technical requirements
Extract, transform and load data from multiple sources (Excel, and ERPs: SAGE, SAP, Primavera…)
Provide architectural insight to business users through evaluation and recommendation - Oversee the mapping of data sources, data movement, interfaces, and analytics, with the goal of ensuring data quality
Managing PowerBI workspaces, report access, report deployment, developing best practices in an enterprise environment
Take ownership of end-to-end development of each dashboard and report being developed
Train end-users and other stakeholders as needed to ensure they become fully autonomous and operational on the tool
Coordinate with IS/IT as needed to ensure compliancy with Thales IT/Security
Key Skill Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field with a minimum of 5-8+ years of experience or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field with 4+ years of experience
Experience in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining - Strong understanding of database management systems, analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework
Experience with database design concepts, middleware concepts, user interface development, and information security engineering & access controls
Knowledge of SQL queries and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience with Microsoft Azure Datalake, Azure SQL Database and Azure Analysis Services
Three plus years of relevant work experience building dashboards and reports in PowerBI
Experience working on Power Query, DAX and Power BI Services
Ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams
Experiences in applying agile work practices
Experience collaborating with teams both cross-functionally and cross-geography
Motivated and adaptable, able to work proficiently both independently and in a team environment
Travel up to 10% both domestic and international may be required

Job Title: Global Business Insight Analyst - Scotland, Toronto, Warsaw or remote
Job Description:
To support the ongoing development of Global Business Insight capability Dentons is currently recruiting a Global Business Analyst. This position will report to the Director, Global Client Financial Analytics & Reporting; with main stakeholder group being Global Clients & Markets teams, key account client teams, global business leaders and regional business insight teams.

The Global Business Insight Analyst will be responsible for providing support to the business in relation to the analysis and manipulation of client based financial data and the deployment of reporting tools to support global financial and client reporting, as well as other data-related initiatives. The right candidate will also be expected to work closely with the Global Finance Transformation Team, and in particular the Record to Report team to align new metrics, assist in requirements gathering, data collection and data reconciliation.
This is an exciting and developing global role, requiring contact with colleagues across the Dentons network. Only ambitious and curious team players will be considered.

Why Dentons is different

The legal profession is changing rapidly and Dentons is leading the way in advancing change for the benefit of our clients. We are driven to challenge the status quo, delivering consistent and uncompromising quality and value to our clients in new and innovative ways. Dentons continues to receive multiple external awards and recognition, including for our ongoing international expansion over the last 12 months; for ground-breaking innovation through the development of Nextlaw Labs and Nextlaw Global Referral Network; and for success in advising clients across multiple regions. Dentons is also a leader on the Acritas'Global Elite Brand Index and a BTI Client Service 30 Award winner.
Against such rapid growth and change, this role offers the successful individual the chance to play a significant role and make their mark in driving the successful implementation of a transformative Business Intelligence capability within Dentons.

Key Deliverables
Working with the Business Insight team and key stakeholders:
Delivery of self-guided analytics to support client, area of law, geography, practice group and sector lines of enquiry
Delivery of business insight based on analysis of data, identification of trends, anomalies, deviation from KPI's
The provision of ad hoc support to decision makers facilitating Dentons to become a data driven organisation through having access to timely data that is both reliable and able to be interpreted by senior stakeholders
Design and execution of ongoing data quality monitoring processes
Delivery of a user interface to navigate users to the required reports
Key Responsibilities
To provide support to the decision makers in Dentons through responding to requests for information/analysis and proactively guiding stakeholders to self-help tools as appropriate
To ensure that the process for the extraction of data from underlying systems and the collation of that data into a global database is efficient, monitored and reconciled
To understand and work with the wider team to deliver an efficient end to end Business Insight solution, to include the management and control of data, consistent application of the access and security models, ensuring data consistency across all systems
To create, manage and deploy dashboards/reporting within the global Business Insight architecture, supporting global and regional team members as required
To embrace ongoing change and improve both process and quality of deliverables, providing clear explanations and training as changes are rolled out
To work with the technical reporting team to ensure all data is reconciled as it is transformed and regions and global teams have complete transparency of the data back to source systems
To produce formats and templates to support client pitches, client facing reports, and client management teams as required by clients and client management teams
To ensure all key stakeholders are fully aware of the resources available to them and fully trained in their use
To work with the data stewards and wider finance transformation data team to ensure that data clean up activity delivers business benefit to support better decision making
To create and manage such documentation and on-line tool support text as necessary
To proactively review and incorporate cross regional working data, partner credit data, key performance indicators and global measures into regular reporting and insight
To support the process for ongoing data management and governance, understand the current guidelines and work with team members to optimize process and efficiency to deliver a world class solution to Dentons stakeholders
To support the investigation of the use of AI within Dentons to leverage information held in unstructured data sources
The post holder will also be responsible for identifying (scoping) and collecting (liaising with colleagues globally) regarding the data required to generate new metrics and the definition of those key metrics, working alongside the Global Finance Transformation data and reporting team
About You
Business international level of English – both written and oral.
Demonstrable and progressive experience in the areas of data manipulation and analytics,
A passion for providing data driven insight, with the ambition to bring excellence to Dentons
A fastidiousness for accurate, reconciled analysis with the personality to not rest until imbalances are found
Experience of influencing and engaging stakeholders, including building and managing relationships within a diverse global firm.
Ability to work under pressure and manage conflicting demands, to respond to ad hoc requests alongside developing a best in class BI solution for Dentons
Strong intellectual rigor and commercial awareness.
Strategically focused, results driven and well-developed analytical skills.
The individual will need to combine good technical skills with accuracy and the ability to cope under pressure, given the demands of the work involved and business requirements.
Problem solving skills, supported by high quality data analysis are critical for this role, along with strong communication skills.
Solutions orientated with the ability to address problems by gathering relevant information and formulating alternatives
Structured, collaborative, accurate and with a drive to perfection
Significant experience and a proven track record in/as:
Data analysis, creating and modeling business data using a variety of tools and techniques, to meet the needs of stakeholders;
Data warehousing concepts
Able to communicate insight derived in relevant business language to enable informed decision making:
Working with enterprise wide databases, observing global access and security protocols and assisting in the effective management of global master data
Analysing and interpreting market data for an organisation, quickly establishing key metrics/measures to support the Business Development department
Strong communication skills and the demonstrable ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations;
Strong situational analysis and ability to articulate the true requirements;
Must be a team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus;
Be able to identify and understand multiple stakeholder perspectives and "truths" and bring an open mind to understanding and build on the views of others;
business development/client data analyst, within a team on international projects;
creating both functional and non-functional documentation, including requirements traceability matrices.
You will possess:
The ability to act as a liaison conveying information in suitably accurate models between the Business and their counterparts within Information Technology. The scope of this information includes business requirements, data constraints, business rules, models of strategy and motivation, processes, accountabilities, and many other business and IT operational needs;
The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings, and articulate their collective relevance to Dentons and to high-priority business issues;
The ability to visualize and create high-level models (rigorous information-rich diagrams) that can be used in future analysis to extend and mature the business architecture;
Possess a broad, enterprise-wide view of organizations and varying degrees of appreciation for strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies, and governance.
Skills to create and amend SSRS reporting as well as to administer Reporting Services
Essential Qualifications / Experience
Experience of working as a data/business analyst for an international organisation /international project,
Experienced in creating both functional and non-functional documentation, including requirements traceability matrices, specifications documents and training materials
Data Analytics tools, Microsoft tools expertise, to include Office, in particular Excel, and PowerBi.
MS Azure SQL; Visual Studio
Experience of working with Thomson Reuters 3E, Data Insights and PowerBi
Applications from current residents in the following cities, will be considered:

Scotland, Toronto, or Warsaw or Remote (attendance at a Dentons office will be required periodically)

Disclaimer: Please ensure when applying for this role that you are legally eligible to work/live in your preferred location. Visa sponsorship or relocation costs will not be provided

IO’s Real Estate Enterprise Team manages the province’s portfolio of government buildings and land, which is one of the largest and most diverse in Canada. The team oversees the day-to-day operation and long-term maintenance of these facilities through partnerships with private-sector service providers, ensuring provincially-owned real estate is used in the most optimal way. Finding innovative ways to reduce and revitalize the government’s building and land holdings is central to its business and integral to the value provided Ontarians.
Position Purpose:
The Business Planning Analyst will provide process documentation, system, planning, and strategy support to the Capital Planning department and to our business users. The role will leverage our VFA software license and work with IT staff and outside service providers to effectively develop and service the assigned business areas. The role will work towards the potential migration of our asset data from VFA to another Asset Management Information System.
What You Will Do:
Provide analytical and system support in all aspects of the VFA (Accruent) contract i.e. training, data validation, invoice reconciliation, development of new tools, integration
Work collaboratively with internal IO and ministry team members, coordinate and identify opportunities and consistencies between IO programs
Responsible for delivering ad hoc reports to internal and external clients including but not limited to asset performance measures
Undertake and coordinate asset management planning issues (i.e. benchmarking, data requirements, organizational and operational efficiencies, etc.)
Identify opportunities to improve quality of data within IO and in VFA by carrying out physical and data audits
Identify, document, implement and communicate all processes within the Capital Planning Program and its interconnected relations to the rest of the organization
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to source accurate and reliable assumptions for life-cycle planning models across applicable product types and sub-markets
Effectively plan and deliver process mapping sessions to acquire necessary information from different levels in an organization
Review domestic and international market reports and studies to remain current on industry trends as it pertains to capital reinvestment models, component inventorying, condition assessment, life-cycle assessment, condition indices and performance metrics
Develop various types of real estate and other business analyses (cost/benefit, expenditure/condition modeling and analysis, quantitative vs. qualitative benefits, etc.) for capital reinvestment
Create reports and presentations to assist both senior management and applicable ministry management in decision making
Interact with internal experts and project stakeholders for the purpose of coordinating tasks and collecting data/information where needed
Who We’re Looking For:
Over 2 to 5 years of experience in the real estate industry (i.e. property/facility management, project management, corporate real estate, planning/consulting etc.)
Post-secondary degree in business, engineering or related field
Experience in developing and maintaining medium size business systems
Experience analyzing and preparing financial reports and technical data
Experience in writing business plans, processes and identifying opportunities for improvements
Knowledge of financial analysis and/or capital investment planning
Knowledge of asset/land/building related legislation would be an asset
Knowledge of ISO 55000 would be an asset
Employment in the Real Estate Division is conditional upon obtaining security clearance through the Program & Policy Enablement Branch, Supply Chain Ontario of the Ministry of Government and Consumer Services

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Marketing Technologies, Analytics & Insights (MTA&I) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.
The MTA&I team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.
The MTA&I team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.
Job Description
The successful candidate will be responsible for Campaign Analytics within the broader Marketing Analytics group. This individual will execute the account management campaigns for Personal Savings & Investing and Direct Investing. If you are driven by helping stakeholders understand data, love when the latest direct-to-consumer marketing campaign results are available, and continually strive to challenge the "process status quo" to make workflows run as efficiently as possible – this is the role for you!
Success in this role will be achieved by:
Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reporting Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.
Responsibilities
Design/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experiments
Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal
Execute with excellence
Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI
Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure
Skill Sets
Familiarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)
Good knowledge of Mutual Funds, Direct Investing and other banking products and transactions;
Technical and detail oriented
Knowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as Unica and SAS
A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications
Team player while able to work independently
Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts
A profit driven mindset
Job Requirements
1-2+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)
Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica)
Knowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirements
Experience designing and executing successful direct marketing experiments, including channel tests
Familiarity with concepts such as "next best offer" and "always-on" an asset
Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline
Track record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget

Experience with MS SQL Server 2016 or later, including SQL, SSIS, SSAS, MDX, and SSRS.
Exposure to Business Intelligence and Visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) and experience building reports and dashboards.
Sound knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle (Agile and Waterfall).
Experience working in a medium to large organization, dealing with large sets of data from disparate source systems.
Ability to work with a diverse group within a team environment.

Insurance or financial services industry experience is an asset.

Experience with Python to develop models for predictive analytics.
Experience with Metadata management, Master Data Management, Data quality management
MCSE: Business Intelligence

Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.
Department Summary:
The Risk Management mandate is to provide oversight, monitoring and reporting of all operational, credit and market risks, including fraud exposures on an enterprise-wide basis. It is comprised of four well-defined functions: Operational Risk Management, Retail Credit Risk Management, Wholesale Credit Risk Management and Market Risk Management.
Role Purpose:
This role supports the Senior Manager of Strategic Initiatives and Portfolio Oversight and the overall Risk Management Team in identifying critical financial information typically from the bank’s Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). The primary responsibility of this role is to assist the senior manager in developing and maintaining a risk reporting framework, support on credit risk strategy initiatives and other ad-hoc analysis will be required as necessary. Accordingly, the role requires strong data programming skills including SQL and SAS.
The Senior Analysts generally works within the established framework to carry on responsibilities under the supervision of the Senior Manager of Strategic Initiatives and Portfolio Oversight. A high degree of self-assurance, initiative and business sense is required of the Senior Analyst in order to carry out the position responsibilities proactively in a timely and effective manner
This role will allow the Senior Analyst to gain insight into the bank’s financial systems, economic drivers and regulatory reporting environment. The candidate should be naturally inclined toward mathematics and have a curiosity to learn complex systems. A background in business, statistics, economics, finance or accounting is desirable.
Job Responsibilities:
Maintain the monthly Local Risk Credit Committee deck for review by senior management
Provide key access to data via SQL/SAS/Python and other data retrieval techniques.
Identify data sources, and develop process required for the preparation of standard reports.
Assist in providing financial information related to the expected loss component of the provision for credit loss and other portfolio insight in actively managing credit risk of consumer lending portfolios.
Support for strategy , product and analysis teams as required
Support the development and implementation of credit risk and loss mitigation plans and provide insight to the management team through ad hoc requests, projects and initiatives.
Cross-train and share risk analytic knowledge with team members to foster a strong risk discipline environment.
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by senior management
Job Requirements:
Education/Experience
University Degree with a business, analytical, mathematical or statistical focus (Economics, Finance, Accounting or Statistics)
Minimum of 6 months to 1 year of experience working with data analytics
Specialized Knowledge
Knowledge of OSFI guidelines is an asset
Knowledge of Basel regulatory requirements on capital adequacy, liquidity risk and interest rate risk would be considered an asset
Technical Skills
Strong technical solution management experience and skills
Strong analytical skills including SQL/SAS/Python
Strong skills in reporting tools such as Tableau
MS Office – Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access
Abilities
Aptitude for innovation and readiness to “roll up sleeves” and do what is necessary to deliver on business objectives
Strong capability to work with cross functional team members and collaborate effectively in high pressure environments
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where processes and procedures are consistently refined
Ability to work autonomously under tight timelines
Ability to work on multiple ad-hoc tasks with a sense of urgency
Attributes
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong attention to detail
Strong organizational skills
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Experience
1 year to less than 2 years

Business Equipment and Computer Applications
Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Visual Studio

Specific Skills
Confer with clients to identify and document requirements.
Conduct business and technical studies, Design, develop and implement information systems business solutions.
Provide advice on information systems strategy, policy, management and service delivery, Assess physical and technical security risks to data, software and hardware.
Develop policies, procedures and contingency plans to minimize the effects of security breaches.
Develop and implement policies and procedures throughout the software development life cycle.
Conduct reviews to assess quality assurance practices, software products and information systems.

Education
Bachelor's degree

Personal Suitability
Client focus, Organized, Effective interpersonal skills, Team player, Excellent written communication, Initiative, Judgement, Accurate

Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

Music Data Analyst
Job Description:
We are Warner Music Group, home to a broad roster of new stars and legendary artists through a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, East West, Elektra, Erato, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Spinnin’, Warner Bros., Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville, as well as Warner/Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide.
We currently have a fantastic opportunity to join our innovative and highly sought-after Business Development team.
A little bit about our team:
Warner Music Canada is home to some of the most influential and innovative artists of our time. Our extraordinary roster of new and established recording artists is unparalleled, and our collective influence on music culture is without precedent. With a visionary approach toward discovering and nurturing musical talent, the Warner Music Canada family of labels is currently home to an impressive generation of major artists.
As the music industry continues to evolve, Warner Music Canada is always looking for innovative ways to help artists grow and reach their fans successfully. Using data to supplement strategic initiatives, the Music Data Analyst will use data to build models, test hypotheses, and interpret analyses to help key stakeholders achieve strategic goals.
If you are highly analytical, a great communicator, and love to solve problems using data in a fast-changing and exciting industry, this role is for you. We are looking for someone who is passionate about data, spreadsheets, and infographics – someone who’s a self-starter, a critical thinker, loves technology, socials, and of course – music!
Here you’ll be able to:
Serve as a part of a key business function that anchors all data-led analytics initiatives cross-functionally.
Leverage data insights by applying learnings and presenting them in a way that can be understood and applied to all levels of the organization.
Collect and translate data into actionable insights to help drive business strategy and decision-making process:
Dig through multiple data tools and data sets to draw conclusions based on marketing plans
Perform artist analyses on streaming, social, content and commerce properties
Determine cause and effect of marketing plans on streaming, sales and other channels
Analyze the impact of advertising, promotion, radio and other inputs on sales/streaming
Perform financial modelling to forecast quantitative impact of pilot and strategic projects.
Identify and fulfil ongoing and ad hoc reporting opportunities.
Be a storyteller: Liaise and communicate recommendations to solve specific strategic initiatives as requested from various departments.
Act as a resident expert on the latest tools and learnings within the music world of streaming, marketing, research & analysis, and CRM/Direct-to-Consumer.
Provide ad-hoc analytical support as directed and requested.
It would be music to our ears if you also had:
3+ years’ experience as a data analyst required.
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, computer science, management information systems, or related field. Master’s an asset.
Proven intermediate/advance level experience working with SQL and Excel, a must. Tableau/Python/R an asset.
Experience with database query and statistical analysis tools/systems.
Experience analysing music industry data (including streaming, and marketing data) an asset.
Experience with enterprise-level and start-up analytical tools, including data segmentation, visualization and dashboard tools. May include: Salesforce, Social listening tools and beyond.
Familiarity with Nielsen SoundScan/Connect and Mediabase/BDS an asset.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large data sets, while keeping the big picture in mind.
Strong interpersonal, visual skills, and creative writing skills.
Extremely organized and detail oriented.
Why join us?
Warner Music Group is all about our people. We are one global company made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business.
It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music, at every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart from the rest of the industry by embracing a philosophy of innovation that is part of our company's DNA.
Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the biggest forces in music today.
Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Please note that due to the volume of applicants we receive for a given position, you may not be contacted if you do not meet minimum eligibility requirements for this position.
Thanks for your interest in working for Warner Music Group. We love it here and think you will too.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please send an e-mail to canada.humanresources@warnermusic.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Job Title: RQ01046 Senior Business Intelligence Specialist - Toronto
Job Description:
Our Public Sector client is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Specialist



Must Haves:
R ScriptingPower BIDemonstrates experience working and communicating directly with stakeholdersManaging high volumes of data
Knowledge of advanced data visualization tools and techniques. Knowledge of statistics and analytical tools such as R/SAS/SPSS Expert documentation skills.
Knowledge of BI technologies such as R Shiny, Power BI, Tableau.


Nice to Have:
Public Sector Experience
Responsibilities:

Supports Client’s wide-ranging business information requirements, implementing and supporting business intelligence software solutions
Develops and supports customized query applications which analyze key business data
Develops and supports guided analysis and drill-down functionality, routine scheduling and notification of report generation, and effective implementation of “opportunity” and “key-trend” alerts.
Provides Clients with approach options and tools for managing business-related data in a manner that assists in quantitative analysis of progress and the relationship between operational actions and their effect on business objectives.
General Skills:

Experience with analyzing data in source systems to identify data cleanliness issues (e.g. missing values, duplicate meanings, and invalid data)
Experience with developing feedback processes to fix corrupt data in the source systems
Experience with developing data extraction, transformation, and load programs (daily and initial load) functionality on a wide-range of data repositories (relational and multi- dimensional data stores)
Experience with developing, implementing and maintaining schedule/dependency logic for Extract Transform Load (ETL) scripts
Experience with developing monitoring and error notification processes to ensure data is updated as designed
Experience with developing automation extraction, cleansing and load scripts
Experience generating research models and reports (scheduled and ad-hoc)
Proven troubleshooting and analytical experience
Experience in process decomposition/mapping and business process re-engineering and complex data models using UML.
Experience in the use of development tools and business re-engineering software
Experience in developing enterprise architecture deliverables (e.g. business, logical, and physical models) based on Enterprise Application Processes and Modeling methodology and guidelines
Desirable Skills:

Knowledge and experience in developing data analysis applications
Knowledge and understanding of Information Management principles, concepts, policies and practices
Ability to provide expert advice in developing and integrating process and information models to enable identifying and eliminating redundant business processes
Experience with developing monitoring and error notification processes to ensure data is updated as designed
Hands on experience working with stakeholders to develop and document interface specifications design between Business Intelligence solutions and external applications
Extensive experience with conceptual, logical and physical data modelling tools like Power Designer, and Visio.
Knowledge and understanding of Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA) and related regulations and standards

Company Description
We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create liveable, sustainable and advanced urban environments. From high-rises to industrial buildings, schools to state-of-the-art hospitals, transit stations to highways, airports to toll systems, bike lanes to parks, we design every aspect of a truly integrated city for people to live, work and play.
Our collaborative and combined approach focuses not only on creating the best solutions today, but also determining the right solutions for tomorrow. We believe cities in the future must be designed with intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, efficient infrastructure and a human touch.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow

Job Description
Overview:
The Information System Data Analyst will be part of a design and development team that includes business analysts, data base developers, data architects and process automation team. The mission will be to develop and maintain data analytics tools using Microsoft Power Bi, Microsoft Power Apps, Microsoft SQL Server and other data management tools.

Most of the things you'll be working on:
 Assist in designing and developing data analytics solutions using Microsoft Power Bi.
Creating analytics models which consume data from different sources like relational data base, Sharepoint and other Microsoft tools.
Manage system / data tool security based on industry best practices.
Participate in reviews and enhancements of analytics tools developed by peers [QA / QC].
Assist in the process of improving data analytics models with adherence to best practices related with performance and reliability.
Properly documents functionality and technical specifications of the analytics products under their scope.
Capable of delivering complete full life cycle development of analytics tools, including identifying user requirements, connecting to various data sources, testing and deployment, etc.
Participate in and contribute to the design and development of best practices for data analytics models.
Research new products and technologies to enhance the process of development, testing and deployment of data analytics models.
Understands the interactions and dependencies among data and process components.
Identifies and documents enhancements to modeling techniques. Enhance, connections and calculations to improve performance of models and outputs.
Works collaboratively with Manager and team to forward plan workload.
Maintains awareness of multiple asks / competing priorities and proactively requests input from others (specifically immediate team / manager) to speed up or slow down various Epics within workload

Qualifications
You'll need yo have:
2 to 3 years of experience using Microsoft Power Bi building dashboards and visualizations
Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and architecture
Exceptional analytical skills
Proficiency using Microsoft SQL
Advanced level of Excel: pivot tables, Power Pivot, Macros (VBA is an asset)
Working experience creating analytics using data coming a well-known ERP application
Additional Information
Additional information
We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.
BI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. #ibi

Business Operations Analyst Summer Student

DUCA is looking for 2 Business Operations Analyst Summer Students to join our Administrative Services team for this summer from May to August, 2021

The ideal candidate for this role is enrolled in a post-secondary educational institution and must be a current student.

Job Purpose & Summary
Reporting to the Manager, Business Operations, the Business Operations Analyst Summer Student is responsible for various functions and duties related to back office processes supporting the administration of deposit and loan products. This role will assist Centralized Operations teams with various administrative duties such as completing and processing files and documentation and assisting with banking system data clean-up and maintenance. The Business Operations Analyst Intern carries out all work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail with a drive to deliver outstanding service to internal teams as they provide support to DUCA Members.

Key Accountabilities & Duties

Digitizes and files various paper documents and assets
Diarizes proper system input and changes, and processes extra payment, PADs and payment change requests on system as required.
Assists branches with the completion of Payment Changes and PAD forms
Forwards letters to quote insurance placement premiums on cancellations.
Updates system with mortgage/assignment number and insurance dates
Processes and balances daily Electronic Fund Transfer (EFT) and cheque clearing files
Processes rejected bill payments and Member requested bill payment traces/recalls
Processes ATM exchange adjustments
Processes registered and non-registered deposit products
Assists in the administration of maturing deposits
Issues posted cheques for Brokers
Reconciles previous day’s transactions and documentation
Follows up on outstanding transfers and documentation
Prepares paid out files for shipment to Iron Mountain
Assists Credit Managers, Senior Manager, Special Accounts and Risk Management Analysts with data cleanup and reporting
Assists with archiving old and discharged files
Maintains accurate data for reporting purposes with both physical and electronic files
Distributes incoming branch courier, faxes and mail

Occupational Experience & Education Requirements

Enrolled in a post-seconday educational institution, working towards a degree or diploma in a related field.
1 to 3 years of administrative experience
1 to 3 years of customer service experience
Retail banking experience considered an asset

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes

Proficiency with MS Office suite
An understanding of or the ability to learn Registered products (RRSPs, RIFs and TFSAs)
An understanding of or the ability to learn Loan products (Mortgages, Line of Credit)
Ability to work quickly and accurately, with strong attention to detail
Problem-solving and investigative skills
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-motivated and results-oriented
Team player

 Working Conditions

Normal office environment.

Department: Centralized Operations

Primary Location: Corporate Office - 5255 Yonge Street, North York

Employment Status: Contract Full-Time

Hours per Week: 38

Job Grade Level: To be confirmed

About DUCA

DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.

At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.

We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Department: Business Intelligence
Reports to: Senior Director, Business Intelligence
This is a full-time position working Monday - Friday 8:00am- 4:30pm out of Calgary or Toronto

About the Company
ComplyWorks Ltd. is a compliance management solution company with offices in Calgary, Toronto, and South Africa.
As a global leader in compliance management, ComplyWorks actively works to bring innovative solutions to the
marketplace, while retaining its focus on its clients. Since inception in 2004, ComplyWorks has continued to expand
its offerings to cover the entire compliance lifecycle, from contractor management, through to workforce and worksite
management.
Veriforce is the fastest-growing SaaS-technology and services company in the global supply chain risk management
market. We help industry-leading companies create and maintain operating cultures and work environments that
optimize safety, promote sustainability, and foster collaboration across a broad spectrum of internal and external
stakeholders. What separates Veriforce from the rest is our people. We hire growth-minded individuals that team well
and continuously look for new, better ways of solving business challenges. If this sounds compelling, keep reading.
Do you love data? Are you a data rockstar? Does working with data and finding the nuance that leads to key
differentiation for the business and customers excite you? This is your opportunity to be a key member of our Veriforce
team. Our company is just beginning to harness the power of data and there is a great opportunity to do some exciting
and big thinking to help us get this right. You’ll interface across teams to answer challenging analytical questions
related to revenue generation, market opportunities and observations that focus on customer behavior. If you are a
data blackbelt with an entrepreneurial mindset, Veriforce is looking for you!
Veriforce is looking for a data superstar who will be a crucial enabler of our journey to be the world's leading data-

driven global supply chain risk management company. As part of this transformation, we are seeking someone who
will dive deep into our business and help create a unified approach to data and a single source of truth.
A Typical Day May Include:
Conducting analysis on revenue generation to inform better sales and pricing practices
Generating executive level dashboards and data analysis to move the business forward
Synthesizing complex data into clear, cogent, and actionable recommendations for executives
Delving into complex data to find revenue-generating testable business hypothesis
Reviewing data and trends to create benchmarks, inform business decisions, and determine ROI
Compiling competitive research
Conducting market research
Diving into internal systems and data to better understand the business and make recommendations based
on findings
Your Core Responsibilities Will Be:
Conduct analysis to assist in determining the reporting and analytical requirements for the executive team,
internal staff and other stakeholders
Develop a clear understanding of the data required (type and quality) to drive business decisions and work
with data stewards, product teams, and business owners to align on data requirements and availability
Present findings and recommendations from analytical exercises to key stakeholders in a clear concise way
that will help shape business strategies
Work with data scientists to drive value through our data, extracting the “so what?” of our business and
building a path to ROI
Takes initiative and solves problems in a structured and logical way. Presents findings and analysis in a way
that is tailored to the audience
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to
drive key business decisions
Shaping and informing key metrics and indicators by which the organization will assess its performance.
Mining large datasets to find trends and problems, then communicate and drive action
Required Skills
A Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business or a related field
MBA strongly preferred
A minimum of 5 years of experience in a position focused on data analytics, business intelligence or financial
analysis
Exceptional knowledge and skills in Excel and other necessary data software applications
Strong presentation, communication and facilitation skills with the ability to collaborate with others in order to
achieve the best results and deliver the most value
Strong organizational and analytical skills with critical thinking, logic, and problem-solving skills including the
ability to rationalize complex, multi-faceted problems into smaller, manageable issues
Proven ability to meet goals under pressure and deliver under tight deadlines
SQL, R, Python and other programming languages are a plus
Fluent in written and spoken English
The successful candidate will have to undergo a criminal record check as condition of their employment.
Applying
Please email a cover letter and resume to careers-cw@veriforce.com with “Business Intelligence Analyst” in the
subject line. Position is open until it is filled.

Position: Research Analyst I
Site: TECHNA Institute

Department: Research
Reports To: Project Director
Salary Range: $24.61 - $30.76 per hour (commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN Compensation Policy)
Hours: 37.5 hours per week
Status: Temporary Full-Time (1 year)
University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Research Analyst I at the Techna Institute.
Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.
The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
Accelerating the Development of Technology for Improved Health!
Techna is an institute of the University Health Network (UHN) focused on the accelerated development and exploitation of technology for improved health. Techna is seeking a bold, creative, and innovative individual who can lead various types of digital health projects that support clinicians, researchers and patients. These initiatives include process redesign, technology strategy, data analytics, system design and implementation and operational technical support for provincial clinical programs.
Responsibilities will include:
Assisting in the modification and maintenance of electronic systems through the coordination of data flow with internal and external stakeholders.
Assisting with collecting data and documentation to support product design and analysis, environmental assessments, and change management.
Assisting with validating new releases and identifying bug fixes to support project and operational improvements of software applications.
Qualifications:
University Degree required in Health Informatics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
Minimum one (1) year practical and related experience.
Ability to effectively operate computer, software, and peripheral equipment, i.e., MS Office, MS Outlook.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to systematically analyze situations/issues, identify options, draw logical conclusions, and determine/recommend practical courses of action.
Demonstrates ability to work with both internal and external stakeholders and document interactions and next steps.
Experience leading project work streams or small projects independently.
Experience in leading and conducting workflow analysis, value stream mapping, data mapping and Plan-Do-Study-Act cycles.
Experience in creating and delivering management-level presentations, training and/or end user support.
Project Management Professional (PMP) or Change Management certification an asset.
Experience with data management and supporting/utilizing data management systems.
Keen attention to detail.
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Self-motivated and results driven team player who can work independently.
Able to work with minimal supervision and with minimal direction to complete tasks.
Able to work with multidisciplinary teams in a positive and productive manner.
Able to effectively deal with high priority unscheduled tasks and problems.
Demonstrates understanding of the healthcare environment in which the organization operates.

The Database Analyst’s role is to direct, evaluate, review, and manage database resources and services across the organization while ensuring high levels of data quality. This individual is also responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing database policies and procedures to ensure the integrity and availability of databases and their accompanying software. Troubleshooting applications and software for all internal customers, such as operations, development, and other business units. May also be required to assist in the design, delivery, and improvement of in-house software applications training programs and related courseware
Responsibilities
Develop and administer strategies for the control and sharing of company database resources and services
Work with application development staff to develop database architectures, coding standards, and quality assurance policies and procedures
Develop long-term goals for production databases in conjunction with data owners and department managers
Design and implement redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets
Evaluate documented resolutions and analyze trends for ways to prevent repeated future problems
Conduct research and make recommendations on database products, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts
Ensure the stability and reliability of data access and data quality across the organization via ongoing database support and maintenance
Analyze user requirements for reports, forms, queries, and data extraction
Provide end-user training as necessary with regards to the effective and efficient use of database tools and resources
Monitor database system details within the database, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements
Create and document models for new database development and/or changes to existing ones through data flowcharting
Respond to and resolve database access and performance issues
Advise on the allocation of physical data storage for database systems
Field incoming problem tickets from end users to resolve application and software issues within servers, databases, and other mission-critical systems
Document all pertinent end user identification information, including name, department, contact information, and nature of problem or issue
Key Success Factors
College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science or related field and/or 3-5 years equivalent work experience.
Understanding of, and experience with, server-client computing and relational database environments
Experience involving programming languages and techniques, including C#, JavaScript, in-depth experience with data management and data processing flow-charting techniques
Experience designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting database servers, using Microsoft SQL, MySQL
Experience working with Windows and Linux
 Experience with support Cloud base SaaS Technologies including Dynamics 365

Company Bio
IMAGINE a hospital where everyone is committed to excellence. We did. We are. From boardroom to bedside, we go above and beyond to offer the best and safest patient care. At North York General Hospital (NYGH), we put our patients first in everything we do. We are achieving a new standard of excellence in integrated patient-centered care and as one of Canada's leading community academic hospitals, we are building on our academic foundation through enhanced education, research and innovation. North York General Hospital is part of North York Toronto Health Partners, a collaborative partnership with patients, primary care, and community partners, a first- generation Ontario Health Team, driving the development of a locally integrated health system to serve the community. As part of our dynamic team, you too can stand out and be amazing! At North York General, our team is making a world of difference.
Position Summary
Research Data Analyst, Research and Innovation
Research & Innovation at North York General Hospital currently has an opening for a Temporary Full-Time Research Analyst. The contract is for one year with the possibility of renewal. Reporting to Dr. Katie Dainty and her team, this role will support a growing research portfolio of projects related to patient-centred outcomes, patient and family experiences of health and health care, and quality improvement in health care settings.
We are seeking a highly motivated individual with strengths in qualitative health research and familiarity with quantitative and literature review methods. The ideal candidate will have experience with qualitative interviewing, qualitative data analysis (including coding, writing memos and analytic notes), and use of NVivo or other data management programs. Additional experience with survey-based data collection and analysis are considered assets.
On a practical level, you will

Assisting with the day-to-day operations of ongoing qualitative and survey studies, including:

Liaising with patients, family members, and other stakeholder groups (e.g., clinical staff, decision-makers, etc.), to arrange research interviews.

Liaising with other investigators and research team members to facilitate recruitment and ensure the consistency and quality of all study procedures.

Conducting participant recruitment/enrollment and informed consent processes.

Monitoring project requirements to ensure that data and procedure flow in accordance with study protocols.

Maintaining ongoing records of participant recruitment, data collection, and analysis files in an organized manner that is easily accessible by other research team members.

Supporting interview and survey data collection, management, and analysis.

Contributing to the writing of final reports and manuscripts.

Supporting literature reviews (e.g. basic, scoping, systematic).

Scheduling and attending research meetings, including preparing agendas and meeting minutes.
Qualifications

At minimum, completion of a Bachelor’s degree in health sciences, social sciences, or related fields that include formal training in the qualitative methodologies. Master’s degree strongly preferred (complete or in progress). Formal training and/or education related to qualitative research methods is required.

A minimum of two (2) years of qualitative research experience in an academic/health care/scientific environment.

Experience conducting qualitative interviews, analyzing qualitative data, and writing research reports is required.

Advanced written and verbal communication, critical thinking, analytical abilities, and interpersonal skills.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a team member and set priorities for delegated tasks

Excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to detail.

Previous word-processing, database and qualitative data management experience in a Microsoft Office environment, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and NVivo. Experience working online with video conferencing technologies (e.g. Zoom, MS Teams) an asset.

Knowledge of ICH/GCP regulations and guidelines.

Ability to produce high quality work in accordance with Hospital standards.

Ability to maintain confidentiality and strong knowledge of clinical ethics regulations.

Must be flexible to work Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm with occasional evening/weekend hours required for data collection. This will be an off-site position pending pandemic conditions.

Bilingualism in French/English an asset
What We Offer
Working at NYGH means working with a dynamic team of fellow healthcare providers, staff, and volunteers in one of Canada’s leading hospitals. This is a Full-time Temporary Position (approx. 12 months), with 75 hours bi-weekly, 8 hour shifts, Days, in Research & Innovation. We offer a highly competitive total compensation package which may include benefits, pension, vacation pay, or pay in lieu of benefits, when applicable. If you were searching for more reasons to consider joining the wonderful team at NYGH, check out some features of our Total Rewards package by visiting nygh.on.ca

Supervisor, Data Analytics

Staff

Data Governance

Full-Time Contract(12 months)


Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role

The Data Analyst will support GS1 Canada’s industry exclusive Dashboard. This includes weekly data processing and validation of master data files, quality assurance testing and ongoing product development and process optimization.

The Data Analyst also plays an integral role in supporting Industry Managed Services (IMS) with subscriber and service level reporting and analysis. Working closely with other analysts, the candidate will extract, process and summarize subscriber data and be instrumental in ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.

The Data Analyst will assist the Supervisor of Data Analytics to translate business requirements into technical and functional solutions that allow IMS to deliver value added services to existing subscribers and promote enrolment of new subscribers which support cost recovery in the not-for-profit model.

Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the refresh of GS1 Canada’s Dashboard – a portal used by retailers to evaluate vendor compliance to services essential for commerce.
Validate retail data against GS1 Canada registries for completeness and perform quality assurance prior to promotion to production
Transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions.
Querying data in SQL Server, Access or other database tools from disparate systems and sources ensuring integrity, quality and efficient processing at every step
Liaise with senior and executive level stakeholders to identify criteria for business reporting and execute the technical solution delivery.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with the Supervisor to prioritize development efforts.
Create reports that go beyond presenting the numbers but also delivers meaningful analytics.
Assist with Data Warehouse development and implementation
Create, deploy and maintain BI tools and reports
Validate system integrity through report generation and analysis from various internal databases as required (i.e. CRM, ECCnet Registry and Item Centre).
Assist with conducting full lifecycle data analysis and evolving analysis and reporting capabilities.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Scheduling tasks to execute at regular intervals or automating repetitive or complex steps using VBA or other scripting languages.
Establish a brand identity by standardizing report processes and generating output with consistent results, accurate information and quality fit and finish.
Engage with Data Governance to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards;
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business or a related area of study, with a focus on problem solving, analytics/mathematics and critical thinking
A minimum of 2-3 year’s work experience, preferably in data management and reporting capacity
Experience in dimensional data modeling
Knowledge of Data Warehouse design but preference will be given to those with experience in Data Warehouse implementation and architecture
Demonstrated proficiency in SQL coding is a must, preferably with SQL Server and its suite of tools and services (SSRS, SSIS, MDM, etc.)
In depth understanding of DBMS systems, online analytical processing and ETL methods
Strong capability with Business Intelligence (BI) tools link MS Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, QlikView or others
Understanding of governance principles and master data management required.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business reporting requirements, technical design and implementation
Meticulous with high attention to detail
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Takes pride in their work and validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness
Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; exhibits confidence in self and others
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and efficient manner
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to positively influence others to promote engagement
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Demonstrated and proven high level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint) with preference given to those with advanced expertise in Excel and familiarity with MS Access or other relational database systems
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset
VBA or other scripting experience is highly preferred
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs
