At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
The Impact you'll make

Build Big Query Data Studio dashboards from scratch and maintain existing reporting

Does this sound like you?
Strong technical and interpersonal skills
Experience with handling ecommerce data, retail experience a plus

How you’ll succeed

We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. Title: Analyst
Team / Department: Analytics

Whenever and wherever you join us, you open a door to opportunities in any and all aspects of media, technology and innovation. We will encourage you to break the rules, knock things down, rebuild them better, and push the boundaries of what’s possible. Our success takes a team of people who are invested in our culture, each other’s success, and their own growth, and together we make Mindshare Canada the place where we do the best work of our career.

OVERVIEW:

Mindshare is looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for data analysis to join our growing team. This role falls under Mindshare’s Analytics team, which encompasses performance analytics, research, modeling and technology. It is an integral part in supporting the Client Leadership teams as they allocate media budgets and optimize effective plans that drive measurable impact towards clients’ business goals. You will work in an environment where everyone is passionate about data, analytics and self-development with a customer-centric focus.
The Analyst acts as a primary day-to-day contact on project management and execution for client accounts and deliverables, including but not limited to measurement planning, weekly reporting, media and creative tests, media and creative analysis, competitive analysis, and industry research. You will be expected to demonstrate hands-on skill in data analysis, processing, management, and visualization. The position will support the Manager to ensure consistent quality output on all projects.

How you will make an IMPACT:
Analyze results and trends in order to assist in making appropriate recommendations and present results / findings to stakeholders
Responsible for the insight gathering and development of weekly, monthly, quarterly & annual digital reporting
Collect performance data from internal and external data sources
Manage timeline for all digital reporting
Provide planning teams with key research and insights to steer quality digital strategies
Actively engage with industry partners to build relationships and grow understanding of partner’s present and future vision from an analytics and measurement perspective
Help to build key presentations to Client, Agency and Industry
Work with Mindshare Analytics team to evolve digital measurement process for both client and company

What YOU bring:

College Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Statistics, Commerce or similar field, or equivalent experience
Intermediate knowledge of MS Office suite (Excel, Word, Powerpoint)
Experience with the following technologies and software: SQL, mySQL,Tableau, Datorama, etc.
Strong capability in customer service skills and communications
The ability to tell a meaningful story using data
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong presentation skills
Excellent time management skills; proven ability to prioritize and organize workload, and operate under tight deadlines while managing multiple projects
Exceptional organizational skills, and detail oriented

What WE bring:

The opportunity to create and contribute to an environment where ‘Innovation as usual’ thrives in everyday work
We foster a growth mindset by exhibiting adaptability, inclusivity, sincerity, curiosity, entrepreneurial spirit, and teamwork
Extensive learning, training and development opportunities
Comprehensive benefits program, including maternity/parental top-up program
Agency that values wellness with programs that contribute to a healthy lifestyle
Exposure to a global network of resources, strategic partnerships, and career opportunities
Corporate social responsibility, actively participating to create a better community
Great social environment where we work hard and play hard

Job Description:
Role Summary
Come be part of an exciting and challenging opportunity by helping to accelerate the growth and application of data analytics capabilities at Sun Life Canada. As part of the Financial Operations Reporting Centre of Excellence, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of applying data and analytics to transform our financial reporting processes. You will be helping Sun Life use analytics to deliver on our purpose of helping our Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.
As a Data Analyst on the Financial Operations Reporting COE team, your focus will be working with a team of financial professionals to build out a suite of impactful business intelligence products and solutions to support Financial Operations within Canada. These products and services will allow Sun Life Canada’s Finance leaders to better analyze financial drivers and make data driven decisions.
What will you do?
Reporting & Business Intelligence (50%)
Build out comprehensive business intelligence & reporting for Finance leadership, keeping in mind the needs of varied audiences and the desire to drive insights & action
Data Sourcing, Manipulation, and Transformation (40%)
Effectively translate business and project needs into data extraction and manipulation plans
Leverage data expertise to support initiatives through scoping, implementation, impact analysis, and ongoing reporting
Organizational Best Practices (10%)
Work to drive efficiencies within Canada Reporting COE by ensuring adoption & continued evolution of best practices
What will you need to succeed?
Relevant Experience and Education
An undergraduate or graduate degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, finance, accounting or computer science, plus strong quantitative skills and background, or equivalent work experience
5+ years proven experience and ability in the following areas:
Reporting and business intelligence
Data sourcing, manipulation, and transformation
Insightful analysis of data
A passion for solving problems
Critical thinking skills
Business understanding
Technical Skills
Strong knowledge of data visualization software such as Tableau, SAS Visual Analytics, etc.
Proven experience with a subset of SAS, SQL & VBA
Able to write complex queries to extract and integrate data from multiple data sources
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Problem Solving
Proven balance of analytical and creative problem solving skills
Coordinate with partners to ensure existing and in-development reporting meets the evolving needs of the organization
Communication
Ability to distill complex technical information into the key points that matter to the audience
Effective writing and verbal communication skills
What will be nice to have?
Industry Experience & Knowledge
Past experience in life insurance / wealth management, other financial services industry
Working knowledge of one or more Sun Life Canada business units
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits, pension, stocks, savings and 4 weeks vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Category: Policy, Planning & Research
Division & Section: City Planning Division, Strategic Initiatives, Policy & Analysis
Work Location: Metro Hall, 55 John Street
Job Type & Duration: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $82,409.60 to $96,805.80 per year, Wage Grade: 6.0
Shift Information: 70 hours bi-weekly
Affiliation: Non-Union
Number of Positions Open: 1
Posting Period: 15-Feb-2021 to 02-Mar-2021

Major Responsibilities
Reporting to the Manager, Business Performance & Standards, the Business Analyst is responsible for researching and analyzing information technology problems and solutions related to business processes and program operations for the City Planning Division. The Business Analyst performs data analysis, including but not limited to developing, monitoring, and reporting on divisional key performance metrics, as well as prepares requirements for maintenance and enhancement of the Integrated Business Management System (IBMS), Application Information Centre (AIC), and associated applications.

Implements detailed plans and recommends policies/procedures regarding program specific requirements.
Conducts research into assigned area ensuring that such research takes into account developments within the field, corporate policies and practices, legislation and initiatives by other levels of government.
Provides input into and administers assigned budget, ensuring that expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations.
Develops, monitors and evaluates data collection processes and systems to support service delivery and monitoring of trends.
Facilitates standard approaches to data capture, collection, input and interpretation and ensures that information and data are delivered in a consistent manner.
Documents and analyzes business processes, system requirements, screens and report layouts, input costs and output levels and conducts data flow analysis and business process modeling.
Conducts business process reviews and makes recommendations to senior management, including process optimization and simplifications that could lead to changes in staffing levels and resource allocation.
Conducts analyses to assess the division’s web information requirements and develops and presents effective concepts, designs, prototypes and page templates.
Evaluates and makes recommendations on the effectiveness of IBMS and web technologies or methods of delivering information and services and the usability and standards compliance of information products and user interface screens.
Develops test strategies, plans and scripts and executes and documents tests of technology solutions and business processes and validation of IBMS enhancements, web pages and applications to support the implementation of process and procedural changes.
Prepares or contributes to technology solutions, including product visions, use case models and supplementary specifications including screen mockups, report mockups and business rules.
Conducts studies on the feasibility of integrating technology and processes to deliver a range of support services.
Prepares and distributes communication of new business practices and conducts training sessions for staff.
Provides presentation support and gives presentations as required.
Supports development of business plans, project plans and work breakdowns.
Provides supervision to teams associated with projects.

Key Qualifications
Post-secondary education in business or public administration or other discipline pertinent to the job function, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Considerable experience in the development, implementation and support of business process reviews and re-engineering.
Considerable experience in software development, including facilitating sessions to identify current and optimal processes, and identifying business and technical requirements.
Considerable experience with documentation and design techniques, systems development methodologies, and project management methodologies and templates.
Considerable experience with business management programs (e.g. Integrated Business Management System [IBMS]) that includes, documentation, mockups, business rules, and developing reports.
Experience with preparation of test cases for user acceptance testing.
Project management and organizational skills to prioritize multiple projects, work in cross-functional teams, set clear directions and design terms of reference and work processes.
Highly developed interpersonal, presentation and communication skills to interact and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
Ability to provide work direction to work teams associated with projects.
Proficient computer skills to use a variety of software packages (e.g. SQL, MS Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Accountability, innovation, adaptability and the ability to change.
Knowledge of legislation, such as the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Accessibility for Ontarian with Disabilities Act, and other related policies and regulations.

Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us!
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics Practice. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization. In this newly created role, you will need to wear many hats: data miner, analyst, and consultant. Data is critical to how we make content decisions at Wattpad and you will play a key role in helping Wattpad continue to scale!
What you'll be doing:
Work cross-functionally across the company, helping make sense of our data
Develop new and existing KPIs/metrics to help us ensure we know the potential costs and benefits of our decisions
Ensure your insights and recommendations are supported by and arrived at through the use of robust statistical methods
Define and deliver independent research projects that you think would be beneficial to businesses across Wattpad
Extract and analyze complex information from a variety of databases and transform data from large datasets into insights suitable for various audiences
Liaise with business leads across Wattpad teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into an understandable format
As a part of the Analytics Practice you will work with other analysts to understand how analytics can best be applied at Wattpad, including best practices, recommendations on tools and technology
What we're looking for:
2-5+ years working in a data analyst, business analyst, operational analyst, or related analyst role, working in a rigorous data-driven environment or experience grown in a start-up or technology company
Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing
Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; you’ll be working with different teams to help answer questions, so it is crucial you can communicate your work to multiple stakeholders
You take initiative and find creative and scalable ways to solve problems
You can deliver, especially under pressure, multi-tasking and meeting challenging deadlines, all while upholding a high degree of quality
University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred
Bonus Points:
Previous experience with experimental design, Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods)
What we offer:
Competitive salary
Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals
Health benefits, fully covered on us!
RRSP Contributions
Generous vacation and Parental Leave Top-up
$200/month Transit and Home Office Allowance, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hybrid office and remote work options
Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family
A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit
And a whole lot more!
**Update: Wattpad is still actively hiring for this role! We are a robust and growing business; our search for new talent continues.**
Due to the current state with COVID-19, Wattpad will conduct all interviews in a distributed manner using applicable third party software where needed and using visual interface tools such as Google Hangouts and Zoom. Our intention is to respect everybody's need for safety and adherence to social distancing.
We also want to respect our team's personal needs and capacity for professional commitments during this time; consequently our pace for the interviewing process might be impacted.
About Wattpad
Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world.
What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse.
What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks.
How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time.
Culture and Diversity
Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period.
Wattpad welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. We are committed to fostering a global team that reflects the diversity of the Wattpad community. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability status or any other protected status.
If you have any special needs or accessibility requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

The Office of the Public Guardian and Trustee (OPGT) is responsible for protecting the property and personal interests of over 10,000 incapable adults who have no one else to help them, investigating allegations of abuse of mentally incapable adults, protecting the public's interest in charities, administering intestate estates, searching for heirs, investing perpetual care funds for Cemeteries, and dealing with dissolved corporations. The Accountant of the Superior Court is responsible for managing funds, mortgages and securities that are paid into court pursuant to judgements and orders of the court under various statutes on behalf of minors and litigants. The OPGT has embarked on a modernization and transformation initiative to help address rapidly increasing workload and caseload pressures, modernize business processes and business-critical tools in order to improve service delivery to vulnerable Ontarians.

Date Posted: 03/02/2021

Description:
About us:

The University of Toronto Scarborough is a place of energy, enthusiasm and passion. Our commitment to inclusive excellence attracts the brightest learners, scholars and employees from around the globe. Our success has been made possible by the opportunity given to us by our Indigenous hosts to operate on their territory, and we cherish our continuing partnerships with these communities. The University of Toronto Scarborough is an exciting campus with unlimitedpotential. Join us on our journey.

UTSC Management is a world leader in providing business education that is heavily influenced by experiential learning and internationalization. The goal of UTSC Management is to create opportunities for our students to learn and experience leadership by applying the latest management theory to real-world problems both inside and outside the classroom.

Your opportunity:

Reporting to the Managing Director, Department of Management, the Business and Data Analyst will support the Department of Management by proactively gathering and synthesizing information from various internal and external sources to support decision making by senior management. The position is responsible for providing accurate and timely information for a multitude of purposes relating to the department of Management, in both graduate and undergraduate units. Data is to be collected in key areas of the department, which includes but is not limited torecruitment, application and admission, student services (including co-op) and student enrolment (courses and programs).

Your responsibilities will include:
Analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and developing technical solutions for systems improvements
Researching and identifying new software solutions to improve workflow and support Management team members in their duties
Advising on data structure designs to ensure data integrity and valid report generation
Providing detailed information on data analysis findings to stakeholders
Designing and optimizing databases to meet the ongoing and changing needs of the department
Planning and collaborating on components of projects specifically in the area of software implementation
Maintaining information on digital platforms to ensure data integrity
Tracking progress of student work-integrated experience applications, interviews andrecruitment
Essential Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree relevant to research methodologies and statistics or a related field or acceptable combination of equivalent experience
Minimum four years of relevant experience with advanced data management and analysis (e.g. data visualization, database set-up and familiarity, advanced data report generation etc.)
Experience using business intelligence software and data visualization tools to create dashboards in order to facilitate data-driven decisions
Data analysis skills, including designing and generating reports; analyzing data and identifying meaningful trends and results; developing projections to support strategic planning; presenting information in a user friendly way and supporting continuous improvement activities
Ability to carry out a variety of descriptive and inferential statistical analysis including regression analysis and other techniques
Strong oral and written communication skills to explain complex statistical analysis to decision makers, probe for information to establish needs and respond to requests, and communicate data query requirements to other analysts or non-technical users
Ability to work independently or as part of a team, demonstrates initiative, creativity, curiosity, and attention to detail balanced by ability to see the big picture
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to build effective partnerships with colleagues and students
Highly motivated, self-starter with creative thinking skills
Must be able to stay organized, multi-task and meet deadlines; and exercise accuracy.
Applicants are also expected to show evidence of a commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion, and the promotion of a respectful and collegial learning and working environment
Assets (Nonessential):
Ability to independently formulate and test hypotheses concerning data in the context of the enrolment matters
Strong working knowledge of survey development, administration and analysis
Advanced knowledge of the structure and meaning of student data housed in various systems
Understanding of complex relational databases and strong working knowledge of software reporting tools
Experience working with complex data within a higher education environment
To be successful in this role you will be:
Adaptable
Communicator
Diligent
Organized
Problem solver
Resourceful

Retail Business Analyst
Overview
IQVIA™ (www.IQVIA™.com) is the world’s leading company providing information, technology, and services for virtually every type of stakeholder in healthcare. Every day, IQVIA™ innovates on a large scale. Since 1954 we’ve been helping healthcare organizations harness the power of commercial and scientific insights We develop and operate systems and applications using big data technologies on our private-public hybrid cloud. IQVIA™ stores and computes more than 20 petabytes of complex healthcare data on diseases, treatments, costs and outcomes, annually, helping our clients run their operations more efficiently. IQVIA processes over 50 billion healthcare transactions annually and employs over 50,000 professionals in more than 100 countries to drive results for over 5,000 healthcare clients globally. IQVIA™ is a publicly listed company (NYSE – Q) with estimated revenue exceeding $10B and a market cap of over $28B.
Individuals joining us should expect a rewarding and progressive career in life sciences consulting. You’ll have the opportunity to address challenging client issues, across multiple geographies with a hands-on influence in delivering solutions. We operate in a truly multi-cultural, collegial and collaborative work environment that is rich in development and growth.
Role & Responsibilities
As a Retail Pharmaceutical Analyst, you will be responsible for providing data analytics, supporting the maintenance and development of a suite of syndicated offerings for retail pharmacies. This includes leading investigations to address internal and external client queries, requiring research and coordination with the commercial team, formulating client responses.
Support in the investigating of both internal and external client queries. Requires research and respond and work with a commercial team to share knowledge and support workload across various offerings and databases.
Retail Analyst:
Provides analysis and project management support in the delivery of syndicated offerings & ad hoc studies.
Manages requirements gathering, providing recommendations to develop research plans, identifying appropriate data sources and delivery options to meet client needs.
Performs analysis in support of offerings production and delivery cycles.
Performs quantitative research, and provides summaries of study results to commercial and offerings lead.
Participates in selecting or developing methodology for use in new offerings and analytics.
May consult with clients in support of project delivery or requirements gathering.
Performs routine data analysis to develop customer specific insights and solutions to customer business challenges.
Validates / QA’s reporting methodologies supporting the business needs
Proactively develops knowledge of the pharmaceutical marketplace with emphasis on wholesale and retail pharmacy
About You
The skills and behaviors required for this position include: Experience within the healthcare industry. Strong understanding of business intelligence tools is preferred, with emphasis on utilization and application. Demonstrated problem solving, analytical and customer service skills.
Bachelor’s Degree
Four (4) years relevant analytics &/or pharmaceutical industry experience
Strong analytical skills
Strong communication skills
Experience analyzing large amounts of data.
Advantaged Knowledge of MS-Excel, MS-Access
Knowledge of IQVIA datasets/databases an asset
Knowledge SQL and relational database concepts
Knowledge of the Canadian Healthcare/Pharmaceutical industry
Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and multi-task
At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.

Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.
Job Description:
This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams.
What will you do?
Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect.
Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge.
Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures.

SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead.

Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
Developing data quality Dashboards and Scorecards within Tableau to monitor Risk Data Integrity and KPIs/KRIs for the Risk Data Management Office.
Partnering with Risk Management and Technology stakeholders to document, test and implement data quality fixes for Risk Data.
Assisting in the execution of controls related to the integrity of risk data. Conduct ongoing data quality reviews and ensure that new initiatives meet the standards required to support the business unit’s objectives and overall controls.
Managing the processes and procedures around overall Risk Data Management for the RDMO including the data controls, issue, intake and service management and overall governance documentation.
Oversee the monthly loading and reconciliation of Operational Losses for the Enterprise and ensuring the integrity of the data captured within the Operational Risk System.
How You’ll Succeed
Data driven - Give meaning to large sets of data and aggregate information from multiple sources to summarize it into a meaningful ensemble.
Continuous improvement mindset: Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
Communication and Relationship Management - You get things done, but it is always done in collaboration with your peers and stakeholders. You will be a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the organization by understanding their needs, and presenting a credible and compelling plan that meets those needs. You will leverage your ability to adapt your communications style to lead working level project discussions as well as preparing management level presentations and briefings.
Critical Thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities. You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions. You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in building scorecards and dashboards with tools like Tableau. You have good coding skills, and have used SQL to extract and transform data for the purpose of producing reports for internal and external use. It's an asset if you have experience with visualization tools like Tableau and Cognos. If you have a STEM undergraduate degree, then it will be considered an asset as well.
You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

LOFT Community Services is a unique and dynamic charitable organization that supports

people living with complicated issues such as mental and physical health challenges,
substance abuse, poverty and homelessness. Serving over 5300 people and providing
1654 units of supportive housing last year, LOFT is one of Ontario’s largest mental health

service providers of its kind. In 2018 LOFT was a Nonprofit Employer of Choice™ Award
(NEOC) recipient.
To help fulfill its mission, LOFT is hiring a Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst
JOB SUMMARY:
The Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting Analyst will work with the other members of the

Performance and Quality Improvement team to meet the performance measurement and
other reporting needs of LOFT staff, program directors, and senior management. This
individual will manage end-to-end activities within the business intelligence function to

support operational and strategic reporting, quality improvement and self-serve reporting
initiatives.
*Note: A satisfactory vulnerable sector check (VSC) is a requirement of employment.*
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Design and develop end-to-end reporting solutions through the business intelligence
platform to meet the organization’s reporting needs and support the strategic plan;
 
Lead the technical design and development by translating business requirements into
functional and technical requirements for the Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence
solutions.
 Manage all stages of the Business Intelligence data architecture modelling process

including definition, development and documentation of the metadata layers, logical
model, physical model, semantic model, user administration, environment optimization
etc.
 
Deliver scalable data and reporting solutions by presenting raw data into actionable
insights, using creative and interactive visualizations methods, with a focus on both
push and self-serve analytics.
 
In conjunction with the operational analysts, develop, document and conduct test
cases and test plans for different test scenarios such as Data quality, Security and
Access Control, Database integrity, Functional testing, Usability testing, Business Cycle

testing, Load and Stress testing. Coordinate testing and report progress on Unit,
System, QA and User Acceptance testing. Coordinate activities with Database
Developer as needed.
 Develop documentation representing the user experience including use cases, user

stories, wireframes, user interface prototypes / mock-ups and related artefacts in
coordination with business users and other stakeholders.
 Work in conjunction with the Database Developer to perform business and technical

analysis and evaluation concerning the Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence,
Analytics and Performance Measurement requirements.
 Develop and maintain all necessary end-user business documents.
 
Work with director to develop and maintain Business Intelligence roadmap and release
management process.
 Support and serve as the backup to the data warehouse developer in BI system
administration duties.
 
Leverage train-the-trainer model to streamline the implementation process and
increase user adoption.
 Participate in the design, development, and analysis of data architecture and

warehousing approaches.
 Participate in all relevant integration projects (data sources, systems, etc.).

QUALIFICATIONS:
 Undergraduate degree in related field (computer science, engineering, mathematics, or

equivalent) required.
 A minimum of 5 years relevant work experience with the development and
administration of business intelligence platform(s). Specific experience with

Microstrategy and its mobile platform is an asset.
 Experience in the design, development and deployment of business intelligence
projects from end to end; knowledge of best practices in advance data visualization

tools and techniques (reports, dashboards).
 Knowledge of business intelligence application development concepts and best
practices; knowledge of business intelligence security best practices.
 Advance knowledge of BI semantic layer, aggregation design, presentation layer,

mobile delivery.
 Strong knowledge and understanding of SQL, SSRS, SSIS, OLAP, ETL best practices,
relational/ multidimensional databases, data mining principles.
 
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks in parallel; strong
problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to think critically and strategically.
 Detail-oriented and process-driven with a demonstrated ability to consistently and
effectively produce high quality work.
 
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to explain complex concepts in
a manner which is simple and easy to understand.
 Proven team player with strong interpersonal skills including ability to resolve conflicts,

diplomacy, achieve consensus and able to work comfortably with staff and external
stakeholders, including clinicians.
 Innovative thinker with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems.
 Demonstrated ability to work in matrix structure, but with minimal supervision as a

self-starter.
 Understanding of Ontario healthcare system, organization, policies, and data structures
is an asset.
 Understanding of project management principles and PMBOK guidelines.
 
Understanding of cultural competency and anti-oppression framework.
 Reflective of a multi-barriered group, as serviced by the program, a strong asset

If you are interested in higher education and are looking to contribute to the largest polytechnic College in Ontario as we shape the future of our students and communities, here is your opportunity to join our team.
At Humber, our career paths open up a world of infinite possibilities for you to explore. People are at the heart of the Humber experience. Visit www.humber.ca for more information.

Statistician and Research Analyst
Role Profile
Under the direction of the Associate Director, Institutional Research, the Statistician and Research Analyst will independently perform a wide variety of statistical and analytical functions to support College leadership and evidence-based decision-making, including data-mining, statistical analyses, statistical modelling, analyzing data for short-range and long-range planning and supporting institutional data stewardship processes.
The incumbent will have extensive experience in the use of statistical software and performing of data mining strategies; they will be creative and nimble with the ability to rapidly learn new technologies and data sets.


Qualifications
The successful candidate will possess a Master's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or a similar field in addition to three years relevant experience in the use of statistical software such as R, SAS, and SPSS. Experience in the use of visual analytics platform such as Tableau is an asset. The incumbent will have a minimum of three years of practical work related experience. Additionally, the incumbent will possess strong verbal and written communication skills; a demonstrated ability to work professionally in a team environment; and ensure confidentiality of information.

Job Title: Workday Business Systems / Testing Analyst (1 yr contract)
Job Description:
Reporting to the Director, Technology Platform Design & Management, the Workday Business Systems Analyst/ Testing Lead will act as a technical lead for the Workday platform and will support the implementation of Workday. The incumbent is responsible for ensuring the implementation of Workday drives business alignment, maximizes business performance and optimizes user experience. As a key member of the Workday deployment engagement team, the role is also responsible for developing and deploying a Workday testing strategy and plan. The incumbent will maintain an extremely high level of confidentiality.
Key Job Responsibilities
Business Systems Analyst:
Lead the platform experience and work with business groups to elicit, and review requirements. Analyze and translate the business requirements into functional requirements for multiple platforms, always keeping in mind the optimal user experience.
Monitor the efficiency and compliance of day-to-day business support with processes, requirements, and criteria; focus on developing business-sound technical solutions such that the day-to-day business support is improved
Liaison between IT and business teams to facilitate the development and implementation of process improvement and strategic plans
Coordinate various technical and business groups in the development of a technical solution, the effort and duration that will be required to deliver the solution and ensure the appropriate level of testing is planned for and executed before the solution is implemented in production
Testing & QA:
Lead the development and provide input on the maintenance of an effective QA process within the software group from a technical perspective; provide input on strategies, environment requirements and accurate effort estimates for related QA activities
Create QA and UAT test plan and test cases for highly complex functions and execute and verify those test cases as part of the overall testing cycle; analyze, test, document, and verify system change requests (defects, enhancements, new features etc.)
Recommend solutions to specific technical / business problems and improvements / changes to processes as and when relevant from a QA perspective
Provide technical QA consultation to internal and external development and support teams on solutions to problems discovered during testing
Lead and champion the integrated testing methodology and framework
Coordinate QA and UAT on execution, report, resource, and application requirements
Review and provide guidance to test team members (both internal and external) on QA and UAT test deliverables
Education, Designations & Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required; or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3 years of experience working in a BSA and QA role supporting Human Resources applications
Fully proficient in reviewing, analyzing, writing, and maintaining documentation with an emphasis on problem solving and multi-disciplinary coordination and leveraging business data analytics
Full proficiency in QA process, best practices, methodologies, Software Development Life Cycle, manual testing and defect management tools
Ability to collaborate and deliver results cross-functionally. Highly proficient in engaging/influencing audiences, building relationships, to achieve broader organizational goals.
Experience in Workday implementation is an asset

Job Description:
Address:
234 Simcoe Street

Data Analytics & Reporting
Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy.
Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies.
Performs data profiling and data analyses.
Documents and maintains data flow specifications.
Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights.
Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes.
Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation.
Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain.
Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements.
Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making.
Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model.
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions.
Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security.
Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups.
Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes.
Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle).

Proficient in working with SQL
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. Data Analyst (Python)
Missisauga, ON

Why We Need You – The Mission

ATP is a global information services and software company that exists to make flying safer and more reliable. Our products help reduce operating costs, improve aircraft reliability, and supports technical knowledge sharing and collaboration within the general and business aviation, military/defense, commercial aviation, and OEM industries. We have deployed solutions for multiple Fortune 100 companies, supporting more than 75,000 aircraft maintenance professionals worldwide. As a global company, ATP has more than 7,500 customers in 137 countries, with nearly 50 years of experience in the information services and software industries.
The ChronicX product provides an innovative approach for detecting and managing recurring defects. ChronicX identifies, consolidates, and ranks recurring and potential chronic defects across aircraft fleets, regardless of the aircraft. It is currently in use on 25% of the world’s commercial airline fleet.
The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with customers' IT departments to implement data feeds from their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with our product – which performs knowledge extraction from these data feeds using a variety of Natural Language Processing algorithms backed by general, industry-specific, and customer-specific dictionaries and word lists. The successful candidate will manage and adjust these dictionaries to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives.

What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance Objectives
Performance Objective #1:
Within your first 30 days, work with ChronicX senior analyst to build a solid understanding of the data sets required for onboarding and maintaining customers. Work with the customer’s IT department to implement data integration with their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with ChronicX Learn (or apply existing knowledge of) SQL and Python programming to write and maintain data processing and cleansing scripts used during customer data import into CX Work on deployment procedures of our products to the customers Perform data analysis on large and technical datasets
Performance Objective #2
Within your first 6 months, successfully onboard new customers while maintaining current customers through monitoring and support. Perform ongoing application data monitoring and analysis for proactive customer support Identify and resolve incidents through ticketing system and provide business support Work with and attend status meetings with ChronicX customers to support users and identify possible improvements to their instances

Performance Objective #3
Within your first 12 months, innovate and improve current business processes and configurations. Provide suggestions for product improvement to the ChronicX development team, supporting continuous improvement and optimization of the onboarding toolset used by analysts and the ChronicX algorithms. Manage and adjust configurations for ChronicX to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives Data analysis and development to support the setup, deployment, evaluation, and customization, and go-live of SaaS web application Consult and influence design of business processes. Identify process improvements. i.e. customer training, customer experience and customer support.
Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies That Matter

Technical Skills: You have experience working in Python
 You have experience with s/FTP, AWS and SaaS web applications You have experience with SQL relational databases and capable of writing SQL statements and procedures You have good understanding of data gathering, processing and validation You have experience with data modeling and good understanding of big data engineering You have experience with Jira and Confluence You have knowledge of Java and an understanding for debugging You have experience or interest in Natural Language processing (Regular Expressions), text data processing and machine learning technologies.
Interpersonal Skills:
Success in this role requires excellent analytical abilities with a keen eye for details to easily identify errors. You should have a technical competency to identify, investigate and resolve complex, technical issues. You must thrive in working in a fast paced environment and have a proven history of delivering top tier customer service. A successful candidate is a team player who has a strong sense of ownership and accountability for their work.

Project Management & Organizational Planning:
The best candidate will have excellent project and time management skills. You do exceptionally well at multitasking and juggling several tasks at once. You will be responsible for maintaining and prioritizing your own queue, so you must excel at planning, executing and closing all projects on or before deadlines.

How we work – The Core Values that Define Our Culture

We are at our best when we:
are selfless team players. We work together to achieve our goals and we put the team ahead of ourselves.are driven to succeed exceed. We take pride in our work and in exceeding expectations.find a better way. By seeking to understand the challenge, we work to improve the process and solution.are simplifiers (not complicators). We focus on solutions and not obstacles. We take action and ownership. We gather the right people in the room and drive to a solution.

Cision Ltd is a leading global provider of innovative earned media software and services to public relations and marketing communications professionals. Cision’s Communications Cloud platform allows users to identify key influencers, craft and distribute strategic content, and measure meaningful impact of PR and Communications Teams’ campaigns. Cision has over 4,500 employees with offices in 23 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC.

Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join that group! We invest in our people through training and professional development and we empower them to grow their careers - because the most important measure of our success is yours.
Cision is looking for a talented PBI Developer with a passion for working with data. Our Business Intelligence Analyst will be involved in transforming, aligning and analyzing company data to providing meaningful insights throughout the organization. Analysis performed by this team directly influences strategic decision making across the Global company.
Responsibilities
Data modelling capabilities including designing effective BI data models
Perform UX design activities and Power BI navigation features (e.g. bookmarks, drill-throughs) to guide end-users through a data-driven story
Developing calculations in DAX which are accurate and performant on large datasets
Perform required transformations in Power BI query editor
Proactively monitor and evaluate the impact of monthly Power BI releases
Publishing reports via the Power BI service, managing them through distribution of apps and monitoring usage/data refreshes/security access
Understand business requirements and be able to relate these to the supporting system requirements producing simple technical specifications for the work to be done
Work with all areas of the business to understand data structures, determine data definitions and evaluate the accuracy of data elements
Working with our clients to manage User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processes and fixing any defects identified
Shaping an approach for governance and deployment of Power BI, including advising on licensing, distribution/sharing, training and support
Create Azure Analysis Services models and Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or graduate degree and 5+ years of related work experience
3+ years’ experience as a Power BI developer
Aptitude writing T-SQL statements and an understanding of logical and physical data modeling
Significant experience with Data Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics concepts including: Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Data Cubes, Data Quality and Data Profiling
Data Governance, Master Data Management and Metadata Management
Deep understanding of security as it pertains to data access, scope, and distribution of reports and dashboards
Experience creating a range of documentation that will include technical documents, workflows, diagrams, business requirements documents and other requested documentation
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure Business Intelligence tools is preferred
Experience using R, Python and Machine Learning is a plus

Job Summary:
As a Debt Strategy Analyst / Data Scientist at Equifax, you will be responsible for work on the front-line in a consultative role, engaging prospective clients and supporting our value proposition with existing clients. As a key member of the Analytics team, the Debt Strategy Analyst / Data Scientist will work with clients to build and optimize their collection processes, and work with client data, Equifax data, and external data assets to deliver meaningful insights to clients. Using profound domain knowledge and insights from data you will facilitate the development & implementation of new strategies, and act as the in-country front-line for the international Debt Services business. Debt Services focuses on helping Equifax’s customers optimize the life-cycle of collections from early stage collections, to recoveries management, to debt sale. We manage millions of accounts and hundreds of millions of dollars on behalf of our clients. Debt Services accomplishes this through a value proposition comprising world-class analytics, best in-class data, integrated on state-of-the-art software platforms. Debt Services is one of Equifax’s key strategic initiatives. There is significant opportunity for growth and development with considerable senior exposure and responsibility being given to the role. As a Debt Strategy Analyst / Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the success of the Canadian Debt Services division.
Who is Equifax?
At Equifax, we believe knowledge drives progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institutions and government agencies make critical decisions with greater confidence.
We work to help create seamless and positive experiences during life’s pivotal moments: applying for jobs or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goals we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employees makes a difference and we are looking for talented team players to join us as we help people live their financial best.
The Perks of being an Equifax Employee?
We offer excellent compensation packages with market competitive pay, comprehensive healthcare packages, 401k matching, schedule flexibility, work from home opportunities, paid time off, and organizational growth potential.
Grow at your own pace through online courses at Learning @ Equifax.
What You’ll Do
Design , develop & implement new strategies, to help the new & existing clients optimize their collection initiatives in the debt recovery space. Evaluate client portfolio performance and provide insightful market intelligence reports for clients
Extract & interpret data, analyze results using data mining & statistical techniques and provide reports to help debt collection teams improve their performance . A strong understanding of large databases including the ability to use data extraction tools such as Python,R, SQL is required
Apply statistical analysis & concepts to identify portfolio opportunities and communicate insights .The Debt Strategy Analyst / Data Scientist should be able to create the analytical solution and interpret results to provide “the story” of the numbers and not simply present back results
Design, build, maintain and publish dashboards and reports in Tableau for clients. Effectively communicate results to key stakeholders using strong data visualizations, superior presentation skills and business language to emphasize the so what of the analysis
Work on both transformational & BAU projects delivering new value while supporting existing processes
Build and maintain credible relationships internally and with clients/prospects. Deliver SME Advisory services in a professional and insightful manner when required
Qualifications
5 years’ analytics & at least 2 years consulting experience in high performing collections or recoveries environment along with a Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Science or Business.
Proficient in database environments and data set manipulation particularly in SQL and Excel. Expertise required in use of Python, R or SAS for data analytics & Tableau for data reporting & dashboard development
Proficient in use of presentation software (e.g. PowerPoint, Google Slides) for development of portfolio performance reviews for existing clients and pitch decks/client facing proposals for prospective clients
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Broad range of experience delivering high quality analytical output within tight deadlines and the ability to effectively engage clients directly in a consultative approach
Extra Points for any of the Following
Telecom experience is an asset
Post-graduate degree preferred
Success Attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountability
Curiosity
Collaboration
Think and act differently
Trust
Ownership
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
If this sounds like somewhere you want to work, don’t delay, apply today - we’re looking for you!

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.
Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers.
The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.
Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters.
Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area.
Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.
Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment.
Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality).
A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience.
MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word).
Strong written, oral, and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes.
Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team.
Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist.
This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel.
Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.

Employment Opportunity
Business Systems Analyst (1 Year Contract)

TO Live

Toronto, Canada


TO Live has an opportunity in the Information Technology Department for an enthusiastic, organized, and resourceful team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and studying new and existing technology systems and solutions. This position will also involve working with other departments to determine their future and current software, data, reporting and hardware requirements.
A key responsibility for this position will be to provide recommendations to management regarding technology systems as they are analyzed and implemented, and how they relate to overall Information Technology lifecycle expenditures. The Business Systems Analyst will also be required to create detailed documentation, workflows, and flowcharts for both new and existing technology systems.


ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze software solutions regarding current business requirements:
Foundation Customer Relationship Management
Foundation Financials
Financial Forecasting and Budgeting
Microsoft Office Azure and Intune
Microsoft SharePoint
Cloud Storage
Archives Digitization
Project coordination for implementing new systems, existing system changes and/or enhancements.
Analyze and evaluate current systems to identify and suggest solutions for process improvements.
Maintain existing applications and databases with appropriate patches and security updates.
Assist with implementation of the infrastructure lifecycle.
Conduct and implement training sessions related to application changes, new software implementations, and business requirements.
Proactively collect information that may turn into future projects.
Perform introduction and information sessions for users regarding software and equipment use, policies and procedures.
Research and address user needs by creating and/or enhancing processes and reports where required that improve user experiences and optimize expenses.
Attend educational events and stay up to date with the latest technology and best practices.
Backup support as required for days off and/or vacation coverage.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Director of Information Technology.


JOB SPECIFICATIONS

Experience working with analyzing and implementing complex and cross-department information technology initiatives.
Minimum 7 years of experience in a similar position within Information Technology.
Fluent understanding of Information Technology terminology.
Fluent understanding of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V and VMware.
Fluent understanding of Microsoft Office 365.
Strong understanding of ticketing, fundraising, event, CRM and accounting processes.
Diligent in training and development of training materials.
Solid analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work under strict deadlines.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.


WORKING CONDITIONS

Flexibility in hours and schedules and includes work on nights and weekends as required.
Lack of natural light in workplace.
Travel between all three TO Live venues as required.


THE ORGANIZATION:
TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall (formerly the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts), the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre (formerly the Toronto Centre for the Arts). In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity.
HOW TO APPLY:

No phone calls please. TO Live thanks all applicants in advance. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
