Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us!
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics Practice. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization. In this newly created role, you will need to wear many hats: data miner, analyst, and consultant. Data is critical to how we make content decisions at Wattpad and you will play a key role in helping Wattpad continue to scale!
What you'll be doing:
Work cross-functionally across the company, helping make sense of our data
Develop new and existing KPIs/metrics to help us ensure we know the potential costs and benefits of our decisions
Ensure your insights and recommendations are supported by and arrived at through the use of robust statistical methods
Define and deliver independent research projects that you think would be beneficial to businesses across Wattpad
Extract and analyze complex information from a variety of databases and transform data from large datasets into insights suitable for various audiences
Liaise with business leads across Wattpad teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into an understandable format
As a part of the Analytics Practice you will work with other analysts to understand how analytics can best be applied at Wattpad, including best practices, recommendations on tools and technology
What we're looking for:
2-5+ years working in a data analyst, business analyst, operational analyst, or related analyst role, working in a rigorous data-driven environment or experience grown in a start-up or technology company
Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing
Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; you’ll be working with different teams to help answer questions, so it is crucial you can communicate your work to multiple stakeholders
You take initiative and find creative and scalable ways to solve problems
You can deliver, especially under pressure, multi-tasking and meeting challenging deadlines, all while upholding a high degree of quality
University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred
Bonus Points:
Previous experience with experimental design, Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods)
What we offer:
Competitive salary
Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals
Health benefits, fully covered on us!
RRSP Contributions
Generous vacation and Parental Leave Top-up
$200/month Transit and Home Office Allowance, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hybrid office and remote work options
Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family
A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit
And a whole lot more!
**Update: Wattpad is still actively hiring for this role! We are a robust and growing business; our search for new talent continues.**
Due to the current state with COVID-19, Wattpad will conduct all interviews in a distributed manner using applicable third party software where needed and using visual interface tools such as Google Hangouts and Zoom. Our intention is to respect everybody's need for safety and adherence to social distancing.
We also want to respect our team's personal needs and capacity for professional commitments during this time; consequently our pace for the interviewing process might be impacted.
About Wattpad
Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world.
What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse.
What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks.
How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time.
Culture and Diversity
Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period.
Wattpad welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. We are committed to fostering a global team that reflects the diversity of the Wattpad community. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability status or any other protected status.
If you have any special needs or accessibility requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

About Oanda

OANDA Corporation is an innovator in computer engineering and financial modeling that provides Internet-based forex trading and currency information services to everyone, from individuals to large corporations; portfolio managers to financial institutions. We are a market maker and a trusted source for currency data with one of the world's largest historical, high frequency, filtered currency databases. We move billions of dollars a day (10 times more money than Paypal!!) in a market with daily capitalization of $4 trillion, dwarfing both the US bond and equity markets!! We continue to experience tremendous growth since our start in 1996, providing unprecedented opportunities for our employees to redefine the forex market with new products we create.

Who we are:

We are an international Product team consisting of product managers and business analysts, who work on a variety of Oanda customer services and business processes. The finance technology area is moving faster than ever before and we are looking for a passionate and experienced colleague to join us.

What you’ll do

Collect project requirements from both internal teams / outsourcing partners and translate these into detailed functional specifications, concrete deliverables, user stories and test plans.
Evaluate and document processes and workflows
Document relationships with 3rd party partners ensuring commercials and services are clearly defined and understood.
Provide insight into and implement optimizations to operational best-practices related to customer facing products and services, client revenue and performance, internal processes, and regulatory compliance
Create and maintain system and user documentation
Perform system and user acceptance testing
Conducts training sessions, software demonstrations and launch activities as new features and processes are introduced
Act as a bridge between our development and business teams.
Build, refine and maintain product backlogs while working closely with product management to define priorities.
Collaborate with cross functional team resources in delivering work in a lean way that builds trust, ownership and accountability.

Who you are

Self-motivated and results-oriented.
Excellent communicator and team player
Capable of making experiment-tested and data-validated conclusions
Demonstrable evidence of analyzing and documenting complex business processes.
Continuous improvement and change management mindset, questioning conventional wisdom and driving change to improve processes and client experience

Desired Skills & Experience

Solid experience working in a similar role
Systems design and trouble-shooting skills.
Working knowledge of Scrum and Agile methodologies and the proven ability to apply them effectively.
Experience of integrating and working with 3rd party products and vendors
Experience documenting and designing new processes and procedures in a dynamic environment.
Degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology, or related experience.


OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Job Title: Sr. Analyst, Brand and Product Insights
Job Description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.
As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are temporarily working from home.
Senior Analyst, Brand/Product Insights
The Senior Analyst, Brand and Product Insights works as part of a team of market research professionals to support tracking and custom market research for various Rogers products. The Senior Analyst supports internal business leaders through the provision of customer and marketplace knowledge to ensure business strategies are grounded in consumer foresight. The Brand/Product Insights team is part of the Consumer Insights ‘Centre of Excellence’ within the organization; with team members acting as individual leads that support Rogers’s key brands and business units.
What you will be doing:
Consumer & Business Insights:
Drive consumer insights through the integration of various customer data sources into custom research projects, including syndicated research, data & product analytics, customer experience, social media – to provide a comprehensive understanding of customer needs.
Engage in compelling business story-telling and provide meaningful and actionable recommendations to senior leadership team based on insights.
Drawing connections between research/data results to business priorities and initiatives
Custom Research Design:
Quantitative and qualitative research methods that will include various type of research including concept testing and new product development research, pricing/rate card research, understanding triggers and barriers, churn research (understanding triggers of churn and potential solutions) as well as brand and communication research.
Project Management:
Oversee day-to-day management of multiple simultaneous custom research projects.
Manage multiple deadlines and priorities in a fast-paced environment
Develop research plans to match business objectives outlining methodology, timing, deliverables
Serve as in-house expert on custom research, including all methods of qualitative and quantitative research
Assess each research initiative with a critical eye to ensure that it provides incremental learning, actionable insights and a positive customer and company benefit. Know when both to recommend research and when to recommend against research
Understanding of effective research & sampling design and tradeoffs of various tactics, techniques and research supplier expertise
Ability to manage a research budget and ensure that each project is maximizing value for money
Market Research and Data Analysis Expertise:
Market Research Study design: sampling strategy, feasibility assessment, questionnaire/screener/discussion guide development
Comprehensive understanding and application of statistical analysis: significance testing, multivariate analysis, clustering, factor analysis, regression, etc.
Data visualization: report development, dashboard development, data visualization tools and methods
Proficiency in SPSS, R or Python as strong asset
Relationship Management:
Comfort working with and influencing senior level stakeholders and partners
Build and maintain strong partnerships with business leaders to understand and influence business tactics and solutions by bringing the voice of the customer to the conversation
Work well with cross-functional teams across the enterprise
Proven relationship building skills and client interaction experience
Leadership:
High degree of self-awareness and impact on others
Ability to influence others through combination of facts, intuition and common sense
An effective listener who seeks to understand first and offers positive/flexible solutions to problems
Is a team player and knows the importance of building a winning team and recognizing individual contributions
Has a vision for where they want to go and can motivate and empower colleagues to achieve a goal
What you have:
Undergraduate degree required; Masters level preferred
Degree in business, consumer behavior, market research or quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, etc.)
3+ years of experience in marketing research or data analytics
Experience both on client and supplier side of market research preferred
Solid business acumen
Strong interpersonal skills for working with internal and external stakeholders
Analytical skills and sound decision-making skills
Ability to summarize issues and quickly solve problems
Ability to adapt quickly in a highly competitive environment
Dynamic, autonomous and customer-focused
Excellent presentation and communication skills
High proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel), Outlook
Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Marketing & Marketing Research / Analysis
Requisition ID: 214444

HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?
At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.
YOUR ROLE
Position Purpose: The CPFR Analyst position will be responsible for partnering with Sales, Demand Planning, Logistics and Walmart Replenishment, utilizing data analysis and collaborative relationships to provide forecast insights and replenishment solutions to deliver both customer and Henkel KPIs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Walmart replenishment, Sales & Demand Planning on store level and GRS (top line) forecasts.
Monitor daily/weekly in-stock. Determine root cause for in-stock issue and provide store level recommendations to correct.
Proactively identify sales trends and provide forecast adjustments to maintain availability & WOS targets
Monitor Walmart ordering patterns (review orders daily), in-stock/out of stock, fill rate, on-time delivery, returns, mis-ship & lead time review.
Align any inventory recommendations with demand/supply chain team on any additional demand of product resulting from promotional inventory
YOUR SKILLS
College degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Logistics or related discipline, or equivalent education and experience
Exceptional analytical and decision-making skills
5+ years’ experience in a consumer product environment
Retail Link and SAP experience preferred

Full-time, Calgary, AB or Toronto, ON

Be Boring. Make Money.™ is our investment approach, but we are anything but dull. We are a diverse team of professionals—all with a shared goal: to be the best.

We celebrate our unique and independent culture. We take pride in doing things a little differently than other investment firms. Our pursuit for excellence means that a career with Mawer is demanding; however, interesting challenges are plentiful, and innovative ideas, diverse opinions, and teamwork are expected and rewarded regardless of title and tenure.

The Opportunity
The Firm is seeking an Analyst, Institutional Portfolio Management to support senior members of the Institutional Client Management team and respond to requests for proposal (RFPs) from institutional prospects located in both Canada and the U.S.

This position reports to the Director of Institutional Client Management.

Primary Responsibilities
Support Institutional Portfolio Managers with client and consultant requests for informationPrepare presentations, related materials, and competitive intelligence research for finalists and other prospective meetingsLead and execute complex client deliverables, including performance reports, due diligence requests, and other portfolio analysisRespond to RFIs and RFPs from consultants and other institutional prospective clients located in Canada and the U.S.Liaise with internal investment professionals to ensure a detailed understanding of the firm’s investment processes and products to maintain accurate and relevant external responsesGenerate and design competitive intelligence reports and make appropriate recommendations to drive business decisionsDevelop and maintain reports in Salesforce that report on Business Development progressUpdate Salesforce and maintain content related to new opportunities and sales activityUpdate and manage RFP content in our RFP database (RFPIO)Support the development and maintenance of marketing collateral for both Canadian and U.S prospectsMaintain marketing and consultant databases, such as eVestmentCommunicate externally with select business partners, clients, and consultantsSupport custom projects for both Canadian and U.S clientsPotentially participate in the production of performance attribution commentary and analysis for investment strategies sent to clients and prospectsPotentially participate in client meetings with Institutional Portfolio ManagersDrive continuous improvement across team processes and written content

Education, Skills & Qualifications
University degreeCompletion of the Canadian Securities Course or other industry-related coursesMinimum 3 years of investment industry experience
Exceptional communication skills, specifically writing
Strong data analysis capabilitiesDetail-oriented
Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and PowerPointStrong time management and project management skills to meet deadlinesAbility to present candid feedback and suggestions to improve processesAbility to perform well under pressureWorks well in a team environmentKnowledge of the institutional investment industry would be an asset

Why Mawer?
Directly contribute to the firm’s growth as a global investment manager.
Learn and work alongside high-performing individuals, within a team that has consistently delivered exceptional long-term investment results and the highest levels of client satisfaction (our client retention is 99%).
Be a part of a meritocracy in which the quality of ideas supersedes hierarchy. At Mawer, talented individuals can progress quickly, regardless of tenure or experience.We offer the potential for ownership over time based on the firm’s selection criteria.We have a unique culture, one that emphasizes integrity, clients’ interests, excellence, teamwork, and long-term thinking.

About Mawer
Established in 1974, Mawer Investment Management Ltd. is an independent firm that provides world-class, global investment management services across all major asset classes to a broad range of institutional and individual clients. We are proud of our reputation as one of Canada’s most respected investment management firms and strive to earn such respect by continually delivering long-term investment excellence, developing strong client partnerships, and living our core values. Mawer currently manages approximately $78 billion in assets and employs over 200 people in Calgary, Toronto, the U.S., and Singapore.

Job Title: Dropship Merchandise Strategy and Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Description
PURPOSE OF JOB
The Dropship Merchandise Strategy and Operations Analyst supports the overall process involved in onboarding our online vendors. This position is responsible for effectively creating and maintaining all Dropship skus and supporting the onboarding of online vendors and skus from a merchandising lens. This involves communications with vendors for sku/cost information and content, plus coordination with the Customer Service Team responding to merchandising database and product issues. This individual will partner with the core Merchandising teams to leverage intelligence and help build the merchandising portfolio.
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent for our Bingo team in Toronto. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We’re currently looking for a passionate Senior Data Analyst who loves data and has a great mind for surfacing insightful visualizations of their research. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the top creative and analytical talent in a highly profitable mobile game development studio with an array of perks and respect for employee quality of life and personal time.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Formulates and leads guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interprets and analyzes data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinates research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiments against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges.
Work with business leaders to identify and define analytical requirements for teams and projects.
Using multiple data sources, create reporting and performance monitoring tools and dashboards for end users.
Understand and effectively communicate trends and analysis on user behavior, player segmentation, virality, and marketing campaigns.
Continuously develop thorough analysis and conclusive insights that drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Create regular presentations for GM and other team leads to discuss game performance and suggest improvements.
QUALIFICATIONS
Experience performing the above in a successful tech or game company.
Bachelor degree in a business or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics) – Master’s preferred.
5+ years of experience analyzing very large, multi-dimensional data sets using SQL, excel, statistical software, etc.
Strong quantitative skills, good working knowledge of advanced statistics and predictive modeling.
Ability to communicate effectively and combine both technical and business perspectives.
Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making and reach out to a broader audience.
Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations.
NICE TO HAVE
Experience in top-tier consulting, venture capital, investment bank or social gaming.
OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, & INCLUSION
We believe in creating games that unite people across the world and that showcase our commitment to providing an environment that is both inclusive and diverse for our players and employees. We strive to create a workforce that is reflective of our global player community as we know that we are stronger and better when we play together. To help promote an inclusive culture, we celebrate the visible and invisible diversity of our Jam Citizens through initiatives including Employee Resource Groups, cultural events, trainings, speaker series, and more.

ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

Job Title: Manager, Business Intelligence & Performance Tracking - North Zone
Job Description:
Manager, Business Intelligence & Performance Tracking - North Zone
Position Overview
This role will lead the design & delivery of analytic solutions that support the long-term strategy and annual plan of The Coca-Cola Company and Coca-Cola Bottlers. All consumer-relevant routes to market are in-scope including, but not limited to, Direct Store Delivery (DSD) Retail, Food Service, and Warehouse.
The Business Intelligence (BI) Manager will identify key strategic growth risk & opportunities at the regional and local level that are aligned with the Cola-Cola North America Operating Unit (NAOU) strategy. In addition, the BI Manager will create performance management capability by leveraging a variety of consumer/shopper/guest, market, and company data sources including shopper panel (e.g. Numerator, Simmons, MEMRI), dining guest panel (e.g. NPD-CREST), syndicated scanner (e.g. Nielsen, IR), financial, and supply chain. The ideal candidate will have not only a strong foundation in analytic capability but also complementary influential communication skills. Prior experience successfully working in a networked organization is strongly preferred.
What You’ll Do for Us
Partner with scaled data services to design & delivery scorecards that manage & optimize strategic initiatives.
Identify insights from varied sources & analyses that enables strategy-to-execution across the entire value chain.
Perform ad hoc analysis that isolate root causes and provide recommended solutions.
Qualifications & Requirements
Bachelor’s degree; Master's degree, MBA, a plus
2-5 years’ experience in relevant industry (e.g. food, beverage, other CPG)
Demonstrated experience and skills in data analysis & problem solving
Business knowledge and experience relative to P&L impact beyond data collection and analysis
Proven ability to take initiative and be innovative.
Able to draw insights-to-action from data and translate to prioritized opportunities
Adaptable and willing to work flexible hours to meet deadlines
Ability to prioritize the workload and balance competing demands
Experience with collaborating and influencing cross-functional teams
Comfortable working with large data sets and able to create simple queries
Advanced Excel, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI skills are a plus.
Demonstrated experience and skills in synthesizing data and analyses across multiple sources to glean insights (e.g., Numerator, Simmons, MEMRI, NPD-CREST, CBL, Bev360, iDine, iShop, Nielsen, IRI, MATRIX).
Skills
Information-to-Insights: Manage & synthesize diverse internal and external data sources that identify key performance trends. Perform detailed data analysis (i.e. determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples).
Data Analysis & Interpretation: Leverage synthesized insights to define key takeaways and recommended action plans to drive profitable growth for The Coca-Cola Company, Coca-Cola Bottlers and Coca-Cola Customers within the NAOU.
Stewardship & Performance Tracking: Develop & implement reports, scorecards & communication routines against key categories, brands, customers, and bottler-specific initiatives. Assist with creation of effective Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and analytical dashboards / analytical tools for business users in Tableau/Microsoft BI/MicroStrategy.
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

About HOOPP

Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.

HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation.
From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.

Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.

Welcome to ivari
Let us introduce ourselves. With about 300 employees across Canada, we’re a company that’s making a difference in the world of life insurance. How? By finding and hiring people who are equally passionate about life and protecting it, then giving them the best, most supportive workplace possible. We must be doing something right because we’re growing quickly and need more great people to grow along with us. Is that you?
Here’s the job opportunity…
As a Business Intelligence Analyst at ivari, you will utilize technical and analytical skills to support the continual development of an enterprise-wide BI function and participate in the requirement analysis, design and building out of the architecture, solutions, tools, and processes to report on business performance. In this role you will:
Conduct the required analysis and utilize relevant tools and techniques to design and develop effective and efficient multidimensional data solutions, including ETL processes, data marts/warehouses tables and OLAP cubes, and any other components necessary to support the user’s business intelligence requirements.
Ensure that the day to day operation of the Business Intelligence systems including data marts, cubes, and reports is functioning effectively by performing analysis, troubleshooting, and resolving any system issues.
Participate in all aspects of a systems development life cycle within the development team (Requirements Analysis, Design, Development, Test, QA, Data Lineage, Documentation, Implementation and Support).
Develop predictive analytics to support decision making based on sound statistical interpretation of internal and external data sources.
Maintain knowledge and expertise of current industry trends, standards, and best practices in the areas of Business Intelligence and Machine Learning.
What we are looking for…
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Mathematics or other Engineering related disciplines. University degree preferred.
Minimum 2 years of experience as a BI Analyst or Data Analyst.
Experience with developing, maintaining, and optimizing very large multi-dimensional data systems.
Possess hands-on experience in data modeling, building and maintaining relational DBMS with respect to Data Marts (star and snowflake schemas), OLAP Cubes, and ETL processes.
Experience with MS SQL Server 2016 or later, including SQL, SSIS, SSAS, MDX, and SSRS.
Exposure to Business Intelligence and Visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) and experience building reports and dashboards.
Sound knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle (Agile and Waterfall).
Experience working in a medium to large organization, dealing with large sets of data from disparate source systems.
Ability to work with a diverse group within a team environment.
The following while not a requirement would be considered an asset:
Insurance or financial services industry experience is an asset.
Experience with AWS Glue, PySpark and Python for ETL processes
Experience with any Big Data technologies such as Microsoft Azure HDInsight, Apache Hadoop, Spark, Azure Data Lake, AWS Data Lake, etc. will be beneficial.
Any experience with Data Science and Analytics: Data Mining, Machine Learning, Statistical Learning, or Pattern Recognition would be beneficial.
Experience with Python to develop models for predictive analytics.
Experience with Metadata management, Master Data Management, Data quality management
MCSE: Business Intelligence
Who you are…
You are a team player who not only understands our core values but lives them every day. You know the importance of…
Bringing clarity and focus to your work;
Taking ownership and doing what you say you will;
Remaining flexible;
Collaborating with others;
We are Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) compliant workplace. You can be confident that our recruitment and hiring processes will be modified to accommodate disabilities, if requested.

Established over 30 years ago, Medcan is a global leader in assessing clients' overall well-being and inspiring them to live well. Medcan has a comprehensive range of diagnostic assessments, which, in combination with innovative programs tailored to specific needs, are designed to successfully reach improved health outcomes.
Over 80 physicians and specialists, alongside a broad roster of complementary health care disciplines, provide health and lifestyle management services on site and by video consult for individuals, families and organizations. Our team of 550 staff see clients physically and virtually from our downtown Toronto location.

Business Analyst, MBA Student Co-op/Placement (4 months placement)
Come join a dynamic team dedicated to designing and delivering innovative products that are shaping the future of health and wellness. The dermatology product team at Medcan is accountable for curating industry-leading products and services that harness the latest technology focused on our customers’ needs.
Medcan is recruiting for a Business Analyst for our growing and innovative Dermatology Business – Refine by Medcan. Analyze Refine’s retail portfolio and performance (in-store and ecommerce) and provide recommendations on how to optimize offerings.
Perform research and analysis to support the development of new product offerings.

MBA candidate or recent MBA grad
Superior quantitative and qualitative analytical skills including designing research projects

This is a 4-month co-op placement position for an MBA student offering full-time hours.

Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's toy, entertainment and digital gaming company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
Job Description:
What will you work on?
As the e-Commerce Merchandise Analyst, you will support Spin Master’s online growth within the US and Canada with a focus on Marketplace, Mid-Tier US accounts and Canada (ie. Amazon, Walmart. and Toys R Us). Your focus is to deliver best in class EComm experiences across sites, partnering with sales, supply chain, COE’s and brands team ensure timely publishing of all items and accountability for complete and accurate product information. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are relentless at testing and learning to drive share of voice, rankings and ultimately sales. Ultimately your goal will be to ensure each of your online retailers provide a great consumer experience, while supporting our sales and brand objectives.

How will you create impact?
Work with sales and brand teams to support seasonal and annual growth plans.
Provide support to develop, standardise, and execute the best in class e-commerce executions in collaboration with colleagues from sales, marketing and COE teams.
Work with both internal and external cross-functional teams to ensure all content is pushed, complete and ready to be received by the retailer in conjunction with inventory being received or launch date.
Work with translations team to ensure content is proactively created and loaded into Salsify
Execute Item set-up in each online retailers’ platform.
Submit and manage assets through each online retailers’ platform.
Ensure accurate representation and communication of product catalog and availability to customer with a focus on daily management.
Audit eCom sites for content integrity, completeness, and optimization
Measure customer KPIs on an ongoing basis, establishing a short insight-to-action process to quickly adapt and optimize activities.
Optimize product listings for Share of Shelf and Rankings using expertise of keyword research, digital marketing, SEM, online display advertising, and SEO from inception with objective to drive conversion and sales sell-through.
Work with the eCommerce team and other account managers to identify opportunities and develop digital activations.
Assist and provide the required Ad Hoc reporting including post-mortem reporting for ecom POS sales.
Engage with cross-functional subject matter experts to incorporate best practices into the digital shelf.
Assist and support Sales Leads with Commercial Planning activities related to product assortment strategy and promotional planning.
How will you fit into the team?
Comprehensive knowledge of major eCommerce eco-systems (Amazon, Walmart.com, Target.com, eBay), with a proven record of hands on experience working within Vendor Central.

Overview:

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.
When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 207,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 153 countries.
With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.
KPMG Canada is looking to hire for a unique an exciting Business Analyst/Project Management hybrid role for Ignition Tax. This role supports KPMG Canada’s major Tax technology projects, ensuring the delivered technology and business solutions are of high quality and consistent with the Firm’s vision. The successful candidate will work closely with clients and KPMG’s internal software development and innovation team to analyze, lead, develop, and deliver services in relation to integrating business applications or technology into our current environment
Why join Ignition Tax:
Competitive compensation package, flexible work arrangements, pension matching and flexible benefits
Commitment to learning and development
An opportunity to solve real problems by building products from the ground up
You love coaching and mentoring others and working collaboratively with like minded entrepreneurs
Thrive in a “Start-up culture” vibe
What you will do:

Key Accountabilities:.
Provide primary support for formulation of problem statement and definition of scope for their assigned area(s)
Work with engagement management to define scope of work in context of larger project.
Demonstrate exceptional requirement gathering techniques with minimal direction from engagement management
Design, conduct and facilitate requirements sessions
Logically structure recommendations and support data to formulate a solid, logical and clear business case.
Organize working group sessions with subject matter experts, client team members and stakeholders to gather and document business processes and business requirements. Document the results of working group sessions to clearly identify and capture requirements.
Create and maintain thorough and accurate project documentation (including functional and technical design specifications) according to the project management methodologies
Identifying, analyzing and documenting business, functional and non-functional requirements
Completing gap/fit analysis, including software application assessment/validation
Creating service level agreements
Data mapping, conversion documentation including detailed conversion strategies, and data migration
Liaise and coordinate with other teams including the client, the business, project management, operations, and IT to move requirements towards execution
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
Managing projects and developing optimization strategies
Assessing work requests to provide scope and effort estimates for BA services, developing work package plans, and executing work as planned
Contributing to the development and maintenance of processes, procedures, standards and tools for the BA service area
Proactively escalate project issues and risks that require program management or executive attention
Meet with clients to take detailed ordering briefs and clarify specific requirements of each project
Understand Agile and Waterfall way of working, be able to adopt to working in bi-modal environment and possess capability to shift the team to execute in both ways
What you bring to this role:
Minimum of 5 – 7 years' experience in a Technical BA role with formal education or equivalent experience
2+ years’ experience in a project management environment dealing with end-users, working effectively in a team-based environment with situations involving rapid change, shifting priorities, and/or simultaneous demands
Proven ability to take ownership of their deliverables and bring a business consultant mindset combined with clarity and speed of thought. Someone who is able to build relationships with their stakeholders, and get up to speed quickly.
Thorough understanding of project management methodologies, standards and tools and their application
Ability to identify, understand and articulate client needs, generate opportunities, and suggest approaches for addressing issues
Provides high-quality service, translating technical applications knowledge into functional business terminology and vice versa
Experience with various analysis techniques including planning and facilitation of business process review sessions, gap/fit analysis sessions, and developer walkthroughs
Demonstrated ability to effectively multi-task, while maintaining attention to detail, in a fast-paced, 'high-tech' environment required
Nice to have
Large scale technical implementation and development experience, especially within tax
Previous work in software, tax and consulting industry

Job Description
Founded in 1846, Laurentian Bank Financial Group (LBCFG) is a diversified financial services provider whose mission is to help its customers improve their financial health. The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").


With more than 2,900 employees guided by the values of proximity, simplicity and honesty, the Group provides a broad range of advice-based solutions and services to its personal, business and institutional customers. With pan-Canadian activities and a presence in the U.S., the Group is an important player in numerous market segments.

This role sits within Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group.

Reporting to the Assistant Vice-President, Compliance, Financial Crimes and Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Terrorist Financing (AML/ATF), the Senior Business Analyst, Financial Crimes and AML/ATF, is responsible for developing, deploying and maintaining models for AML/ATF monitoring of transactions and various other support activities related to transaction monitoring and Client Due Diligence processes.

The incumbent helps the Bank's Financial Crimes and AML/ATF business unit implement AML/ATF strategies for monitoring transactions involving current and future products. In addition, he or she actively participates in designing AML/ATF strategies and extensive analyses for the portfolios of the Bank and its subsidiaries.

The position is based in Toronto.

Responsibilities
º Serve as an expert advisor for the Financial Crimes and AML/ATF business unit and the business lines in the implementation of new AML/ATF strategies, and support teams in reviewing their AML/ATF monitoring strategies for current products.
º Analyse the performance of current monitoring practices and methods and trends related to AML/ATF activities.
º Analyse data in order to submit recommendations for modelling AML/ATF scenarios.
º Document business rules for developing models.
º Work with the development team to ensure that the AML/ATF scenario rules that are deployed meet the specifications.
º Submit requests for adjustments to the development team during tests and monitor the adjustments until implementation.
º Document analyses, tests and results and prepare periodic scenario performance monitoring reports.
º Conduct periodic monitoring of key performance indicators and submit recommendations for optimizing AML/ATF models.
º Conduct studies and complex analyses, draw conclusions and recommend solutions.
º Ensure data privacy (security profile and access codes).
º Optimize the use of strategies and systems by identifying business process improvement opportunities and implementing flexible, reusable solutions.
º Coordinate and/or participate in work groups with stakeholders to identify problems and needs and develop a work plan for implementing the appropriate solutions.
º Serve as an advisor in his or her field of expertise for managers and senior management.
º Support and maintain efficient communication with stakeholders involved in management operations.
º Keep updated on current legislation and the Bank's policies, programs and procedures.
º Prepare various reporting for management oversight activities
º Assist with managing Internal Audit and Regulatory remediation activities.

º Project support including working with project teams to document, review an test business requirements
º Assist with change management activities and overall governance controls

º Perform all tasks of a similar or general nature requested by his or her superior or required for the job.

Qualifications
º University education in a quantitative field (bachelor's degree in economics, mathematics, finance, statistics or actuarial science) or four years relevant experience in a similar field
º Strong knowledge of SAS programming (SAS EG, SAS AML)

º Concrete experience in statistics, data analysis and modelling
º Relevant experience and knowledge of AML/ATF regulations in the banking sector
º Experience using relational databases and SQL language
º Relevant experience and knowledge of fraud and money laundering concepts, issues, systems and prevention and detection strategies
º Ability to influence proposed solutions and innovate
º Ability to simplify and communicate complex ideas
º Ability to make presentations before a non-technical audience
º Knowledge of the banking industry
º Bilingual (French and English), spoken and written
º Talent for interpersonal communication
º Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
º Self-reliance and resourcefulness

Additional Information
We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.

Job Title: Senior BI Reporting Analyst - QA Lead
Job Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
What does TD Enterprise Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights.
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.


Our department supports a very important business function at the bank which oversees Information Security and Cyber Risk reporting. We are searching for talented individuals to join us in a very exciting journey as we operationalize our Enterprise Protect Risk Reporting Factory. We are moving away from a tradition project delivery model to a continues change model to drive value quickly and embracing the agile mindset. You will have the opportunity to start at sprint zero as we form our Pod and refine our new way of working.

Job Description
Are you a big picture thinker? Fantastic! This is exactly the kind of thinking TD needs when it comes to our business intelligence reporting and analytics. In this role, we need you to take a holistic, strategic approach to sourcing data, design and development of critical reports for the bank's Information and Cyber Security risk reporting domains.

As data's role in providing extraordinary insights into business and information security grows, we'll look to the valued expertise you'll provide in this role, to develop, adopt and evolve the best in class reporting and business intelligence capability.
Does this sound like you? You're a natural leader and can lead continuous change in our risk reporting factory model, joining product owners and partners to drive quality over critical reporting metrics that meet regulatory and board commitments and recommend risk-based testing strategies. Moreover, you have a talent for developing and executing end to end testing that draw on your technical expertise in automation. Finally, you'll fit in well if you have the agile mindset of doing work, like to own your space and execute with speed and precision, relishing all challenges as opportunities to dig in, collaborate and take TD into the future of data and analytics.

As a Senior Business Intelligence QA Analyst, you will:
Work in a dedicated Pod developing and executing formal test strategies and plans to ensure the delivery of quality reporting and data. Accountable for test planning, writing test cases/scripts, test case automation and test execution. Define and track quality assurance metrics such as defects, defect counts, test results and test status as well as participate in test planning, defect management/resolution, installation/maintenance, and are involved in risk/issue management.
Testing may include but not limited to the following: system integration testing, regression testing, user acceptance testing, functional testing, performance testing, operability testing, and deployment verification testing.
In-depth experience testing with very large datasets and comprehensive understanding big data technologies
Apply test automation and innovation on data platforms and reports in a continuous change model aligned to business or organizational strategies.
Collaborate with technology and business partners to resolve issues
Work closely with various testing center of excellences to align testing to enterprise frameworks and best practices.

Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Seven (7) or more years relevant experience
Expert knowledge and experience in end to end test automation
Experience in a data and reporting centric environment
Test strategy definition
Test plan creation for release
SQL scripting for ETL logic
JIRA – Story creation, Defect Tracking, Track the stories till closure
Confluence – For documentation
CI/CD Tools - Bitbucket
Excel report validation
Tableau Testing
Python Scripting
Experience with technology and cyber risk management
Experience working in Agile/Scrum delivery model
Additional Information

If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

About Us:
Propel (formerly MoneyKey) is an innovative Fintech Company that provides services and unsecured financial products to consumers via a safe and secure online platform. Propel was founded in 2011 in Toronto to remove the complexity and bureaucracy that people often experience while trying to borrow money, and to provide an underserved population with unsecured credit in a respectful way and with extraordinary service. Our goal is to provide our customers with a simple and convenient process!
Our amazing team has experienced phenomenal growth and thrives on an entrepreneurial spirit, passion, and top-tier talent. We believe in innovation and in measuring success through results and growing within; talent and hard work never goes unnoticed, and we succeed together.
About You:
You are a talented professional looking for a career, not a job. You have a passion for numbers and data analytics, with an Accounting background and experience with data analysis tools. You possess an excellent business acumen to develop in-depth knowledge of each product combination offered by the organization and to play a key role in supporting the decision-making process for strategic next steps in the business.
You picture yourself succeeding within a vibrant and entrepreneurial organization where your ideas will be heard, and where you will have an opportunity to showcase your talents and great skills. You are motivated by goals, a self-starter, and a hardworking individual who likes to wear multiple hats. We are seeking a proven, driven team player who is looking to join a fast-paced, high growth, energetic and forward-thinking team.
Responsibilities
Preparing internal and external reporting over product performance metrics (KPIs) and month-end financial results from source system data
Working with, extracting, validating, and analyzing data from multiple databases and internal systems for the purpose of producing reporting and conducting data/financial analysis that directly affects business decisions. Extensive use of SQL, Excel, amongst other tools required for the above.
Documenting data queries, sources, structures, and flows to enable streamlining and knowledge sharing/transfer.
Working with and leveraging IT to create and develop reporting tools to manage and track, reconcile, identify exceptions/issues, and report on the flow of transactional data between multiple internal systems and databases.
Key contributor towards optimization of various reporting and data processes. Assisting team in creating efficiencies across data flow and reporting infrastructure
Continuously analyzing data in real-time as well as historical results, performance metrics and market figures to support the business and enhance profitability
Analyzing profitability and performance across all company entities and business units. Based on analysis, providing recommendations to optimize financial performance
Developing an in-depth knowledge of the business as well as each product/offering by the organization in the various markets in which it operates
Providing support to the Accounting & Finance team to improve forecasting effectiveness, reporting, and accuracy across the business
Working closely and supporting Director of Finance with managing and executing all audit or regulatory related requests
Analyzing profitability, performance and cash flows across all Company entities, products, markets, customer types and various other attributes
Executing on and supporting the Accounting & Finance team at various stages of the reporting process, including P&L, Balance Sheets, Cash Flow, etc.
Involvement in product structuring and a key contributor to successfully launching and ongoing performance analysis of new products. Working closely with the PMO team
Contributing to the Finance team as a strategic thinker, identifying concerns or potential risks in a proactive manner
Conducting ad hoc financial analysis to support various departments across the company.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Economics, or related field
CPA designation (or working towards designation) preferred.
Working knowledge of Accounting reporting standards (IFRS and US GAAP experience an asset)
Solid experience with financial reporting and analysis
Knowledge in the use of databases, data analysis/query tools and proficiency in Excel
Proficient with SQL tools for data analysis, mining, and verification/integrity.
Hands-on experience with creating dashboards and reports on Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools is an asset (e.g. Tableau, Domo, Cognos, or related tools).
Hands-on experience with Accounting and ERP systems (e.g. Oracle NetSuite), including GL feeds is an asset
Passion for working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail and organization skills, motivated and able to multitask
Knowledge of Fintech Space an asset.
We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.
We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.

Yorkville University is recruiting for a talented and hardworking Associate / Senior Analyst to join its growing Strategy & Analytics team.

We are looking for a highly motivated, smart, and business savvy individual that would like to solve complex business challenges in an entrepreneurial environment. Under direction from the Director, Strategy & Analytics, you will work closely with various functions across the organization to grow and improve existing programs, evaluate new programs and enhance the student experience.

You will use data to influence decisions on how the business can improve and will support a variety of teams across the organization make sound strategic choices. The role requires a curious mindset and someone who wants to work with a team driving continuous improvement across all areas of the business.
About Yorkville University
Founded in 2004, Yorkville University is a Canadian university with a national presence. With campuses in New Brunswick, Ontario and British Columbia, Yorkville University offers professional, practitioner-oriented masters and bachelor degree programs, delivered entirely online, in class or a blend of both.
Please visit www.yorkvilleu.ca for further information.
About Toronto Film School
Toronto Film School offers a fast and effective path to an exciting career in film, television, theatre, fashion, graphic design or video games.
What sets Toronto Film School apart is that right from the start students begin the transformative process of turning raw energy and creativity into the practical skills demanded by the competitive world of the entertainment industry.
Students will be filming, editing, performing, writing and designing in a high-energy environment, preparing for exciting careers within the entertainment industry – with the guidance of industry professionals and supportive faculty, who understand what it takes to succeed.
Toronto Film School has three campuses in the GTA: Dundas College, Davisville and Concord.
Please visit www.torontofilmschool.ca for further information.
Diversity, equity and inclusion are a critical component of life at Yorkville University and Toronto Film School, and we are committed to making these values an integral part of our culture. Toronto Film School/Yorkville University encourages applications from all qualified applicants, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPOC), people from the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Transsexual, Queer, Questioning, Two-Spirit, Intersex, Asexual + (LGBTQ2SIA+) community, and other equity-seeking groups.
Yorkville University/Toronto Film School is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (‘AODA’). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at 1-866- 467-0661 ext. 1236.

Support different functional areas with analytics to help solve problems or improve performance (e.g. developing pricing strategies or retention strategies)
Provide analytics and insights to the Executive Team and Board of Directors as required
Work to improve data definitions and data integrity across the organization
Work with private equity ownership, including their in-house data science team
Opportunity to be part of the team to build internal AI capabilities to forecast student outcomes

A. Education and Experience

1-3 years of experience, preferably in Business Analytics, Finance or Consulting
B. Required Skills and Abilities
Excellent written and verbal communication
Excellent organization and prioritization skills, with an appreciation for detail
Strong knowledge in MS Excel and PowerPoint. MS Excel proficiency to include running simple business models to help influence decision making (break even analysis, market sizing, business line P&Ls, pivots etc)

Talent Analyst
3 positions:
1 full-time permanent position
2 full-time contract positions (12 months)

Role Objective
The Talent Analyst is responsible to conduct leading practice research, surveys and data analyses to produce perspectives and recommendations that inform the design and development of talent strategies, programs and projects. The role also takes an active role in the implementation and administration of talent strategies, programs and projects and the monitoring and measuring of effectiveness and impact.
Accountabilities
Talent Management Research and Analytics
Build, track and update various monthly and quarterly talent metrics.
Plan and develop instruments for producing talent analytics activities including but not limited to survey design/measurement and assessment development/validation.
Identify and interpret trends in data, present findings, and provide recommendations to varying levels of the organization.
Leverage internal HR, survey, and/or business data using internal tools, systems, and data sources.
Merge data from multiple sources/systems, conduct appropriate analyses, and provide actionable insights.
Proactively partner with key stakeholders to address business gaps or opportunities identified through analytics.
Create, administer and summarize employee feedback surveys.

Talent Strategies and Programs
Create presentations, spreadsheets and graphs.
Maintain, organize and implement programs, processes and tools that help with the efficient administration of talent programs and activities.
Draft contracts, reports, letters and various correspondence.
Conduct research and investigate topics related to various talent and employee related policies and programs.
Participate in or execute on various talent initiatives and projects.
Research leading practice approaches and present recommendations to talent approaches, programs and projects.
Administer processes and activities vital to the operations of existing talent programs.
Assist with the development of content, training and deployment of talent strategies.
Respond to tickets progressed to Tier 3 from the HR Support Centre.

Supporting Total Rewards Programs, Projects and Activities
Data development, sourcing, extraction, manipulation, analysis and presentation supporting compensation, pension, benefits and talent retention programs
Program development specific to Talent Retention (included strategies designed to achieve employee well-being, recognition and engagement), and Total Rewards
Measurement in the form of surveys, periodic and cadenced reporting, KPI reporting specific to services, programs, and completion of key annual workplan activities
Audits and reconciliation related to completion of key annual workplan activities
Data cleansing, matching and preparation for annual/cadenced compensation, pension and benefits activities
Support the delivery of all talent and total rewards programs and activities
Minimum Qualifications
Education and Skills
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
1 - 3 years experience in talent activities.

The Ideal Candidate Demonstrates
Broad understanding talent management practice.
Advanced MS Excel skills.

The role: Senior Business Analyst – Licensing
We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst – Licensing to join our busy and dynamic team in our Toronto, Richmond Hill office.
Why we need you:-
As Business Analyst, you will work with Compliance and various business stakeholders to investigate, define and execute product changes to support our Compliance level. Whilst also, translating business requirements into detailed requirement documents and work closely with business and technology on accurate implementation.
You’ll be required to create and maintain the ‘knowledge base’ of our systems and licenses and provide different business units with compliance gap analysis on requested features. Be the knowledge owner of our different solutions across all licenses. You will also need to proactively raise risks with current and potential functionality and ensure our product is compliant with local regulation.
You will be required to manage data requests to allow data driven decisions and map competition landscape by comparing the company's product to competitors' functionality.
Who are we looking for:-
Relevant experience as a product, business and/or business systems analyst or to have qualification/certification in these areas
Intimate knowledge and experience with Operational aspects around Regulated Markets.
Demonstrable technical experience with distributed application design and data analysis
Strong interest and aptitude in defining business requirements for software development.
Understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Superb attention to detail.
Strong relationship management skills – ability to relate to business users and software developers.
Strong organisational skills and ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects.
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.
Creative and analytical approach to problem solving
As the ideal candidate, you will have:-
Experience in working within regulatory frameworks and compliance and on system integration is desirable. Detailed knowledge of regulatory product requirement across jurisdictions and technical understanding of regulated frameworks is a plus. A relevant degree in computer science or another technology related discipline is advantageous.
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus.
Your package will include:health and dental insurance for you and your dependentsthe option to join our company pension schemein-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your careerPaid for lunches, as well as fresh fruit, snacks and drinks around the officeregular on-site yoga sessions
What happens next?
If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a phone interview. And if that goes well, we’ll meet you for a face-to-face interview.

Mejuri is a direct-to-consumer approach to buying jewellery for the modern woman. We are about making luxury a habit – disrupting the traditional jewellery industry to make fine jewellery affordable and empowering women to purchase for themselves. Series B funded, and one of the fastest growing global digital brands, we are backed by strong VC investors such as Natalie Massenet’s Imaginary Ventures, NEA and Felix Capital.
We focus on perfecting every customer touchpoint, creating the best digital and in-store experiences and content that is conversational and engaging. We are a team of designers, writers, technologists and strategists, and we are looking for someone special to join our team and help us make luxury fun and accessible.
“Mejuri redefines personal jewelry decisions” – Forbes
“75 per cent of Mejuri’s customers are women buying for themselves, and 30 per cent make repeat purchases each month. Among those filling their virtual baskets? Lizzo, Selena Gomez, Margot Robbie and Oprah Winfrey.” – British Vogue
At Mejuri, we have a tremendous appreciation for fact-based decision-making. We are looking for a passionate and curious individual to support the growing analysis and business intelligence needs of our marketing team! At a high level, this new role will provide reporting and analyses to our marketing organization, monitoring how campaigns are performing and how to improve.
Responsibilities:
Produce effective data visualizations, dashboards, and analytical solutions that provide marketing teams access to critical metrics and insights
Collect and analyze data; synthesize results of analyses, and communicate the implications with leadership in a concise manner
Partner with channel leads to log all relevant data associated with brand and growth marketing activities. Then work with the data engineering team to ensure the data is efficiently and seamlessly captured in a centralized data warehouse environment
Perform exploratory data analysis on new data sources to assess quality, reliability and understand key gaps
Support annual financial planning activities by building defensible forecasts for revenue and other key business drivers• Automate and streamline dashboard and data analyses where feasible
Maintain high levels of accuracy, integrity, process consistency and documentation in planning, forecasting, and modeling approaches
The successful candidate will have:
3+ years experience in relevant data analytics or business intelligence roles - preferably in marketing
Driven, creative, intellectually curious and able to effectively collaborate cross-functionally, partnering with stakeholders to drive business performance
Extensive SQL experience for data extraction, manipulation, and analyses; including stored procedures, complex joins, creation of views, and database scripting. Strong grasp of analytical database design concepts
Extensive experience in Visualization tools (preferably Looker)
Deep understanding of KPI selection, sales metrics, and business case development
Strong understanding of applied statistics skills, such as: statistical testing, regression, mathematical techniques etc
Acute attention to detail, excellent written and verbal communication skills for explaining analytic approaches to non-technical audiences
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment
Familiarity and preferably experience working within Google suite of productivity apps (Google Gmail, Sheets, Docs, and Drive, mainly). Proficiency with spreadsheet-based formulas (eg. Excel/Sheets) is critical.
Working at Mejuri = Solid Gold
Mejuri aspires to not only inspire and empower our customers, but to build an inspiring, empowering and thoroughly modern workplace.

We offer:
Beautiful, light filled plant and dog-friendly office
Competitive health, mental health, dental and vision benefits for you and your family
Fully stocked kitchen with snacks and drinks
Wellness - Private wellness/prayer/pumping room, and a lifestyle spending account for health and fitness needs
Parental leave top up program (80% for 4 months)Stay shining with a generous employee discount

What is the opportunity?
The Senior Configuration Analyst will be a main player on the IT Service Management (ITSM) team with the key role of managing the day to day activities for the Enterprise Configuration Management process. Objectives include setting up the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), expanding use of the CMDB into other IT processes, aid in establishing a Configuration Management process, and establishing relationships with Configuration Item (CI) owners to enforce the process.
This role will focus on Configuration Management but will also be involved in other aspects of the ITSM processes such as Asset, Change, Incident, Problem, Availability and Service Level Management. The primary responsibility will be setting up and maintaining the CMDB.
What will you do?
Configuration Management process improvements/ITSM initiatives:
Support the Senior Manager, Enterprise Configuration Management in the implementation of the CMDB
Assist the Senior Manager, Enterprise Configuration Management with continual process improvement; lead and deliver key project-based initiatives
Collaborate with IT & Process Owners, and Process Stakeholders to gather and analyze needs, translating these needs into requirements; maintain up to date knowledge of industry best practice standard
Configuration Management Operational Tasks:
Ensure the Configuration Management process is understood and adhered to; assist in identifying and onboarding new CI Types; work with CI Owners to help maintain their data
Reconcile the CMDB data when exceptions are noted between CMDB, discovery information, and other authoritative production data repositories
Resolve CI duplicates within the CMDB; work with CI Owners to identify and understand CI relationships; build, maintain and validate CI relationships within the CMDB
Work with Discovery/CMDB administrator to enable Discovery services or implement scripts required to process data feeds to update the CMDB; establish and support controls and procedures to review, assess, prioritize, & track compliance to requirements incorporated into tool and process designs; maintain operational procedures and knowledge base; assist with process documentation and user guides
Metrics, Reporting and Governance
Develop reports for management on KPIs to improve the process effectiveness, efficiency, and data accuracy; perform CMDB audits to ensure data completeness and quality; enable process adherence through reporting and dashboards
What do you need to succeed?
Must Have:
Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field along with 5 to 7 years Configuration Management experience
Experience in data analysis and management utilizing advanced Excel techniques
Familiarity with Agile and SCRUM methodologies
Experience in a large IT shared services organization
Excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration and documentation skills
Ability to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams
Understanding of Service Management processes
Passion for learning and knowledge transferAbility to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams
Nice to have:
ITIL v3 Foundations Certified
