McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 17 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
Job Summary
As part of the Specialty Health Business Transformation and Innovation team, the Sr. Associate Business System Analyst uses their skills to define product requirements, develop process flows and maps, collect and evaluate future enhancements for the product backlog. You will work closely with customers, stakeholders, SMEs and technology development teams to ensure the solutions effectively meet the business and technical requirements. As part of an Agile development team, the Sr. Associate Business System Analyst will responsible for guiding the team to make requirements a reality.
Section A –General Responsibilities
Prepare and lead various customer-focused user groups to elicit business and workflow requirements
On-going interface between business and the different development teams
Ensures stakeholder requirements are captured, analyzed, justified, and included in development by reviewing regulatory requirements, feedback from user groups, and pilot programs
Recommend solutions and offerings
Understand and support an iterative, cross-functional product development life cycle
Work with Agile Scrum to support Product Owner; these cross-functional teams are tasked with enhancing our Patient Services technology offerings.
Within scrum, owns requirements for new products or enhancements to existing products, develop and write user stories, acceptance testing, sprint demos, pilot management
Acts as the subject matter expert on new offerings, providing knowledge transfer to other teams (e.g. training, Sales, support, etc.)
Participate in Agile team meetings (iteration planning, daily scrums/stand-ups, retrospectives etc.)
Participate in Product Management team meetings (roadmap planning, release planning), and other inter-team meetings
Section B – Specific Responsibilities
Proactively test and manage system bugs
Proactively identify, define, track and manage future enhancements
Provide User and Stakeholder Support and Training, including day to day end user support of the Salesforce platform, and onboarding new employees
Provide in-person and virtual training of users at all levels in the organization, ranging from 1-on-1 training to training for medium sized groups (30-40 users)
Partner with internal customers at all levels, ranging from leadership to end-users, to identify and address areas of improvement, additional functionality, training and support
Partner with other divisions within the company to ensure successful collaboration and sharing of data, contacts, leads, procedures, processes, knowledge and more
Create and maintain documentation on processes, policies, application configuration and help related materials for users (e.g. Reference Guide)
Manage supplication user profiles and permission sets
Perform Ongoing System Administration
Section C – Position Requirements
Minimum 2- 3 years of experience in program operations or in an analytical role within programs
Experience in patient program service platforms (e.g. Salesforce, Maple and CMSv2 and associate programs)
2 – 3 years of experience working with other Specialty Units (e.g. Pharmacy, Inviva Nursing)
Experience with Salesforce is an asset
Familiarity with Microsoft SharePoint, PowerApps, Power Automate.
Strong familiarity with the business processes and workflow associated with Patient Programs, Pharmacy, Inviva and reimbursement is preferred
Experience in the health care sector an asset
Ability to do minimal travel
Bilingual — English/French is an asset
Skills/Abilities:
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills and is an effective communicator with diverse audiences, including both technical and non-technical customers and colleagues
Demonstrated ability to lead and participate effectively in cross-functional teams
Ability to facilitate diverse stakeholder discussions and negotiate requirements
Strong analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple projects/timelines
Ability to effectively prioritize and escalate issues as required
Display a high level of critical thinking in a cross-functional process and well-developed problem resolution skills for new and existing software solutions
Ability to be pro-active with a sense of urgency with a focus on the positive
Well-versed in business analysis and functional requirements specification, including writing user stories
Skilled at creating well-defined acceptance criteria at the feature and story level
Organized, methodical with rigorous work approach
Experience in project management, its practices, techniques and tools
Be a self-starter, a highly motivated person able to work in a fast-paced environment that is continually changing
Six Sigma training would be an asset
Career Level P2
Worker Type
Regular

Planning Analyst, Modelling & Geospatial Analysis (MOD000N)

Employee Status: Regular

Barganing Unit: Non-Union

Pay Range: 63,958.00 - 87,476.00

Location: Head Office

Closing Date: 14-Mar-2021
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!
Our Research & Planning Analytics Office is seeking an Analyst, Modelling & Geomatics to conduct technical transportation analysis that supports corporate business objectives and long-term planning that furthers the development and implementation of the Regional Transportation Plan (RTP) for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area (GTHA).

What will I be doing?
Conducts technical analysis and research that provides critical inputs to the transportation systems and policy planning, project appraisal, infrastructure delivery, and strategic business decisions that support the RTP, corporate planning, and the assessment of transportation infrastructure, transit service, and policy initiatives.
Maintains, selects, and applies computer-based analytical tools (e.g. travel demand models, statistical models, spreadsheets, databases, and Geographic Information Systems) to support:
Evidence-based assessment and analysis of transportation planning issues and proposals
Forecasting of transit ridership, demand patterns, network impacts, and benefits in response to growth, changing markets, policies, service changes, and infrastructure projects/plans
Collection, tabulation, trend analysis, and visualization of complex and large datasets
Obtains support, shares information, and works closely with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. municipal partners, provincial ministries, and other advisory groups) to achieve Metrolinx corporate objectives and to define, implement, and monitor projects, policies, programs, guidelines, standards, and other initiatives.
Reviews and prepares corporate responses to studies, contracts, work scopes, projects, and other proposals by internal and external stakeholders, providing relevant technical commentary, recommendations, and advice.
Formulates, evaluates, documents, and presents data analysis, research, and forecasting proposals, results, and associated recommendations for Senior Advisor, Management and/or Board approval and consideration.

What skills and qualifications do I need?

Completion of a degree in Urban and Regional Transportation Planning, Engineering, Land Use Planning, Mathematics, Data Science, or related field or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent.
Minimum two (2) years’ experience in transportation planning, preferably in the public sector
Minimum two (2) years’ experience in data science, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), or other fields with a strong emphasis on quantitatively based data analysis is an asset.
Proven analytical skills with practical experience in technical analysis, undertaking literature and best practice reviews, and conducting internet and survey research using supporting spreadsheets and database applications.
Interpersonal and oral/written communication and consultation skills to develop and present research findings and analyses and obtain cooperation with stakeholders and clients.
Practical experience with transportation demand modelling software (e.g. EMME, TransCAD, VISUM), statistical analysis software (e.g. STATA, SAS, R), GIS software (e.g. ArcGIS), and/or computer programming languages (e.g. Python) is a significant asset.
Knowledge of the theory, principles, research methodologies, and practices of transportation modelling, transportation planning and policy analysis is an asset.

Accommodation:
Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance.
Application Process:
All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

The Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer/Analyst will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of stakeholders and for documenting and developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs.

The Junior BI Developer/Analyst will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. Key Responsibilities
Work with the business to define report requirements and translate those requirements into reporting deliverables-
Participate in the design and implementation of complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements.
Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs and charts.
Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports.
Participate to functional and technical specification reviews.
Research technical solutions to business problems.
Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI.
Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting.
Participate in the administration of Magna’s instance of the Talend tool suite and respective infrastructure.
Actively participate in the governance of Magna’s instance of the Talend tool suite. Knowledge & Education
Completion of University Degree (Information Technology, Computer Science, etc.). Work Experience
0-3 Years of Work-Related Experience. Skills & Competencies
Self-motivated and autonomous with excellent analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize data relationships and patterns).

Knowledge in data modeling (SSAS Tabular Model preferred).
Knowledge in ETL and Data Warehouse concepts.
Strong SQL and scripting skills.
Knowledge in Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, SSRS, Power Pivot, Power View, PowerBI).
Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.

Excellent English language skills (written and oral). Work Environment
Regular overnight travel: 10-25% of the time.

Who we need
This is a full time, contract opportunity backfilling for a maternity leave (May 2021 - July 2022). The Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting the Direct Marketing, Brand Marketing and Lottery teams with data selection, analysis, segmentation, data and vendor management, as well as helping to develop, execute and report on media campaigns.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter, experienced in the running of multi-channel campaigns. They are a critical thinker with a drive to research, explore and analyze data. This individual takes pride in deriving insight from data and has effective communication skills that support the movement of an idea from concept, to design, to implementation. The ideal candidate is results oriented and is motivated by making an impact wherever they find themselves.
Working collaboratively with key stakeholders, the role provides analytical insights and campaign support in a fast-paced, fluid environment to ensure data-driven decision-making advances progress toward our mission.
How you will make an impact every day
Campaign Planning, Data Management, Segmentation and Analytics
Collaborate in the planning, execution and evaluation of the Foundation’s multi-channel Lottery campaigns
Work with key stakeholders and media vendors to plan media campaigns, track results and provide status updates during campaigns; recommend changes mid campaign to drive results
Analyze supporter behaviour, and work with the marketing leads to develop and implement donor segmentation strategies
Using data insights identify opportunities to improve donor communication, upgrade, retention and lifetime value
Ensure the accurate completion of weekly, monthly and quarterly performance reports
For donor segmentation and targeting define and write either directly or through a 3rd party the specifications for the extraction of data from CRM sources, Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Google Analytics databases for lottery and fundraising campaigns
Ensure data that is sent to and received from external partners is accurate and timely
Document protocols to ensure knowledge sharing and transfer
Participation in CRM management including ongoing processes, UAT, QA, changing requirements and enhancements
Working within the marketing calendar ensure critical dates related to data are met
Build, manage and sustain the internal and external business relationships necessary to support the programs’ objectives, including key suppliers
Work across the organization to keep informed of other Foundation programs and activities to identify opportunities for learning, insights and collaboration
Build strong lateral relationships with IT team to achieve maximum integrations and synergies, especially the development and use of CRM and other projects that support the advancement of the team
Budgeting and Planning Administration
Provide data and insights to support the development of program leads’ annual and short-term plans
Manage lottery data vendors SOWs and MSA.
Assist with development of Media SOWs and Blocking Charts to support Lottery and Brand media campaigns.
Monitor, research and share market trends, evolving thinking and technologies and the implications to HSF programs
What you bring
University degree in analytics, finance or equivalent
Minimum 7 years of direct response and/or database management experience in a customer centered organization
Experience working with CRM systems
Experience working with Google Analytics
Knowledge of data-visualization including Tableau and Power BI, or equivalent
Experience reporting on mass media campaigns including all digital and traditional media.
Solid experience and understanding of data to inform direct response campaigns
An understanding of donor experience
Understanding of customer file segmentation and strategic planning based on ongoing interactive communication
Experience managing external suppliers and consultants
Ability to translate complex ideas to layperson language
Ceaseless curiosity and an ability to delve into the data to prove/disprove hypothesis
Exceptional data querying skills using SQL, SAS, and Excel
An extremely strong ability to translate data into action
Knowledge of sophisticated data models including donor segmentation
Exceptional project management skills and ability to oversee and execute on complex campaign schedules
Strong ability to manage multiple demands
Must be a team player with strong interpersonal skills including collaboration and consultation
Comfort with turning ambiguity into process and action

RSA, Johnson, CNS and Deeks are part of the RSA Group of Companies (“RSA”).
Position Summary
As a member of the Reinsurance & Exposure Management Team, the Risk Analyst will support the delivery of underwriting risk management, governance, and improvement across the Canadian portfolios, direct or intermediated, personal and commercial. Ensuring the insurance risks across the Canadian business are identified, managed, measured, monitored, and reported specifically as relevant to exposure and accumulation management thereby supporting long-term profitable growth of the Canadian business.
What you'll do in the role
Support the development of accumulation management capability across the Personal and Commercial portfolios at portfolio and per risk levels in accordance with RSA Group best practices.
Develop standardized monthly processes for analyzing Canadian property risk exposures
Use advanced data analysis and manipulation, provide insight and dynamics of exposure shift through time and the actual and potential consequential impacts upon the Canadian portfolios with recommendations for action.
Gain knowledge and insight into key catastrophe perils impacting the Canadian insurance business and build tools to assist with managing and monitoring these exposures.
Assist with modelling individual large risks for underwriters utilizing various modelling tools.
Upon request, deliver exposure profiling in response to anticipated or actual events or scenarios.
Support the Reinsurance function as requested through data research and analysis
Leverage learnings from industry and market in relation to catastrophe modelling, exposure and accumulation management.
What you'll need
University/College degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or business
Knowledge of property and casualty insurance
Ability to develop creative solutions to complex issues that have an impact across large areas of the business utilizing database tools such as SQL and SAS.
Knowledge of catastrophe modeling tools is considered an asset
Out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for new ways of doing things
Outstanding communication skills (both oral and written)
Ability to work effectively in a remote environment
Eager to jump in and provide analytical support for all tactical and ad hoc initiatives and manage projects as required.
Results oriented with the ability to prioritize tasks and responsibilities.
What you'll receive
A market-leading, comprehensive Total Rewards Program which includes competitive compensation and bonus, flexible benefits, and pension plan.
Best-in-class vacation policy that includes paid volunteer, parental leave top-up programs and personal leave days.
Strong learning culture with a focus on overall development, internal mobility and career advancement.
Tuition reimbursement program.
A culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion, with a strong focus on community and corporate social responsibility.
Temporary / Fixed Term Hires:
Competitive salary
Strong learning culture
Diverse, award-winning culture with a strong focus on corporate social responsibility

To support our continued growth and provide excellence in customer service and satisfaction, Reliance Home Comfort is looking for a high energy and results focused individual for the following role:
To support our continued growth, we are looking for a high energy, results focused individual for the following role:
Position: SAP Data Analyst (12-month Contract)
Location: 2 Lansing Square, Toronto
Reports to: Project Leader, CIS System Implementation
Company Overview:
For the past 50 years, Reliance Home Comfort has been the industry leader in providing home comfort solutions to over 1.9 million customers across North America.

Reliance™ has been providing affordable, reliable home heating, cooling, hot water, water purification, electrical, plumbing & Smart Home products & services. Our customers know they can count on us for fast, friendly, knowledgeable service and advice – and that’s comfortable!

Our organization has grown exponentially in size and we are incredibly proud to be recognized recently by:
 Waterstone Human Capital Ltd. as Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures Waterstone Human Capital Ltd. for Canada’s Most Admired CEO (Sean O’Brien) Glassdoor as “Best Places to Work in Canada”

Each day, 2,300 Reliance Team Members focus on delivering an outstanding customer experience, developing top talent and giving back to the communities where we live and work. In 2019 alone, we have donated over $650,000 to United Way and $100,000 in equipment to Habitat for Humanity.
Primary Mission: Role requires an engaged, organized, and a self-starter-type individual with strong data cleansing and migration skills. This individual will be responsible for supporting the Reliance Data Workstream and Business Solution Integration leads. This is a cross functional SAP data role which provides data cleansing, data migration, solution testing, data cutover support.
Key Responsibilities:
 Responsible for working with Business data lead and SAP technical migration lead to develop a data cleansing and migration strategy, execute data cleansing and migration project activities, and perform data conversion during mock conversions, cutover, and go-live phases. Support Reliance data workstream in developing a data governance strategy that includes business metadata definition, data quality measures, and data controls definition. Leverage SAP data migration methodologies and migration tools to execute data migration activities for data extraction, transformation to SAP S/4HANA target, load and validation activities. Bring a business lens to the data workstream required to understand the nature of legacy data elements. Standardize and simplify Reliance data definitions and content to migrate into an SAP S/4HANA master and transactional data schema. Ensure the data elements being migrated supports the user journey within SAP roles and across Reliance business functions. Create processes for Data Life Cycle management so that Reliance can continue data discipline in an SAP production landscape. Responsible for the management of the data migration task lists and update the plan with the latest estimates to complete. Monitor and report on key data cleansing and migration metrics to the Business data lead and SAP Technical migration lead in a business professional manner. Ensure execution of data cleansing and migration tasks as per project plan and escalate when there are risk, issues, or decisions identified. Ensure data issues are remediated and completed on-time – to be measured via volume and quality yields. Manage dependencies between the project milestone dates and data migration project due dates. Support business data lead in setting up appropriate SAP master and operational data governance. Support in building and executing on mock conversion and cutover plans.
Skills, Abilities and Experience:
 5 - 10 years’ experience in SAP implementations and operating SAP in a production environment focused on data cleansing / data migration / and post go-live master data management Worked on at least 1 SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC implementation in the role of a data cleansing &/or data conversion analyst within the past 5 years. Past experience with Banner CIS billing system or Solomon Financial system (Microsoft Dynamics SL) would be an asset. SAP project implementation experience ideally with the following tools: SQL, SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC data conversion, Python, JIRA, SAP HANA architecture, SLT (SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server). SAP Data Services is a must. Ability to work with data within structured and unstructured databases, reporting tools, Excel files, flat files as well as experience analyzing data sets or data results. Exposure and understanding to SAP ETL practices in migrating data from a legacy environment into an SAP greenfield for SAP modules including but not limited to FICO, SD, MM, EAM. Individual must have business acumen and an ability to deal with ambiguity within data sets. Excellent problem-solving and root cause identification skills are required, coupled with a strong business orientation and general pragmatism. Good interpersonal skills are required and the ability to relate well throughout the organization is a necessity. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders across all levels of the organization. Forward thinking and able to foresee consequences of actions, recognizing risks and opportunities. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Teams, SharePoint).
Please note that this position requires a Criminal Background Check and Driver’s Abstract be completed for potential candidates (if applicable). This check must be satisfactory in order for an employment offer to be extended unconditionally.

Leads the Business Systems Analysis & Data Analysis team and is accountable to ensure that business requirements are accurately captured, understood, approved and disseminated appropriately to customers, clients, business stakeholders, and IT teams

Provides strategic direction across all programs

Uses tools and best practices to systematically measure and improve team performance
Facilitates and provides leadership in requirements elicitation meetings by using various elicitation techniques such as use case modeling, prototyping, process flowing, role shadowing, and interviewing
Develop and manage application roadmap and LCM (Lifecycle Management). Collaboratively works with project teams to evaluate technology solutions and to create solutions designs
Formulates the strategic direction for quality assurance and business analysis services
Influences and effectively communicates by developing strong working relationships with project teams and stakeholders
Translates strategies into current and future action plans
Consults and guide on documentation related to release notes, training material, and operational readiness

Manages risk and ensures that proper mitigation plans are implemented and communicated appropriately to the customer and team
Ensures that constant innovation is encouraged in all aspects of business analysis and enforces alignment to industry standards
Leads departmental and cross-team process improvement initiatives
Socialize and communicate IT processes and methodologies with business leaders
Participate as part of the architecture and design team organized to evaluate new and existing business systems and requirements
Excellent communication skills – Ability to translate technical concepts in a format that is understandable and relevant to all stakeholders.
Collaborate with business leaders, and internal software architects and development teams to ensure that the direction, scope, and dependencies are documented.
Possess strong knowledge of both project management, agile delivery and the software development lifecycle (SDLC) of large-scale development projects.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree
Understanding of information technology, computer programming and management information systems
Strong reading, writing, speaking and interpersonal skills
Proven record of complex problem solving and decision making

If you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.
About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of September 30, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$943 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.2 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.
Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

Support Investment Counsellor client reviews and acquisition through the development of tailored ad-hoc performance analytics and reporting.
Deliver return and risk statistics for the use in various investment management tools and platforms.
Produce regular and ad-hoc performance reports and analytics for various investment committees, senior management and business partners across BMO Private Wealth.
Drive increased productivity and quality by identifying opportunities to improve performance measurement applications, processes and reporting.
Ensure that all operating policies, procedures and controls are followed within the team.
Develop, maintain and ensure that all performance measurement policies, procedures and controls are aligned to Compliance requirements.
Keep current on relevant industry practices and incorporate, where suitable, into policy, procedures and controls.
Participate in and lead small to medium size projects which require performance and risk analytics or capability development.
Participate in the implementation of strategic initiatives with respect to performance measurement for BMO Private Wealth as established by senior management.

Broad knowledge of financial products and processes

Organized, resourceful, efficient, accurate and ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Ability to work effectively both independently and part of a team

President’s Choice Bank (PCF) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Loblaw Companies Limited (LCL) and was established to promote President’s Choice Financial® products and services across Canada. PCF is focused on providing everyday payment solutions and services that reward the everyday. Together with the PC Services division of Loblaws Inc. which operates in the same office location, we offer products and services in the following segments:
Payment Cards: The President’s Choice Financial Mastercard® credit card offers PC OptimumTM points for every dollar spent, with no annual fee. The PC MoneyTM Account is the newest addition to the payment products offered and operated by President’s Choice Bank. The PC Money Account works like a bank account and offers PC Optimum points for every purchase, with no monthly fee.
Insurance: PC® home and auto insurance are offered through PC Financial Insurance Broker Inc. and relationships with several insurance companies.
Telecom and Gift Cards: The Mobile Shop, PC mobile prepaid cell phone service, and Gift Cards businesses are focused upon delivering convenience and exceptional value to LCL customers.

LCL is Canada’s largest food distributor and has expanded into certain non-food categories, with operations across the country. LCL concentrates on food retailing with the objective of providing consumers with the best in one-stop shopping for everyday household needs.
PCF and PC Services are important business units within LCL that manage and develop the products and service programs in order to improve the customer experience, maximize value, and provide a platform to enhance customer insights and relationships. Our vision is to make the everyday simple and better
The Senior Analyst of Insights is accountable for delivering tactical and strategic knowledge through data manipulation, dashboarding, and statistical modeling. The Senior Analyst will report directly to the Senior Director of Category Management for PC Telecom and will provide analytics, data integration, and visualization support for all PC Services lines of business (The Mobile Shop, Gift of Choice (Gift Cards), PC Insurance). The Senior Analyst utilizes point-of-sale, loyalty, credit card, and operational data to design/evaluate marketing initiatives, uncover key business insights, and inform product strategy.


What You'll Do:
Manipulate and calculate large complex data from various sources; convey complicated information concisely, simply, and with clarity; and deliver actionable insights that enable business partners to fully understand key drivers of business results
C ollaborate with product and marketing teams to assess opportunities, develop targeting strategies, and measure the results of campaigns & initiatives. Ensure timely communication of strategic and operational results
E mpower business users with their own data through the development/improvement of data cubes, visualizations, and dashboards
Conduct sophisticated multivariate analysis/predictive modeling at the customer, product, and enterprise levels, and recommend appropriate actions to ensure profitable and sustainable business growth
Develop and implement statistical models using machine learning techniques that include linear/logistic regression, decision trees and k-means clustering analysis
On a monthly basis, extract and assemble data to provide product-level KPI reporting to the Category Management team
What You'll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, engineering, statistics or other analytically based discipline). Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Management Analytics or other professional designation is highly preferred
Minimum 3 years proven strong business analytical and modeling experience including statistical and segmentation analysis; data analysis and insight development; dashboarding and data visualization
Must be proficient with SQL; experience working with large datasets in SQL Server, Teradata, and/or other related systems; knowledge of SAS Enterprise Data Miner an asset
Proficiency with programming languages; experience with Python and R strongly preferred
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel & VBA for data exploration, ad-hoc analysis, and reporting
Experience working with dashboarding tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, MS Power BI, etc.)
Experience working with machine learning algorithms including linear/logistic regression, decision trees, k-means clustering analysis
Strategic critical thinker with proven ability to think conceptually (use numbers to tell a story) and make meaning of complex data to develop insights and communicate results
Strong communication skills and desire to work in cross-functional groups

ABOUT CBRE RESEARCH AND CONSULTING
CBRE has a full-time staff of 30 Researchers located across Canada with various education backgrounds including: business, economics, geography, planning, real estate finance, and urban land development. With this unrivalled platform, the Canadian Research Team provides real estate intelligence and insight for all the major markets.
CBRE Research is quoted extensively by both local and national media outlets and is considered to be the industry leader for real estate trends and analysis. Many financial institutions, private owners, equity partners, and pension funds depend on the latest CBRE market intelligence to assist with their key real estate decisions.
CBRE Research also works in conjunction with local market professional who advise and support global and national occupiers.

JOB SUMMARY
Provide research and analysis support of commercial real estate markets, with a primary focus on the Canadian industrial and logistics market. The role will encompass certain regular tasks around the review and analysis of collected data, as well as a range of activities that contribute to and support the team’s production and delivery of high-level research material.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for writing property market reports, with a primary focus on the Canadian industrial and logistics market.
Prepares and produces project/client presentations and reports. Refines drafts and other initial work product to prepare final materials for distribution and production.
Analyzes market trends and incorporates findings into presentations, reports and white papers.
Generates ideas and produces relevant thought leadership outputs. May participate in or lead special research projects in support of business initiatives.
Reviews and evaluates data results collected by themselves and others within the research team to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness of research data and analysis.
Other duties may be assigned.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 2-4 years of industry experience within the logistics and supply chain industry, in particular experience within omnichannel fulfillment, last mile delivery, and micro-fulfillment.
Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university, preferably in Real Estate, Economics, Finance, Geography; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers.
Positive work attitude and ability to work in a team environment.
Ability to work well under pressure, with multiple competing deadlines.

REASONING ABILITY
Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents.
Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations.
Requires strong analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
Ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of data preferred but not required.

Job Title: Mercer Executive Career Consulting Analyst - Toronto - Summer 2021 Contract
Job Description:
At Mercer, we promote a culture where you can bring your authentic self to work. When you join us, you bring your inclusive energy and enthusiasm to a team that values you personally and professionally – regardless of who you are, what you look like, where you were raised or born, who you love or what your religious beliefs are. You are welcome here.
Mercer’s Career Consulting Team is seeking an Analyst who will take on a 4-month contract for our Toronto office. Depending on performance and business conditions, there is the possibility the contract could be converted to full-time work after the 4-month term.
About The Career Business
Mercer's Career business segment helps our clients around the world engage their talent to drive business performance. Career consultants partner with HR leaders, board members, and top-level executives to optimize business performance through strategies that enable organizations to better reward and engage their people. We stay ahead of the competition by providing best-in-class information, unsurpassed global reach, dedicated support services, and innovative solutions. We bring clients a range of integrated solutions across five practice areas: Workforce Rewards, Executive Rewards, Workforce Planning & Analytics, Communications, and HR Transformation.
What Can You Expect?
As an Executive Career Consulting Analyst in the rewards practice, you will work with a broad range of clients and industries in a stimulating environment, participating as an integral member of project teams to diagnose issues and design strategic human resource solutions that support clients’ success. You will provide quantitative and qualitative analytical support to senior consultants and draw meaningful conclusions from client and market data. You also can expect to:
Work with clients on a wide range of executive and director compensation and governance issues, including executive rewards strategy and philosophy development, incentive design, performance management and goal setting, proxy voting, and performance and payout modeling.
Conduct research and analysis to understand industry and organization-specific issues, including business strategy, corporate performance, and compensation and rewards trends.
Work with other members of the Career team to develop client recommendations.
Prepare client presentations, including recommendations presented to senior management, boards of directors, and executives.
Example projects include:
Executive and board of director’s compensation benchmarking for publicly traded companies.
Developing executive rewards programs following mergers and acquisitions.
Research and design short and long-term incentive programs.
What's In It For You?
The opportunity to work with some of the smartest and most energetic people in the industry, who will nurture, challenge and enable you.
A dynamic, collaborative and inclusive culture, where diversity is embraced – and you are celebrated and appreciated for who you are.
The opportunity to network, share views, and learn from others by getting involved with our Business Resource Groups: PRIDE, Women@Mercer, Racial & Ethnic Diversity and Rising Professionals Network.
The chance to make a positive difference in your local community by using your paid time off to volunteer through events organized by Mercer Cares, our community outreach and volunteerism BRG.
A huge variety of virtual learning and development resources to support your personal and professional growth.
What You Need To Have?
A bachelor's degree including significant coursework in areas such as finance, economics, engineering, statistics, mathematics and/or accounting.
Consulting, business, finance/banking, accounting, HR, and/or economics internship experience preferred.
Interest in obtaining a relevant professional designation (e.g., CFA, CPA or MBA) would be considered an asset.
Strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative, and working knowledge of Excel.
Experience in data analysis, financial modelling, and presentation design.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Intellectual curiosity, seeking opportunities to develop new skills.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines and changing client needs.
Superior organizational skills and strong attention to detail.
What's Next?
In order to be considered, submit your complete application by providing a cover letter, your resume and your most recent transcript in PDF format, via our career section by March 19, 2021.
We will review completed application submissions and you will be contacted if you are selected for an interview.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, Mercer will provide a reasonable accommodation to employees and prospective employees to the point of undue hardship upon request and as required in respect of the individual’s particular restrictions and limitations. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, feel free to contact Stephanie Joseph at stephanie.joseph@mmc.com.
About Mercer
Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 25,000 employees are based in 44 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 76,000 colleagues and annual revenue of $17 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit https://www.me.mercer.com/. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer.

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
Commercial Banking and Wealth Management works in close collaboration with CIBC’s Personal and Small Business and Capital Markets strategic business units to lead and manage the organic growth, client retention and profitability of CIBC’s businesses. Commercial Banking in Canada includes the development and implementation of a strategic plan that effectively integrates the diverse activities of Commercial Banking including delivery network, specialized industries, business solutions, segment strategy, deposits and lending practices as well as across all functional responsibilities.
Wealth Management business in Canada includes Asset Management, Wood Gundy and Private Wealth Management, which is focused on providing excellence in relationship-based advice, service and product solutions that meet the needs of CIBC’s high-net-worth private wealth individuals and institutional clients
As part of the Private Wealth Management National Office group, The Business Intelligence team focuses on providing detailed insights into the performance of the business to help enhance the client experience and drive asset and revenue growth
The Analyst will be in a dynamic position of being responsible for the generation and distribution of high priority dashboards with proactive, actionable insights across all aspects of the Private Wealth business. The successful candidate will be able to go beyond analytics/reporting to provide actionable insights to senior leadership. The role also supports Executive decision-making by ensuring that important industry and innovation trends impacting Private Wealth Management are identified and analyzed.
How You’ll Succeed
Business Intelligence – You will support the delivery of performance dashboards and reporting tools that go beyond the numbers to provide business insights to help influence decisions. You will assist with the production of Strategic Initiatives reporting and business performance reporting in addition to investigation of issues impeding progress. Research specific trends and distil key insights for use in PWM Leadership strategy discussions. You’ll build presentations and business cases to support strategic initiatives linked to organizational goals and clearly communicate key findings from analytical research. You will support projects of varying levels of complexity or components of strategic initiatives that are aligned with CIBC's strategy.
Business Effectiveness– Actively seek and evaluate opportunities to improve existing processes and work with key stakeholders to implement changes where appropriate. Improve and automate processes using a variety of tools to drive operational efficiency. You’ll uncover and identify opportunities to improve the client experience and business effectiveness by leveraging statistical approaches against multiple sources of data. Work collaboratively with business partners, and effectively leverage their resources and knowledge to achieve project/client goals and complete deliverables on-time. You’ll act as a change promoter by finding innovative ways to encourage a culture where processes are continually improved.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in. You have project management experience: plan, prioritize and organize work effectively, to meet deadlines, while managing competing priorities. You can demonstrate proficiency in working with large datasets: both structured and unstructured data, using macros, VBA, or programming language such as SAS, SQL or related. Proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and other MS Office tools.
You have a degree or diploma in. Post-Secondary education in Mathematics, Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Actuarial Science.
You give meaning to data. A strong passion for data, charts, analysis, trends, and evangelizing data usage.
You understand that success is in the details. You synthesize information quickly and accurately and apply concepts based on understanding of financial markets and key Private Wealth Management services. You can draw insights and note significant changes based on strong attention to detail.
You act like an owner. You are someone that is a self-starter and has the ability to thrive on a high-degree of independence and ownership.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. You build and maintain effective working relationships with internal groups, other business units and internal partners within CIBC.
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Job Description
Given the current circumstances, the resource will be working from home, 100% of time. As working conditions return to normal, they will be expected to be onsite.
Business Overview
The BI & CRM support group provides support for Customer Relationship Management, Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence applications for Fidelity Investments Canada.
What You Will Do
You will be responsible for all aspects related to development and support of ETL data integration solutions for Fidelity Canada. This includes analyzing data and developing Informatica Power Center mappings and SQL & PL/SQL code based on specific business requirements; administration of Informatica Power Center tool and IPAAS; working closely with other team members to ensure application availability, system maintenance, and on-call support.

Analyze data requirements and their impact to the system
Perform administrative duties for Informatica Power Center application
Perform administrative duties in Informatica IPAAS
Perform ETL processes in Snowflake
Execute unit tests to ensure the accuracy of code changes, and to verify that data integrity and performance requirements are met
Participate in team’s on-call support schedule, works on incident and enhancement/maintenance tickets assignments and delivers excellent technical support
Create and maintains technical documents, including data models
What We’re Looking For
University Degree, preferably in Computer Science
3+ years of experience with SQL and PL/SQL development
1+ years of experience with ETL development, preferably with Informatica Power Center
1+ years of development experience with Oracle database.
1+ years of experience with Snowflake data warehouse environment
The Skills You Bring
Experience in a Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence environment
Experience with data modelling tools
Development experience in Mutual Funds industry is an asset
Strong technical and data analysis skills
Excellent problem solving skills
Customer service oriented
Good communication skills

Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose
Contributes to the overall success of the Data Governance and Analytics team within Risk Management and Business Controls / Global Wealth Management in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. The incumbent takes effective ownership of requests from stakeholders and ensures results generate value-added actionable insights pertaining to customer behavior, channel performance, sales productivity, and key compliance/regulatory, financial, and operational risk indicators.
Accountabilities
Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.

Source, cleanse, transform, and interpret the data needed to deliver reporting needs.

Source, cleanse, transform, and interpret the data needed to deliver analytics projects.
Use statistical and data mining techniques to identify insights and make recommendations
Assists stakeholders in identifying and developing analytics solutions to meet business objectives.
Prepare and present findings to senior management.
Builds effective working relationships within the team and with key business units and corporate functions including Compliance, Finance, IT&S, Enterprise Data Office, etc.

Champions a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.

Required – University degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.

Experience with business intelligence tools and in building analytics or financial modelling.
Excellent mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills to synthesis and summarize large data sets gathered from multiple sources.
Strong communication skills (verbal and written) to present results to senior management.
Knowledge of the mutual fund business, distribution channels, and regulatory framework is an asset.

Job Title: Business Data Analyst, Client Service Centre, Client & People Services - contract/secondment for 22 months
Job Description:
OVERVIEW:

JOB PURPOSE:
The Business Data Analyst, Client Service Centre (CSC) supports the efficient operation of the CSC, focusing on the activities of the Director and the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst. The Business Data Analyst uses business analysis and data analysis expertise to gather, examine, interpret, evaluate and report on CSC data and processes. This includes having an understanding of the workflow and business processes followed by the departments of the CSC, as well as the data managed by those departments. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for business analysis activities, including process documentation and requirements gathering, as well as data analysis related work such as the provision and analysis of data in response to requests for information from the Executive Director of Client & People Services, the Director (CSC), the CSC management team, other Law Society divisions, Benchers, Committees and Working Groups. The Business Data Analyst facilitates project and task execution as assigned, manages competing priorities, and applies a high degree of professionalism in managing stakeholders and their expectations.
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
A university degree (preferred) or college diploma in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analysis, or a related discipline, coupled with relevant, ongoing education or experience in project management, business analysis, business intelligence, reporting and information systems.
A minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in the fields of business analysis and data analysis, preferably in a legal or regulatory environment, which includes the responsibility of data analysis and reporting, as well as requirements gathering, process redesign and documentation.
Excellent grasp of delivering superior client service.
Knowledge of the rules, regulations and guidelines of the Law Society, Client Service Centre and the business units in the CSC.
Strong interpersonal skills related to needs identification, business process consultation and relationship management at all levels of the organization.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to facilitate meetings, effectively respond to requests for data and statistics, and to share and document information.
Solid understanding of data and analytics.
Knowledge and experience with reporting tools.
Strong understanding of business unit processes, workflows and management control structures.
Speaks in a clear, articulate manner, using audience-appropriate language and terminology, for individual and/or group situations.
Advanced Excel skills: knowledge of pivot tables and VLOOKUP required
Proficiency in word processing (WORD, Adobe PRO), spreadsheets (EXCEL), database software (AS400, Inspector, IRIS, Access), content management platforms (SharePoint), and the internet and intranet.
Ability to conduct complex data analysis and reporting with business intelligence software (IBM Cognos Business Insight Advanced, SAP Crystal Reports).
Solid understanding of technology, particularly application of technical solutions to work processes and procedures.
Ability to perform data reconciliations between multiple platforms with similar data sets to ensure data quality.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Client/Customer Service Planning
Works closely with the Director (CSC), the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, and the CSC management team to coordinate the planning, allocation and prioritization of resources with respect to CSC operations.
Reviews reports and other documents relevant to data requirements and provides feedback to the Director (CSC).
Independently uses business intelligence software to perform analyses of varying complexity in order to respond to internal and external requests for data/statistics.
Develops working relationships with multiple level contacts from business units within the CSC, IT, and other departments/divisions across the Law Society.
Together with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, manages and oversees the UAT testing of complex technology projects, communicates issues, and recommends possible solutions or improvements.
The Business Data Analyst is responsible for providing service to licensees and the public related to CSC processes and data/statistics, and for providing technical support and analysis to the Director (CSC) and members of the CSC management team to ensure timely completion of projects or tasks relating to the CSC.
Client/Customer Service Delivery
Provides effectively, timely responses to internal and external requests/inquiries and leads/coordinates the resolution of concerns relating to CSC data and reports.
Contributes to ongoing continuous improvement activities in the CSC.
Collaborates with all CSC departments and other departments in Client & People Services, and outside Client & People Services, on issues relating to the CSC.
Prepares statistical analyses and reports for the Director (CSC).
Performance Goals, Targets and Standards
Monitors and reports on the achievement of existing performance goals and standards, and assists the Director (CSC) and CSC managers to establish and monitor departmental and CSC goals with respect to quality and timeliness.
Engages in continuous process improvement with respect to the databases and IT systems used in the CSC, tracking and resolving end user issues, identifying and addressing requirements, and managing testing.
Works closely with the managers to implement improvements to system capabilities and work processes with respect to electronic capture and communication of information.
Works with staff across the CSC to coordinate major projects and Law Society initiatives, including ensuring that appropriate test scripts are developed.
Team Membership
Is a key member of the Client Service Centre team and ensures that the activities of the office of the Director (CSC) and the CSC occur in a systematic, coordinated and coherent fashion.
Collaborates with the Director (CSC) and CSC Managers to plan and align operational requirements with electronic and personnel resources.
Works with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst and the CSC management team to provide support and coordination as required, ensuring that the CSC’s objectives are met.
Collaborates with staff from departments/divisions across the Law Society to complete complex data/statistics requests.
Works with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst and IT to complete the analysis and data validation of database functions, with respect to the databases and IT systems used in the CSC.
The Business Data Analyst works with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to provide leadership to staff in the CSC through guidance, training and problem solving in order for the CSC to provide accurate and timely information to clients accessing the CSC.
ACCOMMODATION:

The Law Society of Ontario values and respects diversity. We are committed to creating an accessible, barrier-free and inclusive workplace, in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please make any requirement you may have for a Code-protected recruitment-process accommodation known when contacted. If you are unable to apply to this position due to the requirement for an accommodation of any kind, please email us at recruitment@lso.ca.

That means moving them to the cloud, helping them build the workplace of tomorrow, and enabling them to make smarter decisions about their technology portfolio. By doing these things, we create success faster and in circumstances otherwise not possible.

We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.

The impact you will have:

The Analyst, Risk and Compliance will help safeguard Softchoice by building security awareness, helping with the management of risk and compliance issues and requests, and administering and maintaining Softchoice’s policies and procedures.

What you’ll do:

Security Awareness
Provide security awareness training.
Help to create educational content using a wide variety of content formats and different distribution techniques.
Help deliver the program goals, objectives, and tactics.
Work proactively to consider key cybersecurity risks, and how to help address them via training programs and process enhancements.
Initiates, facilitates, and promotes activities to increase the level of information protection awareness within the company.
Management of Risk and Compliance Issues and Requests
Point of Contact to investigate reported information security issues and escalate to appropriate teams within the organization.
Forensic analysis/Investigation assistance where required.
Produce reports for management related to information security.
Analyze data to provide insights and recommendations to mitigate any potential fraud risks.
Participate in/or lead Risk and Compliance department transactional investigations.
Participate in Incident Response Team as a Risk and Security SME
Provide responses to customer security and compliance questionnaires, RFPs etc. as they pertain to supported programs.
Create and/or participate in self-assessments, audits and testing exercises to ensure compliance.
Governance
Assist in the creation and maintenance of Information Security policies, standards, and guidelines.
Maintain database of attestations, certifications, questionnaires, and compliance information.
Execute program governance as it relates to Risk and Compliance for various programs and certifications.
Maintain and update policy and procedure documents as required to meet compliance standards.
Liaise with internal departments to obtain compliance data to maintain and update databases on a regular basis.

What you’ll bring to the table:

Foundational understanding of security-related threats and risks
Knowledge of quote to cash processes
Basic understanding of auditing procedures
Exposure to privacy legislation and regulation, including PIPEDA, HIPAA, GDPR, CASL, CPPA
Strong research and analytical skills
Customer service focus
Ability to work with and maintain highly confidential information
Highly organized & extreme attention to detail
Excellent written, verbal, communication, and reading comprehension skills
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Demonstrated initiative
Ability to manage a high volume of work, including ability to multi-task and prioritize workload;
Technology experience – Computer proficiency; able to use Microsoft suite of tools effectively (e.g. Word, Excel) with aptitude to learn new software quickly.

Some reasons why our employees love working here:

Softchoice has been recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 15 consecutive years.
Softchoice has been certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States for several years.
We offer meaningful work that drives professional development.
Our team members have 2 paid volunteer days per year to give back to a cause of their choice.
We offer an opportunity to build a career in the technology industry.
We have raised over $3 Million through our team member run charity Softchoice Cares.
You will have the opportunity to take an ownership position here at Softchoice.
Inclusion & Equal opportunity employment:

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging. Individuals seeking employment at Softchoice are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to asktalentacquisition@softchoice.com. We are committed to work with you to best meet your needs.

Our commitment to your experience:

We are committed to the safety of all candidates and team members. With that in mind, we have implemented virtual interviewing for all candidates. We understand that you may need to interview with distractions around you (such as children or furry friends) and we will most likely be doing the same.

For team members joining Softchoice, you will be onboarding remotely. Rest assured, offering a human and inspiring onboarding experience is our top priority.

Prior to commencing employment:

Completion of a satisfactory criminal record check, education verification and reference checks are required for employment.

The Data Engineer reports directly to the Director, Business Intelligence & Analytics, and is responsible for the creation and implementation of business intelligence solutions. They will act as a subject matter expert (SME) for the design, development and maintenance of the data pipeline and storage requirements as they relate to the needs of the organization. This person works across functional areas to ensure quality and consistency in services.


The role also involves a consultative aspect by acting as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for internal business units and customers.
Key Responsibilities
Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for data storage requirements as they relate to the needs of the organization.
Design and Develop ETL Pipeline to ingest data.
Perform the GAP analysis between applications to migrate them to newer solutions.
Designs, develops, implements, and installs defined SQL Server database systems and maintains enterprise level database systems.
Testing, fixing, improving, and deploying software and solutions.
Must be able to troubleshoot and correct database problems and to proactively maintain the health of database systems.
Provide guidance on the structure of data sources, drafting of queries, compiling of operational type business intelligence data to various departments.
Write complex scripts to preprocess files and schedule ETL jobs.
Meeting project milestones and delivering working solutions.
Handle all requests with a high standard of quality and professionalism; determine the best course of action to ensure resolution meets established standards.
Coordinate activities with business units. Provide analysis and interpretation in clear user language.
Document activities as required in compliance with established controls, delivery schedule, process documents.
Maintain knowledge of business unit policies and procedures, systems, and requirements.
Identify opportunities for process improvements, document them and collaborate with the team to move them forward.
Participate in department objectives; including quality and productivity standards and other duties as assigned within the department.
Assisting customers (internal and external) through each phase of the software lifecycle, including requirements, delivery, and support.
Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.
In this role, incumbent will gain experience and knowledge to evolve from focusing on single/defined database systems to multiple database systems with broader interdependencies.
Have an interest in coaching and mentorship for other members of the BI&A team.
Qualifications
5+ years of experience designing and developing ETL jobs.
5+ years of experience working on relational databases and writing SQL queries.
5+ years of experience using Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, SSRS, Power Pivot, Power View, Power BI)
5+ years of experience with related scripting languages and techniques (Python, PowerShell, Rest API etc.)
5+ years of experience with working on cloud technologies for data pipelines, data warehouses.
Post-secondary diploma or degree in a computer science-related course.
Knowledge in reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (Power BI preferred).
Experience with ServiceNow considered an asset.
Experience with unstructured data (JSON) considered an asset.
Be self-motivated, organized, and detailed oriented.
Strong leadership and motivational skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong problem solving and diagnostic skills.
Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.
An interest in, and comfort with, technical concepts related to network and information security.

About Oanda

OANDA Corporation is an innovator in computer engineering and financial modeling that provides Internet-based forex trading and currency information services to everyone, from individuals to large corporations; portfolio managers to financial institutions. We are a market maker and a trusted source for currency data with one of the world's largest historical, high frequency, filtered currency databases. We move billions of dollars a day (10 times more money than Paypal!!) in a market with daily capitalization of $4 trillion, dwarfing both the US bond and equity markets!! We continue to experience tremendous growth since our start in 1996, providing unprecedented opportunities for our employees to redefine the forex market with new products we create.

Who we are:

We are an international Product team consisting of product managers and business analysts, who work on a variety of Oanda customer services and business processes. The finance technology area is moving faster than ever before and we are looking for a passionate and experienced colleague to join us.

What you’ll do

Collect project requirements from both internal teams / outsourcing partners and translate these into detailed functional specifications, concrete deliverables, user stories and test plans.
Evaluate and document processes and workflows
Document relationships with 3rd party partners ensuring commercials and services are clearly defined and understood.
Provide insight into and implement optimizations to operational best-practices related to customer facing products and services, client revenue and performance, internal processes, and regulatory compliance
Create and maintain system and user documentation
Perform system and user acceptance testing
Conducts training sessions, software demonstrations and launch activities as new features and processes are introduced
Act as a bridge between our development and business teams.
Build, refine and maintain product backlogs while working closely with product management to define priorities.
Collaborate with cross functional team resources in delivering work in a lean way that builds trust, ownership and accountability.

Who you are

Self-motivated and results-oriented.
Excellent communicator and team player
Capable of making experiment-tested and data-validated conclusions
Demonstrable evidence of analyzing and documenting complex business processes.
Continuous improvement and change management mindset, questioning conventional wisdom and driving change to improve processes and client experience

Desired Skills & Experience

Solid experience working in a similar role
Systems design and trouble-shooting skills.
Working knowledge of Scrum and Agile methodologies and the proven ability to apply them effectively.
Experience of integrating and working with 3rd party products and vendors
Experience documenting and designing new processes and procedures in a dynamic environment.
Degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology, or related experience.


OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

3+ years analyst experience with sales analysis or support, financial analysis, econometrics, or statistics

Salesforce experience
Data warehouse experience

Excellent analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze large volumes of raw data, draw conclusions, and develops actionable recommendations.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills proven ability to build and maintain strong cross functional relationships
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Expert-level Excel skills
History of balancing multiple time-sensitive priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines
Self-starter with ability to work independently with little supervision
SQL Server Management experience
Project management experience

CDW is a leading technology solutions provider to business, government, education and healthcare organizations in Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom. Job Description:
Adresse :
234 Simcoe Street
Groupe de famille d'emploi :
Analyses données et rapports
Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy.
Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies.
Performs data profiling and data analyses.
Documents and maintains data flow specifications.
Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights.

Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain.
Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements.
Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making.
Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model.
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions.
Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security.
Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups.
Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes.
Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
