Typically between 1 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle).
Skilled in working with BI tools such as PowerBI, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks.
Proficient in working with SQL
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.

À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. At Aecon, we’re building the future and our people are at the heart of everything we do. We're always looking for exceptional talent to work on our exciting and ever-expanding project portfolios. We are focused on being the #1 Canadian Infrastructure Company and the first choice employer in our industry.


Position Overview
Faster. Smarter. Safer. This is how Aecon Utilities is committed to delivering projects. We simple do it better. We are Ontario’s premier utility contractor and are ready to become Canada’s #1 utility construction provider.

Reporting to the Project Manager, the Data Analyst will be a key member of the project team working on the development and implementation of the Aecon Utilities digital footprint. Post-implementation, the focus of this role will shift to the development and maintenance of all in field data collection, dashboards, KPI's and predictive analytics in support of improving operational efficiency, utilization, and productivity. The ideal candidate will have a combination of technical and analytical capability, as well as experience and knowledge in construction operations.

Key Responsibilities
Key member of the project team accountable for the development, setup, and implementation of a Telematics system and digital solutions across several Aecon divisions
Accountable for the design, development and ongoing monitoring of KPIs, productivity reports, dashboards and predictive analytics to improve operational efficiency and productivity.
“Makes sense of the data” in a way that can be read, understood, and actioned by Operations teams.
Conduct detailed analysis of data to identify anomalies and patterns and make recommendations for outcomes.
Utilizes data to anticipate gaps, identify unknowns and develop solutions.
Maintain the quality, accuracy and consistency of our system configuration and data.
Responsible for the creation, maintenance, review and improvement of processes and training documentation
Work collaboratively with the Operations, Fleet and AeconONE teams to understand business requirements and develop best practices and processes.
Participate in the planning and implementation of future system enhancements.
Provide practical assistance and technical support to operations, as necessary.

Required Knowledge and Experience
Post-secondary education [Specific requirement?] coupled with a minimum of 3-5 [?] years of related work experience.
Experience in construction operations, with a solid understanding of equipment and fleet requirements, including tracking, production, utilization, etc.
Strong computer skills – MS Office, SAP and Power BI Applications
Strong ability to translate business requirements into practical solutions.
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong oral, written and interpersonal skills.
Experience with Telematics / Fleet Management systems is an asset.
Experience developing dashboards, KPIs and analytics in support of business operational excellence.
Ability to foster a cooperative environment between different operational groups and functions.
Ability to see a task from conception to implementation.
Ability to work independently, accurately and under pressure.
Willingness to travel as required.

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.
The Data Insights & Analysis (DIA) team provides insightful review, perspective and direction on operational strategy and performance of Bell’s business units. DIA belongs to a shared services group that typically engages on projects and work streams that impact customer experience, wireless sales and marketing, customer onboarding, finance and operations. DIA focuses on end-to-end business intelligence solutions that support information delivery within business lines and to senior executives across Bell’s business units.
Team members are experts in business strategy and operations, analytical and strategic, yet highly pragmatic and results-oriented. As a Senior Analyst in DIA, you will work on projects that take on some of the most cutting-edge business solutions in the Telecommunications industry. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence your knowledge of strategy and operations combined with your communication skills and analytical rigour will shape the way that we do business.
What we need from you:
You must care! Care about your work. Care about your clients. Care about your colleagues.
Passion and enthusiasm for analyzing large datasets and making decisions – we are here to make money!
Ability to work with and make appropriate decisions with incomplete datasets.
Help the business “connect the dots” and understand “the big picture” – and to never loose sight of this.
Interest in using data and technologies to help solve business problems.
What we would like from you:
An degree in business/commerce, engineering, or mathematics. Nevertheless, if you have an English degree and are interested, then please apply.
Experience in telecommunications, retail or consulting industries.
Experience with business and marketing analysis.
Experience managing and mentoring team members.
Effective process/project management skills and the ability to navigate and influence stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to comfortably interact with partners and executive management.
Experience with SQL (Teradata), SAS and visualization software (MicroStrategy/Tableau).

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
The role of the Director of Business Systems Analysis & Data Analysis is to manage the production of complete, correct, feasible, prioritized, traceable, and verifiable business, functional, and non-functional requirements by utilizing various requirements elicitation techniques. This position manages requirements throughout the project lifecycle including RTM (Requirement Traceability Matrix) and QA (Quality Assurance).
Responsibilities for this role include:
Leads the Business Systems Analysis & Data Analysis team and is accountable to ensure that business requirements are accurately captured, understood, approved and disseminated appropriately to customers, clients, business stakeholders, and IT teams
Implements deliverables, ensuring quality and on-time delivery
Leads by metrics, providing an executive business analysis dashboard for projects
Provides strategic direction across all programs
Develop and implement quality assurance framework, governance and resources.
Directs the development of business, functional, and non-functional requirements as a member of a large cross-functional team
Uses tools and best practices to systematically measure and improve team performance
Facilitates and provides leadership in requirements elicitation meetings by using various elicitation techniques such as use case modeling, prototyping, process flowing, role shadowing, and interviewing
Develop and manage application roadmap and LCM (Lifecycle Management). Collaboratively works with project teams to evaluate technology solutions and to create solutions designs
Formulates the strategic direction for quality assurance and business analysis services
Influences and effectively communicates by developing strong working relationships with project teams and stakeholders
Translates strategies into current and future action plans
Consults and guide on documentation related to release notes, training material, and operational readiness
Provides accurate executive status updates to project teams
Manages risk and ensures that proper mitigation plans are implemented and communicated appropriately to the customer and team
Ensures that constant innovation is encouraged in all aspects of business analysis and enforces alignment to industry standards
Leads departmental and cross-team process improvement initiatives
Socialize and communicate IT processes and methodologies with business leaders
Participate as part of the architecture and design team organized to evaluate new and existing business systems and requirements
Excellent communication skills – Ability to translate technical concepts in a format that is understandable and relevant to all stakeholders.
Collaborate with business leaders, and internal software architects and development teams to ensure that the direction, scope, and dependencies are documented.
Possess strong knowledge of both project management, agile delivery and the software development lifecycle (SDLC) of large-scale development projects.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree
Understanding of information technology, computer programming and management information systems
Strong reading, writing, speaking and interpersonal skills
Proven record of complex problem solving and decision making
Minimum 10- 12 years of experience in managing Business Systems Analysis & Data Analysis personnel.
You have 5+ years of technical leadership experience working within large investment finance organizations, including leading centralized or matrixed teams
Understanding and experience in Business Analysis Process (SDLC, documentation procedures) experience.
Information Technology project experience within a Capital Markets environment is required.

If you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.
About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of September 30, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$943 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.2 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

We are a fully remote company based in Canada. We are looking for a data analyst to handle all our data operations. We are currently using hull.io to fetch data from our MySQL database, hubspot, chargebee and intercom. We need someone to manage this operation to unify and map our data across these platforms. TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
TD Direct Investing is Canada’s largest direct investing brokerage, empowering over 1 million self-directed investors and traders with its full spectrum of powerful solutions and innovative tools to manage their investments with ease and confidence. As a member of the TD Direct Investing Product & Strategy team, you have the opportunity to work with results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people who share your passion to help our clients, and one another, to succeed.
Job Description
Reporting to Senior Manager, Strategic Insights & Analysis, and working alongside a team of analysts, this role will help drive and support TD Direct Investing's client engagement and acquisition initiatives from an analytical, process development, and execution perspective. This role will primarily focus on providing data-driven insights and decision support to various business initiatives, acquiring data in support of such work, as well as helping to develop robust processes and procedures, and executing thereon.
Key accountabilities include:
Developing expertise in querying various DI and pan-Wealth data-sources, and work with Wealth and Enterprise partners to obtain relevant data, to enable deeper analysis and the generation of value-added insights
Building understanding of DI business results and underlying drivers based on client segments and also along demographic, geographic, platform and product-based lines.
Performing and evolving DI's client segmentation analysis to support targeted organic growth initiatives and value proposition enhancements
Analyzing, modelling, and forecasting internal KPIs, considering variables of profitability, behaviour, attitudes, channel preferences, demographics, and values
Building robust processes in support of client acquisition and engagement initiatives, including auditable procedural documentation
Executing on established procedures and control requirements, and ensuring proper documentation
Liaising with business stakeholders on project needs, data specifications, timelines and priorities
Contributing to a culture of continuous improvement (through process improvements, automation, improved documentation, etc.)
Job Requirements
Post-secondary undergraduate degree, preferably with a business/accounting, mathematics, engineering, or computer science focus
Post-undergrad work experience in business/product roles, finance/accounting, and/or analytics/data science
Familiarity with self-directed investing and/or the broader wealth management industry, a plus
Experience with data extraction, manipulation, and visualization tools (e.g. SQL, Python, Alteryx, Tableau) preferred
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint, including experience developing business documents and executive presentations with clear, compelling communications
Ability to understand business questions and issues, think strategically, synthesize information quickly
Strong analytical and communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely
Comfortable in operating in a dynamic, fast-paced, and sometimes ambiguous environment
Ability to independently manage deadlines while multitasking between different projects

Position Purpose:

The Alectra Green Energy & Technology Centre (GRE&T Centre) makes energy innovations come to life by identifying, evaluating, developing and accelerating the commercialization of emerging, clean, and customer-friendly energy solutions, creating sustainable values for customers, shareholders and communities it serves. The Grid Innovation team at the GRE&T Centre is focused on enabling a more sustainable electricity grid, by unleashing the potential of grid modernization technologies and integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into local electricity grid. The Business Analyst will provide support to the project initiatives undertaken by Grid Innovation team. The incumbent will work closely with the Grid Innovation team and provide technical support in delivering pilot projects such as Non-Wires alternative (“NWA”) project aimed at designing and operating local distribution energy market that enables distributed energy resources (DER) to participate in grid services; defer or reduce the need for wires investment on distribution grid.

Responsibilities:

Participate in daily project development meeting with the software system vendor; document, update and maintain issues tracking system, capturing live issues and progress on software development.
Analyze business functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and business rules; review and update functional specification documents as necessary to ensure it is up-to-date and address business requirement changes.
Assist with the solution design discussion including database structure, user interface, customer experience etc.
Ensure that changes and features to the system development are properly submitted, updated, assigned, escalated in the current development ticketing system.
Create, deliver, and maintain user stories, process workflows, mockups and system test cases.
Conduct user acceptance testing, system integration testing, regression testing and all other Q&A testing, ensuring system is functioning as designed.
Discover, record and log system issues, defects and resolutions; participate in debug solutioning, fix and QA testing.
Identify areas for improvement and make appropriate recommendations to the project team pertaining to best practices, processes, templates, workflows and methodologies.
Coordinate and support the project teammates and management to ensure alignment of projects and timelines.
Ensure deliverables and feedback needed by project team and vendor software development teams are provided in a timely manner to ensure overall delivery of projects on-time and within budget.
Collaborate and interact with a variety of team members and business units to coordinate project activities; perform demos and customers/users support to the system.
Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis of new and existing data sets and research reports, including advanced modelling and analysis through Excel or similar tools, and develop recommendations based on findings.
Develop written reports and presentations as required to communicate project updates, share research findings and provide topical backgrounders for internal and external stakeholders.
Maintain collaborative working relationships with vendor project team members and support collective efforts on projects delivery.
Provide project support as needed to support the achievement of departmental objectives and other initiatives being carried on within the GRE&T Centre
Other duties as assigned

Education & Specialized Knowledge:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited institution field
Direct experience with both classical waterfall software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies (i.e. scrum)
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications including MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.
General knowledge of the energy markets and utility industries

Experience:

Minimum of 3 years of business analyst or related work experience demonstrating the range of duties expected for this position
Experience in Azure DevOps system environment
Experience in project management on web-based software development project
Knowledge of energy policy and regulation, especially related to distributed energy resources is a strong asset
Experience working in Energy/Utility and/or Data Analytics sector is a strong asset

Skills/Abilities/Competencies:

Strong analytical, problem resolution, technical, application / system troubleshooting skills with the ability to think clearly and resolve issues efficiently under pressure.
Excellent organizational and time management skills with high attention to detail in a demanding, deadline-driven environment.
Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate effectively with other team members as needed.
Excellent data gathering techniques supported by strong interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to use creative and strategic thinking to identify and develop solutions for customers
Demonstrated skills in research and planning to support strategy development and commercialization planning
Ability to build and maintain strong collaborative and collegial working relationships with team members, and internal and external stakeholders
Strong oral, written and presentation skills, with the ability to learn, apply and explain information in an organized and concise way
Self-motivated; ability to work both independently and as a team player
Strong results orientation, with excellent attention to detail
Must hold and maintain a valid class “G” driver’s license

Janssen Inc. a Johnson & Johnson company is looking to hire a Senior Corporate Accounts & Operations Analyst to be located in the Toronto office.
 At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, metabolic and chronic diseases and women's health. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen Inc. is a member of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Please visit http://www.janssen.ca/ for more information.
Position Overview
This position is responsible for managing trade activities and drive distribution operation strategy at Janssen. This person is a subject matter expert at an operational and tactical level. This position will also serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external dealings pertaining to our direct trade partners and supply chain operations. The main purpose of this role is to develop, maintain and oversee good working relationships with wholesalers, other industry partners and internal cross functional partners. This position will play an important role in the creation and execution of the wholesale distribution strategy allowing the delivery of strong business results, with high corporate compliance, against Janssen commercial objectives.
Core responsibilities:
Trade Account Management - Leads and manages the operational business relationship with Direct Trade Partners executing monthly meetings, facilitating quarterly business reviews; publishing performance metrics, areas of focus, and joint action plans. Report Direct Trade Partner adherence to Distribution Services Agreements (inventory plan execution, service fees, distribution service value, trade data and market share). Hold Trade Partners accountable for performance. Ensure data integrity and adequate data flows between Trade Partners and Janssen. Leverages Trade Partner relationships and knowledge to analyze & interpret trade data, identifying actionable insights to develop/create innovative business opportunities, driving value back to Janssen.
Janssen Business Unit Partnerships – Interacts and collaborates with internal business partners across functions (co-lead S&OP’s providing market inventory position and wholesaler shipments to pharmacies), creating a partnership environment around delivering shared defined business objectives to influence and maximize financial outcomes for Janssen to enable market growth. Member of the new product launch, acquisition and divestiture teams; develop pipeline launch distribution strategies and ensure products are distributed successfully and on-time. Provide feedback on market demand, inventory and other relevant information to the launch team.
Data Analytics and Insights - Review and monitor daily Trade Sales to ensure purchases are aligned with individual Brand demand. On a monthly basis; executes the delivery of accurate, relevant and “real time” demand analytics that deliver insights that help to shape quarter end and year end approach. Publish monthly BUD decks and shipment reports, delivering key updates and insights to month over month changes. Ensure integrity of information flowing from wholesalers into the Qlik environment.
Distribution Operations - Executes Janssen supply chain processes to deliver product to Trade Partners/Pharmacies/Patients, in full and on time; ensuring standardized workflows. Leverage Trade Partner data to monitor, measure, validate and analyze rebates, distribution fees, provincial pricing adjustments, inventory levels and sales. Understand and identify variances, escalate to management when necessary; collaborate with partners to resolve discrepancies and maintain process efficiencies. Part of a cross functional team responsible for executing efficient and precise delivery of corporate ME/YE commitments. Identify and execute new innovative and disruptive solutions to a variety of complex problems in an evolving market (returns, contracts, cross border trade, etc..).

Qualifications

University degree is required.
A minimum of 3 years relevant experience is required.
Healthcare-related experience is preferred
Supply chain experience and /or commercial experience is preferred
Results and performance driven, who demonstrates personal ownership and accountability for delivering business results and disruptive innovation
Strong analytical skills, generating easy to interpret reports. Use statistical methods to identify areas for operational improvements and suggested market insights to Business Units.
Working knowledge of Supply Chain and Customer Account Relationship Management is preferred.
Strong communication skills, ability to influence change with diverse audiences at multiple levels is required.
Strong project management skills is highly preferred.
Demonstrate ability to self-direct, act with sense of urgency and agility
Strong attention to detail
Bilingualism in French and English is an asset

Job Title: Senior Analyst/Associate, Business Management, Active Equities
Job Description:
Company Description
Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $450 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to exceed $1.5 trillion in the next two decades. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.

Job Description
The Active Equities (AE) department primarily invests in common equity of publicly traded companies across sectors, geographies, and size. The department’s strategies are deployed across five investment teams spanning the Americas, Europe and Asia. The AE Business Management group leads the business management activities for the department including supporting the operational, administrative and financial aspects of the department.
We are recruiting for a Senior Analyst/Associate to join the Business Management team within the Active Equities department. The Senior Analyst/Associate will contribute to key deliverables and initiatives in addition to core business management functions and responsibilities. The role is based in Toronto and will report to the Senior Manager, Business Management.
Role-Specific Accountabilities:
Reporting:
Build automation and efficiencies in reporting processes
Assist with Board and intra-department reporting and presentations
Support review of operating performance for the department (e.g. analyzing operating expense and transaction cost)
Assist with business planning and budgeting
Execute on ad-hoc reporting and analysis to support business management and investment decisions
Business Management / Operations
Update and maintain department policies and procedures
Manage the coordination of departmental data requirements (e.g. market data and subscriptions, marketing materials, internal websites)
Coordinate orientation sessions for new hires in the department
Support headcount planning and tracking recruitment activities
Coordinate requirements gathering and provide testing support for new departmental systems and tools
Assist with the preparation of the department offsite
Other relevant duties and projects as assigned
Equity Research Budget and Broker Relationship Management
Prepare the annual equity research budget at the department and group levels
Work with the senior investment team members on allocating the annual budget at the broker level
Coordinate the mid-year equity research review
Work with senior team members to collect broker feedback
Work with the Trading and Execution team and Operations on tracking broker payments
Develop and maintain a broker scoring process to ensure AE is obtaining quality research compared to payments made
Support broker relationship management

Qualifications
If you possess the following, we’d like to hear from you:
Undergraduate or graduate degree in Finance, Commerce, Economics, Accounting or other related discipline.
3-6 years of finance and /or investment related experience; Experience in financial/management reporting, databases and/or investment-process management is a definite asset.
Highly organized, proven attention to accuracy and detail and an ability to produce high-quality work under pressure and with time-sensitive deadlines.
Ability to effectively and efficiently prioritize and manage multiple projects.
Extremely motivated, takes initiative and proactively seeks opportunities to add value.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and creatively to solve multi-dimensional problems.
Self-motivated, flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and new challenges.
Understanding of investment operations and processes, including IT platforms and analytic tools that support investments.
Proven experience in Tableau dashboard development would be an asset.
Experience with data-driven IT projects; programming skills (e.g. SQL, Python and Excel VBA) would be an asset.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to build relationships effectively with people at all levels.

Job Title: Identity and Access Management, Senior Business Analyst
Job Description:
What is the opportunity?
This position reports to the Senior Manager, Business Systems Analysis. This is a key project role that works with Business and Technology stakeholders and third party vendors. This person is responsible for documenting business analysis information, i.e., requirements, Use Cases, business rules, and others that support the Identity & Access Management (IAM) Program. The role will plan and execute elicitation of business analysis information on new complex systems or modifications to existing IAM systems through workshops, Process Owner interviews, and other methods. This position is part of the Delivery Team that collaborates closely with the Strategy & Design, Engineering, Quality Assurance, Support and Operations teams within the IAM program in the delivery and management of Identity and Access Management (IAM) services. The ideal candidate is passionate about collaborating with various teams, performing business analysis tasks, and has experience with IAM related projects.
What will you do?
Partners with the various IAM Teams to execute the vision, strategy, and roadmap within the unit.
Define and develop, with guidance, detailed business requirements while identifying, tracking and resolving business systems issues.
Assess, research, analyze and document sponsor/stakeholder needs in accordance with Project Life Cycle utilizing reporting tools, requirements gathering methodologies, process models, data models and prototypes.
Recommend business solutions that satisfy sponsor/stakeholder needs continually exploring and assessing options for value-add for clients.
Works with Project Manager to identify tasks and scheduling which feeds into the overall project plan.
Complete end user documentation and collaborate with Change Management in the preparation of materials such as training guides, operations manual, and others.
Develop and execute test plans to ensure quality of work, particularly for the User Acceptance Testing phase
Lead and facilitate small group meetings and one-on-one interviews.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-haves
Bachelor’s degree in computer science/engineering or equivalent work experience
Experience as a Business Systems Analyst eliciting functional and non-functional requirements within Identity and Access Management (must have)
Demonstrated Identity and Access Management project experience (Business roles, entitlements catalogue, User Access Provisioning, Privileged Access Management)
Experience in validating system or process needs, changes, gap analysis, UAT, User cases and stories, process mapping
Experience using Visio, MS Project, HP ALM, Confluence, Jira
Nice-to have
SailPoint IdentityIQ (IIQ) or CyberArk experience
Cloud suite and services experience - AWS, Azure
Certified CBAP/CCBA/ECBA
Agile project experience
What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Opportunities to work with the best in the field
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs

Health Services Branch (HSB) has the mandate to manage the operational and accountability programs for physicians and practitioners who provide insured services through fee for service or other contractual payment programs. HSB has a challenging opening for a program analyst to conduct program research and analysis, respond to program inquiries, and participate in the development and implementation of operational policies, programs, procedures and guidelines relating to health service provider payment programs.

NOTE: The headquarters for this position is located at 49 Place D'Armes in Kingston, East Region however, the successful candidate may work from 438 University Avenue in Toronto.

What can I expect to do in this role?
In this role you will:


Conduct program research and analysis
Monitor and assess the effectiveness of programs, policy, agreements and services
Assist in or provide issue coordination services and products to manage and resolve program issues.
Conduct ongoing monitoring and review of programs to ensure performance and enforce accountability, and maintain effective relations with external stake holders.
Participate in the development and implementation of operational policies
How do I qualify?
POLICY PLANNING /PROGRAM ANALYSIS /ANALYTICAL SKILLS/PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS:Proven judgment and program planning skills to research and analyze program information to assist in the development of payment program policies, procedures, guidelines, and operational requirements.
Demonstrated analytical and evaluative skills to assess compliance and accountability
Demonstrated analytical, research and problem solving skills to identify, analyze and recommend solutions to complex or contentious program issues
COMMUNICATION SKILLS:Demonstrated written communication skills in order to develop and/or contribute to reports, funding agreements, policy manuals, briefing material and correspondence.
Verbal communication and consulting skills to provide information and advice related to provider payment programs.
INTERPERSONAL & RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT SKILLS:Proven interpersonal skills to develop and maintain effective relations with internal and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to respond to clients, providers and other external inquiries to provide information related to program policies and procedures.
Demonstrated ability to manage and defuse contentious issues and inquiries.
KNOWLEDGE:Knowledge of or the ability to learn about the health care system, Ministry health care programs and health provider payment programs, including fee for service and contractual payment programs and related funding mechanisms.
Ability to interpret Ministry policies/procedures and applicable legislation/regulations (e.g. Health Insurance Act, Personal Health Information Protection Act, Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, Canada Health Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act)
Knowledge of performance measures and financial modeling and research and data analysis methods to support the development and coordination of policies, guidelines and procedures.
Knowledge of program analysis and evaluation techniques to assess the effectiveness of new/changed policies and programs
TECHNICAL SKILLS:Working knowledge of a variety of computer software such as MSOffice (Word, Access, Excel, Outlook) and Internet search.
Additional Information:

1 Temporary, duration up to 12 months, 49 Place D'Armes, Kingston, East Region or 438 University Ave, Toronto, Toronto Region

On behalf of our Client, one of Canada’s largest banks and one of the largest banks in the world by market capitalization, Equality Street is looking for a highly skilled Digital Marketing Analyst to join their Digital Marketing & Sales Team to support them to leverage data and drive performance by providing actionable, innovative and elegant visualization solutions.

The Digital Marketing Analyst is responsible for the design and development of visual analysis tools, dashboards and reports This individual works closely with internal team members and leverages data to solve business issues and support business decisions and projects.


This is a contract role with an immediate start for 12 months with high chance to be extended.

Location: Toronto, ON (temporarily remote due to Covid-19)


MUST HAVE SKILLS FOR THIS ROLE: proficiency in Tableau, Data Studio, Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics


Responsibilities will include but not limited to:

· Take the lead on the visual design for all digital marketing projects in order to design and develop usable, elegant and highly interactive dashboards , reports and analysis tools

· Identify insights and trends through deep-dives into behavioural and client data to understand user experience and find opportunities

· Design, develop and implement performance metrics to support campaign measurements, analysis, and reporting

· Work closely with internal stakeholders to ask relevant questions, understand their key business challenges and identify opportunities for data analytics to make a meaningful impact

· Proactively identify creative solutions, visualizations and analysis. Communicate and present solutions to non-technical business users


You will be successful in this role if you have following skills and abilities:
Strong inter-personal, oral and written communication, presentation and collaboration skills with the ability to work, influence and make an impact in a cross-functional environment with all levels of the organization
Ability to anticipate, identify and find solutions to challenges that impact team and individual deliverables
Passion for data visualization, design and software development. Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and ability to effectively respond to rapidly changing business needs
Creative mindset and ability to introduce disruptive thinking in the design and implementation of visual solutions
Solid analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills
Strong business acumen and ability to understand the linkages between your deliverables and customer values, customer first mindset
Ability to work independently as well as part of a larger team


Requirements
Professional qualifications:

3+ years experience in data visualizations, including a rich portfolio of dashboards, reports and visualizations of digital data in a business context

3+ years experience using Tableau, Data Studio, Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics (or other BI tool) for developing and designing dashboards and reports, ideally in data-rich and complex business environments

Previous experience in digital data analysis and visualization in a large corporate environment (preferably banking, financial) is highly desired

Demonstrated proficiency conducting detailed data analysis

Experience with other visualization platforms and/or business intelligence tools

Experience using SQL and other data manipulation languages to conduct business analysis is considered an asset

The Master Data Analyst will play a key role in setting up and maintenance of master data in ERP system(s) and the processes that support data quality, data integrity and developing the documentation to support it. The individual will be responsible to ensure data accuracy, completeness, consistency, and conformity according to Business requirements.
Analyze and resolve all EDI issues in processes and maintain accuracy in all inbound and outbound documents and perform troubleshoot on processes and analyze all errors

Specific Key Responsibilities & Duties

a) Data Governance:
Defines, designs, and builds data, data structures and processes to meet business needs
Promotes data governance by ensuring quality and accuracy of including but not limited to customer/material/supplier master data through execution of the annual governance plan where scheduled checks and balances are performed

b) Data Management:
Responsible for data collections, entry, and loading master data into ERP(s)
Identifies areas for data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies
In collaboration with subject matter experts and department leads, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the organizations data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable
Manage all request for changes and creations to Master Data records to ensure proper approvals were provided following Business Validation processes

c) EDI

Responsible for troubleshooting, researching and analyzing error handling and exception reporting and reprocessing EDI activities as needed.
Participate in EDI related projects, implement and monitor EDI systems, including data mapping, translation and interface
Develop and maintain EDI documentatio

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Requirements
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred.
Experience in ERP or MRP systems in a manufacturing environment.
5+ years’ experience in master data
Ability to manage priorities in continually changing environment, and to solve problems with high attention to detail.
Great communication skills to facilitate projects with the ERP vendor, team members, external data providers, and management.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel etc.)
Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Domain knowledge in CPG industry

Create better business outcomes with your analytical acumen and creativity.
.Join our team
We are the Digital Strategy (Channel & Customer Experience) team, and we have one single objective - using technology to deliver the very best possible user experience. Whether you’re a customer exploring our products and pricing online, a sales rep providing a quote, or a dealer submitting an order, our team is committed to ensuring your experience with our systems is seamless.
We sit within the TELUS Business Marketing team, and we support everything from small to mid-market businesses, as well as both our wireless and wireline suites of products.
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Are you passionate about using data to drive customer experience improvements? By generating insights and recommendations, you can help us meet the needs of our customers: small to mid-market business owners.
As a Senior Business Analyst on the Experience Strategy team, you will use your aptitude for analytics, expertise with data visualization tools and creative thinking, to pinpoint pivotal opportunities for improvement to our customer and channel journeys, which will then guide key strategic recommendations.
Here's how
You will be the team’s customer analytics muscle - identifying, tracking and driving on key user experience metrics such as L2R, digital adoption and automation rate
You will help senior leaders visualize and understand our customer experience opportunities by building dashboards and presentations that showcase customer experience metrics

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Data Miner
You love digging into a new set of data; you’ll analyze it, pivot it, and seek out new trends - all in pursuit of getting the best possible market insights

Detective

Analyst, Planning Analytics (PLA001J)

Employee Status: Regular

Barganing Unit: Non-Union

Pay Range: 63,958.00 - 87,476.00

Closing Date: 14-Mar-2021
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!
Our Planning Analytics Office is seeking an Analyst, Planning Analytics to carry out research and analytical studies related to the development of business cases for transportation projects.

What will I be doing?
Creates and updates economic and financial models using Excel and other tools to determine costs and benefits of transportation projects
Conducts comprehensive research and analytical studies to develop Metrolinx business cases for assessing major capital projects and supporting implementation of the Greater Toronto-Hamilton Area (GTHA)’s Regional Transportation Plan
Provides advanced, current information regarding emerging policy issues
Reviews and analyses studies from internal and external sources (e.g. Ministry and municipal partners, consultants, non-government organizations, and academic sources) to ensure accuracy, consistency and validity of data analysis and findings
Assists in the development of briefing notes, presentations and reports with analysis and recommendations while ensuring consistency with government transportation goals, objectives and guidelines
Conducts research and prepares input that addresses transportation project evaluation issues raised in the Chair, President & CEO and Chief Planning and Development Officer’s correspondence and/or external reports and studies related to transportation, project evaluation and business case analysis. Conducts detailed analysis to develop recommended approaches for negotiations that identify and support the interests of all affected parties and avoid compromising Metrolinx’s transportation objectives

What skills and qualifications do I need?

Completion of a university degree in Urban Planning, Economics, Applied Sciences, Transportation, or related field or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent; Master’s level education is preferred
Minimum four (4) years’ experience in analytical research and statistical analysis methods and techniques to develop study designs and procedural methods, evaluate study results and recommend transportation concepts
Transportation economics theory and principles, transportation financial and policy analysis, including project assessment, evaluation and planning processes, land use, transportation planning and transportation modelling
Land use planning, multi-modal transportation theory and environmental issues and processes to assess regional transportation requirements in accordance with Metrolinx objectives and determine social, economic and environmental impacts
Data gathering and modeling techniques to conduct and facilitate data gathering and analysis, ensuring validity of data and consistency with government guidelines
Current transportation/transit landscape with respect to various provincial, municipal and transit agency and stakeholder actors
Research, analytical and problem solving skills to assess research requirements, determine data sources and appropriate analytical techniques, assess implications of findings on the business unit and organization and assess relevance of latest developments in statistical analysis for Metrolinx applications
Communication and stakeholder management skills to maintain liaison with internal and external contacts, provide advice to program management, and participate in technical projects and task groups
Computer skills to analyze and present data, prepare reports, correspondence and graphical presentations

Job Description:
Role Summary
Come be part of an exciting and challenging opportunity by helping to accelerate the growth and application of data analytics capabilities at Sun Life Canada. As part of the Financial Operations Reporting Centre of Excellence, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of applying data and analytics to transform our financial reporting processes. You will be helping Sun Life use analytics to deliver on our purpose of helping our Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.
As a Data Analyst on the Financial Operations Reporting COE team, your focus will be working with a team of financial professionals to build out a suite of impactful business intelligence products and solutions to support Financial Operations within Canada. These products and services will allow Sun Life Canada’s Finance leaders to better analyze financial drivers and make data driven decisions.
What will you do?
Reporting & Business Intelligence (50%)
Build out comprehensive business intelligence & reporting for Finance leadership, keeping in mind the needs of varied audiences and the desire to drive insights & action
Data Sourcing, Manipulation, and Transformation (40%)
Effectively translate business and project needs into data extraction and manipulation plans
Leverage data expertise to support initiatives through scoping, implementation, impact analysis, and ongoing reporting
Organizational Best Practices (10%)
Work to drive efficiencies within Canada Reporting COE by ensuring adoption & continued evolution of best practices
What will you need to succeed?
Relevant Experience and Education
An undergraduate or graduate degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, finance, accounting or computer science, plus strong quantitative skills and background, or equivalent work experience
5+ years proven experience and ability in the following areas:
Reporting and business intelligence
Data sourcing, manipulation, and transformation
Insightful analysis of data
A passion for solving problems
Critical thinking skills
Business understanding
Technical Skills
Strong knowledge of data visualization software such as Tableau, SAS Visual Analytics, etc.
Proven experience with a subset of SAS, SQL & VBA
Able to write complex queries to extract and integrate data from multiple data sources
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Problem Solving
Proven balance of analytical and creative problem solving skills
Coordinate with partners to ensure existing and in-development reporting meets the evolving needs of the organization
Communication
Ability to distill complex technical information into the key points that matter to the audience
Effective writing and verbal communication skills
What will be nice to have?
Industry Experience & Knowledge
Past experience in life insurance / wealth management, other financial services industry
Working knowledge of one or more Sun Life Canada business units
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits, pension, stocks, savings and 4 weeks vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.
Job Title:
Business Partner Data Analyst
Location:
Mississauga
Who We Are
At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software. To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done.
What’s in it for you?
The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and fun.
The Growth - Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!
The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.
What You’ll Do
You will be a business partner analyst working closely with different departments across SOTI to understand their business processes and reporting needs and understand data captured by sources/systems used by business units.
Ability to translate and document business requirements into technical documentation, supporting document management and knowledge sharing
Ensure assigned deliverables are within business / audit control requirements
Take ownership of end-to-end design and all aspects related to development and ensure design and development standards and followed
Create project documentation (Detailed design, Source-to-target mappings, Implementation plans, etc.)
Develop data and database-oriented solutions in order to solve complex business problems leading to data driven decision making
Develop data integration processes to integrate disparate data sets into a cohesive data model in support of BI and analytical requirements
Works closely with data architecture to ensure proper adherence to architectural guidelines and principles
Experience You’ll Bring:
Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, problem-solving and research skills.
Must be able to multitask and have experience with interacting within a diverse user/customer base
2-3 years of experience designing and developing reports and dashboards
2-3 years of experience using SQL or Python or similar languages to query data to do analysis.
2-3 years of experience with MS SQL Business Intelligence Stack (SSAS, SSIS, and SSRS).
2-3 years hands-on advanced experience using Power BI or similar visualization BI platforms.
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
1 year experience with Data Warehouse concepts, including the use of Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) tools.
Experience using Cloud architecture, NoSQL databases and R/Python is a plus.
Experience using building data pipelines to integrate with unstructured data sources is a plus.
Experience in designing and building unstructured data stores using Azure or AWS technologies is a plus.
Finance/business background is plus.
About SOTI
SOTI is the world's most trusted provider of mobile and IoT management solutions, with more than 17,000 enterprise customers and millions of devices managed worldwide. SOTI's innovative portfolio of solutions and services provide the tools organizations need to truly mobilize their operations and optimize their mobility investments. SOTI extends secure mobility management to provide a total, flexible solution for comprehensive management and security of all mobile devices and connected peripherals deployed in an organization.
At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities.

If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.

If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at careers@soti.net .

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

RESPONSIBILITIES
Our analyst will be contributing to preparing budgets, forecasts, revenue and expense analysis and business trend analysis. You will provide senior management with financial and business trend reporting used for planning, strategic and tactical decision making. You will also be responsible for the development and maintenance of numerous reports that will point to either data anomalies, business trends or simply over/underspending. The areas covered may include financials, work requests, utilities, capital planning, project management, real estate transactions and others. You will need to analyze the data, make recommendations as appropriate and present the findings.

Experienced building reports using Power BI with live feed from Data Warehouse and be able to write complex queries within SQL
Act as Business analyst to comprehend the new requirement for building the new reports
Identify tactical and strategic opportunities, gaps, and financial risks through collaboration with cross-functional teams

Assist with capital project and resource allocation reviews, including statistical/financial modeling of assumptive scenarios in support of key business decision-making
Contribute to compilation and analysis of financial and operational data required for quarterly Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reporting
Preparation and review of departmental expense analysis, focusing on key variances, cost drivers and explanations, including liaison with various functional leaders;
Evaluates and investigates financial and operational reporting of high dollar or high profile transactions
Special ad-hoc projects and other functions as required by manager or client

QUALIFICATIONS

Power BI, SQL, Python, Macros, PowerPivot and/or Tableau are Mandatory
Financial acumen, analytical ability
Strong basic accounting skills/understanding
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good organizational skills
Self-starter who will innovate, look for problems and corresponding solutions
Logical thinker with good common sense
BA or BS required
3-5 years relevant experience

Job Description
Collects and analyzes operational data. Assists in the design, development, and implementation of data gathering and reporting methods and procedures within Operations. Recommends procedural changes to improve efficiency of operations. Functions as technical coordinator and internal consultant regarding needs and requirements of Operations data processing. Responsible for tracking, analysis, and forecasting of storage capacities, inventory levels, equipment and/or manpower requirements. Follows established evaluation processes to determine effectiveness of current operational activities and determine problem areas and develop solutions. Serves as primary site liaison for Information Technology, ILD, LMS teams, and other internal departments as required by the site.

Uses spreadsheets, databases, and other tools to provide ongoing analysis of operational activities (such as freight flow, storage capacities, transportation solutions, etc.). Develop standardized and ad hoc site and/or customer reporting.
May investigate and recommend new technologies and information systems.
May conduct feasibility analyses on various processes and equipment; calculates cost benefits and business impact and proposes solutions.
May partner with Operations to develop financial models to analyze productivity and payroll.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent level of experience is preferred.

Dans des marchés en rapide évolution, les clients à travers le monde font confiance à Thales. Thales fournit des systèmes de commande de trains par télécommunications (CBTC) et des systèmes d’enclenchement destinés au secteur des transports en commun sur voie ferrée à l'échelle mondiale. Le centre de compétences pour la signalisation ferroviaire urbaine est situé au centre-ville de Toronto. Nous sommes le plus grand bureau situé au Canada et nous disposons d’un service pour chaque étape du cycle de vie du développement logiciel (SDLC). Cela comprend le logiciel, le matériel, la conception des systèmes, la vérification et la validation, les opérations, etc. Les équipes de services partagés dans les domaines des finances, des ressources humaines et des technologies de l’information sont également situées sur ce site. In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
Thales provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances, low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big Transport family, here in Toronto!
Job Purpose:
Thales is looking to add a Business Intelligence Engineer to lead the Thales North America BI Centre of Excellence (CoE) to join their team in Toronto.
The Business Intelligence Engineer is responsible for the support and deployment of BI solutions, particularly using Datalake, datawarehouse, PowerBI technologies. The role will encompass planning, implementation, management and support of Business Intelligence solutions with the key purpose to implement strategic automated reports. While the primary tool is PowerBI, this responsibility would also extend to future applications implemented in support of the Thales business domains. This role, at times, may directly lead projects assigned to their domain. As a shared service organization, our customers are Thales units within the North American region; however, the engagement of business units outside of this region is possible.
Key Job Functions:
Lead the North American BI CoE (Centre of Excellence)
Work closely with the IT teams to design and deliver reporting and analytical solutions that satisfy business and technical requirements
Extract, transform and load data from multiple sources (Excel, and ERPs: SAGE, SAP, Primavera…)
Provide architectural insight to business users through evaluation and recommendation - Oversee the mapping of data sources, data movement, interfaces, and analytics, with the goal of ensuring data quality
Managing PowerBI workspaces, report access, report deployment, developing best practices in an enterprise environment
Take ownership of end-to-end development of each dashboard and report being developed
Train end-users and other stakeholders as needed to ensure they become fully autonomous and operational on the tool
Coordinate with IS/IT as needed to ensure compliancy with Thales IT/Security
Key Skill Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field with a minimum of 5-8+ years of experience or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field with 4+ years of experience
Experience in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining - Strong understanding of database management systems, analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework
Experience with database design concepts, middleware concepts, user interface development, and information security engineering & access controls
Knowledge of SQL queries and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience with Microsoft Azure Datalake, Azure SQL Database and Azure Analysis Services
Three plus years of relevant work experience building dashboards and reports in PowerBI
Experience working on Power Query, DAX and Power BI Services
Ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams
Experiences in applying agile work practices
Experience collaborating with teams both cross-functionally and cross-geography
Motivated and adaptable, able to work proficiently both independently and in a team environment
Travel up to 10% both domestic and international may be required

With ServiceNow having 2 major releases a year & 9 solution areas, we have multiple projects going all the time and you can be assured that your skills will be tested and honed.
Role Overview:
As the Business Analyst you will serve as the ultimate facilitator between the client and SuMO in truly understanding the client’s needs and playing a key role in the overall management and success of a project through the entire project lifecycle.
Using proven methods and tools, you will lead the planning, eliciting, analyzing, validating and managing of requirements, business processes, high-level solution design, test case design, and implementation planning & support - in partnership with Engagement Managers, client Stakeholders, and technical consultants. You will work on projects that use Waterfall, Agile Scrum and hybrid delivery methods.
Responsibilities:
Collect, review, analyze, manage, system and user requirements from business users
Form a partnership with the client business teams to deeply understand their business in order to enable the capture of clear, concise, and correct user stories
Bridge the gap between business and technology, ensuring common understanding and technology/Business alignment of both functional (for business needs) and non-functional requirements (quality attributes, scalability, interfaces, constraints, etc.)
Convey business requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, use cases, prototypes, etc. as appropriate
Responsible for creating, refining, and maintaining functional requirements/user stories/use cases and associated deliverables – process flows, test cases, etc. – to meet development and stakeholder needs
Provide project management support using approved project management processes, tools, and techniques
Manage the UAT process by performing smoke testing, test case validation, and obtaining business approvals on UAT for scheduled deployments.
Contribute to a collaborative team environment by information sharing and team cooperation
Required Skills:
We are looking for high performing individuals who are:
Agile and innovative individuals, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment
Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers
Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet the client’s business objectives
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
What You’ve Done:
University degree in Commerce/Business Administration, Applied/Computer Science, or equivalent
Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Business Analyst role in a Waterfall, Agile or hybrid project-based environment
Nice To Have - Fluent in ServiceNow or Service Management technology
Strong knowledge of project and software development methodologies/techniques
Solid presentation, facilitation, interview, and workshop skills
Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict-management skills
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and under tight deadlines
Ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion, and simplify complex situations
Proficient in developing requirements definition, functional specifications, test scenarios/scripts, data models and business procedures.
Strong process flow and diagramming skills (Visio application)
Creation and delivery of training materials
Exposure to managing the testing disciplines (use of Quality Center tool)
Strong interpersonal skills; strong relationship management and negotiation skills.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills - verbal, written, listening and presentation.
Business Analyst certification, IIBA, PMI – (PBA), or equivalent – Nice to Have
What’s in it for you?
We’re different. We recognize that you have opportunities in front of you but here’s what makes SuMO different and a great place to work:
ELITE Partner status- What does this mean for you? It means that you get to work with large global customers on cutting-edge projects. It also means that you get to be on the cutting edge of technology and solutions – not just doing the same thing every day.
A collaborative team – With experts across the country providing support for you so you know that we will have your back.
Investment In YOU- We will ensure that you are equipped with everything you need in terms of Training, Certifications, and Accreditations so that you positioned for success at SuMO and for your career ahead.
 Benefits & Culture– Competitive compensation including Profit Sharing. Work-life balance is also important to us as is hanging out with your colleagues at company events.
If this sounds like it could be a home for you, send us your resume. We’d love to talk.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. You must be legally entitled to work for any employer in Canada.
