Mississauga
Job Description
Job Summary
The Patient Support Services (PSS), Business Process Analyst is responsible for the overall capturing of business requirements as it relates to PSS application change requests, as well as planning, managing and delivering projects with the department of Patient Support Services.
Activities include the coordination and prioritization of requests that come in from our Program Staff and Customers of all new and ongoing PSS initiatives. This person acts as the business matter expert and liaises with our Bayshore Information Technology group to ensure deliverables are met during our monthly release cycles of various application toolsets.
The Business Process Analyst is responsible for PSS program specific CRM configurations and maintaining InfoBay program documentation.
As well, the Business Process Analyst acts as the business project lead and business representative on all PSS IT related projects to perform requirements gathering and sign off, project coordination of activities, timelines and scope creep, and the coordination of business resources required to complete user acceptance testing.

Duties and Responsibilities
Duties and Responsibilities of Business Process Analyst include (but are not limited to):
Leveraging tools and applications in Bayshore to manage and deliver system and application changes for the PSS department.
Process map business requirements and process workflows to articulate business needs.
Validate and test application changes and provide feedback to both business stakeholders and I.T. developers.
Documentation of application changes and training guides, work instructions and release notes.
Manage and prioritize with the business the order of operation required for application changes, and project initiatives.
Leverage their project management skills to efficiently manage project roles, identify resource requirements, status reporting, define project deliverables and ensure the quality of projects.
Collaborate with I.T. to ensure projects are completed within the established project plan, and delivered on time.
Managing risks, evaluating, and re-evaluating change requests, maintaining the defined scope parameters. Both from a day-to-day perspective but also, from a long-term project perspective. You will be responsible for troubleshooting, anticipating and deploying solutions to issues as they arise.
Provide assistance to team members, and clients as needed in application changes.
Support and collaborate with the PSS Training & Education team to provide training and operational education to CRM users and on new application changes and releases to ensure best practice data entry is consistent.
Complete system administration activities for the applications including new pharma launches in order to maintain the PSS specific configurable menu items, workflows and functions.
Update InfoBay documentation following CAB approval or as program requests are received (enrollment forms, client materials etc.)
Look for ways to improve processes and increase the configurable items in the application support process.
Act as a business point of contact for level 1 application support and manage escalations to I.T. from our internal stakeholders as needed during implementations of application changes and operationally
Track and resolve issues when escalated, initiating corrective actions as appropriate to manage delays or address system problems.
Participate and lead our Change Advisory Board meetings to manage application release process.
Provide Business Applications Manager progress updates on initiatives and deliverables.
Establish and manage relationships with customer business and project stakeholders.
Escalate as required to Management when additional help or resources are required.
Complete other tasks as required by BSRx Management.

Job Qualification
Qualifications
Bachelors or College Diploma in Systems Analysis, Business Analysis, or equivalent work experience.
Experience leading or supporting health care project implementations is an asset.
Experience with Use case diagramming, workflow and business analysis documentation methodologies.
1-3 years’ experience working with clinical teams to develop and implement application changes.
2-4-6 years’ experience documenting business requirements and articulating those requirements to I.T. professionals.
Experience working with MS CRM, Procura, MS Sharepoint, BSRx Connex, MS Project, Excel, Powerpoint
Experience working with specialty pharmaceuticals and an understanding of home health services is an asset.
Experience with and an understanding a variety of roles within Patient Support programs, Specialty pharmacy, Reimbursement services also an asset.
Ability to work independently or within a team environment.
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate cross-functionally in a variety of mediums.
Ability to handle difficult situations and solve problems in a rapid fashion
Ability to handle difficult and stressful situations with diplomacy and ease
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Client Focused, and ability to act with a clear sense of urgency
Proven ability to drive continuous improvement processes
Bilingual (English and French) is an asset

Position:

Data Analyst

Reports To:

Supervisor, Data Analytics

Tier:

Staff

Department:

Data Governance

Company:

GS1 Canada

Location:
Toronto

Status:

Full-Time Contract(12 months)


Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role

The Data Analyst will support GS1 Canada’s industry exclusive Dashboard. This includes weekly data processing and validation of master data files, quality assurance testing and ongoing product development and process optimization.

The Data Analyst also plays an integral role in supporting Industry Managed Services (IMS) with subscriber and service level reporting and analysis. Working closely with other analysts, the candidate will extract, process and summarize subscriber data and be instrumental in ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.

The Data Analyst will assist the Supervisor of Data Analytics to translate business requirements into technical and functional solutions that allow IMS to deliver value added services to existing subscribers and promote enrolment of new subscribers which support cost recovery in the not-for-profit model.

Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the refresh of GS1 Canada’s Dashboard – a portal used by retailers to evaluate vendor compliance to services essential for commerce.
Validate retail data against GS1 Canada registries for completeness and perform quality assurance prior to promotion to production
Transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions.
Querying data in SQL Server, Access or other database tools from disparate systems and sources ensuring integrity, quality and efficient processing at every step
Liaise with senior and executive level stakeholders to identify criteria for business reporting and execute the technical solution delivery.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with the Supervisor to prioritize development efforts.
Create reports that go beyond presenting the numbers but also delivers meaningful analytics.
Assist with Data Warehouse development and implementation
Create, deploy and maintain BI tools and reports
Validate system integrity through report generation and analysis from various internal databases as required (i.e. CRM, ECCnet Registry and Item Centre).
Assist with conducting full lifecycle data analysis and evolving analysis and reporting capabilities.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Scheduling tasks to execute at regular intervals or automating repetitive or complex steps using VBA or other scripting languages.
Establish a brand identity by standardizing report processes and generating output with consistent results, accurate information and quality fit and finish.
Engage with Data Governance to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards;
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business or a related area of study, with a focus on problem solving, analytics/mathematics and critical thinking
A minimum of 2-3 year’s work experience, preferably in data management and reporting capacity
Experience in dimensional data modeling
Knowledge of Data Warehouse design but preference will be given to those with experience in Data Warehouse implementation and architecture
Demonstrated proficiency in SQL coding is a must, preferably with SQL Server and its suite of tools and services (SSRS, SSIS, MDM, etc.)
In depth understanding of DBMS systems, online analytical processing and ETL methods
Strong capability with Business Intelligence (BI) tools link MS Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, QlikView or others
Understanding of governance principles and master data management required.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business reporting requirements, technical design and implementation
Meticulous with high attention to detail
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Takes pride in their work and validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness
Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; exhibits confidence in self and others
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and efficient manner
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to positively influence others to promote engagement
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Demonstrated and proven high level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint) with preference given to those with advanced expertise in Excel and familiarity with MS Access or other relational database systems
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset
VBA or other scripting experience is highly preferred
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs


Click here to apply online.


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.

For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment. Additional Information

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external digital insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada
The Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of digital experience. We do this by delivering hindsight (descriptive analytics), foresight (predictive analytics), and insight (prescriptive analytics) on how to optimize, personalize and strategize. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.
The Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including digital analytics, website analytics, big data, cloud, E2E analytics, market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management and visualization.
Job Description
About this Role
The successful candidate will be responsible for Personalizing the website experience. Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights supports the central marketing function within TD Bank Group with high quality, innovative, and insightful information to help build value for our customers and shareholders. Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights is a located in Toronto. It supports most consumer facing TD Bank Group lines of business.

Your goal as a part of the Digital Analytics team is to use testing methodologies to understand and learn the client experience and suggest improvements and changes to better personalize the consumer experience and return greater shareholder value. You will be a key player in the TD's personalization journey and will collaborate with different groups within and outside of marketing to drive change.

1. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive a better experience and a higher marketing ROI
2. Testing different segment/audiences and thier impact on marketing ROI
3. Understand the business objective, translate those into a test and use the results to make informed decisions
4. Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of website personalization

Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, solve problems, and continuously strive for achieving results.
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD?
Responsibilities:
o Design/execute/measure website experience through testing methodologies
o Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal
o Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
o Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance the personalization experience
o Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure

Skill Sets:
o Familiarity with website personaization through testing methodologies (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)
o Technical and detail oriented
o Knowledge of leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of SAS, Hadoop systems, Omniture, SQL Servers, DOMO, Big Query and Google Marketing Cloud
o A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications
o Team player while able to work independently
o Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts
o A customer driven mindset
Additional Information
Qualifications
o 4+ years of relevant experience in a digital marketing, A/B testing, website analytics, consulting, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)
o Significant experience with Omniture/GA360 and website data an asset
o Knowledge of testing methologies and clickstream data; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of open source python/pyspark an asset
o Experience designing experiments to test user experience
o Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline
o Track record of getting things done and solving problems

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
TD Insurance Data & Insights group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
Joining us in TD Insurance Data & Insights is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.
Job Description
Are you a big picture thinker? Fantastic! This is exactly the kind of thinking TD needs when it comes to our business intelligence support and analytics. In this role, we need you to take a holistic, high level approach to collection and reporting of data for major projects and initiatives across TD.
As data's role in providing extraordinary products and services to our customers grows, we'll look to the valued expertise you'll provide in this role, to develop, adopt and evolve the best in class reporting and business intelligence capability.
Does this sound like you? You're a natural leader, and can lead major initiatives and projects, joining business owners and partners to determine business needs and recommend solutions. Moreover, you have a talent for looking at a collection of data and drawing rare insights. In this role, we'll need you to include those insights and commentary within the existing reporting packages you deliver. Finally, you'll fit in well if you like to own your space and execute with speed and precision, relishing all challenges as opportunities to dig in, collaborate and take TD into the future of banking.
As a Senior Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, you will:
Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards for businesses
Lead the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
Conduct analysis to provide improved BI to inform management leadership team
Craft complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
Develop substantial and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages.
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Understand business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide relevant direction
Lead the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, portfolio growth, profitability, etc.)
Provide (and may develop) complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional or enterprise level
Work independently as the senior analyst / expert and may provide technical support to others
Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
Ideally have or acquire knowledge of broader enterprise reporting platforms and data sources and ability to integrate data across the enterprise
`
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Five (5) or more years relevant experience
Undergraduate degree in Business, Math, or a related discipline
Five (5) or more years relevant experience
Priority is given to the candidates with prior experience with Azure cloud platform, Hadoop based environments, Python, and Tableau.

POSITION: Business Analyst – Environmental
REPORTS TO: Director, Product Management
Cority leverages its cutting-edge SaaS-based technology and broad EHSQ product suite to partner with organizations around the world to effect meaningful change in the way environmental, health, safety and quality is managed. Cority stands by its customers as they attain performance goals, reduce EHSQ risks, enhance corporate productivity, and create a healthier workforce. The company has received many accolades for its strong employee culture and outstanding growth rate including recognition as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies; being shortlisted for the Canadian Chamber of Commerce’s Private Business Growth Award; and being named by Aon Hewitt as one of the Best Employers in Canada.
LOCATION: Toronto, Canada, Carlsbad, CA, or Remote.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Aid with the development and furthering of the Environmental Product which includes:

Build the products into a best-in-class solution. Gather, research and develop requirements to continually improve the product.
Document product specifications and collaborate with R&D to build prototype functionality.
Problem solve design issues and bugs in the application, including documenting solutions and establishing priority for future releases/service packs.
Support Sales-led demos (both remote and on-site, as agreed upon) as an application subject matter expert. Technical resource to Sales for RFP completion.
Support Marketing documentation development, ‘thought leadership’ initiatives, and ‘social media’ initiatives.
Key contact for product testing questions/issues relating to the Environmental Product.
Key contact for helpdesk questions/issues relating to Environmental Product.
Resource to Consulting for implementation support.
Communicate and train internal and external stakeholders on developed functionality.
Additionally, work with the product team on general product improvements and projects as required. Some cross-functional work in other areas of the product may be required.


QUALIFICATIONS AND CHARACTERISTICS OF AN IDEAL CANDIDATE:

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, or an Environmental related field; and/or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
The self-starting individual should have a minimum of two years experience working in an Environmental role within a large organization with a mature Environmental Management System or in the technology industry as a business analyst.
Knowledge of Chemical Management, Air Emissions, GHG, Waste Management, environmental sampling, geospatial data representation (e.g. GIS-based solutions) and/or other key areas of Environmental management are an asset.
General understanding of EU, US, Canada, and/or Australia regulatory frameworks related to Environmental regulations is a plus.
Experience working with an EHS software solution is desired.
An ability to grasp issues, problem solve, and suggest innovative solutions is an asset.
Communication skills, both verbal and written, are critical to the success of this candidate.


ABOUT CORITY:
Cority is an enterprise software company based in Toronto with a global client base. The company’s core product is a software platform that is used by large corporations, NGOs and government agencies to manage employee health and safety. If you’re interested in learning more, go to www.Cority.com

Job Description:

Scope of Position
The Senior Technical Support Analyst supports and maintains enterprise IT infrastructure services (Email, Active Directory, Servers, Networks, MDM, Firewalls, Security, etc.). They plan and execute assigned infrastructure & business projects. They research, recommend, and implements IT standards and records (e.g., inventory). Participate in the procurement process for IT hardware/software and IT service agreements. Day-to-day direction is provided by the team lead or manager as required.
What you need to be successful
Diploma in Information Technology field or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience and/or relevant designation required.
6 - 7 years of relevant technical support experience required.
Experience developing system images and deploying images to computers and servers using various imaging solutions.
Experience supporting, configuring, and troubleshooting issues with active directory.
Experience supporting, configuring, and troubleshooting issues with Microsoft Exchange and Firewalls.
Experience sizing, building, configuring, and deploying windows servers.
Experience supporting, configuring, and troubleshooting issues virtual environment (Hyper-V, Vmware).
Experience in project management fundamentals, with the ability to plan common infrastructure projects.
Knowledge of security concepts and procedures (Encryption, MFA, Access rights, patching, vulnerability management, end point protection, etc.).
The following skills will be considered as assets: Cloud certification; Security certification; MS PowerShell scripting; Excel formulas & data analysis
What you’ll be doing
Key responsibilities of this position include:
75 – 85% of the Technical Support Analyst’s time will be spent on special projects or activities (e.g. research, evaluate, and implement technical solutions).
Deploy, support, and maintain corporate infrastructure systems (Servers, Active directory, MS Exchange, MDM, Firewalls, security systems, etc.).
Plan and execute assigned infrastructure projects.
Provide support to the Help Desk and work with them on transitioning infrastructure changes from the project phase to day to day operations.
Participate in and administer the selection and acquisition of software, hardware, and related technology.
Formulate and update hardware and software standards and policies.
Prepare and maintain administration documentation including equipment inventory, asset management, software licensing and system availability statistics for computer and network equipment.
Research, recommend, and evaluate new software tools.
Assist with IT network, hardware, and software strategies.
Ensure that adequate network and hardware security, backup, and disaster recovery processes are implemented and maintained.
Provide off business hour attention as may be required (Support, maintenance, cutovers, etc.).
Support Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) policies and initiatives.
Perform other duties as may be assigned
Position: salaried - exempt
Reports to: Team Lead

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You'll Be Doing
You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Business Systems Analyst, you’ll support collaborative end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology following values, principles and practices of both Waterfall and Agile/Scrum delivery. You’ll participate in all phases of application delivery with a diverse team to create and build flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best in class client experience.
How You'll Succeed
Understanding and Documenting Requirements – Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate requirements discussions to ensure you meet project needs through daily scrums, JAD sessions and requirements elicitation sessions. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
Solution Design – Build client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate requirement documents around areas such as scope clarification, business and solution requirements.
Leading and Mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in business and technology. Drive to collaborate and support individuals and cross-functional teams to resolve organizational, operational and process problems within an agile environment.
Project Delivery Team – Work with the Project Delivery Teams to identify, anticipate, assess, manage and resolve issues and risks related to requirements' activities and deliverables.
Communication – Proactively communicate and collaborate with business partners to analyze information needs. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with diverse groups, managers and subject matter experts and ability to negotiate (able to express oneself clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing) effectively to manage project delivery and project coordination of complex activities.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in a BSA role with preference in the digital space (Mobile, Web and Online) . You have strong knowledge and ability to collect and assess business requirements, prepare business requirements systems document, requirements traceability and user stories. It’s an asset if you have experience with software development methodologies (SDLC, Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc.) and digital applications.
You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a BSA role leading projects and designing solutions. Previous experience working in Agile projects and working knowledge of JIRA, Confluence will be an added advantage.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
Values matter to you . You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Support the ETL process of miscellaneous data marts and operational data stores.

Develop and/or maintain new/existing SAS code to support ETL processes for IDR.

Date Posted: 03/02/2021
Req ID: 2700
Faculty/Division: UofT Scarborough
Department: UTSC:Dept-Management
Campus: University of Toronto Scarborough (UTSC)
Description:
About us:

The University of Toronto Scarborough is a place of energy, enthusiasm and passion. Our commitment to inclusive excellence attracts the brightest learners, scholars and employees from around the globe. Our success has been made possible by the opportunity given to us by our Indigenous hosts to operate on their territory, and we cherish our continuing partnerships with these communities. The University of Toronto Scarborough is an exciting campus with unlimitedpotential. Join us on our journey.

UTSC Management is a world leader in providing business education that is heavily influenced by experiential learning and internationalization. The goal of UTSC Management is to create opportunities for our students to learn and experience leadership by applying the latest management theory to real-world problems both inside and outside the classroom.

Your opportunity:

Reporting to the Managing Director, Department of Management, the Business and Data Analyst will support the Department of Management by proactively gathering and synthesizing information from various internal and external sources to support decision making by senior management. The position is responsible for providing accurate and timely information for a multitude of purposes relating to the department of Management, in both graduate and undergraduate units. Data is to be collected in key areas of the department, which includes but is not limited torecruitment, application and admission, student services (including co-op) and student enrolment (courses and programs).

Your responsibilities will include:
Analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and developing technical solutions for systems improvements
Researching and identifying new software solutions to improve workflow and support Management team members in their duties
Advising on data structure designs to ensure data integrity and valid report generation
Providing detailed information on data analysis findings to stakeholders
Designing and optimizing databases to meet the ongoing and changing needs of the department
Planning and collaborating on components of projects specifically in the area of software implementation
Maintaining information on digital platforms to ensure data integrity
Tracking progress of student work-integrated experience applications, interviews andrecruitment
Essential Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree relevant to research methodologies and statistics or a related field or acceptable combination of equivalent experience
Minimum four years of relevant experience with advanced data management and analysis (e.g. data visualization, database set-up and familiarity, advanced data report generation etc.)
Experience using business intelligence software and data visualization tools to create dashboards in order to facilitate data-driven decisions
Data analysis skills, including designing and generating reports; analyzing data and identifying meaningful trends and results; developing projections to support strategic planning; presenting information in a user friendly way and supporting continuous improvement activities
Ability to carry out a variety of descriptive and inferential statistical analysis including regression analysis and other techniques
Strong oral and written communication skills to explain complex statistical analysis to decision makers, probe for information to establish needs and respond to requests, and communicate data query requirements to other analysts or non-technical users
Ability to work independently or as part of a team, demonstrates initiative, creativity, curiosity, and attention to detail balanced by ability to see the big picture
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to build effective partnerships with colleagues and students
Highly motivated, self-starter with creative thinking skills
Must be able to stay organized, multi-task and meet deadlines; and exercise accuracy.
Applicants are also expected to show evidence of a commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion, and the promotion of a respectful and collegial learning and working environment
Assets (Nonessential):
Ability to independently formulate and test hypotheses concerning data in the context of the enrolment matters
Strong working knowledge of survey development, administration and analysis
Advanced knowledge of the structure and meaning of student data housed in various systems
Understanding of complex relational databases and strong working knowledge of software reporting tools
Experience working with complex data within a higher education environment
To be successful in this role you will be:
Adaptable
Communicator
Diligent
Organized
Problem solver
Resourceful
Note: A copy of the full job description is available upon request from the UTSC HR Office. Thisis a 12-month TERM position starting April 2021. Please ensure to include a cover letter with your application.

Job Title: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence, Private Wealth Management
Job Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
Commercial Banking and Wealth Management works in close collaboration with CIBC’s Personal and Small Business and Capital Markets strategic business units to lead and manage the organic growth, client retention and profitability of CIBC’s businesses. Commercial Banking in Canada includes the development and implementation of a strategic plan that effectively integrates the diverse activities of Commercial Banking including delivery network, specialized industries, business solutions, segment strategy, deposits and lending practices as well as across all functional responsibilities.
Wealth Management business in Canada includes Asset Management, Wood Gundy and Private Wealth Management, which is focused on providing excellence in relationship-based advice, service and product solutions that meet the needs of CIBC’s high-net-worth private wealth individuals and institutional clients
As part of the Private Wealth Management National Office group, The Business Intelligence team focuses on providing detailed insights into the performance of the business to help enhance the client experience and drive asset and revenue growth
The Senior Manager will be in a dynamic position of being responsible for the coordination, communication, generation, and distribution of high priority dashboards and various business intelligence reporting to key Private Wealth Management stakeholders. This role is responsible for providing a high level of service to internal clients through effective consulting with the multiple stakeholder groups and Private Wealth Management head office.
How You’ll Succeed
Business Intelligence - Work with key stakeholders to manage timely production of reporting and business performance reporting in addition to investigation of issues impeding progress . Lead the delivery of performance dashboards and reporting tools that go beyond the numbers to provide business insights to help influence decision. Research specific trends and distil key insights for use in PWM Leadership strategy discussions. Build presentations and business cases to support strategic initiatives linked to organizational goals and clearly communicate key findings from analytical research. Lead work packages and/or deliverables on strategic initiatives, including coordination and alignment with Wealth Management Lines of Business (LOB). Support employee engagement innovation initiatives across Wealth Management and being a positive role model to champion innovation across the organization. This role has the authority to recommend changes to business strategy, processes and systems to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Collaborate - Liaise with Finance to define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Produce summaries of progress for discussion with the PWM Leadership Team. Liaise with Strategy & Corporate Development to highlight key activities for CIBC Board of Director and Town Hall presentations. This role interacts on a regular basis with Private Wealth Management LOBs (primarily management) for the purposes of obtaining and clarifying progress against strategic initiatives. You will interact on a regular basis Finance and Insights & Analytics for the purposes of obtaining business datasets. This job interacts on a semi-regular basis with Corporate Development and Strategy for the purposes of Board of Director presentations and strategic analysis. This job requires the Sr. Manager to be part of internal committees and enterprise project teams.
Business Effectiveness– Uncover and identify opportunities to improve the client experience and business effectiveness by leveraging statistical approaches against multiple sources of data. Manage, prioritize, and respond to ad-hoc requests. Research specific innovation opportunities and identifying high-level applications relevant to the Wealth Management business.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in. You a minimum of 5+ years of work experience in the Financial Services industry, and/or other analytical-related functions. Proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and other MS Office tools. Demonstrated project management experience: plan, prioritize and organize work effectively, to meet deadlines, while managing competing priorities.
You have a degree or diploma in. Post-Secondary education in Mathematics, Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Actuarial Science.
You give meaning to data. A strong passion for data, charts, analysis, trends, and evangelizing data usage. You have demonstrated proficiency in working with large datasets: both structured and unstructured data, using macros, VBA, or programming language such as SAS, SQL or related.
You understand that success is in the details. You can synthesize information quickly and accurately and apply concepts based on understanding of financial markets and key Private Wealth Management services. You draw insights and note significant changes based on strong attention to detail.
You communication skills make an impact. You have excellent communication and influencing skills. You convey factual and conceptual information requiring detailed explanation and interpretation through presentations at an executive level Strong interpersonal skills: build and maintain effective working relationships with internal groups, other business units and internal partners within CIBC.
You act like an owner. You are a self-starter and have the ability to thrive on a high-degree of independence and ownership.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

Business Management
Supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defense (1st LOD) programs (e.g., operational risk, AML, compliance, regulatory, etc.), including overseeing business operations within the jurisdiction to ensure adherence and efficiency. Contributes to a strong risk management culture through collaboration with other first line employees, and second & third line functions to ensure Compliance, AML or operational risks are identified, mitigated, monitored and reported on an ongoing basis.
Qualifications:
Supports multiple, similar business units with corresponding number of regulators.
Assists with the implementation of risk management programs/ frameworks while identifying and minimizing negative impacts to the business.
Develops and implements risk mitigation strategies.
Acts as a subject matter expert in the evaluation, development and implementation of an internal control system.
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.
Monitoring to ensure that 1st line jobs are following defined processes and procedures.
Develops, documents and maintains business/group procedures updating and obtaining approvals as regulations or the operating environment changes and communicates changes to the business/group & relevant stakeholder groups.
Supports the development of measurable sustainment strategies including assessing and recommending mitigations for industry/ segment-specific risks and prioritizing opportunities presented by internal and external stakeholders.
Tracks exception/exemption requests and corresponding approvals.
Builds awareness, knowledge, and skills and, as necessary, provides communication, practical tools and ongoing support including making presentations, to promote a culture of risk identification and management.
Supports the management of 1st LOD program for the business/group in compliance with appropriate principles, standards & direction from the second line of defense groups. Includes developing and promoting program and ensuring the execution of all program components.
Works with assigned business/group leaders to implement 1st LOD programs and frameworks, developing and maintaining an in-depth understanding of the applicable regulatory and internal risk management requirements. Interprets and provides advice on the application of the requirements for the business/group.
Develops and maintains an understanding of the business/group strategies and objectives, products and services, internal and external stakeholders and business processes as well as the underlying infrastructure to identify and manage implications and risk exposures for the business/group.
Identifies, investigates, analyzes, documents & mitigates program risks, taking into account jurisdictional issues, and raises any issues or concerns to senior leaders and other stakeholders.
Analyzes the impact and effectiveness of the program through periodic reviews.
Recommends adjustments to the overall program, policy or processes within the business/group in accordance with the Risk Appetite Statement, Governance and Corporate Policy.
Supports the business/group through internal/external audits or regulatory examinations and assists in development of action plans to resolve any identified issues.
Provides support to the development and delivery of training and awareness programs within the business/group to increase awareness of and compliance to risk management requirements.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

ROLE: Business Analyst, Projects
REPORTS TO: Senior Project Manager, Investor and Corporate Reporting
LOCATION: Corporate Office in Richmond Hill
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Venterra Realty is a privately held Canadian corporate success story by any measure. It is a technology company, an investment management company and a commercial real estate company. Venterra has $3.0 billion assets under management; revenue of $250+ million. It owns and operates over 60 multi-unit residential properties, representing more than 18,000 units in the highest growth cities in the Southern U.S.

Investors have enjoyed some of the best risk-adjusted returns available in the market with an average annual return of 18.0% over a 20-year period. Financial performance of the firm’s investments has exceeded the average performance of the top U.S. REITs by 50% over the past five years. Significant capital is available to fund further growth. Customers (Residents) at Venterra properties rate their living experience in the top 5% nationally of all apartment communities. The CEO, John Foresi was also named a 2018 Glassdoor Top CEO. The values-driven corporate culture is applauded by employees. People join for a job and stay for a career.

Technology is in the DNA of its founders and they are the leaders of Venterra today. The Chairman gained a Master’s Degree in Artificial Intelligence before most of the world had heard of the words. Earlier in their careers, the Chairman and the CEO jointly led the growth and sale of a highly successful software technology business, focused on transportation logistics optimization. They then applied their business and technology acumen to the real estate industry and created Venterra.
2020 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women
2020, 2019 & 2018 Fortune Best Workplaces in Texas
2020, 2019, 2018, 2017, & 2016 Fortune Top 100 Best Medium Workplaces
2018 Fortune Best Workplaces for Diversity
2018 Houston Top Workplaces
2018 Glassdoor Top CEOs
2021, 2017 & 2016 Glassdoor Best Place to Work
50 Most Engaged Workplacesby the Achievers Corporation
And have 98% of our communities recognized as "Top Rated"by ApartmentRatings.com
 We are looking for people who:
Have strong personal values and want to work for a values-based company
Are ambitious and hard working with exceptionally high personal standards
Embrace problem-solving and learning new skills
Thrive in a rapidly changing and high growth environment
Are passionate about driving continuous improvements and the use of technology with data to drive business results
THE OPPORTUNITY
This is an exciting time to join Venterra. We are seeking to build on Venterra’s current success and continue to position the organization as a leader in the use of finance technology. Our solutions have been a combination of implementing customized third-party solutions and building solutions from scratch. In support of Venterra’s growth plan, the Investor Reporting Team is in the process of transforming Venterra’s end-to-end Investor Management lifecycle through the implementation of a third-party Investor Management and Accounting Software.
Reporting to the Senior Project Manager, Investor and Corporate Reporting, the Business Analyst, Projects will have the opportunity to execute critical Venterra projects and initiatives. Initially, this role will have a mandate to partner with the Senior Project Manager, Business Stakeholders, and the Vendor to lead the refinement, analysis, documentation and execution of project requirements and business processes for the end-to-end Investor Experience project through to project completion. Other initiatives will be assigned based on Venterra’s Annual Business Plan priorities and Business needs for both the Investor Reporting and Corporate Reporting teams.
KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with stakeholders and the project team to elicit, analyze, specify, validate, prioritize, and document business and stakeholder requirements
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle by identifying, analyzing, redefining, coordinating, and implementing, as required
Organize and facilitate meetings, discussions, and workshops among stakeholders, and between the business and external providers to assist with prioritizing and coordinating the implementation of competing deliverables
Develop and maintain detailed and accurate plans and documents (e.g. Requirements Traceability Matrix, Action Items Matrix, Scorecards, etc.) to ensure project deliverables will achieve the approved requirements
Partner with stakeholders and third-party vendors to define and execute user acceptance testing criteria, and to track, validate and report on issue resolution status through to acceptance and approval
Create clear and concise process maps, workflows, charts, visuals, training materials, end-user communications and other documentation, as required
Analyze current state business processes to identify opportunities for efficiency and automation, and partner with stakeholders to define, document and seek approval of redefined future state processes
Support RFP processes and vendor evaluation and management efforts
Provide post-implementation support to business stakeholders and users for project related deliverables
Other ad hoc initiatives and requests as required
CANDIDATE PROFILE
Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Business Process Improvement, or related discipline; PMI-BPA certification is an asset
5-7 years experience in a Business Analyst/Project related role, preferably in SaaS, HCM, ERP or other software implementations
Candidates who can demonstrate proven Business Analyst experience in leading projects through the end-to-end lifecycle and through successful software implementations will be preferred
Possesses confidence, a high sense of urgency, and ability to take ownership, think critically and solve problems with minimal direction and guidance
Knowledge of project management and change management principles and experience with implementing change in a project environment
Demonstrated experience in organizing and facilitating workshops, and with leading stakeholders through requirements and acceptance criteria elicitation; UAT scripting and execution; task analysis, assignment, and approvals; and, workflow and business process re-engineering and documentation
Superior coordination, organizational and facilitation skills with keen attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively interpret, document and present business requirements, specifications, reports, project documents, implementation plans, etc.
Exceptional interpersonal skills to interact effectively and build professional relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, Visio, PowerPoint, etc.)
Experience in real estate or asset management is preferred but not required

Work at CBC/Radio-Canada
At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.
Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.

Your role
As a Senior Research Analyst you will be an integral part of a dynamic team that provides on-going research for CBC's English Canada's initiatives. You will assist in the design, implementation, analysis and presentation of market, media, and audience research studies undertaken by the Custom Research team. Core responsibilities of the Senior Research Analyst will be questionnaire design, survey scripting and deployment, monitoring data collection, data analysis, report writing and presentation of results.

Key Tasks:
Conduct and manage quantitative and qualitative research initiatives for CBC English Services.
Select or create the research design or methodology best suited to meet current needs.
Questionnaire design and survey scripting, sample deployment.
Work with external sample providers and troubleshoot data collection issues.
Use SPSS or other software to analyze survey data and present them in easily understood tabular or graphic formats.
Synthesize this information and build reports that highlight insights in a clear and concise manner.
Present findings to internal stakeholders.

We are looking for a candidate with the following profile:
Academic and professional training in social science research with a post-secondary degree in communications, social science, media studies, or relevant discipline, or equivalent education and experience. Minimum B.A, but M.A preferred.
Knowledge of the media landscape, in general, and of CBC, in particular.
Requires in-depth knowledge and industry experience of current qualitative and quantitative market research methodologies.
Demonstrated survey and questionnaire design expertise, particularly in the media and audience research field, including program testing, host testing, website testing as well as Brand Lift Studies.
Demonstrated technical expertise with survey scripting tools such as Sparq, Alchemer, Qualtrics or Survey Monkey.
Demonstrated competency in creating compelling reports and presentations of market research data with a focus on insights.
Advanced MS Excel and MS PowerPoint skills, Google docs, slides and sheets.
Experience using large syndicated data sources (vividata, Numeris, comScore, EA Prizm, etc.).
High level of oral and written communication skills, especially for the presentation of research findings.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Excellent attention to detail to ensure data accuracy.
Sense of initiative and creativity in conceptualizing research problems, designing methodologies, analyzing, interpreting and presenting data.
Requires the capacity to respond in a timely way to a wide range of requests, both urgent and long-term, and to handle multiple priorities.

Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.
If this sounds interesting, please click on ''Apply online''. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected will be contacted.

Job Description:
We currently have a Temporary Full-time (until approx. May 2022) opportunity for a Data Specialist/Clinical Analyst in the Decision Support department at our Bayview campus.

Summary of Duties
Perform quality control processes on Activity Level Reporting (ALR) data to ensure quality and integrity of data submitted to Health Ontario (CCO)

Development and deployment of ad-hoc and standard reports to support Odette Operational needs using a variety of reporting tools such as SQL, SAP Crystal Reports, SAS, PowerBI, etc.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong technical and analytical aptitude
Ability to problem solve
Able to organize, plan and prioritize work with time constraints and strict deadlines

Established proficiency in computer software applications (e.g. MSOffice, Visio and MS Projects)

Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 210781 to:
Human Resources
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

What is the opportunity?
At the heart of our economy is a national payments system, safely circulating billions of dollars each day. But the payments system must modernize to support the rapidly changing needs and expectations of the Canadian marketplace, foster innovation and strengthen competition within the payments ecosystem. RBC has an opportunity to learn from modernization initiatives around the world and set its own path towards a world-class payments system capable of meeting the needs of a global economy and to put in place a solution that will establish a competitive advantage for RBC. To address this opportunity, RBC is currently is seeking to hire an experienced Senior Business Analyst who can manage and support both business and system requirements process.
What will you do?
Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review. Apply advanced elicitation techniques to work with different types of stakeholder groups
Lead requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out business priorities
Define business analysis approach including tasks and deliverables based on the project and delivery methodology (Agile/Iterative Waterfall).
Verify and validate quality requirements with the impacted stakeholders
Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates. Analyze and document scope of the business solution using enterprise-standard requirements methodology
Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties. Analyze and document both detailed business and system solution requirements using enterprise standard requirements methodology
Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Minimum 5 years of experience in a Senior Business Systems Analyst role with proven experience with various methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile delivering medium and large-scale payments projects
Must be able to analyze system interactions and clearly articulate and document end-to-end system flows
Must have solid understanding of Payment Systems, API development and ISO 20022 SWIFT messages.
Experience in managing diverse stakeholders, providing clear communications and presenting assessment options
Must be able to produce requirements artefacts: Problem Opportunity Analysis, Scope Modelling, Business Process Mapping, Business Context Diagraming, Use Cases & Scenarios, Business Rules & Data Catalogue, User Stories, Story Decomposition, Story Mapping and Requirements traceability
Nice-to-have
Knowledge of Wire Room, Payment Processing, Real-Time Gross Settlement (RTGS/LYNX), Automated Clearing Settlement System (ACSS), Cash and Liquidity Risk Management, Clearing and Settlement process
Relevant college, university, and/or post-graduate degree in Business Analysis
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs

Join our Talent Community
Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

The purpose of this role is to support the U.S. Credit Stress Testing team in the preparation of regular, periodic and ad-hoc credit stress tests, including regulatory stress testing submissions for all Wholesale and Retail portfolios as required. In this role, the candidate will be responsible for execution and creation of SAS jobs required for stress testing models and automation of manual files in SAS. Additionally, this person shall be a subject matter expert on data utilized in stress testing and assist in any research required to understand stress testing results. The team is responsible for all aspects of credit stress testing lifecycle with a focus on analytics, tactical execution and strategic continuous improvement. This effort involves meaningful contributions to credit analysis and stress testing activities and close partnership with upstream and downstream groups.
Supports the research and development of stress testing and scenario analysis methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from changes in the market and external environment for business/group portfolios and products. Applies knowledge of analytics algorithms and technologies to develop models, methodologies and supplementary stress testing tools and infrastructures that assess the impact of a stress on risk capital and ensure risks are properly identified, understood and risk related strategies are enabled. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. defining tolerance for adverse outcomes, capital modelling, assess capital and liquidity, recovery actions, portfolio and risk management strategies and tactics.
Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Tableau Reports/Dashboard Developer (18-month term)
Job Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst – Tableau Reports/Dashboard Developer (18-month term)
Toronto, ON, Canada Req #1563
 Friday, February 26, 2021
Summary:
The Business Intelligence Analyst works closely with the business and senior management and is a major contributor to the reporting deliverables. Building and streamlining BI reports and Dashboards (Tableau) and processes and leading BI Automation projects.
The need to comprehend business concepts and ensures these concepts are delivered as meaningful analytics. The analyst facilitates design and concept gathering and assists in the creation of new reports or analytics. Additionally, the analyst should be experienced with problem-solving and conflict resolution to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues.

Job Duties:

The primary purpose of this position is to support the business and Director, Business Intelligence, Senior VP, Business Analytics and Lead – Data & Business Intelligence in terms of automation projects and analysis via Tableau with a view to deliver enhanced business performance.
Driving the design, development, and maintenance of the required management reports.
Administer and manage Tableau server, user access, and scheduled reporting.
Develop and deliver both sales and non-sales focused analytics dashboards and interactive dashboards.
Lead initiative to develop and deploy Tableau Mobile organization wide and integration with Salesforce.
Promote Tableau Online and Tableau Public by publishing meaningful reports and dashboards.
Act as a bridge between IT and business stakeholders.
Author Tableau dictionary and process documentation.
Monitor, prioritize, and manage multiple initiatives and projects with the ability to identify issues/risks and create appropriate mitigation/action plans.
Contribute to team objectives by focusing on process improvement and efficiency.
Utilize SQL to connect Tableau to query complex production database logic and design.
Manage Tableau integration with SQL replica of production database and Salesforce.
Assist in developing Risk Management and Other Non-Sales Automated reports.
Advance Tableau utilization and Digitalization of all Regular Sales & Non-Sales Reports
Write SQL queries, VBA codes, and understand complex database relationships.
Be involved in any ETL process for Tableau stored procedure.
Work with different levels within the IT & sales, non-sales organization to gather information and data points on key initiatives and projects to support business performance.
To Identify and recommend improvements to current processes, with a focus on increased efficiencies and enhanced value-added analytics.
Introduce new Dashboards, reporting formats, etc. which provide insights to different areas of the business.
Drive a variety of special projects to improve internal business processes.
Create BRDs and maintain BI Documentation for all processes.
Assist in implementing solutions for financial forecasting and other modeling


Requirements:
2-3 years of relevant experience in Business Analysis and automation, Business Intelligence tools (Tableau) and/or any other BI Tools
Reports and Dashboard Builder – Data Visualization using BI Tools
Project Management
Microsoft SQL & VBA/Macros, R, Python
Basic Knowledge on CRM
Microsoft Office: Excel, Visio, Word, and PowerPoint
Proven ability to conduct and/or support multiple projects with minimal oversight.
Strong interviewing and listening skills to elicit detailed requirements.
Proven analytical skills in defining business needs into product requirements.
Demonstrable excellent written and verbal communication skills with business and Technical stakeholders as well as internal and external users.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work independently and to prioritize work with a focus on deadlines and deliverables.
Proven record as a strong team player in a fast-paced, deadline driven, diverse environment; and
Exceptional interpersonal skills

FLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:FLT) is a global leader in business payments. We simplify the way businesses manage and pay their expenses. Our portfolio of brands help companies automate, secure, digitize and control payments to, or on behalf of, their suppliers and employees. Our payment solutions cover four primary expense categories: Payables, Tolls, Fuel, and Lodging. We serve businesses, merchants and partners in North America, Latin America, Europe and Asia Pacific. Job Title: Business Analyst - Product Development for FIS Ambit BancWare
Job Description:
Position Type :
Full time
Type Of Hire :
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
Education Desired :
Bachelor's Degree
Travel Percentage :
0%
Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.
About the team
FIS’s award-winning Ambit risk management solutions enable financial institutions around the globe to avoid the next meltdown by quantifying and mitigating their risk.
FIS provides an integrated solution suite for asset/liability management, budgeting and planning, regulatory compliance, and profitability. We provide solutions focused on helping our customers integrate systems and data to streamline operations, reduce cost, mitigate risk and understand enterprise-wide exposure.
NOTE: This role can be worked remotely within EST
What you will be doing

FIS Risk Credit and Lending solutions is seeking a Business Analyst with strong skills to join our Toronto based Ambit BancWare development team working on a variety of financial engineering projects for asset/liability management and interest rate risk product offerings. He or she will thrive in a highly collaborative environment using agile development processes. The candidate is also responsible for the testing of new systems or enhancements and support customer interactions.
Responsibilities:
Participate as a team member in the agile (Scrum) process throughout the SDLC to produce high performing, advanced risk analytics for our customers
Interface with North American customers for requirements gathering and product support.
Independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs of our customers by applying their financial and technological knowledge to the design of methodologies, models, and/or systems solutions. This may involve rapid prototyping, with requirements and solutions developed on an iterative basis that provides interim deliverables until a final production solution is created. This includes conducting research and analysis, accurately and clearly defining user requirements and processes, and liaising with our customers and internal stakeholders (Professional and Client Services) to define the scope and priority for the various strategic projects.
Participate in project planning and estimation, working with other team members to analyze requirements and provide recommendations for testing
Develop test plans and procedures based on business requirements and design documents to ensure the application’s quality and relevance for our clients
Perform automated, manual and regression testing to verify the application and associated financial models have been correctly implemented to meet requirements
Communicate progress, identify any risks related to quality and delivery, and track software issues throughout the life-cycle of the development process
Conduct gap analysis between current process vs target state and propose viable Technology solutions
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer/Information Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Financial Engineering or Finance or Master’s degree with related work experience
Strong experience as a software product development Business Analyst
Experience with QA/testing for the Microsoft technology stack
Experience with relational databases to manage, store and analyze large data sets
Strong logical, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills to effectively express ideas, engage in complex discussions and collaborate with a wide range of colleagues
Delivery-oriented team player who takes responsibility for the team’s success and strives to continually learn and improve
Bonus if you have:
Experience in the banking or financial services industries with knowledge of fixed income financial instruments
Experience with risk management, interest rate modelling and/or predictive analytics applications
Experience implementing/installing and/or supporting enterprise level software for external clients
Experience with MS SQL Server, SSAS
Experience with Excel for manipulating and analyzing data cubes
What we offer you
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
A wide range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
A competitive salary and benefits
A variety of career development tools, resources, and opportunities
Privacy Statement
FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
Sourcing Model
Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
