We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
As a Business Analyst you will be Implementing changes to CIBC systems to deliver high quality information to our internal and external stakeholders. You will become an integral part of CIBC and be able to deliver changes that maintain a balance between project deliverables and ongoing maintenance as well as continually improving on existing processes. Work with business and technology partners to plan and perform the User Acceptance Testing of projects of varying scope. Where applicable, prepare high level business requirements/user stories create test plans, documenting and communicating test results as required by the nature and scope of the enhancement. Maintain controls related to the integrity of risk data, conducting ongoing data quality review, ensuring new initiatives including program/product/process design implementation, systems, procedures, documentation etc., meet the standards required to support the business unit objectives and overall controls
How You’ll Succeed
Understanding and Documenting Requirements – Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs.
Build strong relationships , lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
Experience with Agile methodology , writing user stories , managing scrum calls , prioritizing backlogs, etc.
Analytical Thinking – Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills. Your experience should be sufficient to interpret risk measures, regulatory reporting guidelines / principles to deliver accurate and complete results to both internal and external clients.
Regulatory acumen– Excellent understanding of the regulatory landscape will result in producing quality, timely and accurate changes to CIBC’s systems.
Who You Are
You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You have demonstrated experience with data analysis tools (incl. data analyst skill-level using SQL, SAS EG and Cognos, Data Management Tools: Informatica DQ, IBM IGC, Oracle DRM)
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
You can demonstrate experience in taking high level requirements from external regulators and translating them into system changes that fulfil both internal and external reporting.. It’s an asset if you have knowledge of Basel II/III/IV Framework methodologies, relevant financial standards (IFRS-9) and BCBS 239 requirements for risk data aggregation & reporting, understand Capital Adequacy Reporting guidelines set out by OSFI(particularly Credit Risk) and understand how this is used within bank.
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Strategy & Analytics - Strategy Analyst
1881 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4S 3C4, Canada Req #128
 Monday, February 22, 2021
HomeEquity Bank is the leading national provider of reverse mortgages to homeowners aged 55 and over, Canada’s fastest growing demographic segment. HomeEquity Bank originates and administers Canada’s largest portfolio of reverse mortgages under the CHIP Home Income Plan™ brand. New mortgages are originated on a direct to consumer basis as well as through referral arrangements with the six largest banks, leading mortgage brokers and financial planning firms. HomeEquity Bank has been the main underwriter of reverse mortgages in Canada since its predecessor; Canadian Home Income Plan Corporation pioneered the concept in 1986. HomeEquity Bank has a highly effective direct-to-consumer distribution model (B2C), as well as an established referral network (B2B), including Canada’s major banks, credit unions, financial planners and mortgage brokers.

HomeEquity Bank is exceptionally well positioned for further growth for a number of very important reasons: 1) positive demographic trends in the 55 years old and over segment, 2) wider awareness and growing demand of reverse mortgages in the market, 3) significant barriers to entry for competitors, and 4) HomeEquity Bank’s firm position as market leader.
Position Summary

Reporting to the Vice President, Strategy, the Strategy Analyst will work in conjunction with the Shared Services Team to help build out the strategic initiatives. This role requires a strong strategic thinker with excellent data analysis and business case writing skills and the ability to research, ideally with some financial services experience, to assist in the strategic planning process, as the company continues to grow its reverse mortgage business.
The successful candidate must be able to exercise discretion, good judgment and take initiative. Working closely with the Executive Team, across the bank, the incumbent must act as a key resource in providing the research and analytical support required to develop and achieve our corporate strategy.
He / she will ensure all activities are compliant with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures and will assist the Vice President, Strategy with our current strategic initiatives

Major Elements of the Role
Support bank annual strategic planning; work with all business units to align business strategy with overall bank goals and strategic objectives
Conduct regular industry research (trends, technology, competitive environment, best practice, etc.) and prepare reports for internal stakeholders
Support strategic initiative implementation
Support business case building for key investments and initiatives through quantitative analysis and simple financial modelling
Support bank business reporting, data and analytics projects
Conduct customer study as needed
Skills and Experience Required
Bachelor’s Degree in commerce; Finance or Accounting preferred
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Will thrive in a collaborative, fast-pace work environment
Team player and motivated by shared success
Individuals must comply with the Bank’s AML, Fraud and Privacy Policies and procedures and be vigilant in the detection and prevention of money laundering, terrorist financing, fraud and the safeguard of all client information.
HomeEquity Bank complies with the Employment Equity Act. Our Employment Equity program is intended to help ensure that all Canadians have the same access to the labour market and to ensure the full representation of members of the four designated groups which include: women, visible minorities, Aboriginal People and Persons with Disabilities.
If you would like more information on the HomeEquity Bank please visit: www.homeequitybank.ca. If you'd like to find out more about the CHIP Home Income Plan solution, please visit www.chip.ca.

We need your help to keep up with customer demand to improving their success!

 We are seeking an enthusiastic, professional & customer focused Data Analytics Analyst to be responsible for internal and client facing reporting strategies that will help grow our business.

We need your help to keep up with customer demand to improving their success!

Participating in the creation and preparation of client reports, reviews & escalation reporting.

Monitor & manage data accuracy of all customer Activity, Opportunity & Contact information maintained in Salesforce & other designated systems
Develop and maintain new business financial models, tools & presentations

 Qualifications

Proficient in MS Office Suite, including Power BI; advanced in Excel
Experienced in building MS Power BI dashboards and reports

How to Apply.

Geospatial

Job Title: Business Analyst Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade Support
Job Description:
HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada.
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking.
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.
About Global Banking & Markets, IT
Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides financial services and products to corporates, governments and institutions worldwide, building partnerships with them to help them achieve consistent, long-term performance. We use the strength of HSBC’s international network to connect emerging and mature markets, covering key growth areas. Our products and services include advisory, financing, prime services, research and analysis, securities services, trading and sales, and transaction banking.
The Global Banking and Markets Technology team is dedicated to supporting Global Banking and Markets by working in partnership with business leaders who rely on us for delivering innovative, robust, stable platforms to enable their investment and financial solutions for clients. Join Global Banking and Markets Technology and be part of the global connectivity, collaboration and team that spans across 20 countries. The total number of successful production releases surpass some of the biggest blue chip tech companies. Canada is a key location in Global Banking and Markets Technology’s global growth strategy and is receiving global attention for its deliveries.
Key Objectives for Business Analyst Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade Support:
Fixed Income normally refers to debt markets under Global Banking & Markets. This role is particularly for Fixed Income projects which facilitate market connectivity, pricing, Request for Quotes and negotiations, processing and persistence of trades electronically for fixed income Cash business covering bonds and derivative products.
Senior Business Analyst responsible for Fixed Income Cash Business use of Bloomberg and Operations use of Optitrade for the block and allocation flow. Analyst will be required to assist and investigate issues and questions raised by a variety of stakeholders. These queries will range from functional questions about the use of both systems, queries with system set up, processing issues and data issues. The expectation is the role will extend to assist the Global Team with testing, system changes and ad hoc Maintain the Bank items managed by the Team.
The candidate would be responsible to deliver multiple services for the project with quality and efficiency coordinating with global stakeholders. The candidate should be able to work in a techno-functional role as an individual contributor responsible for business communication, requirement analysis and implementing solutions as a hands on contributor. He/she would be required to coordinate with global business/technical team and Production Support teams. Proven track record of delivering high quality, excellent analysis and excellent communication and interpersonal skills are the essentials for the position.
Principle Accountabilities:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Analyst who will join our team supporting Business, development and maintenance of the Fixed Income applications (Trade Order Management Solutions & Optitrade)
A successful candidate must have deep knowledge and skills in investment banking with both front-end and back-end applications in order to support various requirements coming from our business partners
We expect this person will play one of the key roles in the delivery team - not only when it comes to analysis but self-driven in understanding functionalities across different flows/applications, trouble-shooting on production issues and guiding other members in team
Identifying potential issues, reviewing solutions and recommending strategies for solving problems. Provide support to Technical lead responsible for the project delivery
Conducting research – business process and strategy – to ensure knowledge of best practice needed to support delivery for business stakeholders
The Candidate must be reactive and responsive to queries raised by the Business. The Candidate Have an appreciation of the priority of the issue, who is asking and what the impact of the request is.
The Analyst must Always be professional and act with integrity. Seek guidance and support from the Team – always look to gain additional experience and knowledge to be able to better support stakeholders.
The Analyst must Develop relationships with Operational users of Optitrade & Always ensure that answers to any queries are concise, directive and correct. Should an answer not be immediately available ensure we communicate this and work with the wider Team to seek guidance.
Always ensure that an issue is fully resolved to the satisfaction of the requestor. Be willing and prepared to work limited shift patterns so that we have coverage amongst the Team from Hong Kong Mid-day until United States mid-day.
Ensure compliance with all relevant internal instructions (Functional Instruction Manual, Global Standards Manual, circulars), internal control standards and external regulatory requirements, including the management of operational risk and adherence to the Group’s standards of ethical behaviour. Ensure that confluence documentation is fully maintained as and when new solutions, resolution pages are created.
Major Challenges are to become system and process flow experts in both Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade. Functional usage in Bloomberg is a cross a varied set of users, so queries can range from Trader use, end to end straight through processing queries re trades, files queries around data attributes etc etc. Gaining an in-depth cross functional knowledge will be an ongoing, iterative process, which at times will have to be self-taught. Need to be multi-functional IA Financial provide support and also be able to do Business Analyst and testing to support the full stack pod in ad hoc Maintain the Bank projects.
The ultimate aim of this role is to become a fully productive and integral part of the full stack Team. Levels of knowledge across the Team can be at different levels however each resource must show an interest and also a desire to take on more responsibility be self-sufficient and look to increase knowledge of the product, the processes and the systems.
Qualifications

Individual Contributor
8-12 years of experience as an individual contributor
Experience in Agile projects
Participate in production support of Fixed Income application & worked on improvement initiatives like improvement of performance, production stability
Self-motivated, enthusiastic and proven rapid learning capability
Experience working in fast-paced, collaborative environment Excellent Understanding of Block and allocation flow & Testing experience in FI Cash flow.
Evidence of working in a controlled environment.
Previous knowledge of Fixed Income products ( cash Trading )
Experience in the use of Bloomberg TOMs would be ideal however Knowledge of Cash Primary trading systems, inherent system functions and a basic understanding of additional PTS functions IE PnL pricing etc etc would be desirable
F2b knowledge of cash fixed income processing would be desirable
Experience in an automated Production support Team environment would be desirable, one which has used CHAT BOTs and has used Symphony extensively.
Experience in JIRA and RTC and some limited knowledge in task automation and Python/scripting language would be desirable.
Technical
Good To Have
Technical exposure to Java.
Exposure to industry standard financial production support standareds.
L2 production support of BBG-Toms and Optitrade applications
Exposure to Automation.
Domain
Must Have
Exposure to Fixed Income Cash and Derivartive products.
Understanding of electronic markets, trading terminologies, pricing models, reference data.
Knowledge of Block & Alocation flow in FI.
Able to go through logs and write basic queries in database

Cardinal Health Canada, with over 1300 employees nationwide, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

We are looking for positive and team-oriented individual to join our dynamic Supply Chain team in Mississauga. The Demand Planning Analyst will be responsible of demand forecasts to identify sales’ trends across all business segments and to proactively represent any statistical forecasting exceptions. The Demand Planning Analyst will also create and maintain forecast models, assist in incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from sales, marketing, finance, and other sources into that demand plan utilizing their analytic and interpersonal skills.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings .

Your Contributions to the Organization will be :
Proactively develop, analyze, and recommend finished goods demand forecasts at multiple levels of aggregation

Identifying areas of forecast risk and improvement opportunities for their assigned demand planning categories

Owning a New Business Program Management, including workflow submissions, troubleshooting, daily uploading processes and measuring forecasting accuracy & bias (NB Materialization)

Playing a key role in the future ERP Implementation

Reviewing historical sale trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, evaluate forecast results

Developing an easy way to quickly compile and analyze month over month and year over year trends on product groups as required.

Creating reports and automated system alerts to proactively identify forecast exceptions

Assisting in the creation of best-in-class processes to improve forecast accuracy and bias

Engaging and collaborating with sales teams to ensure better inventory planning, demand Signal Exception Analysis, new business materialization and service level analysis

Drive analysis and provide insights related to overall network optimization, stocking analysis, core assortment framework and other related adhoc activities

This Job might be for you if:
Possess a strong understanding of logistics and distribution gained through 2-4 years of Supply Chain experience

College/University education in /Supply Chain Management, MBA is an asset

You possess strong analytical skills and proven ability to analyze data trends with the use of reporting tools (ex. Excel, Access) and initiate action from findings.

You have the ability to work successfully in a team environment as well as individually

Proven ability to handle multiple tasks at the same time and be able to prioritize effectively

You have strong facilitation, presentation, and effective communication skills

You have knowledge of category management is an asset

Our Story:

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organisation. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people’s lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact.
Why Work for Us:
We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work – our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry.

Overview:

About Citylitics Inc.
Citylitics delivers predictive intelligence on local utility & public infrastructure markets.
The U.S. needs to invest $4.5 Trillion over the next 5 years to upgrade its infrastructure, including water, energy, public transit, roads, airports, and more. Citylitics is the only source of predictive intelligence on where, how, and why these infrastructure investments will be made. Our Data Engine transforms over a billion documents buried in 31,000+ cities & utilities data sources into high value intelligence for targeted business development. The largest infrastructure industry leaders rely on Citylitics for external datasets and intelligence reports.
Citylitics' vision is a world where data drives trillions of dollars of societal infrastructure investment towards the most ideal social, economic, and environmental outcomes.
Who We Are Looking For
We are looking for a Data Analyst who can query and extract interesting data from our databases, analyze it, turn it into actionable solutions and storylines, and develop presentations for internal and external clients. You will be responsible for turning raw data into impactful insights. You will be a key resource for client engagement, research, and future product features. You will develop ideas for structured analysis and curate hypotheses in line with market interests. You will also prepare data and execute analyses using sound statistical methods and established data modeling techniques.
Most of our team is based out of Toronto but we are working remotely due to COVID-19. We are open to fully remote candidates but have a preference for candidates based in Toronto, Kitchener/Waterloo, Milwaukee, Chicago, or Austin. We have office bases in Toronto, Milwaukee, and Austin.
Requirements
The ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong command of data-driven best practices and knowledge of relational databases. They will be able to work independently for much of their time, but will also work with the wider team to seek input from the Product, Sales, Client Success and Engineering Teams on data that we need to add to our Data Roadmap. They will then work to clean and standardize data, build specs and schemas, and manage data ingestion processes to ensure timely and accurate uploads to our Data Warehouse. This includes providing insights into the causes of data issues, point out anomalies, create dashboards and generate insights reports. This role is primarily responsible for the quality and integrity of the data at Citylitics.
The interview process will include a data aptitude test that must be completed in order to be considered for this position.
What You Will Accomplish:
Deliver infrastructure-related data & analytics that our clients need and answer any related follow-up questions that our team or clients may have regarding the source or consistency of the data
Deploy your proven data skills to dig deep and parse through thousands of data sources relating to infrastructure across North America
Champion the integrity and coverage of our data by developing tools to streamline data aggregation and automation processes
Manage client projects including client calls, scoping, delegating data aggregation tasks, instructing/coaching others on the data aggregation
Design and document a repeatable and successful data ingestion process that will be incorporated in our search tools and client-facing platforms, having a significant impact on how intelligence gets delivered within the infrastructure industry.
Writes scripts to aggregate data for client projects - clean the data, standardize it, back it up and report on progress to the Team Lead and the larger team
Work closely with the Client Success and Product teams to query and package data that supports our Product Roadmap and helps make impactful team decisions
Requirements:
Technical chops - Python and SQL for scripting and an advanced knowledge of Excel
Written and verbal communication - well-spoken so you can communicate technical processes (like where our data is sourced, how we process it, how we apply filters, etc.) to clients or non-technical users
Organized - takes pride in writing clean and readable code, putting together a functional and well-designed dashboard or build a spreadsheet that is concise and easy to sift through
Have experience managing data collection projects including understanding the importance of data integrity, the tradoffs of using spreadsheets and the value of communicating data collection steps clearly
Undergraduate or graduate degree in Data Science, Engineering, Information Studies, Market Research, Journalism or similar level of project experience
A willingness to fail and find dead ends, but learn fast and make immediate adjustments
At least 1 year in a client-facing role is an asset
Benefits
Why Citylitics?
This is a rare opportunity to influence positive change through your work within one of the biggest societal challenges of our generation (infrastructure - from water to transport to energy and more).
Contribute to delivering a disruptive solution with a compelling value proposition into an industry that is eager to hear from you and in a market with no direct competition.
We live at the cross-section of infrastructure, startup and data science. We are a unique team focused on a unique opportunity.
There is no corporate bureaucracy here. You will accomplish more here in a few months than what you would in a few years at a large, entrenched technology company.
Perks include company-paid transportation, health & fitness benefits, a generous yearly training budget, and work-from-wherever days in addition to your competitive salary and incentive bonuses.
We work hard. We win together. We are on a mission to solve the world's infrastructure needs. We enjoy happy-hour patios and social events (though virtually these days!). We believe our team's diversity makes us the best we can be!
Application Deadline is March 31st, 2021, but candidates will be selected for interviews on a rolling basis.

La Banque le Choix du Président (PCF) est une filiale en propriété exclusive de Les Compagnies Loblaw Limitée (LCL) et a été créée pour promouvoir les produits et Services financiers le Choix du Président à l’échelle du Canada. PCF met l’accent sur la prestation de solutions et de services de paiement de tous les jours qui récompensent le quotidien. En collaboration avec la division Services PC de Loblaws Inc., avec qui nous partageons notre bureau, nous offrons des produits et des services dans les segments suivants :
Cartes de paiement : La carte de crédit Mastercard Services financiers PCMD offre des points PC OptimumMC pour chaque dollar dépensé, sans frais annuels. Le compte PC ArgentMC est le plus récent ajout aux produits de paiement offerts et exploités par la Banque le Choix du Président. Le compte PC Argent fonctionne comme un compte bancaire et offre des points PC Optimum pour chaque achat, sans frais mensuels.
Assurance : Les assurances auto et habitation PCMD sont offertes par l’entremise du Courtier d’assurance PC inc. et en partenariat avec plusieurs assureurs.
Télécommunications et cartes-cadeaux : La Boutique Mobile, le service prépayé de téléphonie cellulaire PC, et le secteur des cartes-cadeaux visent à offrir de la commodité et un rapport qualité/prix exceptionnels aux clients de LCL.

LCL est le plus important détaillant alimentaire au Canada et a étendu ses activités dans certaines catégories non alimentaires pour l’ensemble du pays. LCL se concentre sur la vente au détail d’aliments, en ayant pour objectif d’offrir aux consommateurs la crème du magasin multiservices pour répondre à leurs besoins quotidiens en matière d’articles ménagers.
Les Services financiers le Choix du Président et les Services PC sont des unités d’affaires importantes de LCL, qui gèrent et élaborent des programmes de produits et de services conçus pour améliorer l’expérience client, maximiser la valeur et fournir une plate-forme permettant d’améliorer tant les données sur les clients que les relations avec ces derniers. Notre vision est de simplifier la vie au quotidien.
About the role:
Loblaw’s Customer Solutions Centre of Excellence (CoE) works to provide customers with exceptional self-serve resources that provide meaningful solutions, inspire customer confidence, and bolster business growth.
As a Specialist, you will provide day to day operational and analytical support for our conversational UI channel, specifically, our customer facing chatbots. As part of the Customer Solutions team, you require a strong analytical and technical background to collect insights , analyze customer sentiment, identify key chat drivers, and recognize themes from the conversation data. You will need to utilize data analysis and BI tools to create impactful and visually appealing reports to drive process improvements and enhance the customer experience. Through collaboration with Customer Marketing, Customer Products & Platforms, and Operations stakeholders we will deliver world class customer experiences through automated customer support.
What you'll do:
Develop a deep understanding of chatbot functionality, our business, customer needs, and our long-term vision to provide friction-less, automated customer solutions
Analyze and interpret qualitative and quantitative data to create insights, formulate reports on conclusions of data analysis, and make recommendations to improve the chatbot customer experience
Ability to communicate insights verbally, visually, and written through powerful storytelling
Collaborate with Digital team, developers, and chatbot vendor stakeholders to understand impacts and benefits of any technical/system changes, implementations, and/or enhancements that could impact the chatbot experience.
Investigate data/process anomalies; propose and implement solutions to improve data accuracy and performance
Perform statistical analysis/provide insight into unusual customer trends, design/implement stemming from our chatbots
Provide ad-hoc reporting in a timely manner
What you'll need:
A university degree or college diploma in a business or technical fields such as business management, computer science, statistics or related field
Experience with chatbot technology, AI, NLP and Machine Learning, an asset.
Strategic and creative thinker who is exceptionally adept with quantitative and qualitative analysis
Strong analytical skills with experience in extracting impactful insights from data sets to develop impactful reports
Ability to convey complex data in a concise and understandable manner, to relate and engage with stakeholders from both technical and non-technical disciplines
Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills including formulas, pivot tables and V-lookup
Intermediate knowledge of data cleansing and data visualization using systems such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL, an asset
Strong time management skills and attention to detail
Customer-focused with a passion for delivering incredible customer experiences
Positive attitude and self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively

Job Summary
Reporting to the Consultant, Business Solutions, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for technical documentation, supporting project delivery and coordinate process redesign and BI development initiatives led by the Business Solutions Group ("BSG"). Contributing to the overall effectiveness and delivery of business solutions for the Financial Reporting and Business Planning ("FR&BP") department, this role is responsible for working with various BSG to document requirements and provide support to key project deliverables to ensure business solution integration and alignment of processes, systems and information.
What you will do:
Document systems specifications including data, ETL and reporting for solutions developed by BSG.
Participate in solution delivery and support project leads in requirements gathering, process mapping, design, development, and implementation.
Facilitate project coordination for process and BI delivery through status communication, defect management and issue resolution.
Provide input into specifications and user acceptance test documents as applicable, to support technology and process initiatives through to completion. This includes identifying gaps, issues, and misalignment.
Analyze data to identify issues and leverage modern BI tools to support business decisions.
Assist business users in understanding any problems and challenges by working with them to enhance system and workflow capabilities to ensure quality deliverables that meet business and project objectives.
Work collaboratively with IT to deal with business solution issues and identifies plans for resolution.

What you bring:
University degree and/or a combination of equivalent training, education and experience
3 plus years in progressive roles dealing with business analysis and production support
Experience in system documentation specializing in data and reporting specifications
Strong knowledge of business requirements gathering, process mapping and gap analysis
Knowledge of business analysis best practices and methodologies with practical application experience
Familiar with core Corporate Accounting functions
Familiar with risk and controls in a Finance environment
Experience in the Pension and/or Financial Services industry an asset
Business Analyst certification an asset
Collaborative, professional, accountable, and trustworthy
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to support multiple projects and work under pressure
Excellent written and verbal (interpersonal and communication) skills
Ability to effectively adapt to change
Excellent business analysis and time management skills
Experience using business intelligence tools, including design, maintenance and documentation
Ability to implement process improvements where necessary
Ability to plan, organize and monitor work effectively to ensure standards of performance are adhered to
Ability to work independently with minimal direction

About HOOPP

Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.

HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation.
From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.

Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.

Job Title: Business Analyst - Data, Systems and Business Solutions - 305311
Job Description:
Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions.
Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions – Job Description
Technical Solution Design & Analytics. You will help our team make data-driven decisions.
Development of agile metrics (Sprint velocity, burndown, etc.) to contribute to oversight of Software BAU (business as usual) team oversight and increase agile maturity.
Lead, guide and support multiple work stream leads / consultants through the design and implementation of targeted change strategies including identification of change impacts to people, process, policy, and structure, stakeholder identification and alignment, appropriate communication and feedback loops, success measures, training, organizational readiness, and long-term sustainability
Developing comprehensive technical solutions for specific problems both as part of BAU process and transformation initiatives
Contribute to and/or lead the design and development of software (prepare the production readiness checklist) and data solutions including prototypes, proof-of-concepts, sandboxes, labs and so forth.
Work on portfolio of initiatives across capital systems affecting economic and regulatory capital, leverage ratio and other critical risk reports
Understand and capture context, problem statements and detail business requirements
Create complex BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing regulatory capital data infrastructure built around Hadoop as well as localized DataMart and other data sources.
Contribute to and/or lead the efforts to enhance business processes through automation and fuse ML/AI
Establishing Frameworks & Process Redesign. You will develop key business processes in line with new capital infrastructure.
Following the data and metrics extracted above, investigate a business process, interview people, analyze systems, document as appropriate
Communicate findings concisely and succinctly.
Work with FRO team members to devise, weigh and implement run books.
Technical Writing. You will help cultivate re-usability of Product Knowledge.
We’re migrating software platforms, and all of our operations and processes need to be re-documented and organized.
Develop a program to preserve and organize this knowledge, and then execute on the strategy.

Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions – Mandatory Skills
At least 8+ year’s hands-on experience as a Business Analyst with at least 5+ years on an agile project. Strong Business Process Mapping, Process Analysis and Business Process Reengineering skills are essential.
Strong analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to comprehensively analyze business processes and workflows
Experience in leading the Target Operating model (TOM) activities in support of different data streams, implemented / analyzed Data Transfer controls, Data Quality Checks and established the system robustness evaluation report.
Lead the analysis studies in production, maintenance, reliability, sanitation and management systems.
Experience in to updating the RTB runbooks/playbooks, job flow monitoring and incident management they are putting together and work on developing handoffs and equivalent procedures
Experience in Updating the Policies, procedures and Handbooks based on the target infrastructure.
Experience in mapping and documenting of interfaces between legacy and new systems
Experience in facilitating workshops and conducting interviews
Database experience and data manipulation using (two or more of) SQL Server or Oracle, Hive and HBase, Teradata, NoSQL and other similar tools is required
Data discovery, visualization and reporting experience using Tableau, Power BI or similar tools is required

Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions – Nice to Have Skills
Basel III/IV, Risk Management, Software Development, Technical Solution Design, Strong familiarity with latest technology stacks for data processing platforms
Foundational understanding of bank’s balance sheet, wholesale and retail products including lending, derivatives and SFTs, related risk management concepts and regulatory requirements (Basel accords)
Foundational understanding of credit risk minimum regulatory capital requirements and related concepts such as PD, LGD, EAD
Foundational understanding of Hadoop ecosystem and Spark Framework. Prefer programming experience in Python
Data integration, transformation and wrangling experience
Experience with data lakes, data warehouses, data marts, data governance and data quality
Strong foundational understanding of Machine Learning and AI concepts and some experience with practical applications is required

Position Purpose:
The Alectra Green Energy & Technology Centre (GRE&T Centre) makes energy innovations come to life by identifying, evaluating, developing and accelerating the commercialization of emerging, clean, and customer-friendly energy solutions, creating sustainable values for customers, shareholders and communities it serves. The Grid Innovation team at the GRE&T Centre is focused on enabling a more sustainable electricity grid, by unleashing the potential of grid modernization technologies and integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into local electricity grid. The Business Analyst will provide support to the project initiatives undertaken by Grid Innovation team. The incumbent will work closely with the Grid Innovation team and provide technical support in delivering pilot projects such as Non-Wires alternative (“NWA”) project aimed at designing and operating local distribution energy market that enables distributed energy resources (DER) to participate in grid services; defer or reduce the need for wires investment on distribution grid.
Responsibilities:

Title: Genomics Database Developer/Analyst - GP
Department: BioComputing Centre
Job ID: 21-0090


Organizational Overview
Great people, exceptional teams building a stronger Public Health Ontario.
We are Public Health Ontario (PHO). We live our values as a shared promise to each other, our clients and our partners. We value credibility, innovation, responsiveness, collaboration, integrity and respect. With our partners in Ontario's health system, we monitor and address the needs of the population by providing the scientific evidence and expert guidance that shapes policies and practices for a healthier Ontario. With locations across Ontario, we are working to ensure that Ontario has the strongest public health system in the world so that every day Ontarians wake up in one of the safest places to live in the world.
For more information about PHO, visit www.publichealthontario.ca
Position Details-
Position Title: Genomics Database Developer/Analyst - GP
Department: Bio Computing Centre
Location: 661 University Avenue, Toronto
Duration: Permanent

Hours of work: Full-time 36.25 hours per week

Compensation Group: OPSEU
Salary: $37.99- $47.11 per hour
Posting Date: March 8, 2021

Closing Date: March 22, 2021
Internal candidates will be considered first
Position Summary-
To support the development and implementation of a robust genomics program at Public Health Ontario (PHO) to monitor genomic changes and rapid detection of emerging variants of pathogens of public health significance for Ontario by providing skills and expertise in the development, administration, and maintenance of scientific databases especially designed for genomics and bioinformatics.
PHO has been mandated by the province to lead the establishment of a hub and spoke model for integrated program model for COVID-19 genomics in Ontario, working in collaboration with Ontario Health and other clinical laboratories and researchers undertaking genomics. The program will enable and support early identification and containment, enhanced case and contact management, outbreak management, surveillance and epidemiological analysis and reporting.
As the hub for this program, PHO will increase its capacity to undertake genomics for COVID-19 variants of concern (VoC) and contribute to sequencing up to 1000 specimens a week (of the anticipated provincial total sequencing need of 2000 specimens per week). PHO will also provide enhanced COVID-19 analytics and host a provincial expert advice on variants VoC to provide advice to decision-makers for improved methods, tracking and interpretation of emerging mutations and variants, and meaningful public health action. The immediate focus is to strengthen and expand the COVID-19 genomics program resulting in direct medical and/or public health action for the pandemic response. The goal of this program is to enable the delivery of an integrated genomics initiative for Ontario's COVID-19 public health response.
Key Responsibilities-
Elicits and reviews business requirements for databases and data extractions with business customers, aggregates findings and develops/implements plans to create, accommodate, migrate and integrate multiple sources of data in a variety of formats within current technical constraints.
Works with biocomputing and genomics staff to elicit, confirm and document database specifications and recommends database solutions, including tools and technologies, to match specifications and meet PHO guidelines.
Extracts data from various PHO operational systems and other data repositories, works with data owners to transform and interpret the data and provides datasets for reporting or analytic functions.
Translates business data management requirements into data models and schemas for the design and development of databases and other data management mechanisms within the overall data architecture of PHO.
Recommends tools to support a wide array of data including genomic data (tracking SNPs, mutations, annotations, lineages, etc.), geospatial and statistical data; discovers, recommends or defines special performance considerations, proposes possible solutions supported by risk and cost-benefit analyses and develops an overall database implementation strategy.
Monitors the data and information needs of the Genomic Program area to ensure their needs are being met.
Designs and develops datasets, data models, databases and data repositories for PHO customers (internal and external), analyzes the data needs of diverse business customers, makes recommendations and eventual commitments regarding performance, reliability, accessibility, efficiency and security of stored data and ensures that all databases satisfy business needs, meet commitments and comply with PHO privacy and security policies.
Administers existing enterprise databases by: developing a database maintenance and application performance monitoring plan to ensure all PHO data is secure but easily accessible by authorized users; recommends and implements methods and controls to maintain data accuracy and integrity; assists in the development of standards and best practices to ensure data is consistent, clearly defined and used appropriately; and, corrects detected deficiencies.
Ensures that implementations of new data stores of any kind or changes to the existing environment are planned and executed to address testing, back-ups, go/no go decision points, back out and recovery and protection of existing technical and business environments. Identifies, logs, tracks and resolves implementation and operational issues.
Deploys and tests security measures and reviews privacy legislation and ensures databases comply with data/information privacy and security policies, especially for Personal Health Information (PHI) and monitors for continued protection and compliance.
Develops interfaces between internal and external databases as required.
Keep up-to-date with, and researches, the latest trends in database management and technology to recommend the most appropriate tools for database development, data extraction and transformation.
Liaises with other database administration, Bioinformatics Analysts, Bioinformaticians, Computational Biologists, System Administrators, and solution development colleagues to ensure that architectural integrity and standards are maintained across the information, application, technical and security architecture domains as new databases are developed and implemented.
Provides general and technical support, advice and comment to business customers, project teams and application developers regarding the use and updating of databases and the feasibility of solutions being proposed, establishes and assesses policies, protocols and processes and recommends changes and participates in committees and working groups to represent database management.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge and Skills-
Familiarity with computational and bioinformatics analysis methods, database requirements, and data end products for reporting and visualization specifically for Whole-Genome Sequencing / Next-Generation Sequencing
Knowledge of more than one operating system, especially Linux-based operating systems (Ubuntu, CentOS) and the tools, processes and technologies used in developing and managing multiple databases
Knowledge of cloud-based architectures, such as OpenStack, and leveraging these environments for efficient database implementations
Knowledge of relational SQL databases such as PostgresSQL, MySQL, MSSQL Server , Oracle and/or other database software and associated software stack. Familiarity with non-relational NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB) is a plus
Knowledge of "extraction, transform and load" tools such as SQL, Informatica and techniques to manage data integrity and quality.
Knowledge of reporting, statistical, and Business Intelligence tools such as R, PowerBI, Crystal Reports, Cognos, and SAS to customise reporting and enable business customers to exploit business analytics.
Knowledge of a variety of database programming software tools and business analysis techniques to solicit and understand customer requirements and translate them into functional database structures.
Knowledge of the development and application of information and data architectures to support public health surveillance, analytics and epidemiology.
Knowledge of PHO lines of business and their general data and information together with knowledge of the various applications that support the business community including: Biocomputing centre, clinical, scientific, research and administrative systems such as finance and HR in order to ensure that new databases complement and leverage existing applications.
Knowledge of central technologies at PHO such as SharePoint to facilitate database integration and exploits its collaboration, content and document management, web and cloud computing features to optimize the use of databases.
Knowledge of security standards and legislation such as FIPPA and PHIPA to ensure that databases comply.
Knowledge of web-based applications and the technical infrastructure in which databases operate to enable efficient interfaces and leverage technical architecture and network capabilities.
Knowledge of the database technology vendor community to research emerging technologies and recommend those that anticipate changing business needs, develop justifications and get planning approvals.
Knowledge of formal change and incident management processes such as Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) to ensure that databases, tools and processes are implemented without risk to the technical and business environments and make sure that database problems are resolved promptly and permanently.
Education and Experience-
Position requires an Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Management Information Systems or equivalent experience and supplementary training and education.
5 years' experience in database development and in developing and implementing data and database management mechanisms and structures preferably related to genomics and bioinformatics data.
Interest in molecular, developmental and/or evolutionary biology in particular bioinformatics and genomics.
Attributes and Competencies-
Communication skills to share database technical information or solution designs with non-technical business management and staff
Written and verbal communication and negotiation skills to develop and present solutions, performance reports, technical designs, documentation, risk analyses, cost/benefit analyses and recommendations to colleagues and management and business customer management and gain approval for courses of action when needed.
Anticipates problems typically associated with developing and implementing new databases or the adoption of new database and other technology such as incompatibility with existing technologies or sub-standard performance and develops plans to minimize risk and protect the business and technical environments additionally engages technical colleagues, vendors and affected business managers to identify and resolve difficult problems.
Planning, organizational, scheduling and prioritization skills to manage own work assignments and tasks, handle multiple concurrent activities, respond to fluctuating demands, meet tight deadlines, resolve incidents, support changing customer requests and provide technical advice and guidance to colleagues and customers.

The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
Accelerating the Development of Technology for Improved Health!
Techna is an institute of the University Health Network (UHN) focused on the accelerated development and exploitation of technology for improved health. Techna is seeking a bold, creative, and innovative individual who can lead various types of digital health projects that support clinicians, researchers and patients. These initiatives include process redesign, technology strategy, data analytics, system design and implementation and operational technical support for provincial clinical programs.
Responsibilities will include:
Assisting in the modification and maintenance of electronic systems through the coordination of data flow with internal and external stakeholders.
Assisting with collecting data and documentation to support product design and analysis, environmental assessments, and change management.
Assisting with validating new releases and identifying bug fixes to support project and operational improvements of software applications.
Qualifications:
University Degree required in Health Informatics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
Minimum one (1) year practical and related experience.
Ability to effectively operate computer, software, and peripheral equipment, i.e., MS Office, MS Outlook.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to systematically analyze situations/issues, identify options, draw logical conclusions, and determine/recommend practical courses of action.
Demonstrates ability to work with both internal and external stakeholders and document interactions and next steps.
Experience leading project work streams or small projects independently.
Experience in leading and conducting workflow analysis, value stream mapping, data mapping and Plan-Do-Study-Act cycles.
Experience in creating and delivering management-level presentations, training and/or end user support.
Project Management Professional (PMP) or Change Management certification an asset.
Experience with data management and supporting/utilizing data management systems.
Keen attention to detail.
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Self-motivated and results driven team player who can work independently.
Able to work with minimal supervision and with minimal direction to complete tasks.
Able to work with multidisciplinary teams in a positive and productive manner.
Able to effectively deal with high priority unscheduled tasks and problems.
Demonstrates understanding of the healthcare environment in which the organization operates.
If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.

About us
Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Dyson launched in Canada in 2006 with our headquarters in the heart of Toronto, where we’ve been recognized as one of the top employers to work for. In recent years, we’ve expanded our reach and grown exponentially across many teams, from digital and direct, to field sales, and our growing number of Dyson Demo stores.
About the role
The Senior eCommerce Analyst will lead actionable reporting of data and insights to guide strategic decisions and drive our direct-to-consumer channel strategy. The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in eCommerce analytics and strong commercial acumen to be able to analyze the business from a 30,000ft view, as well as a 100ft view and provided clear recommendations. They will drive understanding of digital behavior and identify opportunities to improve customer experience and sales performance across DysonCanada.ca and traffic-driving media channels.
Ongoing sales analysis and reporting:
Analyze eCommerce and total market trends and communicate recommendations that support the direct-to-consumer channel strategy.
Analyze product range and promotion performance to determine optimal assortments and opportunities to maximize return on investment.
Assist in developing an understanding of base rate and lifts.
Present insights and recommendations via written and verbal communications that can be understood by a broad audience.
Collaborate with eCommerce lead on forecast modeling to support monthly business processes.
eCommerce Platform & Journey Analysis:
Proactively monitor the eCommerce platform for changes in customer behavior and communicate these insights and recommendations, with commercial thinking, to the team to drive change.
Work closely with eCommerce and Category teams to cultivate a deep understanding of what resonates with our owners in order optimize end-to-end customer journeys.
Support eCommerce enhancement planning by identifying new opportunities and quantifying the impact for business case prioritization.
Collaborate with eCommerce team to develop multi-variant and A/B tests, and support post-test analysis.
Partner with Media team to drive the creation of weekly channel performance reports (SEO/SEM, Display, Paid Social, Affiliates) to supplement agency reporting. Identify high value / underperforming audiences and opportunities to improve visitor engagement
Maintenance & Ad Hoc requests:
Build and maintain custom dashboards using tools such as Adobe Analytics, GA, Data studio and Tableau. Educate and empower teams to self-serve data.
Develop appropriate tagging strategy to capture the necessary KPIs and metrics, and verify accurate data collection.
Maintain working knowledge of industry best practices and changes in analytics platforms, and identify how they impact existing programs.
Investigate specific issues and propose solutions by analyzing data from a wide range of sources including digital analytics data, customer feedback and session replay tools.
Identify additional analysis as required
Fulfil other duties as necessary.
Forge links with other markets to ensure sharing of best practices
Identify opportunities that fall within the role to enhance professional growth
Review systems and current methodologies and make recommendations for improvements to enhance overall analytical capabilities of the team
About you
Bachelor’s degree required
3+ years in an eCommerce Analyst or Retail Sales Analyst role required, with a strong understanding of eCommerce user journeys
Master of web analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (VBA/macros experience) and highly proficient in all Microsoft Office Applications, including PowerPoint.
Storytelling - Can easily distill complex analytics into simple themes that are appropriate for non-technical stakeholders
Working understanding of data management, multi-channel marketing strategies and conversion rate optimization
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and commercial acumen to apply context to analysis
Able to demonstrate a proven track record of identifying digital optimizations based on customer insight and data, and its interpretation into actionable test hypothesis and campaigns
Comfortable quickly flexing between longer term strategic thinking and day-to-day execution
Proactive, creative team playing who enjoys problem solving and enabling those around them
Possess a high sense of urgency, strong attention to detail and high standards for the quality of their work
Benefits
At Dyson, how we reward you is linked to our high-performance culture. But it’s about more than salary and bonus. Through a package of financial, lifestyle and health benefits, we support whatever stage of life you’re in and the moments that matter.

What will your typical day look like?

The Senior Analyst, Data Governance aligns under Tier 2, Specialized Services. This team provides administrative, transactional and specialized operational support to meet business needs through end-to-end lifecycle consultation with exceptional customer service.
In this role, you will:
Establish and maintain data quality management best practices, standards, guidelines and processes and ensure adherence across the organization through regular audits;
Develop, maintain and communicate systems security frameworks to ensure the safeguarding of our people data;
Provide strong data analysis and solutioning in the data governance domain enabling stakeholders to manage, control and leverage quality information within and across business units and functional domains. This includes maintaining various dashboards, capability metrics and provision of reporting to identify trends, potential issues and support solutioning;
Liaise between Talent and other business areas (e.g. IT, Privacy) to ensure that requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined and communicated and new data quality requirements are understood and documented effectively;
Work with technology vendors and IT to ensure that the technology environment is optimal, embracing new functionality and capabilities within existing tools, and helping to plan for future enablement.
About the team

People Experience is a tiered, centralized team, providing a scalable platform to respond to changing business needs, and drive continuous improvement across the Culture and People Office function. The team is the face of HR to the business and delivers people inquiry, intake management, program services, and people leader services (aligned to lifecycle stage and Workplace Experience pillars). With a focus on the employee journey, People Experience delivers end-to-end operational experiences through defined processes that are standard for all business segments.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone who has:
A relevant Degree such as Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent;
3 – 4 years data management experience, ideally within the Professional Financial Services sector;
Demonstrated expertise with data quality management, governance, business and data requirements analysis, metrics and controls;
Experience with data systems/tools and related software for information profiling, quality and metadata management, ideally PeopleSoft and SAP;
Knowledge of practices/technology in areas such as data stewardship, business intelligence, data models and Master Data Management;
Strong analytical and problem solving skills which you utilize to quickly problem solve, determine solutions, provide insights into best practices and advise our stakeholders at every level across the firm. This may include the presentation of data quality findings and data management education;
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and a detailed and quality focus;
A commitment to building collaborative team relationships, contributing to a positive work environment and working effectively within a matrix environment.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.
Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers.
The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.
Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters.
Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area.
Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.
Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment.
Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality).
A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience.
MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word).
Strong written, oral, and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes.
Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team.
Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist.
This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel.

Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
As Consultant of the Risk Business Intelligence Office (RBIO) you’ll apply your Technical skillset and knowledge of Risk Management to enhance risk domain business intelligence. You’ll participate in collaborating with business owners to capture detailed requirements and aid in supporting our technical teams to deliver reporting solutions using the Business Intelligence tools available.
How You’ll Succeed
Business Analysis – Work with owners of the various source systems that feed into our central data warehouse. This includes attending regular meetings to discuss new initiatives and planned promotion schedules in order for us to be able to synchronize our system with such upstream changes. In addition, provide support to our BI Developers with business requirements and UAT testing.
Collaborate – Work with technology teams that support our systems. They depend on our expertise to provide detailed requirements to implement our initiatives. Strengthen existing mutually beneficial relationships with external teams including the technology team.
Project planning and execution - As part of your business intelligence and data management responsibilities, you will participate in managing and tracking various commitments to our clients, helping to ensure that critical deadlines are closely monitored and not compromised.
Who You Are
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You demonstrate experience in having a thorough understanding of and extensive experience with data warehouses, data querying tools (SQL), BI Tools (Cognos, Tableau), experience with large data models and preparing data mapping and business requirement documents
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
You have a degree in computer science or mathematical studies. Business Analyst Certification is an asset.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
