At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.
Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers.
The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation.
Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters.
Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area.
Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.
Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment.
Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality).
A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience.
MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word).
Strong written, oral, and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes.
Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team.
Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist.
This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel.

This is an experienced professional role that requires both strong business acumen and advanced understanding of reporting and Business Intelligence tools and techniques as well as advanced skills to connect to and query databases within big-data environment (Hadoop) and use this data to build machine learning algorithms to solve relevant business problems.
The role is responsible for building advanced reporting solutions and providing business insights to Wealth businesses.
The role will share an effective ownership of the assigned reporting area and ensure efficient production of Business Line Reporting including Scorecards and Dashboards and generation of value-added business insights and ad-hoc analysis as required to support Wealth partners and initiatives related to sales force management and data monetization within Wealth.

Provide specialized end to end reporting solutions (dashboards, scorecards, analysis) and business insights for one or more business areas such as Private Banking, Private Trust, Wealth Insurance
Create complex BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing enterprise data infrastructure built around Hadoop as well as localized datamarts and other data sources
Review, analyze and understand the data and data sources to ensure that all business requirements are met and that the reporting is comprehensive, efficient and accurate
Initiate and own the work effort to review and validate the quality and integrity of the reporting processes for assigned reporting packages while following Department's procedures related to business requirements, process mapping, issue logging, business signoffs, etc.
Contribute to efforts to improve reporting processes within your assigned area with respect to efficiency, accuracy and timeliness
Maintain and regularly review documentation for assigned processes in support of the team’s business continuity
Contribute to the team in both technical and analytical aspects by sharing and adopting best practices
Contribute to maintaining positive working relationships by effectively communicating and regularly sharing experience and knowledge with internal and external business partners and with your colleagues
Relevant practical experience successfully working in an analytical or reporting role and extensively using Tableau, Hive, SQL and Python for the purpose of reporting and analytics
Demonstrated ability to work with Hadoop and enterprise-scale datamarts and data platforms to process, query and join the data effectively
Expertise with reporting techniques and report automation using Hive, SQL, Python and Tableau and evidence of successful application in prior work
Strong analytically anchored problem-solving skills with ability to critically research and evaluate issues and find optimal solutions
Highly organized and able to prioritize and handle a variety of tasks and responsibilities simultaneously and efficiently
Flexible and adaptable with a positive “can-do” attitude who gets excited about taking on new challenges
Energetic and enthusiastic team player, capable of working both independently and as part of a close team environment with high attention to details for accuracy and initiative to follow up items and get things done

À propos d'Aston Carter:
Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent.
Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients.
Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.

About Aston Carter:
Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Analyst Health Data Public Health Emergencies
Job Description:
Job Description:

Analyst Health Data Public Health Emergencies (4 positions)
Health Services – Public Health
Contract Durations: Approximately thirteen (13), twelve (12) and ten (10) month durations
To provide technical support with regards to database management, timely analysis of health data, and health data mapping to support program planning, and the monitoring of the health status of Peel’s residents.
Major Responsibilities:
Function as data guardian for health databases. Conduct data extraction, cleaning, and analysis of these data.
Obtain, clean and analyze data from Region of Peel - Public Health programs, as required.
Organize, analyze and interpret health-related data using sophisticated software and analytic tools
Conduct technical analyses and prepare reports of health data health status monitoring, program planning, program evaluation, answering health questions, or for responding to requests for information.
Present data in useful, understandable formats including tables, charts, maps, customized reports, and data dashboards using a variety of software.
Provide support on technical issues related to health status, surveillance and/or program data
Provide technical input on database design and maintenance.
Utilize geographic information system tools to prepare maps.
Qualifications:
BA or BSc preferably in Mathematics or Biostatistics or other related Public Health Sciences
Minimum of three years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge and understanding of public and community health issues; knowledge of communicable diseases an asset
Ability to coordinate the collection and retrieval of health data
Ability to synthesize, analyze and communicate health/epidemiological information from multiple sources
Knowledge of database sources, emerging survey tools, and relational databases
Excellent computer skills using statistical software, Excel and Mapping Software
Demonstrated ability to work efficiently within and interdisciplinary team setting
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) along with project management and organizational skills.
Locations: 7120 Hurontario Street, Mississauga as well as various Region of Peel worksites along with the ability to work remotely, as we navigate the COVID-19 pandemic.
We are committed to supporting community recovery from COVID-19. This plan will follow a phased approach that is guided by Public Health and Ontario's Framework for reopening. Get details
Hours: 35 hours per week; Monday-Friday; ability to work evening and weekends when required. Ability to work after hours and on-call duties on a rotational basis
Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.
If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.
About Us:

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.
To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca.
Additional Information:

At the Region of Peel, we respect diversity and treat one another in ways that are fair, courteous and compassionate, recognizing everyone’s contributions. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the diverse population we serve. The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Position Purpose:
The Business Analyst will support projects and tactical activities related to the maintenance and continuous improvement of the Home Depot Protection Plan within the Financial Services Team for the Canadian division. The role will be accountable for working alongside other members of the team to support program leadership with the coordination, execution, and sustainability of projects, initiatives, and roll-outs – both internal and customer-facing. They will work with cross-functional partners to resolve specific business issues, as well as developing and implementing key business strategies to support and grow the HDPP portfolio. This includes conducting advanced analytics, process/systems engineering, report creation, and effective communication skills between teams across the organization and external third-party groups.

Position Responsibilities:
Prepare business analysis and forecasts for use in the development of operational recommendations and business decisions
Conduct field testing and/or feedback analysis to assist leadership in defining strategic innovation roadmap
Support/perform the preparation of regular and ad hoc reporting/updates
Create new and supplemental reporting methods to aid management in proactive problem solving
Investigate opportunities to develop/implement business solutions to drive improve portfolio performance
Liaise with technical and non-technical teams, communicating business solution requirements
Maintain business relationships with vendor resources (internal and external)
Seek opportunities to grow awareness of Home Depot Protection Plan program benefits with cross-functional teams
Provide regular commentary/updates to leadership and stakeholders regarding progress, opportunities, risks and emerging trends for the purposes of decision-making
Build and maintain knowledge of warranty industry regulations or policies

Experience/Knowledge Required:
Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+ Meets Expectations)
1-2 years of analytical experience (ideally in a retail environment) with emphasis on customer experience improvement, change management, and data analysis
University or College Degree in a field related to the position: Finance, Marketing or Business Administration preferred
Advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint required
Intermediate or higher knowledge of SQL, Alteryx, Google/Adobe Analytics, Big Query, and/or Tableau desirable
Strong project management and critical thinking skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyze data for recommendations
Strong organizational and time management skills and ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously with an attention to detail
Strong relationship builder and has the ability to communicate effectively across different levels of the organization and external stakeholders
Ability to work independently
Curiosity.

Job Title: Data Analyst, Finance and Enterprise Risk
Job Description:
Adresse :
234 Simcoe Street
Groupe de famille d'emploi :
Analyses données et rapports
Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy.
Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies.
Performs data profiling and data analyses.
Documents and maintains data flow specifications.
Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights.
Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes.
Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation.
Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain.
Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements.
Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making.
Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model.
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions.
Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security.
Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups.
Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes.
Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 1 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle).
Skilled in working with BI tools such as PowerBI, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks.
Proficient in working with SQL
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
Ici, pour vous.
À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde.
En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences.
Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr .
BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Pour demander des mesures d’adaptation, veuillez communiquer avec votre recruteur.

Build a meaningful career

At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 6,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.

Business Operations Analyst

LifeWorks by Morneau Shepell

Remote

Defined Term Contract - 6 Months


LifeWorks

LifeWorks supports the total health and well-being of over 35 million lives worldwide with our clinical expertise, global presence and digital well-being platform, LifeWorks by Morneau Shepell. We empower healthier, happier, and more productive employees by combining our award-winning Employee Assistance Program with proactive wellness solutions in a digital ecosystem that helps them prevent and manage issues and concerns about family, health, life, money, and work.

As a Global Employee Engagement Platform serving tens of thousands of companies and millions of employees worldwide, LifeWorks by Morneau Shepell uses innovative technology and mobile-first user experience to deliver a Total Wellbeing Solution that people and companies - such as Aviva, Burberry, Walgreens, Expedia, Intel and Nestlé Canada - love to use.

Morneau Shepell employees have access to the same high-quality well-being support and resources provided to our customers. We pride ourselves on providing a work environment that inspires innovation, connection and collaboration while also supporting your growth and development both personally and professionally. We value difference-makers, and individuals and teams who bring high energy, passion, and a relentless commitment to excellence to their roles.


Summary

Under the guidance of the Manager, Business Analysis, the Business Operations Analyst is responsible for conducting strategic business operations analysis, creating requirements for business products or programs, making recommendations for business opportunities and process improvements, and facilitating change requirements for new or existing clients.


Responsibilities:

Lead requirements analysis, validation and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable
Elicit business requirements for new products, programs and processes using business analysis elicitation techniques such as requirements workshops, business process analysis, use case creation, data analysis, etc.
Critically evaluate business needs, drive decision making through strong analytical, leadership, and conflict management skills
Ability to lead internal teams
Suggests areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions
Liaise with multiple business units, technology teams and support teams to identify requirements, best practices, interdependencies and opportunities for improvements and technical solutions
Validate solutions by leading User Acceptance Testing
Manage & maintain the Operations Change Request process; analyze requests; interview key subject matter experts to understand risks, costs and feasibility, and make recommendations to stakeholders
Perform data analysis using SQL and other tools as necessary
Convert data into tangible information and business reports for stakeholders Identifying trends, risks, cost and revenue drivers to facilitate decision making
Create or support business case initiatives, providing sound insight, costs, ROI and recommendations
Anticipate business or project issues. Make recommendations to mitigate risk
Identify opportunities for organizational process or program improvements
Provide the organization with solutions that are practical as well as visionary
Successfully and efficiently engage in multiple business analysis initiatives simultaneously
Work independently with users to define concepts or under the direction of project managers
Act as a project resource/stakeholder as assigned


Succeeding in the Business Operations Analyst role will require the following core qualifications and skills:

Bachelor’s degree, with Business Analysis course work, preferred
CBAP certifications an asset
Understanding of the BABOK areas of knowledge and their practical application
Minimum 3 years of previous experience in a business analysis setting
Experience in meeting, workshop, or classroom facilitation
Process design and process improvement experience
Exposure to process improvement initiatives
Project management experience is an asset
Experience in EFAP and/or global business environments an asset
Advanced knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office and Visio
The ability to think analytically, solve problems to complex business processes, and document results
The ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner across functional and technical departments
The ability to work on multiple tasks at any one time while maintaining high-quality standards
The ability to develop wireframes, workflows, use case diagrams, flowcharts, and other analysis-type documentation
The ability to develop test scenarios and test cases, and testing activities necessary to assess the quality and completion of system implementations
The ability to perform industry research to clarify, define, or satisfy technology or business process issues
The ability to identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change
A strong understanding of web-based application delivery
Must be process-oriented with sound judgment, attention to detail, accuracy, and follow-through including the flexibility to perform in an ever-changing work environment
Must be energetic, driven and committed to project success while working under tight time constraints and pressure

Job Grade: MS3

Company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
Job Description:
Job Number: 871966
Category: Research
Positions Available: 1
Years Experience Required: 1
Location: Toronto, Ontario
Posted Date: Feb 19, 2021
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Research Analyst
Computational Genomics,

Krembil Centre For Neuroinformatics
The Krembil Centre for Neuroinformatics at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is harnessing the power of high-performance computing to integrate and analyze the wealth of data generated about the brain. Our research is performed in an open science environment, with an emphasis on reproducible data-driven research and a patient-centric approach to accelerate identification and treatment of mental illness. A focus on global collaboration is key to transforming our understanding of mental health and its treatment. The Centre operates as an incubator for medical technologies to identify, manage and treat mental illness, while shaping policy at national and global levels.
Position Description
The Laboratory for Computational Genomics (https://triplab.org/) led by Dr. Shreejoy Tripathy within the Krembil Centre for Neuroinformatics is currently seeking a full-time, contract (1 year) Research Analyst. The successful candidate will assist with ongoing projects to understand how the brain and its cells change in the context of psychiatric and neurological disorders, including Alzheimer’s disease, major depressive disorder, and epilepsy. The successful candidate will work with mouse and human datasets that span multiple data types, including single-cell genomics datasets and cellular electrophysiology and electronic health records.
The primary responsibilities of this position will involve:
Analyzing diverse data types, including single-cell genomics and cellular electrophysiology
Writing computational scripts to automate data analysis, including in Python, R, and the Unix shell
Participating in data quality control and contributing to novel data analyses using computational tools
Maintaining high quality online documentation for computational tools and analysis workflows
Communicating with and assisting team members in collaborative projects
Participating in scientific report writing, including of drafting grant proposals and publications
Assisting with some routine administrative tasks, including meeting scheduling and preparing data use agreements
Contributing to a healthy and lively lab and group environment
You will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and complies with all applicable CAMH policies, as well as all regulatory and legislative requirements. This position is located at 250 College Street with opportunity for some remote work.
Qualifications
The successful candidate will have a Bachelor’s Degree in either, Bioinformatics, Neuroscience, Biology, Genetics, or Computer Science combined with one year of relevant experience working in a research environment. The ideal candidate will have a passion for how basic research can transform our understanding of the brain and improve our treatment of its disorders.
Experience writing open source computational scripts for data analysis (especially R or Python and Unix/shell) is required. Evidence working collaboratively in a team setting is an asset. Evidence of strong written and oral communication skills and working collaboratively in a team setting are strong assets. Experience with molecular biology (such as qPCR or RNA-sequencing) or bioinformatics is a plus but is not required.
The ability to independently manage multiple tasks and prioritize conflicting priorities is required. The successful candidate must have strong time management, organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to think creatively with a focus on results and outcomes is preferred.
Please Note: This full-time, contract position lasting one year is part of the OPSEU Bargaining Unit.
Salary Range: $24.60 to $32.81 per hour
CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
We thank all applicants for their interest however, only those selected to interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

Reference No. R2587018
Position Title: MES Business Analyst - Vaccine
Department: Project Management B100
Location: Sanofi Pasteur Limited, Toronto, Ontario
Sanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine company
Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.
Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.
Job Purpose:
The Manufacturing Execution System implementation for B100 requires a MES Business Analyst position with a combination of technical and business analysis skills to contribute to the project. The professional will be part of the MES project team and be contributing from a technical and validation perspective to help ensure MES rollout is delivered on time, on budget and to the intended scope as defined by the project team and approved by the project steering committee:
As a business analyst, collaborate in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new solutions, and enhancements to existing solutions. For instance, create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to solutions developers.
Coordinate and manage meetings with the B100 teams and extended project teams (e.g. application Core Teams).
Liaise with various business groups in the organization to facilitate the implementation of MES system and new or improved business processes.
Develop and maintain requirements, design specifications, traceability matrix, test scripts, and business cases during the planning and development phases of ITS projects.
Effectively manage day-to-day tasks in project plans for the project. Ensure assigned tasks are completed on time and within budget, or that scope, duration or budget changes are well-communicated and approved by ITS management and B100 management.
Coordinate, perform, and support in-depth testing, end-user reviews, modified and new processes validation.
Context and Challenges:
This profession role will support implementation of core solutions for a major capital project. This includes technical understanding and process familiarity of shop floor systems.
The role will require a mix of technical and business competence and acumen and an ability to translate business requirements to technical design.
Key Accountabilities:
Successfully delivery of the assigned tasks.
Collaborates with manufacturing operations, ITS teams, quality organizations and project leadership to develop validation documents, specifications, test scripts, documentation, and to execute the project tasks within the Sanofi global core solutions model.
Key Requirements:
Education:
Bachelors of Applied Science/Engineering with 5+ years of pharmaceutical manufacturing or ITS related experience .
Experience & knowledge:
Experience with Vaccines and / or Biologics manufacturing processes
Solid understanding of IT Technologies and shop floor manufacturing solutions, including
DHS – Data Historian System (OSISoft PI)
MES – Manufacturing Execution Systems (Werum PAS|X)
Experience in application deployment (software development life cycle -SDLC), including management of change, testing strategies and testing execution
Broad understanding of ITS Technologies and Solutions
Experience with validation practices
Good understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives
Effective written and verbal communications skills
Language: Fluent English

We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request.
Thank you in advance for your interest.

Job Description:

Data Quality Analyst, Utilization and Analytics
Permanent Full Time
The Data Quality Analyst will provide management of data quality and reporting of various operational clinical reports and ministry submissions including but not limited to surgery/diagnostic imaging/ALC wait-times information systems (WTIS), safety and quality reports, and performance/benchmarking reports for internal and external reporting. The incumbent will serve as a liaison and data quality subject matter expert between the hospital’s ministry contacts (CCO, MOHLTC, Ontario Health), physician offices, and Mackenzie Health Operational leadership.
This position will ensure the hospital maintains submission and data quality compliance of wait-time submission to CCO, conducts training for various administrative WTIS stakeholders, and ensures benchmarking/performance reports are disseminated internally in a timely manner. With Mackenzie Health’s continually evolving SMART hospital objective, this role will also be continuously improving data quality and submission processes to improve throughput and efficiency. Strong organizational, technical, and interpersonal skills is imperative to effectively perform in this role.
What must you have?
Post-secondary diploma in a healthcare or business administration related field.
What else do you bring?
At least 3 years experience in clinical data quality analysis.
At least 3 years experience working with electronic medical records (Epic, Meditech, etc.)
At least 3 years’ experience working in healthcare setting with a basic understanding of hospital patient flow / clinical workflow.
At least 3 years experience working with CCO’s wait-time information systems (iPort/ATC).
Functional knowledge in CCO’s surgery, diagnostic imaging, and ALC reporting is required.
Experience in training others in healthcare workflow would be an asset.
Experience working with multiple stakeholders at all levels of the organization (surgery, DI, ALC) an asset.
Detail oriented with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to deal with situations where information is difficult to obtain, complex, or ambiguous
Demonstrated independent ability to prioritize, multi-task and work to tight timelines
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Demonstrated commitment to continuing education
Effectively uses empathy and respect in interactions with others
Proven attendance record.
Demonstrates understanding and complies with patient and staff safety policies and procedures that foster a safe and inclusive environment for all.
Demonstrates behaviours consistent with Mackenzie Health’s Commitment to Caring.
Models behaviour that is aligned with the values of Mackenzie Health – Excellence, Leadership and Empathy.
Commitment to providing an exceptional experience for staff and clients within a challenging and exciting health care environment.
Preferably, your profile also includes:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Knowledge of hospital clinical databases (e.g. DAD,NACRS, CCRS, NRS, OMHRS, CCIS, WTIS, ERNI, etc.) and case mix systems (e.g. RUG/RWPD, RCG/RCW, SCIPP/SWPD, etc.).
Experience with funding models (HBAM, MOH QBPs, CCO QBPs).
Knowledge of MOH, CCO/ ORS and CIHI data submission and reporting tools.
Knowledge and understanding of key health care performance measures (clinical, financial, utilization, efficiency) and balanced scorecards.
You may be required to work at any site of Mackenzie Health

Knowledge & Skills:
Strong problem-solving and data analysis skills.

Strong written and oral communication skills.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office products.

Intermediate knowledge of business process mapping software such as Visio.

Business Overview
The Market Research team is part of Fidelity Canada’s Corporate Affairs group, and provides market and/or competitive insights to support the firm’s business development, thought leadership and strategic planning efforts.
What You Will Do
We are looking for a natural communicator with a strong analytical foundation and innate curiosity to join our team as a Market Research Analyst. This role is responsible for analyzing, interpreting and communicating insightful market and/or competitive research in support of business development, thought leadership and strategic business planning for Fidelity Canada. You will gain diverse exposure to Fidelity's functional areas and leadership teams and will have the opportunity to see tangible results from your research.
The Value You Deliver
Primary Research: Assist with Fidelity Canada’s primary research program including questionnaire design, sampling, data collection, and analysis. You will play a meaningful role in synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data and preparing research reports and/or dashboards for key internal partners.
Secondary Research: Support Fidelity Canada’s advisor and institutional business lines with demand analysis and competitive positioning to identify key financial industry trends and uncover new business opportunities, working closely with industry-leading market research partners to inform strategic decision making.
Project Management: Oversee strategic projects for the Corporate Affairs group including scheduling, collaborating with internal and external partners, identifying risks, and reporting.
What We're Looking For
A minimum of 3 years' relevant experience is required, preferably in the financial services / asset management / market research industries
A Bachelors degree in a business, economics or quantitative focus area
A Post-graduate degree in a business or quantitative subject area (including MBA) is an asset
Bilingualism in English and French is an asset
Completion of the CSC designation is preferred
Completion of the MRIA designation is considered an asset, as well as other investment-focused designations CFA/CAIA/CIM/etc
The Skills You Bring
Solid understanding of the financial services and asset management industry.
Excellent analytical and quantitative ability with proven skills in conducting sophisticated data analysis.
Excellent oral and written communicator with well-developed data visualization and presentation skills.
An avid learner who stays ahead of trends and is confident in their ability to learn new technologies and adapt to constantly evolving demands.
Ability to work well under pressure while maintaining high standards.
Ability to build rapport and credibility with stakeholders including business leaders at all levels.

Reporting to the Consultant, Business Solutions, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for technical documentation, supporting project delivery and coordinate process redesign and BI development initiatives led by the Business Solutions Group ("BSG"). Contributing to the overall effectiveness and delivery of business solutions for the Financial Reporting and Business Planning ("FR&BP") department, this role is responsible for working with various BSG to document requirements and provide support to key project deliverables to ensure business solution integration and alignment of processes, systems and information.
What you will do:
Document systems specifications including data, ETL and reporting for solutions developed by BSG.
Participate in solution delivery and support project leads in requirements gathering, process mapping, design, development, and implementation.
Facilitate project coordination for process and BI delivery through status communication, defect management and issue resolution.
Provide input into specifications and user acceptance test documents as applicable, to support technology and process initiatives through to completion. This includes identifying gaps, issues, and misalignment.
Analyze data to identify issues and leverage modern BI tools to support business decisions.
Assist business users in understanding any problems and challenges by working with them to enhance system and workflow capabilities to ensure quality deliverables that meet business and project objectives.
Work collaboratively with IT to deal with business solution issues and identifies plans for resolution.

What you bring:
University degree and/or a combination of equivalent training, education and experience
3 plus years in progressive roles dealing with business analysis and production support
Experience in system documentation specializing in data and reporting specifications
Strong knowledge of business requirements gathering, process mapping and gap analysis
Knowledge of business analysis best practices and methodologies with practical application experience
Familiar with core Corporate Accounting functions
Familiar with risk and controls in a Finance environment
Experience in the Pension and/or Financial Services industry an asset
Business Analyst certification an asset
Collaborative, professional, accountable, and trustworthy
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to support multiple projects and work under pressure
Excellent written and verbal (interpersonal and communication) skills
Ability to effectively adapt to change
Excellent business analysis and time management skills
Experience using business intelligence tools, including design, maintenance and documentation
Ability to implement process improvements where necessary
Ability to plan, organize and monitor work effectively to ensure standards of performance are adhered to
Ability to work independently with minimal direction

About HOOPP

Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.

HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation.
From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.

Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.

Job Description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist.
Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist – Job Description
The Senior Business Insights Analyst will be accountable for delivering timely, meaningful business performance reporting and analytics that drive measurable business value across our business lines.
We are looking for a self-motivated and innovative individual who excels in a fast paced and high impact business team.

Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist – Mandatory Skills
Over 5 years of relevant experience in reporting, analysis and insights, preferably in the Financial Services industry
Strong analytically anchored problem-solving skills, solid background working with data and conducting analysis or planning complex data flows and processes
Strong interpersonal skills, able to build relationships, effectively interact, influence and motivate individuals at all levels of the organization to make an impact
Superior communication skills with proven ability to communicate quantitative/ qualitative information and key messages in a clear and compelling way
Detail oriented with excellent organization skills and ability to effectively manage work under tight timelines and changing priorities
Disciplined with a proven track record of delivering results and executing with excellence
Demonstrated ability to work with various data sources (enterprise-scale datamarts and data platforms, local files) and various data types (Excel, SQL, text) to process, query and join the data effectively
Expertise with reporting techniques and report automation using platforms such as SQL, HIVE
5 years' experience in mining, analyzing and visualizing large amounts of data and programming skills (e.g., SQL, Hive, HQL)
Experience with creating complex Tableau dashboards: 2 years
Experience with various enterprise-scale datamarts and data platforms, local files: 4 years
Experience with various data types (Excel, SQL, text) to process, query and join the data effectively: 4 years
Expertise with reporting techniques and report automation using platforms such as SQL, HIVE: 5 years

Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist – Nice to Have Skills
Experience in working with bank's proprietary systems, processes and applications and/or a business analysis/reporting function would be considered an asset
Experience with Banking and / or Wealth Management businesses is an asset
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques such as regression, clustering algorithms using programming languages such as Python, PySpark or R is an asset
Skills in designing high-quality dashboards and performance scorecards using visualization tools such as Tableau is an asset
Academic qualifications with a focus on business, finance, or statistical analysis is an asset

Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 12 months to start
Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics & Reporting Specialist - Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
Our cleint is looking for candidates who strive to constantly improve and build on their skills, work effectively with others to deliver results, and are not afraid of a challenge.
Bruce Power’ s Life Extension Program and Major Component Replacement (MCR) are responsible for optimizing the life and performance of its assets by carrying out focused major component replacements on a range of nuclear and non-nuclear systems.
Items outside of the scope of the MCR Program will be carried out through the Asset Management (AM) Program. The Asset Management approach allows Bruce Power to manage the scope of work during refurbishment, while balancing the work program and extending the life of the units before refurbishment begins, through targeted inspections, upgrades, testing and replacements of components and systems. This approach optimizes the life of the assets and enables a coordinated refurbishment program.
The BI Developer has primary responsibility for preparing and providing accurate and reliable reports that depict the Project/Program status, activities, accomplishments, and challenges. The BI Developer is responsible for collecting and examining data from various data sources and compiling it into a series of reports for distribution to project stakeholders. They will also assist in creating and maintaining a series of fact sheets, slide presentations, program highlights, short videos, media outreach and success stories that showcase the program performance.
Essential Job Functions:
Collects, organizes, and compiles project data into a series of reports that are distributed on a timely basis.
Monitors project data for accuracy and consistency of data
Collects project data for the Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Reports and any additional ad hoc reporting requirements
Builds a strong relationship and works closely with the Project Team to ensure validity of data
Builds a strong relationship with project stakeholders to ensure reporting products are meeting expectations
Utilizes IT applications to extract and present relevant data elements, including MS Suite of products, Ecosys, Powerday, P6 and others.
Experience with Access/SQL/skillset, and BI solutions such as Power BI required.
Required Skills & Experience:
 4-6 years of proven work experience in a similar role on an IT team or BI Reporting environment.
Ability to translate business requirements into BI solutions.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Power BI (Mandatory).
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Access.
Understanding of SQL Server based data warehousing concepts.
Project management mastery (P6 is a Plus).
Humble intelligent and confident.
 Education:
Bachelor’ s Degree or Technical Community College Diploma is preferred.

The IT Business Senior Analyst is an intermediate-level position within TTS Data and Innovation technology team responsible for liaising between Payments/Receivables business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.

Responsibilities:
Good Knowledge with Payments domain is highly recommended.
Work experience with SWIFT, ACH and other payment products would be a plus.
Payments Data domain expertise like ISO XML, CAMT52 etc. would be considered as a plus.
Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT
Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions
Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Good communication skills are expected.
Qualifications:
5-8 years of relevant experience
Experience in Payment flows and data domain working with SWIFT, CAMT52, ISOXML, MT formats.
Experience with Agile/ Scaled Agile delivery projects.
Proven interpersonal, data analysis, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships
Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience

Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.
Job Description:
This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams.
What will you do?
Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect.
Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge.
Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures.
Contribute & maintain quality requirement artifacts. Use a variety of visual techniques such as process models, workflow diagrams, storyboards and use cases, with appropriate guidance.
Participate in requirement elicitation sessions contributing in discussions to identify the true business need and associated risks.
Identify project risks and issues and communicate to Project Manager.
What you need to succeed:
University Degree in Business, Technology, Computer Science and Management
Experience or Knowledge in Investments, Asset Management and/or Capital Markets
Exposure in data analytics and data extraction with reporting tools such as SQL or Tableau.
Consultation and facilitation skills application in a school or office setting
Preferred skills:
Effective and efficient communication in a virtual environment.
Customer service focus to achieve valued results with a sense of urgency
Organized and flexible individual, comfortable in an evolving environment.
Innovative team member with a passion for learning and improving the client experience
What’s in it for you?
SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. Our history of organic and strategic growth reflects this commitment with over CA$303 billion in assets under management / US$238 billion in assets under management.
SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. We are breaking ground with innovative solutions for a growing institutional client base of more than 1200 organizations across North America. As a subsidiary of Sun Life, we are aligned with one of the world’s leading financial services companies, and benefit from the stability and strength of that relationship.
Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead.
Visit us at https://www.slcmanagement.com/inv
For a journey this exciting and complex, we’re looking for someone who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change.
Job Category:
Business Analysis - Systems
Posting End Date:
09/03/2021

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.
Job Description
Are you a big picture thinker? Fantastic! This is exactly the kind of thinking TD needs when it comes to our business intelligence support and analytics. In this role, we need you to take a holistic, high level approach to collection and reporting of data for major projects and initiatives across TD.
As data's role in providing extraordinary products and services to our customers grows, we'll look to the valued expertise you'll provide in this role, to develop, adopt and evolve the best in class reporting and business intelligence capability.
Does this sound like you? You're a natural leader, and can lead major initiatives and projects, joining business owners and partners to determine business needs and recommend solutions. Moreover, you have a talent for looking at a collection of data and drawing rare insights. In this role, we'll need you to include those insights and commentary within the existing reporting packages you deliver. Finally, you'll fit in well if you like to own your space and execute with speed and precision, relishing all challenges as opportunities to dig in, collaborate and take TD into the future of banking.
As a Senior Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, you will:
Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards for businesses
Lead the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
Conduct analysis to provide improved BI to inform management leadership team
Craft complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
Develop substantial and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages.
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Understand business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide relevant direction
Lead the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, portfolio growth, profitability, etc.)
Provide (and may develop) complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional or enterprise level
Work independently as the senior analyst / expert and may provide technical support to others
Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
Ideally have or acquire knowledge of broader enterprise reporting platforms and data sources and ability to integrate data across the enterprise
`
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Five (5) or more years relevant experience
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Requisition ID: 92145
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
In this role you will help the Director/Sr. Manager to lead a project team responsible for the delivery and daily operations of a project/application for Global Capital Markets technology team to meet their business needs. This will include overseeing and participating in the research and analysis of business processes, facilitate business and IT collaborations, and defining requirements that lead to the design and implementation of effective solutions. In addition, the candidate is responsible for the testing of new systems or enhancements as well as the integrity of daily operations and ensuring ongoing support.
Key Accountabilities
Responsible for the successful implementation of specific business line solutions for projects and support highly complex business applications for Derivatives and Structured Products
Formulates and defines systems scope, and objectives based on a thorough understanding of the requirements of the specific business line, and the data /system flow architecture.
Participates in all phases of the IT System Development Lifecycle (SDLC). Acts as a liaison between developers and business team members. Provides timely project status updates to the Project Manager; identifying/reporting project risks as early as possible and proactively mitigating project risks as identified. Provides expert knowledge of cross-functional and business processes, with ability to handles extremely complex problems to meet the business needs of Global Capital Markets
Collaborates as the business lead with multiple technology groups and vendors to ensure that the application, integrations, infrastructure and security architectures are designed to meet evolving business requirements, meet standards for reliability, scalability, performance and availability and align with Scotia IT&S Technology roadmap.
Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of the business strategies and policies, risk management practices and methodologies, product offerings, financial markets, financial instruments, regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to provide effective business solutions and services to the end user business lines
Analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to help arrive at innovative solutions.
Coach/mentor junior staff of the team
Responsible for System Artifacts such as BRD’s, Tech Specs, IST Plan, Test Cases, evidence of test execution, UAT Strategy, UAT Test Plan etc.
Manage the relationship with business users, other project teams and other stakeholders
Functional Competencies
Highly analytical and attentive to details, must be a self starter, result oriented and customer focus.
A high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills necessary to relate to other people at their systems knowledge level.
Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
Ability to solve technical problems/ processes and understand complex details to create business solutions to meet clients' needs
Have expertise in very complex business and technical processes and their implications across the enterprise. Demonstrate an informed knowledge of business functions related to Global Risk Management to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities
Strong SDLC and technical knowledge such as RiskWatch, Risk script, Linux, Scripting, SQL, python and familiar with RDBMS (Postgres, Oracle, etc). Experience with agile and continuous integration and delivery an asset.
Experience with risk management, derivatives applications, valuation and market data knowledge would be an asset
Have project management and agile delivery experience would be an asset
Education/ Experience
A recognized under-graduate degree in business administration, mathematics, computer science, or engineering related discipline.
Have at least 8 to 10 years of relevant IT and business industry work experience in capital market preferred.
Proven IT experience with an emphasis on highly complex systems/business initiatives.
A CFA or FRM designation would be an asset.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Job Title: Analyst - Regulatory Business Sustainment, Internal Controls
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 97604

Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Analyst - Regulatory Business Sustainment, Internal Controls, GBM 97603
Why work for Scotiabank?
Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off.
This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!

Global Banking and Markets

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.
Position


As the Analyst you will assist with the design and execution control processes with input from the GBM business lines (Line 1A) and the second lines of defense (e.g. GBM&T Compliance), thereby contributing to the overall success of the first line of defense in managing operational risks inherent in the businesses.
The Regulatory Business Sustainment (RBS) group within the GBM Internal Control operates as the Bank’s center of excellence in the first line of defense for ensuring compliance with G20 regulations including Derivatives regulations in Canada, US, Europe and APAC Derivatives regimes, collectively referred to as the OTC Derivatives Regulations. In addition, the group provides oversight for some of the Volcker rule requirements in the first line of defense.
The Analyst will support the RBS team of regulatory specialists who monitor and report Scotiabank's compliance with OTC Derivatives Reforms such as Dodd Frank, EMIR and similar rules in Canada, and Asia and Volcker. The Analyst is primarily responsible for supporting the effective execution of GBM controls and monitoring and oversight functions.
RBS works closely with the Front Office, as well as Global Wholesale Operations, Compliance, Legal and Technology groups. This position requires organization and coordination skills, curiosity, creative problem solving and the ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Requirements
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in business, or related field (eg. Mathematics, Accounting).
Minimum 0-3 years in the financial industry or similar environment
Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large quantities of data, research and organize results.
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders to execute projects.
Good oral and written communication skills.
A demonstrated ability to collaboratively work in a team environment under tight deadlines.
Intermediate to Advanced user capabilities in Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Attention to detail and organizational skills
This role requires successful completion of the NFA Swaps Proficiency Requirements within 90 days of assuming the role.
The following skills would be an asset:
Knowledge of key current rules and regulations governing banking institutions, specifically in the Capital Markets business
Capital market products knowledge
