As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent for our Bingo team in Toronto. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

PERKS & BENEFITS
Unlimited Vacation, Paid Sick Days & Holidays*
100% Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plan*
Life Insurance, RRSP matching, Flexible Spending Accounts & More*
Catered Lunches & Well-stocked Kitchens
Company Events such as movie night, pub night and more…
You'll be equipped with a high-end laptop, monitor and mobile device
Convenient location in downtown Toronto’s entertainment and technology districtOnly applies to full-time positions.
ABOUT THE ROLE
We’re currently looking for a passionate Senior Data Analyst who loves data and has a great mind for surfacing insightful visualizations of their research. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the top creative and analytical talent in a highly profitable mobile game development studio with an array of perks and respect for employee quality of life and personal time.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Formulates and leads guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interprets and analyzes data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinates research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiments against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges.
Work with business leaders to identify and define analytical requirements for teams and projects.
Using multiple data sources, create reporting and performance monitoring tools and dashboards for end users.
Understand and effectively communicate trends and analysis on user behavior, player segmentation, virality, and marketing campaigns.
Continuously develop thorough analysis and conclusive insights that drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Create regular presentations for GM and other team leads to discuss game performance and suggest improvements.
QUALIFICATIONS
Experience performing the above in a successful tech or game company.
Bachelor degree in a business or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics) – Master’s preferred.
5+ years of experience analyzing very large, multi-dimensional data sets using SQL, excel, statistical software, etc.
Strong quantitative skills, good working knowledge of advanced statistics and predictive modeling.
Ability to communicate effectively and combine both technical and business perspectives.
Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making and reach out to a broader audience.
Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations.
NICE TO HAVE
Experience in top-tier consulting, venture capital, investment bank or social gaming.
OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, & INCLUSION
We believe in creating games that unite people across the world and that showcase our commitment to providing an environment that is both inclusive and diverse for our players and employees. We strive to create a workforce that is reflective of our global player community as we know that we are stronger and better when we play together. To help promote an inclusive culture, we celebrate the visible and invisible diversity of our Jam Citizens through initiatives including Employee Resource Groups, cultural events, trainings, speaker series, and more.
Jam City is an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, age, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, religion, ethnicity, marital, or domestic partnerships status, disability, genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing), predisposing genetic characteristics, military status, veteran status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expressions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws. Our management is committed to following this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruiting, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.
ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

Description
Do you crave the creativity and freedom of a startup but the stability of a large, established company? Are you seeking the autonomy to take risks, make decisions and drive business success? Do you want to accelerate your career to the next level?

Ingram Micro Cloud, a business unit of Ingram Micro, powers the world’s largest cloud marketplace and is committed to helping our partners accelerate their digital business success by leveraging our hyper-scale platform technology, an infinite ecosystem of cloud solutions from the biggest innovators in the tech industry, and go-to-market support and resources to drive adoption and growth. With proven proficiency in SaaS, IaaS, IoT, security, and XaaS technologies, we invite visionaries to join our team and make an impact on this fast-growing industry.
Ingram Micro is seeking a BI Developer focused on helping Ingram Micro transform into leaders of the data revolution. Our BI Developers have a passion for working with data and will be involved in transforming, loading, aligning, and analyzing company data that will assist Sales, Finance, Marketing, and other teams with purposeful insights.


In this role you will be:
Working on designing and maintaining/mining a large data warehouse
Working with the latest cloud technologies like Azure, AWS, etc. Develop, support, maintain and extend ETL processes, database modeling/tuning/validation, Business Intelligence, and Data Warehouse services
Working in an Agile environment
Support the continuous improvement and evolution of the Reporting / BI business policies
Diagnose and support the resolution of Reporting / BI system defects identified by users
Provide training and expert knowledge regarding the Reporting / BI business process and standard operating procedures to business users
About You
Experienced in large data warehouses architecting/designing/implementing/maintaining
Expert on MS SQL Server – T-SQL, SQL Server Jobs, scheduling, configuration, querying
Expert on SSIS ETL – packages, integrating new data sources, transformations, deployment,
Expert in supporting SQL data investigation, debugging, troubleshooting, and fixing issues
Hands-on experience with SQL Server with working knowledge of Tables, Views, Stored Procedures, Functions, Indexes and SQL Scripting
Strong understanding of financial analysis and reporting
Ability to become a subject matter expert on the Ingram Micro Cloud business processes and systems
Ability to take responsibility, meet deadlines, multi-task, and work under pressure

Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us!
At Wattpad, we have a massive scale and reach across our global users; this is what makes us unique. It’s been an exciting time of growth, change and development for Wattpad. We are expanding our analytics practice at Wattpad and are searching for a Data Analyst Team Lead. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization.
What you'll be doing:
Provide support and guidance to a driven, passionate and capable data Analytics team
Manage and work closely with our Data Analysts on solving business problems and delivering value
Plan, develop and scope large, impactful analytics projects in collaboration with the team and business partners
Help guide and develop the processes and practices of the Analytics team to continuously improve our ability to deliver valuable insights
Help shape the departmental vision and direction of the Analytics practice at Wattpad
Promote and support the development of best practices, recommendations on tools and technology, and the overall technology evolution within the Analytics practice
Liaise with business leads across Wattpad teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into a digestible, understandable format
Extract and analyze complex information from a variety of databases and transform data from large datasets into insights suitable for various audiences
What we're looking for:
5+ years’ of practical experience in a data oriented field, with established team leadership working in a rigorous data-driven environment or experience grown in a fast-paced start-up or technology company
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; you’ll be providing you’ll also be working with different teams to help answer questions, so it is crucial you can communicate your work to multiple stakeholders
Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing, experimental design
Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment
You take initiative and find creative and scalable ways to solve problems
You can deliver, especially under pressure, multi-tasking and meeting challenging deadlines, all while upholding a high degree of quality
University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred
Bonus points:
Previous experience with Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods)
Please submit a GitHub repo or Jupyter notebook from a project you’ve completed or worked on. Or, share a link to similar work. This can be from an academic or industry project.
What we offer:
Competitive salary
Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals
Health benefits, fully covered on us!
RRSP Contributions
Generous vacation and Parental Leave Top-up
$200/month Transit and Home Office Allowance, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hybrid office and remote work options
Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family
A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit
And a whole lot more!

We also want to respect our team's personal needs and capacity for professional commitments during this time; consequently our pace for the interviewing process might be impacted.
About Wattpad
Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world.
What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse.
What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks.
How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time.
Culture and Diversity
Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period.
Wattpad welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. We are committed to fostering a global team that reflects the diversity of the Wattpad community. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability status or any other protected status.
If you have any special needs or accessibility requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Job Description:
We are Canada Life
Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
Be your best at Canada Life.
Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Montreal, Toronto, London, Winnipeg.
Role description
What you will do
Independently work with subject matter experts (SME) from across the organization to identify and document current state processes and to identify process improvement opportunities
Engage with team members to identify and document alternatives and recommend future state processes that improve the customer experience and drive efficiencies for the organization
Collect, clean, analyze and visualize data to inform data driven decisions
Work with system SME and data product SME to create mapping of data between source systems and data product
Identify and document data requirements to meet business outcomes
Work closely with the delivery team to identify, coordinate, and consolidate dependencies to deliver on the release plan
Work closely with the Tech and Data team members to ensure adequate testing by contributing to test plans, identification of test situations and test cases, execution of test plan and verification that test results meet business expectations
Identify, escalate and contribute to the resolution of issues and mitigation of risks
What you will bring
Strong fact-finding skills – Ability to elicit and consolidate requirements from multiple stakeholders
Action oriented - Ability to quickly consume information and translate it into meaningful action
Exceptional critical thinking skills - Ability to identify and document the happy path as well as all the edge cases
Excellent written and verbal communication skills - Ability to communicate complex messages and trade-offs clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Well-developed collaboration skills - Ability to build strong relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders at all levels of the organization, ability to conduct workshops
Demonstrated attention to detail - Ability to produce high quality output under strict and accelerated timelines
True flexibility and adaptability - Ability to work in ambiguous situations; resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere
Previous experience in creating process flows, documentation, data mapping and analysis, functional testing and validation
Comfortable with handling and analyzing large amounts of data including querying, mapping between systems etc.
Broad knowledge of insurance domain (Group life/health/disability) and understanding of underwriting, policy administration, enrollment and claims systems
Working knowledge of navigation in mainframe systems
Strong understanding of Azure cloud, Data Warehousing and Data Analytics flow
Working knowledge of Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL
Previous experience with data analysis and visualization tools preferred (Tableau and Power BI)
Strong knowledge of Agile
Mindset/Behaviors:
Challenger mindset and passion to challenge status quo to find new solutions and drive out of the box ideas – embraces change
Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency and trust across the team
Has a learning mindset to take on versatile roles as needed
Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today
We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!
Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.
We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.
Job Description:
This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams.
What will you do?
Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect.
Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge.
Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures.
Contribute & maintain quality requirement artifacts. Use a variety of visual techniques such as process models, workflow diagrams, storyboards and use cases, with appropriate guidance.
Participate in requirement elicitation sessions contributing in discussions to identify the true business need and associated risks.
Identify project risks and issues and communicate to Project Manager.
What you need to succeed:
University Degree in Business, Technology, Computer Science and Management
Experience or Knowledge in Investments, Asset Management and/or Capital Markets
Exposure in data analytics and data extraction with reporting tools such as SQL or Tableau.
Consultation and facilitation skills application in a school or office setting
Preferred skills:
Effective and efficient communication in a virtual environment.
Customer service focus to achieve valued results with a sense of urgency
Organized and flexible individual, comfortable in an evolving environment.
Innovative team member with a passion for learning and improving the client experience
What’s in it for you?
SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. Our history of organic and strategic growth reflects this commitment with over CA$303 billion in assets under management / US$238 billion in assets under management.
SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. We are breaking ground with innovative solutions for a growing institutional client base of more than 1200 organizations across North America. As a subsidiary of Sun Life, we are aligned with one of the world’s leading financial services companies, and benefit from the stability and strength of that relationship.
Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead.
Visit us at https://www.slcmanagement.com/inv
For a journey this exciting and complex, we’re looking for someone who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change.
Job Category:
Business Analysis - Systems
Posting End Date:
09/03/2021

In the 1830s, the May family began raising chickens on a farm outside what is now Brampton, Ontario. They became a pillar of the community, and their proud tradition of hard work, agricultural wisdom, and humble family values inspire and guide us to this day.
Role Purpose: The Logistics Analyst has primary responsibility for on-demand analytics (including data mining), providing business recommendations (and support), and leading cross-functional projects. They lead to scope problems/ opportunities, develop potential solutions and reach consensus on the path forward. Projects range from inventory optimization, to cost savings, to process improvement, to supplier management to field execution.
Note: This is an 8-month contract only.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES:
Budgeting: prepare, track and manage a budget for the logistics areas of responsibility by conducting analysis & preparing data to support requested budget; ensure compliance of budgeting for logistics teams by validating invoices relating to logistics, live haul and finished goods; monitor the financial performance of area of responsibility against approved budget so that areas of unsatisfactory performance are identified; and yearly freight tender responsibility.
Project Management: achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; Implementing productivity, customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change; with leadership team, set and monitor targets based on a developed, actionable plan; define action require when results are off target; and provide analysis, strategic planning processes to Leadership Team.
Technology Lead: evaluate future needs as it pertains to application, hardware, communication, professional services, and maintenance; develop a technology strategy based on the findings of future needs, best practices and available technology to modernize use of technology in order to improve service and work more efficiently; and provide professional expertise and advice as it pertains to technology.
Data Analytics: in collaboration with stakeholders, take lead role to implement data analytics supported by reports and dashboards are required; create processes and methods to gather logistics; run detailed spreadsheets in EXCEL; understand implications of network models; understand use of optimization tools; and score card management.
Logistics Optimization: evaluate vendor operations (e.g. freight forwarders) according to quality standards; track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance; define action require when results are off target; and collaborate with IT professionals to implement effective systems.
Policies, Processes & Procedures: adhere/comply with company policies and procedures.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
One to three years of working experience required;
Good understanding of supply chain fundamentals and the ability to embed best practices into the daily operations;
Experience with data mining and analysis techniques;
Experience in data mining, analysis and reporting;
Experience with supply chain processes (e.g., inventory planning, warehouse management);
Strong quantitative analytical skills, business acumen and insight; with the ability to understand and synthesize data from various sources, work around data limitations, and form impactful judgments and insights;
Desire to -roll up your sleeves - disaggregate complex problems and simplify into executable solutions;
Working knowledge of MS Office, relational databases and ERP systems (e.g. NAV).
EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Undergraduate degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Analytics, Mathematics or related field required.
CLT (Canadian Livestock Transport) certification is an asset.
COMPETENCIES:
Building Trust - Builds strong relationships on a foundation of trust, loyalty and authenticity.
Driving for Results - Relentlessly pursues quantifiable and measurable results: identifies areas for improvement and executes changes as necessary.
Communication & Listening - Encourages open and honest communication with the team, communicates messages clearly and concisely and listens attentively to others.
Initiative - Proactively seeks new opportunities and challenges; takes ownership and accountability for enhancing results or minimizing problems.
Builds Networks - Builds strong relationships with peers, partners and key stakeholders, cultivating meaningful connections.

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
As a member of the Data Office within the Global Wealth and Asset Management division, the Senior Data Analyst role is responsible for working with the Data Management and Delivery team, as well as other project teams, to ensure the data components of solutions provide the appropriate value to the business users, and are aligned with the organization’s Information Management Program:
Responsibilities for this role include:
Deliver flexible, reusable and well-maintained core data repositories
Use accelerated delivery methodologies to ensure data initiatives provide timely business value
Develop and maintain expertise in the Investment domain, as well as expertise in accessing, querying, testing and validating data content to drive quality and consistency within solutions
Partner with the Data Governance group to establish appropriate standards and methodologies, template and tools related to documenting, analyzing and testing data - work with management to implement these standards within the IS and Data Governance organizations
Developing templates and methodologies to ensure data requirements are accurately and completely captured and can be effectively communicated to other data stakeholders, including Business Users, Business Architects, Business Analysts, Solutions Architects, Solutions Developers, Quality Assurance Analysts, Data Governance and Data Management Staff
Ensuring the proposed technical solutions effectively meet the business need
Conducting data profiling to analyze quality of incoming data and advising on any data cleansing rules
Assisting in the creation of business glossaries (data dictionaries)
Collaborating with the QA group to develop methods to test data components
Evaluating existing and proposed data models and how to best access and query them
Evaluating existing and proposed data interfaces and how to clearly document them, including specification of data flow models, data flow timing, source-to-target mapping, and data transformation rules including data validations and controls
Keeping current on evolving Investment business knowledge domains to accurately assess the quality of the data
Providing guidance to project teams via peer reviews
Qualifications:
5-10 years related experience in working with Investment domain data and Data Management solutions
Experience with data-centric projects delivering the following (within a capital markets or investment banking domain): Master data management, Data integration, Data warehousing and reporting. Big Data environment for analytics
Significant experience in major trading platforms, book of record systems, performance management platforms, such as Bloomberg Polar Lake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso
Experience delivering data documentation artifacts in organizations of similar size and complexity within project deadlines
Experienced writing complex SQL queries to analyze data and provide results to business users or project team members
Able to communicate clearly, both verbally and in written form at various levels within the project teams
Strong work ethic, results oriented, and accuracy / attention to detail are critical
Demonstrated initiative, able to work both independently and as a team member
Able to clearly communicate complex methodologies and approaches to stakeholders, peers and management
Able to work in agile or scrum delivery environments
Good understanding of techniques and tools pertaining to the planning, analysis, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance of technology solutions
What about Perks?
Manulife has lots of perks including, but not limited to:
Competitive compensation
Retirement Savings Accounts including a RPP (Pension Plan), RRSP (Retirement Savings Plan), and TFSA (Tax Free Savings account)
Manulife Share Ownership Program with employer matching
Customizable Benefits Package including Health, Dental, Vision, and 100% of Mental Health expenses
Financial support for ongoing training, learning, and education
Monthly Innovation Days (Hackathons)
Wearing jeans to work every day
An abundance of career paths and opportunities to advance
This is a full-time permanent role located in Toronto, Ontario.

About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of September 30, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$943 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.2 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

You are working towards a post secondary undergraduate degree in business, STEM, or a related field

The SNAPiT team is seeking dynamic Research Data Analyst to assist with ongoing data configuration, the development of data reports and dashboards, and provide technical support to internal and external users. The SNAP Implementation Tool (SNAPiT) is a comprehensive database developed to track, monitor and evaluate the SNAP National Expansion Project. This expansion project has a goal of implementing 100 SNAP Affiliate sites across Canada by 2021.

The Research Data Analyst will also assist with migration of data, prepares and analyses large and complex data sets, and functions as a key member of the SNAPiT team. The position will be responsible for supporting a Client Relations Management System (CRM) that includes a Client Information System (CIS). This includes monitoring applications, generation of relevant reports, and integration of data across systems for the purposes of stakeholders reporting. The incumbent will also be responsible for analysing system specifications; executing test cases and reviewing results; and documenting and reporting the technical issues.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Supports the maintenance on the overall quality of the data in the CIS and other datasets as required;
Responsible for maintaining and updating datasets.
Document data processes and procedures for data base management and identify new processes to enhance data entry into system.
Provide system support and training to staff, including orientation for all new staff and follow-up training in response to changing data requirements for the CIS.
Support client system, support activities; take ownership of all assigned tickets and provide support until issue is resolved, which might require communicating with developers if issue needs to be escalated for technical support.
Responsible for designing and executing test cases on system builds and/or enhancements; record results of tests and the resolution of issues.
Responsible for building statistical and narrative reports.
Develop and implement data entry monitoring that ensures data quality.
Identify, analyze and interpret data trends.
Supports the dissemination of data reports and dashboards for managers, stakeholders, and external partners.
Interpret data analyses for internal and external presentations and reports.
Summarize findings for professional and lay audiences.
May be invited to oversee the work of Researcher I, research volunteers, or students.
Assumes other responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Masters Degree in social sciences and/or at least five (5) years related experience or related equivalent.
Knowledge of information management systems and research activities (principles and processes).
Advanced Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel and analytical platforms, including Power BI would be an asset.
Advanced knowledge in computer software and database utilization/management (i.e. MS Excel, SPSS, and Sequel coding language).
Experience writing SQL queries to analyze data.
Previous experience in client support using a ticketing system is an asset.
Strong facilitation skills to resolve issues internally and with external developers.
Demonstrates ability to collaborate with multi-disciplinary team members, managers and government personnel.
Excellent oral, written and communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Good organizational skills and the ability to take initiative and work independently.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Work independently and collaboratively to accomplish responsibilities, goals and projects.
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality.
Be a dedicated and flexible team player able to interact with team members, and colleagues at all levels of the organization.
Demonstrated ability to work in a respectful manner with groups from diverse backgrounds and experiences.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Governed by concurrent and dynamic deadlines, despite conflicting priorities and frequent interruptions.
Fast-paced work environment.
Working from home during the COVID-19 pandemic.

We are seeking a Data Analyst, Fraud & Risk to join our Risk team. You will play an integral role in fraud and risk mitigation using skills including the ability to recognize non-obvious patterns, analyze diverse data sets and work closely with internal teams and stakeholders to recommend solutions in an ambiguous environment.
Due to COVID-19, the position is remote until further notice.
What will you do?

Analyze data to identify fraud trends and proactively take action to improve efficiency and reduce time to identify new fraud techniques, tactics and procedures. Leverage diverse data sources
Analyze fraud data to determine patterns on sophisticated fraud activity
Deploy countermeasures by writing and deploying SQL fraud rules and analyze the impact
Monitoring evolving fraud clusters and propose new rule criteria using SQL
Analyze rule performance trends
Data visualization through tableau, Python, etc.
Assist Data Scientist in the creation of fraud artificial intelligence models
Work with data in the AWS infrastructure leveraging new cloud technologies for report and model creation
Ability to perform deep dives and write summaries of complex and sensitive escalations to Legal and Fraud Leadership
Work with internal teams to come up with action plans to address corrective and preventative measures to mitigate risk
Work with cross-functional teams across Paramount Commerce to collaborate on fraud risks and investigations
Communicate analytical insights to key fraud stakeholders through Dashboards, KPIs, etc.


You will have/be:

Bachelor's Degree relevant field (Mathematics, Business, Computer Science)
3+ years of relevant experience in data analysis, Investigation deep dives
1+ year of experience in Risk, Fraud, AML or Compliance
Experience developing in one or more programming languages (SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure
Effective spoken and written communication skills, including strong data presentation and visualization skills
Detail-oriented, with an aptitude for solving unstructured problems
Ability to work in fast-paced dynamic environments where decisions are made without compromising on customer experience and financial losses
Able to work with minimal supervision, will engage the right stakeholders at the right times
Excellent team player capable of learning and sharing knowledge in a global team environment
Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines
At Paramount, we celebrate diversity and know that our company is stronger with a multicultural team that brings different experiences and backgrounds to the job. We also know that your work team isn’t your only team. Work-life balance isn’t just something we say; it’s something we live.

What is the opportunity?
US Regulatory Services is responsible for ensuring timely, accurate, and complete reporting to various exchanges, self-regulatory organizations and the SEC.
In this role, you will primarily be responsible for day-to-day operational execution to broader planning within this area of expertise. Functions within the team can include remediating issues identified; control and risk management and reporting process improvement; providing support for regulatory change initiatives; and researching and responding to regulatory inquiries and exams. Additionally, you will utilize subject matter expertise while representing the department or function at a broader level, as well as performing user testing for new or existing process enhancements, documenting new procedures related to new reports on-boarded while acting as a go-to-person/escalation point for questions from analysts and other areas. You will focus on multiple forms of regulatory reporting, such as Electronic Blue Sheets, OATS, LOPR, Short Interest, TRACE, MSRB, CAT and more. You will work closely with several areas of the Firm to support the above functions, including various business groups within the Firm, Compliance, Legal, Finance, and Technology.
What will you do?
Review and analyze new business, rule changes or system changes that impact reporting processes and perform associated testing / checkouts
Coordinate the remediation of reporting anomalies (raise JIRAs, document requirements, and perform checkout etc.)
Support UAT strategy, document test cases and execute testing of applicable regulatory, business or control changes
Maintain a strong focus on streamlining processes by identifying and implementing automation processes
Lead the development and implementation of controls to ensure the timeliness, accuracy and completeness of reporting
Establish new procedures as required; work with Production line team to update procedures documents
Produce presentations for a range of stakeholders highlighting achievements, regulatory reporting metrics, regulatory risks and change management initiatives
Serve as a liaison for Regulatory Services on assigned projects; ensure Regulatory Services is informed of program developments and potential impacts to existing processes and reporting logic
Identify and develop performance management metrics for the group across accuracy daily, weekly, or monthly regulatory reports including: Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned
Coordinate and assess headcount requirements and delivery timelines for new regulatory initiatives and changes undertaken by the Firm may be assigned to work on projects outside of responsibilities listed above
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent Required, preferably in Engineering or Business or a related subject
Big 4 Consulting / Advisory experience (3+ years preferred)
Understanding of financial products (Equities, Listed Derivatives, Fixed Income, and/or OTC Derivatives) and US regulatory reporting requirements
Understanding of the trade life cycle (Orders, Executions, Allocations)
Understanding of Middle Office Trade Processing
Strong proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio
Understanding of project SDLC
Familiar with trade/transaction data warehousing and reference data sourcing
Nice-to-have
Technical mindset with basic understanding of SQL and VBA
Proficiency with Broadridge and Fidessa
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work

Gain invaluable skills that can be transferrable within the operations financial industry

Uken is looking for someone passionate about data to join our team. You will play a vital role in improving existing games and launching new ones by providing Product Managers the tools and insights into player behaviour. You will be deeply involved in our data-driven game design process by working closely with game designers. Your role in that process is to analyze and build the datasets used to make sense of our players by building reports and visualizations, developing new metrics, and providing actionable insights about our players.

You’ll be working on meaningful things like:

Answering business related questions through exploratory data analyses and ad-hoc reporting that drives engagement, retention and monetization
Building data visualizations used by the Product and Leadership teams
Developing new metrics and player cohorts to unlock insights into player behaviour
Continually trying to improve our A/B test analysis process through new tooling and automation
Deep diving into user behaviour to unlock value for the product team
Collaborating across data teams in the organization to improve data driven decision making and elevate Uken’s use of data science.

Your background should include:

2 years writing complex queries in SQL preferably Redshift
Attention to detail and proven organization and analytical skills
Ability to communicate and present information clearly
Proficiency in Python and/or statistical modeling
An appetite to learn, grow, and take on increasingly more responsibility
A desire to answer questions that drive business outcomes
Passion / knowledge of the mobile gaming industry

It'd be a big plus if you have:

Previous experience at a startup or mobile game/app company
Degree in statistics, economics, math or a related field
Experience in a Product Management / Data Analyst role

We believe in a fun and meaningful work environment:

You'll be equipped with a high-end laptop, monitor and mobile device
Competitive salary and stock options
Full health, dental and vision coverage
Fully catered lunch, breakfast and snack-filled kitchen (in-office)
Uken social nights including social mixers, games night and more…
Office based or home based work options
Convenient location at the corner of John & Front St.

About Us

Uken builds games that people everywhere love. Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? and Jeopardy! World Tour are the top 2 trivia games, engaging millions of global players every month.

We consider ourselves data driven designers, technologists, and artists. Through collaboration, we pair the craft of design with feedback and data to deliver a pace and rhythm in each game session that immerses our audience and leaves them wanting more. We have a quirky, nerdy culture that fosters creativity, collaboration, quality ideas, and a data driven mindset. We believe in moving quickly and improving constantly and that mantra is reflected in the weekly updates we make to our games and internal technologies. We have an appetite for pushing technical boundaries with a focus on practical use.

We take entertainment seriously.

About Felix
Founded in 2019, Felix is a patient-driven digital healthcare company that puts you in control of your health and wellbeing. We’re passionate about building technology and beautiful customer experiences to make healthcare more accessible (and more enjoyable) for all Canadians. Our strong venture partners provide us the resources to support our rapid growth and we are continuing to build our incredible team based in Toronto. Felix is Canada's first end-to-end healthcare experience, providing online treatment, prescription delivery and ongoing care across a growing range of categories such as birth control, erectile dysfunction, acne and more.‍
Description
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Felix Operations team! Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be fundamentally responsible for the collection and analysis of data as it relates to our growth efforts. The Data Analyst will work in support of the Felix Growth Marketing team, and will use data to develop strategies that improve and optimize the performance of our user acquisition campaigns, drive conversion within our marketing funnel and facilitate engagement and retention throughout the patient lifecycle. The Data Analyst will leverage strong problem-solving and analytical skills to generate insights, draw conclusions and help us best understand our data.
Responsibilities
Be the primary point of contact for analytics support for the Growth Marketing team
Work cross-functionally with the Growth Marketing and Product & Design teams to collect and synthesize data and provide insights into patient acquisition and lifecycle
Build and own marketing analytics dashboards (e.g. performance marketing including paid social and paid search, funnel breakdown, etc.)
Identify key audience segments within our customer base and across our verticals of care using metrics such as LTV, cross sell %, etc.
Perform cohort analysis to help us better understand our customer journey
Carry out ad hoc analyses
Automate and improve processes focused on increasing the efficacy of our Growth Marketing strategies relating to user acquisition, engagement and retention
Requirements
1-3 years of demonstrable experience in a data analyst or marketing analyst role
A university degree in an analytical discipline (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Marketing Analytics, Business, Economics, Mathematics, etc.)
Fluency with data, analytics and visualization technologies (SQL, Python, R, Looker, Mixpanel)
Fundamental understanding of marketing platforms and APIs (e.g. Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, etc.)
Experience with acquisition funnel analysis and cohort analysis
Demonstrated track record of successful analysis of online customer behavior
Knowledge of CRM principles and lifecycle marketing strategies (ex. acquisition, retention, customer journey, conversion, churn, winback, etc.)
Benefits
Full medical, dental and vision benefits
Maternity / paternity policy
4 weeks vacation (3 weeks anytime + 1 week during the holidays)
Stock option grant
Very cute puppies
We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
‍

Location: Toronto, Remote (Canada). We have an office in Toronto, but are currently working remotely and open to candidates from anywhere in Canada.

Job Title: Analyst Health Data Public Health Emergencies
Job Description:
Job Description:

Analyst Health Data Public Health Emergencies (3 positions)
Health Services – Public Health
Contract Durations: Approximately thirteen (13), twelve (12) and ten (10) month durations
To provide technical support with regards to database management, timely analysis of health data, and health data mapping to support program planning, and the monitoring of the health status of Peel’s residents.
Major Responsibilities:
Function as data guardian for health databases. Conduct data extraction, cleaning, and analysis of these data.
Obtain, clean and analyze data from Region of Peel - Public Health programs, as required.
Organize, analyze and interpret health-related data using sophisticated software and analytic tools
Conduct technical analyses and prepare reports of health data health status monitoring, program planning, program evaluation, answering health questions, or for responding to requests for information.
Present data in useful, understandable formats including tables, charts, maps, customized reports, and data dashboards using a variety of software.
Provide support on technical issues related to health status, surveillance and/or program data
Provide technical input on database design and maintenance.
Utilize geographic information system tools to prepare maps.
Qualifications:
BA or BSc preferably in Mathematics or Biostatistics or other related Public Health Sciences
Minimum of three years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge and understanding of public and community health issues; knowledge of communicable diseases an asset
Ability to coordinate the collection and retrieval of health data
Ability to synthesize, analyze and communicate health/epidemiological information from multiple sources
Knowledge of database sources, emerging survey tools, and relational databases
Excellent computer skills using statistical software, Excel and Mapping Software
Demonstrated ability to work efficiently within and interdisciplinary team setting
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) along with project management and organizational skills.
Locations: 7120 Hurontario Street, Mississauga as well as various Region of Peel worksites along with the ability to work remotely, as we navigate the COVID-19 pandemic.
We are committed to supporting community recovery from COVID-19. This plan will follow a phased approach that is guided by Public Health and Ontario's Framework for reopening. Get details
Hours: 35 hours per week; Monday-Friday; ability to work evening and weekends when required. Ability to work after hours and on-call duties on a rotational basis
Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.
If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.

Company Profile
Home Capital Group Inc., together with its operating subsidiary Home Trust Company, has developed a track record of success as Canada’s leading alternative lender, employing nearly 800 people in our Toronto headquarters and branches across the country. Building on the demonstrated strength of our core residential and commercial mortgage lending business, the Company and its affiliates also offer complementary lending services and competitive deposit investment products. Our culture has been shaped by the passion and integrity of our people. Home Trust is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Home Capital Group, trading on the TSX under the symbol HCG.
Position Responsibilities
• Data Profiling and Quality Analysis – This role is responsible for the development and maintenance of automated data quality rules, both in detail and with dashboard metrics and KPIs.
• Validation and Troubleshooting – Ensure that data quality rules are accurately built using validation tools (Informatica Data Quality) and develop an in-depth understanding of source systems and EDW data structures to further define rules.
• Root Cause Analysis – Track, investigate, and analyse root cause of data quality issues, ensuring data quality issues and remediation plans are communicated to all necessary stakeholders.
• Data Issue Remediation – Assist and support the DMO team and the D&A Team overall, as required, to correct and/or remediate data quality issues in systems of record (e.g. ERP applications) based on business priorities.
• Ensure data quality management and lineage processes adhere to related Home Trust strategies, policies, standards, and guidelines.
• Participate in Risk, Audit, Compliance and Regulatory requests for the D&A team as required.
• Develop and implement data quality test scripts, DQ reports, and identify defects using DQ rules based on prescribed DQ dimensions and Data Steward direction.
• Investigate root causes of data quality issues and resolve/remediate data quality incidents by working with Data Stewards, the business and IT teams as required.
• Work closely with business and IT to ensure new data quality requirements are understood and documented effectively.
Formal Education
Post secondary degree or diploma required (University degree preferred) in Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent
Certification(s)/Designation(s) preferred in related area

1-3 years of experience analyzing, profiling, reporting and managing data issues for large data sets.
